7JPpNSJ7Bilj_Dy7lXHhjw.text: I love Angels Trumpet! I've tried a bunch of different items in my few visits, and they've all been fantastic. Couple the great food with their superb beer selection, and you've got a winning combo.  I can vouch for their burgers, fries, house-made pop tarts, and the "Nutter" sandwich (get it with marshmallow fluff too!). Those are all sure-bet items, and some of the tastiest things that exist in the Valley. *These may in fact be my favorite french fries around now too. Top notch.  The only thing wrong with ATAH is that it needs a bug lamp or two. There are way too many flies buzzing around.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outlaw Burger

7eQYRpKN-zcFtG-QZ2f6yw.text: Loved! Great place, nice selection of craft beers and unique flavorful food options. I am in town for business and had one free evening. I was looking for something unique and tasty. Ended up here on my third stop from places near by, that weren't quite what I was looking for. After searching Yelp reviews this was my final stop. I'm a burger connoisseur and had the Brewlee with smoked pork burger. Excellent!! I grabbed their homemade pop tart of the day which is some sort of banana cinnamon vanilla - I didn't even pay attention until I got back to my room and it's still warm... And delicious. Yum!! Leaving PHX AZ satisfied with a good find!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brewlee Smoked Pork Burger

o-H4cMoiYuhdpcHOp7o9nA.text: Came here for a friend's birthday this past Friday for the first time, as this is a regular hangout for her; I see why! Sizable back area, with heaters to keep the temperature just right. They also have an area for your dog, if you bring them along. Beer selection is rather extensive, food is great! Sampled a friend's pizza which, albeit was on the greasy side, was still delectable. The pouting was tasty, although the gravy could have used a bit less salt. Overall, would love to head back here again, maybe during the Summer..

0pnIoZyOaFpLTn_3EKL_LA.text: Terrible service. I'm usually one to not care about service if the food is good, but this place is just too rude. Even tried to give them the benefit of the doubt. We had at least 4 people help serve us and 3 out of 4, were just completely rude.

H_aSNBm3LK1zy5qaTG8PNQ.text: Really glad I was able to go here before leaving town. This place is a lot larger than I thought it would be. But just as packed. My friend and I decided to by-pass the wait time and just sit at the bar. Hello beautiful wonderful taps. Why yes, I will sample you. We got ourselves a couple samplers and perused the menu. Some kitchy offerings (spam sliders), and some good old standards.  I decided on their grilled cheese w/ fries. And it was awesome. Not too greasy, and not too cheesy. Yes, that's a thing.  I was told by the patron next to me that I had made a huge error in not ordering the tots, but to each his own. This place has become quite the trendy, sought after spot. If you love craft beer, brave the line/ wait/ heat.

X_yTpYKQK0utiOK9JH6gPQ.text: Atmosphere is very fun and they have many unique beers. I thought the food was ok. They plated it nice,  but it was not good enough for me to recommend it to a friend.  Spam sliders really needed a sauce.

CT6n6atVFZgWxl8adbGJKA.text: Have quite a few beers and even wine on tap. Food is really good. They have indoor and outdoor seating depending on your mood and temperature. Pretty good happy hour and other specials.

c9BESGBd3jU8UEpifu7xrA.text: Came here for a friend's birthday celebration.  I didn't eat but my companions seemed generally satisfied with their food.  I had a cider that was delicious.    The service went from good to bad.  At one table, we were served promptly and the waitress gave us separate checks.  We changed to another quieter table and were told by our new waiter that he could not split up the checks.  That caused a huge headache amongst our group and we left with a rather negative impression.

uxqN6omfOGGE-fcJz_BSrQ.text: My husband and I love this place. It has an amazing beer selection and it is new every time. They currently have 31 beers on tap! They also have 6 wines on tap. All the food we have had has been really good. Their pizza is great! The only reason I give it a 4 star is because they don't have a happy hour and it is pretty pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nice outdoor space:)
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

tm6DGoO2BqkNpXcLciJl0g.text: My boyfriend and I have eaten here about 4-5 times in the last few months. Every single time the food is great. And, very affordable.   The only downside is that the food does take a while to come out, which sucks if you're hungry when you show up. On the other hand, I guess it's worth it for good food.   The atmosphere is loud, boisterous and fun. It seems to always be extremely crowded. But I've never seen anything outrageously awful happen so it's a pretty good place to be.   I am sure we will eat here many more times this year!

iZ_bv7dpIqgALWsnHfFp4Q.text: I've been to Angel's Trumpet a few times now and it is a must try. If you love beer and food this is the place for you. They have a bunch of different craft beers on tap which may be overwhelming to some but their staff is very knowledgable and willing to help you find a beer you may like. My favorite thing to do is get a flight of beer. You can choose up to 6 different beers in your flight which are about 3oz servings.   The food has never disappointed me. I went recently for happy hour with some friends and a couple of us were able to split one of their flatbreads for only $7. Their food is bar food turned up a notch.  Some favorites: pretzels, poutine, and their "Nutter" sandwich add peppered bacon!  Tip: grab a beer and go outside on the patio to play some cornhole (bean bag toss for those who may not know what cornhole is). Definitely a great place to go with some friends!

mBwHiEER-JOc1EzSNDW34Q.text: I love this place!  There is always something great on tap and the food has been amazing on many visits! Tuesday night TV Dinner is fresh but retro! I wish this restaurant was on the west side  so good!

U3TWEqs4Ef4o5_Z3Zt3E6w.text: I've been here more times than I am able to count on my fingers and toes... I think that about sums it up  OH... I am a HUGE chicken wing fan and the harshest critic of their preparation and flavor... This place is one of the top 3 places I will actually go specifically for the wings...   Kuddos to the chef!!!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ni0I6P8vwq1jfNjpoqRQ3A.text: Husband ordered: brulee beef burger w/medium over easy egg w/ fries which came with a special dipping sauce.  Me: 810 Sammy w/fries Toddler: cheese pizza Beer: AZ red ale My husband Loved his burger! It was huge so definitely filling. He said it was very flavorful the bacon was crispy, the green leaf lettuce was just a great combination for this juicy burger. I liked my Sammy - it was different, not bad simply good. The adobo sauce was good but I don't know maybe it was too smoky for my taste buds. My toddler had the cheese pizza. I have to say none of us liked the dipping sauce - tasted more like marinara sauce. we would have preferred ketchup, but regardless it didn't take away from this place or food.  We like the decor and it keeps a cool temp inside which is nice because of the az heat!

OgtLwYhgExlpCWO985orNg.text: Maybe I am spoiled, but I'm a little turned off by Angel's Trumpet. I've been there around 5 times, and each time was..."ehh."   Beer selection is good. A little hard to read, but that's my eyes fault. Kinda weird that the waitresses refer to them by numbers.   I don't think I need to flag down a server to either order or pay my bill-that seems counterintuitive to their existence as a restaurant with wait staff. I don't think that I've ever had a greatly outgoing server there. I always feel like I am bothering them.   The food is good. Poutine is good.   There's plenty of other places to go around there. But if you feel the need to try, do it. If not, you're not missing much.

7E9iqWLK-weL-512byObfw.text: Cute little place! Didn't try the food but great for happy hour on the patio when the weather is nice. Will be back!

uyvrpT5pi4LdM0SPZR2IIg.text: It was ok.  We got there about 9pm, place was busy.  Took about 5 mins to be acknowledged and about 5 more to place our order.  Waitress was nice enough but not overly helpful.    I asked about their draft wine, she replied it's draft wine.  Hummmm, I sort of figured that out already.  I was looking more for where it came from, house wine?  Etc.  My friends got beer and it was nice and cold.    I really hope it is in for the long haul.  It's a nice place to have downtown.  I think with a few tweaks here and there it could wonderful!  Fingers crossed!  .

Cg14tjlsNVQlfbN3WcKS5Q.text: I love Angels Trumpet . That's why I'm giving a 4 star review. I go there fairly regularly and always have enjoyed good service, great food and a pleasant experience. However, yesterday I visited there with a friend who has been a long time,very regular customer of theirs and this time the service was not up to par. We had a dog with us and so we were on the patio sitting in the chairs at the edge of the patio and no one came to take our order or even say hello! There were three other tables on the patio when we came in and as we sat there one left,  it was a very slow time of day . The two servers on the patio  kept looking at us but they never came over finally my friend got their attention and the young man said oh sorry, I'll get your order but just so you know we don't normally wait on people when they're sitting here normally you would go to the bar and I asked him how I would do that since I had a dog and the bar is inside. He didn't answer. My friend went inside and just ordered from the bartender and bypassed the waiter. If they have a rule that certain seating on the patio is only for patrons who order at the bar there should be some kind of sign there because we had no idea that was how we were supposed to order. It's a dog-friendly patio so this doesn't seem to mesh. By the way the bartender gave us excellent service!

rinzy7fQcH1UorX34-g10A.text: I attend this resturant/ bar during my shift of door dashing. I checked in and asked for the order I was picking up and was told it was ready. It was showing that the order hasn't been confirmed or called in yet so I canceled the picking up of that specific order. When I advised the manager I was Doug that he tried to pressure me into using MY OWN card to pay for the order since door dash wasted their food and told me that he was going to "make it my problem" by calling the police if I didn't.  This wouldn't have happened if I were white. I am an African American they would not let me leave the resturant even though this error was not caused by me

vZzGe_X-8r3hPcEXlpZWtQ.text: Fantastic beer selection - the bartenders will make great recommendations and let you sample any beers on tap. I had the va-va-verde with brisket and it was good bar food in a great atmosphere. Will definitely go back when in town

bJCLxCzwR9XT6mpZ-21cOA.text: First of all, I drove past it because the place is so nondescript.  I thought I had the wrong address for a minute.  It stands right next to an empty-open-dirt lot right across from the Film Bar. Once I got in, I immediately like the open-flow of the place because it carries from inside to outside effortlessly. The layout is quite laid back and they even have lounge chairs outside for some real relaxation. I also thought that the blackboard listing all their drinks had a nice eccentric effect to it.    We went on a Friday late afternoon and the place was semi-full but completely full two hours later.  I enjoyed the Farm flat bread pizza topped with delicious veggies.  I loved every bite even though I'm not a vegetarian.  My two friends each enjoyed the Flight which is a muffin tray that holds six small glasses of different beers of your choice.  I was too hungry so I didn't go for that.  But if you go there on a full stomach, it's a great choice if you want to try almost all the drinks.

ZGwZH5boTTbhZgJ9qtswOQ.text: Great rotating beer selection !   Strong local showing, just don't see Santan today.  Only so many handles I suppose.  Check this place out.

i33FV1UrxBqQO4RTp0XGvg.text: Everything about this place screams 'awesome downtown scene'. With their HUGE selection of great beers, delicious food (we had the soft pretzel app) and their big back patio, it's hard not to love this dr hangout. The staff at Angels Trumpet is fun, nice, and down to earth, which matches its atmosphere. This may have been my first time here but it will most definitely not be my last.  Overall, if you want to have a good beer in a chill environment, head to Angels Trumpet Ale House.

w_ibfH22bZ2M2otXq0J0HA.text: This is my updated review.  I originally reviewed in February, and I have gone back to Angels Trumpet Ale House a couple times after that.  My second time was in the summer, I stopped in for some beers during art walk and I ordered the poutine again.  I was so thoroughly surprised about how much the dish improved.  It was absolutely fantastic and was even better than home (they put green onions on top which were a great addition).    The most recent trip was for lunch during the weekend.  We stopped by for lunch before hitting up a matinee at the Film Bar that is right across the street.  The patio was a great way to enjoy the weather and drink a couple beers.  I ordered a burger with an egg on top.  I was never so impressed with the presentation of the burger.  The bun had a since shine to it.  It came with a huge side of fries that are very good.  Because of these more recent experiences and the quality of the food, I have increased my rating.

NSQ9ivkGDJFyIn0s_JOX4w.text: Two words "Brulee Burger". Now, go get one! This is a great place for anyone looking for a great beer selection and food choices that go beyond the typical pub menu. Angel's Trumpet has something for everyone (save some room for the pop tart of the day). The only draw back is that they don't have a full bar (beer and wine only) but don't let that stop you from having a great time here!

Cs2tHfkALDvLshNZS6zEIQ.text: Such a fun pub to head to. Had a really great recommendation of beers. I had a nitro pale ale, delicious. My friend and I split the mess(poutine) and I had the pretzels and he had the sausage platter. The food was delicious. Very much a cool gastropub environment. The parking is a little hit or miss. The spots on the property are a one way parking, but there are plenty of parking spots on the street as well as metered spots. I would definitely recommend it and return. I would love to visit on a Tuesday, they have a "tv dinner" special. Would LOVE to try that out!

02NxOSP9gNGqdLJwtpq0Gg.text: My previous review about the food still applies - absolutely amazing! I got the Brewlee Burger again. I want to try out those homemade poptarts sometime!  A friend and I went here for lunch yesterday. They were fairly busy, but that didn't stop this place from having great service last time I came. We waited (after our drink order was taken) at least fifteen minutes before our food order was taken. It wasn't too much of a problem though (except we were hungry) since we didn't need to be anywhere else afterwards. Once the order was taken we got our food within another fifteen minutes. The service was decent but has been better.  The atmosphere is amazing, like always. I'll definitely be back and continue to recommend this place to friends.

unD8hzcxUxTO_4zxiVx-0Q.text: Great little place in downtown Phoenix. Love the beers on tap, and the menu is delicious! My mom and I came in and had the 810 sandwich and the pizza special, and everything was fantastic. Will absolutely be coming back and recommending to others.

4CPcPDaFCoSFpckzadRAsw.text: I have heard about this place since I moved out here in October of 09', I decided enough was enough....it was time !   It's so tucked away downtown I actually drove past it.  It was about 9PM on a Wed. and inside all tables were packed.  The patio was actually great and I like that they have all drinks written on a chalkboard as opposed to using just menus. I had a red blend of wine which was really yummy, similar to a Cabernet.   The only thing I wasn't that thrilled about was their food selection.  I'm not sure why, but nothing really caught my eye.  We ordered "the mess" and shared between the three of us.  Brown gravy, cheese curds and fries.  They were pretty good, but I thought the gravy left little to be desired.    The thing that would keep me coming back would have to be the mellow vibe and man, I loved that patio.  I will eat before and be happy to quench my thirst on a flight of beers. :)  Want something low key, but a great atmosphere...this is it.

wyJ3kBtQTuPtaF_Ha354RQ.text: So I really, really like this place and have recommended it to PHX visitors and suggested it to friends when we are downtown.  My friends seemed to really, really like it too..lol.  They have a large chalkboard with a never ending list of craft beers to choose from..and wine..on tap!  I've had the spud taco, veggie flatbread pizza and avocado salad.  I would stick to the pizza and salad.  The spud taco was a little greasy for my taste.  Nice, sized portions.  I would suggest getting here early to beat the crowds to a table.

k-h_-Gwhm7phTKIjEyaTug.text: Great place to get your drink on!  Great outdoor seating and some badass choices of beer. B

Zisw9Xevaq5xwSJ4MCdLhA.text: The beer selection was amazing. The food was fantastic. I had the beef brisket tacos. Delish. I would like to go back and have the chicken wings they looked mouth watering.

SkFDiw0kvGiX8E7xIZFurg.text: Last night was the THIRD time I have tried to make it in since last year. This last time we showed up at 6pm and the wait was an HOUR because they just decided that evening NOT to serve food on the patio - PLUS there were open tables. The staff has never been very pleasant so I guess it was a sign to head on down the road!

7Ur2k4iFJ-japdZ1GLh8yA.text: Stopped in for dinner and drinks on a recommendation from family.  Did some reading up before going in and were excited by the selection of craft beer.  Pictures of the food left us eager to try a few items too.  We got there early to beat the crowds and were promptly seated.  After a few questions and some pondering we both ordered our beers.  They came out quickly.  I enjoyed the selections, something for every type of beer connoisseur.  Service was very good and we were never left sitting.  Our waitress was very personable.  We both got entrees, a brisket sandwich which was OK (not a lot of flavor), and a burger.  I was disappointed because the burger looked to be a frozen hockey puck type.  Definitely formed by something besides hands.  I was expecting a more handmade type thing at a place with this much gusto.  Still tasted good though.  Fries were also very tasty.  We also splurged on the homemade pop-tarts.  They were awesome!  Highly recommended!  Overall, we will return for sure, just maybe not right away.

orICpAkBjGm6f8FjmY-YAg.text: I wish I could give a better review on this, but I only stopped in for a half hour or so. We stopped in on a Sunday afternoon,  pulled up and the private lot was full so parked on the street right outside. It looked like an absolute dive until I walked in and boom, the place really opens up and is really nice! Great casual, noisy environment and was pretty busy, but quick, friendly service with tons of different brews. A little pricey, but that's to be expected at a place like this. I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cooling off!

sn_yzxL3geA6tld81Gfu3g.text: Wow!!! Being from Seattle I love the hipster environment!! Although I am not a beer drinker they did have cider and wine on tap, but if you are a beer drinker you will be in heaven! So many to choose from and such a wide variety!! My gf and I came over for the packers vs cardinals game tomorrow and we chose this place for dinner! The brisket and grilled cheese was the best I have had (besides my papas) and that is saying a lot! I am bbq and brisket picky!!! Go here it won't disappoint

Nrcw1hasqroyfIkMlJnrPQ.text: My go to place for craft beer selection and I adore the meat pizza and burgers! The bartenders are very knowledgeable with recommending beer that might fit your palette.

Dd3uw7S1vjxBBkIuX79uCA.text: Visited with a group of about 8 and everything looked great! Crazy selection of beers! Definitely would go again. Sorry for lack of details but it's been a while. I'm a bit behind with yelping!

C_bjpYtT4XyL1mIrMP-30Q.text: Awesome flatbread pizza and an even better selection of beer.  Word of advice, don't try the wild ale. The color is deceiving.

WgJS_f7YoL0tGsvKrd0cuQ.text: Woo! Had a beer flight...fun names for the beers a and quite a variety! Great atmosphere and lively crowds. Wonderful people watching.  Food looked amazing, I can't wait to go back and try some of the dishes myself!

OtC2Jow-9t0hr0L02bJOFw.text: Really came here for the beer in all honesty, but the food was good and the service was great. Our server came by and checked on us "just enough" so as not to be annoying, I.e. our glasses were always full and we never had to look for refills etc. if you weren't specifically searching this place out you might drive right past it. Great hidden gem in downtown Phoenix. I plan to be back as the menu is inviting and my friends' food looked delicious. I had the spam sliders and they were delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TXtdNkMlnzg3zvABUTklYQ.text: Best beer selection in town by far! It is always changing! We have had a good portion of the menu over time and we have always left very happy! The best place to eat when your in the beer mood!

vkSFhFb7vtx1S8PUvqlOLw.text: Love this restaurant, my favorite place to eat when visiting downtown Phoenix. The burgers here are excellent and the salads are a great choice too. Great food selections and the inside of the restaurant is decorated nicely.

7foZpzZ-cUKOerdiqe1ZFg.text: I like Angels Trumpet Ale House, I really do, but some of their business practices are a little shady.  To be fair, I am writing this review after my third visit within two weeks.  This last time I left unhappy.  I wont throw them completely under the bus though, so I'll start with the good.  The food and ale!   My favorite thing on the menu are the wings, served crispy and naked, sauce on the side.  These wings are delicious!  I always order my wings crispy with little to no sauce, so these are a sure thing for me.   I have also had the grilled cheese made with smoked mozzarella and fontina, honey drizzle, tomato and much more.  Delicious!   Be sure to ask for a smaller size of "the mess" appetizer, as your side.  The Mess is their version of poutine.  Really good!  I gave the sausage platter a try this last time, not my favorite.  It was good enough, but didn't blow me away.  Sausage quality is just okay.  I wouldn't order it again.    Moving on to the service...its hit or miss.  Great service once out of three visits?  Disappointing.  The other night was terrible and the server was either really dumb or just plain rude.  One person in my party ordered the avocado salad, which she has had several times prior.  Right away she said this time it doesn't taste right.  She gave it a shot, but it just wasn't right,  so she called the server over to let him know.  He said "I'll let the manager know".  He returned and said he could take 50% off for the salad. Really?  50%?  My friend immediately said no and the server stomped off and said "I'll send her out." The manager came out and said "I never said I would take only 50% off."  So...Was our server just trying to pull a fast one on us?  At the end of the salad ordeal, the manager was nice and there was no charge.  However, it was the most awkward experience I have ever witnessed over sending something back.    Now for the bill. Our server said he was going home and did we mind if he brought the checks?  I have no problem with this whatsoever in any restaurant.  He did the work, he should get the tip and not the person he passes the table to.  We were a party of 5, this joker added gratuity to all of our checks.  For a party of 5, really?  He didn't even say anything and I would barely have noticed the way it was slipped in on the check.  I normally don't have a problem with auto gratuity for large parties, but I do for a party of 5.  This guy is a scammer and he ended up shorting himself anyway as we would have tipped more on our own.   I should also point out that Angels Trumpet has no auto gratuity policy as this didn't happen with my party of 12 just a few nights prior.    All in all, I recommend Angels Trumpet Ale House.  Food and drinks are great.  Just beware of shady service and double check your bill!  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sausage platter.
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled cheese with a small &#34;mess&#34; (poutine).
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Naked wings! Delicious!

ZGAAz4DFYlLcC_9gVy_jrA.text: 2 1/2 stars for their flabreads. 4 stars for everything else.   They have a great selection of beers. They even have draft wines if you are into that. The atmosphere is also great. It has a bright, sunny, open feel in the daytime and becomes more intimate at nighttime, Either way, it feels like Im at someone's 1960's home but with a modern twist (seems weird to say but thats how I interpret it.)  I tried some of my friends avocado salad and thought it was pretty good for being basic, The flatbreads on the other hand could have been better. The bread that had toppings got soggy real quick. The cheese felt like food truck quality grade, nothing real stood out flavor wise except the grease from the meats and cheese, and the brussel sprouts were undercooked. I was still able to eat it but I dont have the fondest memories of eating it.  Even though the flatbreads arent that good, the beers and atmosphere win me over that much. Although hesistant to eat anything big from here, the beer should be the focus.

LlCkORwjkPcB-lJNi-s-6Q.text: Great place! I always get their fish tacos . My bf likes to get the spam sliders, sounds weird but they are good too!!! They have a great selection of alcohol and the ambience it just great. I take longer trying to figure out what new drink I want to try lol. The staff is really friendly and does their best to accommodate and answer any questions. They also make their own "pop tarts" and they are soooo good if you saved room for dessert. The only issue I have is the parking is hard to find but that can be expected given their location. Give this place a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

sOjF3_zkELYB3MWI8qa1Tg.text: Definitely one of my favorite spots downtown! They have a great beer selection -- 31 taps that are always new and changing (they list them online too, which is nice). I love the atmosphere and both the indoor and outdoor seating. We've been lucky a couple of times and have sat at the half in/half out tables, and those are great :) the service is always amazing too, we've never had a long wait for anything.   Their Outlaw burger is one of the best BBQ burgers that I've had, and I've had a lot. The only thing I haven't liked that much so far is their salad, but I definitely want to try more things on the menu! My boyfriend likes the wings a lot and my sister has told me that the Bug Guppy fish tacos and margarita pizza (might only be on the happy hour menu) are amazing.   The parking lot is super small so it's hard to get a space at night, but there are tons of metered spots nearby! It's definitely worth the walk over. If you come here for dinner or drinks, definitely go across the street and check out Cobra Arcade! :)

efAKoYpP1uY4kzY1ayVLSg.text: Great food, ample beer selection, friendly staff and awesome music (80's alternative - OH YES!). I highly recommend sitting out on the patio for a pint if you're downtown. We had burgers, sandwiches, and wings with both the spicy/tangy and the sweeter sauces.  4-stars because I would like to see more local taps.

gGHOC7-jXAl5utbZYo5LXA.text: The food at this place made me sick.  Do not have the wings. The pepper they add to the taquitos snack is Gross. Only thing good is the beer.

rqtAj8-FqGX9HWtD2y1hGA.text: My sister and I flew in for a conference but our hotel room was not yet ready. Decided to go for a beer and a burger and found this place on Yelp. We walked over and at first glance wasn't sure what the place was as it was a little deceiving from the outside! Upon entering it had a great atmosphere. We were greeted by our server almost immediately. They had a happy hour going on so we tried one of the local Bock beers. It was amazing!! We each ended up ordering the veggie burger which was a well flavored, homemade black bean burger. Quite yummy as well!!! Great service and great food!! Can't ask for much more!! Highly recommend!!

_OaoTVmjkLw_Hvc0I9sOFA.text: Went on Sat afternoon & it packed but able to be seated pretty fast. Place is open & hipster. Food was good too.there ketchup & ranch were bomb. My daughter had the chicken nuggets from the kids menu and they were really good.

RPdrC7CoiIz3HGSysu5W-w.text: Awesome food! And good beer! We are already planning our trip back.    We tried "the mess" appetizer, fries with gravy and cheese curds, and it was great! Big portion so the three of us couldnt even finish it!   My girlfriend got the flight of beers and said its a great option to try some of all the different kinds they had.   We also had the fish tacos, the tractor flatbread, and the chet burrito. We were raving about everything!    We also got thw rum mango poptarts and holy crap it was heaven in a pastry. 10/10 would recommend   Service was a little slow, but it was a busy dinner time so its understandable, I think its a great place to take friends or grab dinner

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The tractor pizza

hdqIi9xeelOQy_VPHLIG_Q.text: Can't believe I've never been here! Cute concept, kinda like one big room! Tons of beers on tap and a large back area to sit outside and enjoy the phx weather! The green chairs outback kinda gave me a cafeteria feel! Prices are pretty good we ordered the pretzels which came out warm and soft (ask for extra cheese Bc the one it comes with won't be enough).  Also ordered the wings crispy and tasty! For the main dish we got the outlaw burgers cooked perfect nice and moist and the bun wasn't soggy was just missing something? Little lack luster is the taste dept, the fries it comes with are crunchy and perfect giving me five guy fry vibes! The side sauce its served with tasted like spaghetti sauce, I'd pass on that  next time! Overall cute spot will defiantly be back to see what other beers they rotate in on top!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pretzel with cheese and a spicy mustard dipping sauce
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Half order wings, sauce on the side
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outlaw burger!

F6gYM0K0hMSyr_6Pn_Kfyg.text: Great food and service! The to go beers are awesome, the scenery is very breath taking. I recommend the #27 for draft beers. Also if you are a wing lover, try them out!

-D7IKNS60cAeDTH3hikLaQ.text: We went here based on some of the Yelp collections recommendations, and we enjoyed it. It has a cool vibe inside, albeit a little loud for conversations to be held at times (I work in a auto shop so I'm kind of deaf). It was pretty busy on a Sunday early afternoon, which we kind of expected, and we had to park at a meter down the street which wasn't a big deal. We sat ourselves at a high top and waited for several minutes to be greeted by our server. I did not really care for the stools, as they were kind of uncomfortable, but that's not a huge gripe. After looking through some of the Yelp reviews we had found a couple things that we wanted to try, including the Spud taquitos and the wings. Neither disappointed at all. I did manage to struggle finding a beer that I really wanted which was surprising considering the fact that there was 31 choices. The first beer I ordered the keg blew and they erased it from the board. I was ok with the second choice, but should have stuck with my typical IPA. I ordered a fried chicken sandwich called the Outlaw and my fiancee ordered the fish tacos and both were very good. Our only minor gripes was the slowish service and the uncomfortable stools, but those are so minor that we will definitely be back.

6X6ZfdWGhCcy20zzJf0ovQ.text: We had a fabulous meal at Angel's Trumpet Ale House tonight.  There were four of us, one had the fish tacos, one the fried chicken sandwich, one had a flat bread pizza and I had the fried chicken salad.  Really good food and prepared just right!!  I like to let people know when I find a great restaurant!!  Try this place, you won't be disappointed!!  Great server too!!

5wCNxk5xOgY__RWHJ3Y4Ow.text: The avocado salad is one of the best I've seen eaten.  Dressed in champagne vinegrette.   The grilled cheese is another great dish served with non greasey fries and home made ketchup.  More like marinara. Spacious. Sports on the big screens. Corn hole in the the back yard. Plenty of outdoor seating. Sunshade over half. 30 beers on tap. Half a dozen wines as well.  I had a Bundaberg ginger beer. Yum. Haven't had one since Australia. Kind staff.   3 non gender bathroom stalls. The music was decent for us old folks.  Billboard top 10 of 1984. I just wish this place was adult only.

EGxhbEnWALiScLaimKF80w.text: Went there for dinner and drinks last night. Another reminder of why I need to spend more time in downtown phoenix! Amazing place. The server was super friendly and very knowledgeable of the beers on tap, gave us great recommendations and I got to try a handful of them.   The food was great as well. Their burgers are well known and I had fried riblets which were delicious!  Overall, great experience and great prices. Thanks guys!

6-eCFM6MB8sshWxPxaHnXw.text: My favorite place in Phoenix to get a flight of beer.  If your a craft lover or beer snob, both will enjoy the beer menu here.  Perfect for afternoon drinking!

cnyn4UL46dC1Sb2bMKfW3A.text: If you like beers, this is place to go. They have tons of selection. We usually do the flight where we pick 6 types to taste before committing to a pint. Their menu pair well with the beers. They have limited parking, one TV and an open flow to the patio. It's a great place to meet up with a group of friends but it can be very loud and echoie.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flight of beers
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sausage platter (brat, polish, chorizo, potatoes) with house-made ketchup, honey &amp; spicy mustards and horseradish.

s3TgHjthDaN-L4a8sE4S0g.text: Great atmosphere and even better patio! Great part of town with nearby metered parking. I was told to order the burger and I did, they were nice enough to sub tots and the whole thing was great! The wait staff was awesome at walking us through the craft beer selection and helped us to pick out beers to sample. I was pleased to find at least three beers that I loved on the menu. After the food was dropped off the place started picking up and we didn't see our waitress for quite a while. We were able to flag someone else down to cash us out but still a very good experience overall.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. they were helpful in picking out beers to sample

gHYh1YKdgO8lHPpatAefcw.text: I ate here three times during my week-long conference; the food was great and very well-priced, the beer was excellent and the staff were friendly, fast and very knowledgeable about their huge selection of beers on tap.  This place is a short walk from the convention center and adjacent hotels and totally worth it.

op6IJicmsygFEyDoMqn2aw.text: Love this place...food is amazing and drinks are great too....nice atmosphere...patio is beautiful!

iHYBMUifDOqfFOXRxnzvXg.text: If the Branch Davidians were into craft beer, this is where they'd pray. Mustachioed hipster beer  cultists mingle with business suit clad professionals in search of a great brew.   Very beer-knowledgable staff with top notch bar fare that will not make you feel guilty in the morning makes this gem a must-do for microbrew enthusiasts. Portions are generous and not overtly greasy as is typical of such a spot. Atmosphere is apropos for a beer-centric joint, but don't hesitate to being the family during daylight hours.   Amazing selection of crafts.  Indoor and outdoor seating, you could stay here for a meal, or begin and end your night hours later in bliss.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Great patio

71onh_rxH1eano9nnqGdsQ.text: Awesome food! Great atmosphere and TONS of beer on tap!  One of my favorites in the city!

kMZtOK5dSnZLVi4_x9-UqA.text: Great fish tacos. That's all I've had the few times I've been there. I'm a creature of habit so when I find something I like I stick to it.

P4ziHRHu5UjH0s2aJPOdmg.text: Great atmosphere and service. The beer menu is fantastic! It is so fun to have so many choices that you don't usually get! Everyone at the table was happy with their food and drink choices.

1fMvLdvmgY-vC4nEfwCyAw.text: Great beer selection! Food is top-notch; friendly knowledgeable staff. Definitely a do-again! We came for lunch; I had the Matador and my husband had the 810.  Highly recommend, even if you have to drive a bit to get here (we drove from Chandler).

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

b8TOHzi27N6Yz645LpCJ5Q.text: Lot of beer choices For me a limited menu A little expensive My wife likes skinny beer which they do not offer so this is a one and done for me

72o0B9t3Y3nKTzt7y2NpQA.text: Burrito is super dry. And served with fried pig skins! Yuck. Also ordered the fall special shrimp flat bread and it was OK.  Beers are great ordered the Keller Weiss and blonde d orange and both were very nice.  Service good.

YIVVPsV-ZgoMyQXS8-lpIg.text: Great rotating selection of beers and great food to pair with them. They have excellent flatbread pizza and some of the best burgers in Phoenix.   Staff is great overall and if you can't decide on a beer, ask their bartender, Cory. She's great and can always pick a good one for your taste!

-OuO_alNC4k7QKODfyoAFg.text: Okay, we have been meaning to try this place for a while, and on the way back from a WONDERFUL performance of Swan Lake by Ballet Arizona, we stopped in. Very cool vibes, great outdoor seating. We wish they would have more porters, stouts, or brown ales instead of so many IPA's...after all, it is fall! Beer was priced between $6-$8 a pint. Very attentive server, even though she was hopping through a lot of tables. We ordered the mess (a poutine of sorts) and the fun guy, a mushroom and veggie pizza. Both were seriously lacking any zip, just like the 2 stars, meh. I don't think the chef used any salt or other spices from the taste of them. Would we come here again? Nope, there are many, many other places that have much better food for the price and beer we actually like.

JZGRN37rI0j8cPjP_OsW_Q.text: 4 stars for beer variety and flights, 4 stars for service considering how busy it was, 3 stars for atmosphere and no stars for food equals 3 more than fair stars. (Mathlete I was not)  Tons of people crowded this place and with a 15min wait and high stars on yelp I thought this would be solid. I'm learning just because there's a crowd doesn't guarantee good eats. My hummus plate appetizer featured vegetables that looked like they were cut by a 5yr old and the hummus was definitely store- bought or needs some serious recipe editing. Pita bread was most def. store-bought. My husband's burgers were unseasoned and bland. When that man doesn't finish sliders something is very wrong..  Beers were crisp and cold and fun to order on a flight sheet with tons of flavors and brands I never heard of. Lighting was way too bright, I felt like I was an ant in the sun under a magnifying glass, not very complimentary on people's faces. All in all even with the beer choices I won't be coming back, I can get a beer variety for cheaper at Bevmo and make my delicious homemade hummus to top it off.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Needed some serious seasoning
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sad ammature hummus appetizer

uFoC3uyx4cXg2jZFA0gRbw.text: Had bookmarked this place ever since it aired on Check, Please! Finally visited two weeks ago and was unimpressed. Service was lacking with poor attention and no enthusiasm by the waitress. Over priced bar food. Ordered the wings and flat bread pizza. Wings were ok but then again I could have found wings anywhere. Pizza was large and enough to take home leftovers. Really nothing special to say. Bookmark removed.

kRyE_VqTy3GYW3SzB_EkNQ.text: This place kicks ass. Found it almost by mistake but now it's on my "must return" list. Over 30 brews to choose from and a menu of great eclectic items. I had a flat bread pizza and my colleague had a turkey sandwich. Fantastic outdoor patio option with an interior decor that is funky, functional, and just the right amount of urban industrial. I would strongly recommend this spot. Knocked it off the wall....

RETIcUfn6LF5e0DljVlPGw.text: I've been here quite a few times now I've had the Casbah Pizza which is absolutely delicious. The mass is also very very good. Tonight I tried a different pizza with lots of wild mushrooms and veggies very very good. My husband tried the barbecue chicken pizza which was also very very good. I haven't had anything yet that is not absolutely wonderful and delicious

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The board with all the beers and wine
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Barbecue chicken pizza very good
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4IX4n7mb27aS7zXZnb5YWQ.text: Service has improved immensely. Food always amazing and beer selection is what brings me here most days. Thank you!

nwudiX9CohsFDbXEAiB0kw.text: Fantastic selection of beer and wine and a few ciders! If you are an avid beer drinker you definitely want to check it out, the food is always pretty good too. Long bar and lots of tables for dates or groups of friends to gather at. A neat place to begin your night at for sure, not the most popping place but perfect to grab a beer BEFORE heading to a concert, event or bar crawl. Would recommend t check thus place out, right across the street from Film bar and Cobra Arcade if you are looking for a fun night.

phTPmMbA1Tj_2ZNmBt_4FQ.text: I liked the atmosphere, what was upsetting was their small happy hour options. Not what I expected

X4GClnmjpPS1dvLzoq2Yfg.text: I discovered Angels Trumpet House after a friend shared with me this place was named one of Phoenix's 50 best places to try. I came here specifically for the grill cheese that was featured on this Top 50 list. Cheese, cheese, cheese all day long I could eat this product...in so many forms. My arteries would not like it but my palette can't get enough. But it did get just enough of the grill cheese on sourdough with several cheeses--not the standard cheddar either. It was tasty but nothing I'm over the moon about. A TON O' BEER on tap, so much local brew adds to the hipness of this place. The ambience reminds me of the food court at IKEA. This restaurant has potential to be something...better.

PD5J_nhwVVYYW42KwrVjrQ.text: such a great place! cool atmosphere, GREAT food and GREAT service! I'm not a huge beer drinker.....so I was super happy that in addition to their plentiful craft beer list, they also had craft wine! My husband and I will definitely be back!

eSvloLhKScJjjnWOjDRNaA.text: A world class beer bar in Phoenix with delicious food. This is something special.  I used to find the chalkboard beer menu a bit difficult to deal with, and it's still a hassle occasionally, but the excellence of the beer selection and the tap maintenance, the deliciousness of the food, particularly the burgers... I go every chance I get.

6LtRjwdzyP6PUggQaR8aSA.text: If you're going to call your place an "Ale House", I can't think of a better way to start than 31 taps dispensing a wonderfully broad selection of bier styles from around the world. Probably the best rotating selection in the Valley--you never know what you will find. With this much variety, your best option is to go for the sampler If you like bier--very cost effective with 6 samples for $9. This is one of those pubs that you need to plan ahead and bring a DD with you, because with the ample array of high alcohol biers, you can find yourself "over the limit" quickly. The food is good, and the servers were enthusiastic and knowledgeable about both the drink and food options. Of the bier absorbing fare, my choice is the spud tacos, filled with sweet potato, corn and Chihuahua cheese.

xhY0FZraOkHk-PrqDar85A.text: I was meeting a pretty big group last night, and when we got there they were waiting to add another table so we could sit down. We figured it would be about 20 minutes so we sat at the bar for our first drink. A couple was leaving so we took their seats (their empty glasses in front of us...EMPTY). The bartenders waled by us and it was impossible to get their attention. When they did finally come over to us it was to talk over our heads to two customers waiting for drinks! We were finally able to make contact, at which point the bar tender pointed to the EMPTY glasses and just said "oh, those aren't yours." OK, even if they HAD been ours they were empty! You should ask if we need anything else.  SO we had our $8.00 drink then made our way over to join our friends. Someone mentioned a menu was coming...never happened. The waiter saw us, but we couldn't get his attention long enough to ask for anything. Now at this point, I didn't WANT to give them my money for their overpriced beer and mediocre food. I did finally get the waiter's attention long enough to ask for water as he refilled everyone else's water glasses. He still didn't ask my friend and me if we wanted food or any drinks. They were pretty neglectful of our table in general - the number of empty glasses and the lack of attention to refilling said glasses was crazy! Everyone had to track down the server in order to get their bills (except my friend and me since we had zero service = zero dollars!). It was such awful service that I ended up using their patio simply to catch up with friends (that was nice) and drink their water. I didn't spend one more dime at their establishment after that first drink at the bar, which is crazy considering I went their with every intention of having at least 2 drinks and food. I will NOT come back here - My desire to spend that much money on drinks is approx. zero if the experience is THAT bad.

C5Q9zahUTLWSlxj2gpUflg.text: Excellent beer selection. Any beer geek definitely check this spot out. If your looking for a bud light and a game your taste buds might explode here. But great atmosphere and nice TVs for games. Only reason I give a 4 and not a 5 is because the bartender was a little rude and never checked on us. Good thing another bartender was more than willing to help out when need be.

H-lW1aaC_s1RYKzWmFT2lA.text: We went on the unofficial opening night and the place was packed! The owner was at the door greeting everyone as they walked through and we randomly got a free beer, which made for a really nice bonus! The atmosphere is really cool and laid back and you cant go wrong with their beer selection. A little pricey, but worth if for the beers on tap. I cant wait to go back!

N8R0d2FxQmEncZprIZMJWQ.text: OK I gave this place the benefit of the doubt by visiting a second time but when we visited for lunch they still continue to have major issues with the place. Our food order was once again messed up as it was the previous time we visited. The server also knew little to nothing about the beers they had on tap.  I think it is bizarre that when four people order food at the same time that the kitchen cannot expedite everything so that everyone gets served at the same time.

Vq456ZIUkPV0zCSkdRZGow.text: I was in Phoenix for a couple of days for a conference and found this place this first evening, a Wednesday, and was impressed enough to bring friends back Friday. It is great! I don't know what the complaints in other reviews about the service are talking about. The Tractor pizza with eggs and brussel sprouts was even better than I was hoping. As a brewer and fan of Belgian ales, I was impressed with their selection on tap, and the choose-your-own flights made me very happy.

2ja_XgdHTwBLy_F4FaMNSg.text: I took my son who has been living in Sweden to Angels since he likes good beer.  And he was noy disappointed.  The price was right for the quality of the beer.  We also enjoyed the food I had the sweet potatoe tacos and the were great.  He loved that so many varieties of good beers were on tap.  Definitely going again especially if all three of my son's are home.   Good beer good food good people

xFzqz8tVqpsePx9J3A00mw.text: One of the most diverse beer selections in AZ.  Friendly service.  Very good food as well, I had the "810" sandwich that was very tasty.  Nice local people doing a great thing.

78fJFm9mRvvAPa2rKcUeXw.text: Great stuff, right in my wheelhouse. 30-some craft brews (some local, many hard-to-find) up on a chalkboard. Start your "quest for fun". We were fortunate to get seated right away -- bustling and energetic on a Wednesday night. Friendly, attentive service. The chalkboard can be overwhelming, and our server tried to steer us in the direction of samplers, but my out-of-town buddy & I decided on a funky IPA for me and a local red ale for him. Excellent. Food is pretty much upscale bar food, and done well. Started with a plate of hot soft pretzels -- 4 crispy/soft/salty mini-loaves that hit the spot. On to a stoudt and a pale ale. I had a super grilled chicken sandwich on a fresh roll with bacon, BBQ sauce and fried onion strings. Loved it. His steak sandwich was just as good. One final porter for him and a water for me (I'm driving) and that was it.  We need more places like this in Phoenix.

NcDN2BOIUjClyqITm5a7-g.text: We arrived around 5pm on their first Saturday night. Bar was full but there were some open spots along the high tops along the windows. The beer list was amazing and, props for using correct glassware for each beer. The reason for the 3 stars was the food. We started out with the chicken wings. I always use these as a barometer for a place that calls itself an ale house. They were served hot, but dry. Three accompanying sauces were served (Ranch?/Some sort of light cinnamon flavored/  and a Tabasco-like spicy one). Unfortunately all 3 sauces failed. Please don't try and re invent the wheel and  don't try and fancy-up wings. Would never order these again. We then split the roasted beet and arugula salad. The roasted beets were fabulous and just the right amount of crumbles. We did not particularly care for the metal plate the salad was served on, as both of us kept getting that metal on metal scrapping feeling when we dug into it. The service was friendly and prompt, our waitress was helpful, although had no idea what we were talking about when we asked about sour ales. I asked because an article had mentioned that it was a favorite of one of the owners. We would go back for a few beers, maybe try something else small off the menu, but at this point I would be hesitant to order a full meal or bring a bunch of people in to eat.

coY44PfaIJZydoZNpifJQg.text: Didn't try the food but it looked great. Super busy when I was there but that just means they're doing something right. The beer on tap was great!

LFlWDq6Nv-PnuR-ucZRjRA.text: I really wanted to like this place.  I was in with a friend a few months ago and we had a great bartender and I had a couple of beers but we didn't have any food.  This time I came back with family and and we had food.  This place suffers from the more is better and more bacon is even better mentality that is in vogue with those that don't understand balance.  The meat pizza was good but over topped which made the crust go soft and bacon dominated all of the meats.  My wife had the summer berry salad special.  She liked it but said the dressing was too oily and didn't have enough vinegar.    I had the Garfield which is a turkey wrap with bacon and cranberry aioli.  The only flavor was bacon.  I really missed the cranberry flavor.  A simpler version done at SunUp is much more balanced.  The beer selection was skewed bizarrely to +7% ABV beers.  There were only a couple of "sessionable" beers available.  The ESB I tried was flat and tasted more like a brown.    The house ketchup it terrible - it isn't sweetened and tasted like canned tomato paste.  It is bitter and sour and really ruined the decent fries that came with my sandwich.  If the place could lose some illusions and pull back a bit it could be a great spot.  Oh, the place only had a few tables of people and noise level was horrible, maybe that is why the waitress missed my iced tea order, although the staff seemed to have no problem talking to each other for long stretches.  Given the spotty service and the fact that one of our glasses was dirty and my daughters soda had something floating in it, I won't be quick to come back.  My wife commented that the bathrooms and the dining area were very clean.

v1n8yqQWS70nS7IBVZSBMg.text: After 3 visits, it's time for a review. But first, I just have to address some of the other, more negative reviews -   1. "The chalkboard is confusing" - No it's not. Find a beer you like the sound of, or the style, tell the server the number. Easy 2. "The colours of the chalk hurt my eyes" - really? get some glasses. 3. "It closes too early" - come earlier 4. "It's too busy" - come later 5. "I don't like craft beer" - don't come at all 6. "I have to share my table, eeew" - unless you are paying their bill, what's yer problem? make some new friends. 7. "It's too loud" - It's a bar, it's supposed to be loud 8. "the parking lot is too small" - be thankful that there is a (free) parking lot. There is always street parking or you could ride a bike. 9. "there's not enough bike parking" - chain it to a lamppost. 10. "The beers keep running out" - it is a rotating selection, they are not running out, they are changing. 11 & 12 "The beers are too expensive" - "Where is the Coors/Bud/Miller?" - I give up.  The fact that this bar is so unique is probably why so many people are confused and write dumbass reviews. It takes them out of their comfort zone. It is for this very reason that I am giving it 5 stars. Most places are exactly the same as everywhere else and kudos to Angel's Trumpet for daring to be different.  I love the beer selection, I love that I haven't heard of most of them. I also love the food. The onion and blue cheese quesadilla was amazing. The bison BLT in a blanket was a knockout and the avocado salad made my vegetarian girlfriend very happy. The service has been good all 3 visits.  What really blew my mind during the last visit was the quality of the music. When a bar plays The Jam, Madness, The Specials, The Clash, Talking Heads, Depeche Mode, The Police, The Beat, I know there is someone in charge (even if only in charge of the music) with good taste.  One suggestion - the chalkboard on the patio should be raised. It's too low when people sit at the table right next to it and difficult to read. Other than that one, very minor inconvenience, this place is unique and it rocks. I will be back for sure.

arTjVMFsRJ9oEH7YCXULZQ.text: I really enjoyed this place.  Located in downtown phoenix, the selection of beers is outstanding.  This is my favorite place to eat when attending a downtown event.  With so many great beers, it is nice there is a beer flight of 6 samplers.  The fish tacos are my choice and it is a lot of food.  I would not recommend the fries with gravy.   They are not good, maybe have the gravy on the side.  They took the fries back, so it doesn't affect my 5 star rating.

2ilVBcGKS34TtHxeXrj5aA.text: dropped by on a Sat night...had to wait 15 mins for a table so by the time I sat down I was a little peeved. from then on my experience was good; ordered a burger and a Flatbread accompanied by a couple of local brews. actually the food and beer was very good. if you want your burger cooked order it well done.  overall good experience.

85RJQPa5q1YrZCNWpAUXwg.text: Great atmosphere, beer and service on those things alone it is 5 stars but was not impressed with the food and the table had 4 different dishes.  That being said the fries were awesome.  This place was packed and people love it but the burrito and the Matador sandwich were very average.

Uw_L1mM8FM1vLLv3m8lbzw.text: This place has a really great beer selection and the service was great. The food here was really good and had great portions. They give you samples of a beer before getting it, which is really cool. This place looks terrible on the outside, but the inside is really nice.  I did have one problem...the parking. It's terrible, I hate having to park on the street.

hOns5-QgY5NQ3o6HGIz2Tw.text: I really like this place. I really really like it.  31 draft craft beers... all written out on some sort of chalk board... you are bound to find one that your little heart desires.  I really enjoy oatmeal stouts so my waitress was able to recommend one that I fell in love with.  They are ever-changing.  A little on the pricier end but worth it.  The decor is great... & I love the patio.    Their flights are served on muffin pans.  I thought that was super clever.  Food looks great... I stole some sort of meaty concoction of a pizza slice for the people I was with & it was cheesy perfection.  Can't wait to try the other stuff on the menu as well.

GfmL0G1HsU-q6ds3n6gkeg.text: Great food! Good prices. Nice backyard. Lots of beer. I've been both with friends and with my mom and toddler, and the experience is always positive. The backyard (during the mid-week mid-day) was a great place for my mom and I to lunch while my toddler played. On weekends and evenings the bar is a great place to meet friends for a delicious bite!

OxCWUawbHL9scghU6HKaXw.text: This is what locally owned business is all about - in this case, an inspired husband-wife team.  You never know what cold micro brews will be available sourced across the globe - from day to day and from hour to hour. A keg finishes, they hook up a new keg and change the chalkboard listing. Always a surprise - a delightful, delicious surprise.  And the pub grub - best I've ever had anywhere. Full of surprises from a chef bursting with ideas. Fried egg to top off a flatbread pizza, pecan pie pop tarts, wild game sausage with condiments made in house daily ... perfect complements to the delicious offerings on tap.  Downtown might need to be a place to live - people might not want to drive home after sampling the riches on the streets down here!

J68qcpcWnW_HYjTovN_a0A.text: This place is incredible, i'm not one to often go out for burgers. But when I go to Angels Trumpet it is always the Brewlee Burger that comes with a fried egg. Be sure to get the fries that comes with their home made ketchup (you;d be surprised how likable this side sauce is). I think that's all you need to know... wait the Beer!   They always have new beers to try, order the flat which will give you six samples of the beers of your choice. Outside sitting area with space to play bags.

lp-E5dTV_U5nDh3WxnjJpw.text: Always great beer to choose from and the food is great.  I love the flat breads.  So yummy.  Hit or miss on the wings.  The first time we had them, they were AMAZING.  The 2nd and 3rd time? Meh.  Wish those would be consistent.  But overall..super great place to hang out.

iRXiZoRvQuhDW_-Qa2zulA.text: This is one of my favorite places in Phoenix!  The first time I went, I had this amazing beet and radish salad for breakfast.  I need to clarify that I HATE beets and radishes and I NEVER eat salad for breakfast.  However, I couldn't shovel it in fast enough.  The beers are fun and I've been able to develop a new love.  I send everyone I know here. In fact, I loved it so much I hosted my next big party here.   I highly recommend everything, but if you love wings please try them. They come naked, with dipping sauces on the side. The meat is so good, you don't even need the sauce.

6-tlMT16Vzxmm-CqXCS_dw.text: Obnoxiously greasy food is this restaurant's biggest flaw.

TXcLsHHb2zl4v90bk77J2w.text: I love this place.  I go to a lot of places.  Some try to be too ambitious and fall on the face with their overly-complicated menus. Some try to take things down to a more simple idea and end up overshooting, making everything bland and too usual.  Angel Trumpet has no such flaws.  They're also not perfect, but I can justify that 5-star review.    Let's get it out of the way:  The chairs suck, they're kind of uncomfortable and rigid.  The beer prices are kind of what we like to call "astronomical" for a mostly poor beanly-fellow such as myself.  The food can come out a little slow.  It's all True, if someone else said it in another review, I can back that all up.  And yet, I don't really give a damn.  This is a local joint in downtown Phoenix peddling 31 different beers that are always rotating.  Not a "regular" beer in sight.  It's what downtown Phoenix has been clamoring for.  And if you're coming to an ale house, you're coming to drink first and eat later.  Still, I like their food.  Stroganoff burger...oh man.  I'm such a sour cream whore and, I love my food saucy and wet but I hate soggy stuff.  The bun stood up to the stroganoff sauce and the sour cream and the mushrooms and the juicy medium-cooked beef perfectly.  The 810 sandwich with hand-pulled turkey works in spite of the overly-southwestern theme (pull back on the adobo a bit, it can taste like the restaurant equivalent of "taco seasoning" that every white person I know uses to make tacos) because each of the ingredients is high-quality.  The bread is fresh and crisped.  The ribbon chips are amazingly thin.  People have griped and complained for literally decades that downtown doesn't have any neat, laid-back places to have a beer and be a human, with most places downtown still ready to serve the post-5pm cattle herd and nothing more.  Here you have a genuine Phoenix experience.  Don't gripe too much.  Soak it up.    We'll will be back there.  Will you?

WAbx9-V22vTOv9tQy08v5Q.text: This place is my favorite place in Downtown PHX.  They are always rotating kegs out so there are always so many new beers to choose from.  Their wings tossed in hot sauce are definitely the best you can get downtown.  They also have TV Dinner Tuesday, where they serve a special meal in a TV dinner style plate.  Can be very busy, especially when it's nice out so plan on possibly waiting to sit.

sOQ7MRe40qDyWIZxI78zLw.text: I have visited this place on quite a few occasions, none have been fantastic yet I have come back. Tonight has ruined it forever for me. The manager made a mistake and took no responsibility for it, and blamed her staff.  A few friends met for a birthday get together we drank we ate and we payed our tabs and tipped well. After we had payed our tab before we had started our last drinks, since our server wanted to go home on time. One sip in my friend, who brews beer and is very knowledgable, realized it was not what he had expected from the waitresses description. Since we all work in the service industry my friend was hesitant to even bring up the issue. We convinced him to just ask, which he expected to hear a blatant no because the beer is expensive. He asked and the waitress stated "Unfortunately we can't resell that beer... but we can get you something else but I will ask that you taste it first." Which we understood as we could replace the beer they didn't like with one that he definitely did for no cost. Especially since, without any indication she removed the previous drink from the table. The waitress walked away while rolling her eyes.  After the beer came a check came shortly after. We explained to a different waiter the situation and his response was "It's only $6.50". My friend explained that had he known he would be paying for the beer he would not have ordered it but that the last waitress had given the impression that this beer would not be charged. We paid the $6.50. My friend honestly did not want a discount, free food. All he wanted was recognition that a mistake was made and to hopefully prevent this from happening again.  I am currently sitting and listening to the manager (the same waitress that "explained the policy to us initially") blame our original waitress for her mistake. "I can't just say no it's our policy that we don't take any beers back." But if you can't say that and you can't take the beer back then you just leave customers confused. She is taking no responsibility for the fact that she caused the entire situation. The drink policy is on the food menu, which if you are sitting and drinking for hours like we were is not visible when ordering drinks.   Train your managers how to speak to customers.

g0b5vszIBYv1Q2OkgXF0MQ.text: I'm sure the food is good, unfortunately the chicken I ordered was as is dry as the dessert and the waitress had a ops mentality. That's to bad

xbspXjH74_BBcVC3rXd69w.text: This restaurant is quite possibly my all time favorite.  Been coming here since they opened,  lots of great beer and the food is phenomenal!

C6hN6NrcK3AaKpLRxcfbJg.text: Great space design and quality beer selection.    I really want to love this place as it's in my neighborhood and I enjoy findingobscure craft and micro brews, but the service is a little slow, they're not knowledgeable about the beers they offer, and the inside space is VERY loud.    The design of the space/building is great.  Great view of the downtown skyline.  But I really wish they didn't build that shade structure that looks so temporary and which draws your attention away from all the other great design elements.  I haven't tried more than 3-4 items on the food menu, so I'm not going to review the food.  What I had seem to be a bit experimental, and was good, but nothing memorable.  With a few adjustments, I think this place will be a great downtown spot.

uEFb5nI6nYeZ4oip6xvnFA.text: This was part 2 of our food adventure and it did not disappoint! The place is very aesthetic. Love how they set up the place. It's a seat yourself type place and they have a ton of beer on tap.   Pros: +nice and relaxing feel, inside and outside seating +there's a beer sampler you can get so taste multiple beers for 10$ +the food is delicious!   Spam slider was a unique twist on using spam. The chicken quesadilla was also amazing! Love the pickled onions on there. It was part of the seasonal menu too so not sure if they serve this all the time.   We wanted to try dessert because we heard it was good but the flavor of tart they had that day did not sound appetizing so we passed.   Cons: - can't think of any

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spam sliders
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beer sampler

-QblXBoa0eqpR7JxqdE6ng.text: Great and creative food choices! Great beers on clean taps. The only thing strange is the bathrooms are kind of gross probably because the building is old. And there is no sign above the door to indicate where to enter. It was confusing. The place would get more walk ins with better signage. Otherwise great place. Service was great too!

WEXEgK8HmSwAcjtdk0I0xQ.text: My friends and I came here for dinner, and we were shocked to have gotten a table for 6 instantly at 7:30 on a Saturday.   The atmosphere: Chill. The chalkboard with all the different beers they had is cool. The crowd seemed older (at that time) and was just hanging out. Our waiter, however, seemed kind of all over the place. We didn't see him much after our food order was taken; we had to wave him down because we didn't get two items and the table was more than halfway done with the food. He said later on that the kitchen or runner staff was new?? So I'm not sure who's "fault" it was. He tried to fix it by comping the app and giving a 50% discount on the entree. I guess at that point, what else could he do?   The food: it was ok. The burger wasn't anything special. My fish tacos were good, and I was thought the portion (2 pieces of fish per taco) was a generous ratio. But I didn't care for the fries, which appeared to be poutine - good thing they were free right, ha! The fries tasted kinda burnt, overdone...and that ruined it for me.   The beer: good things throughout the table.   Overall, maybe a place for beer and not a meal.
