It's the type of place that "The Middle" by Dj Snake would play ad Infinitum. It's chill yet hip. Diverse yet monochromatic. Liberal but conservative. The place truly caters to all personality types.  I got a burger because I had just watched that episode of SpongeBob when he dueled Poseidon for best Kraby Patty - and also because I need to eat something to stop that rising feeling of drunkenness.  Legit though. Their craft beer and hamburgers are on point. I got a cider and it did not disappoint. Like dat Appleseed boi himself made it. And then the hamburger and fries were to die for. I legit zoned out my friends talking to me for at least an hour (I am not a fast eater) because I was too focused on eating my burger.  When I was done, I got the check in a timely manner from a kind waiter. It was quite affordable!   Angels was a nice stop to refresh and  refuel before I went back out on the town. If you're a Phoenix resident - get in there now and chow down, it will be worth it. If you're just passing through, make sure half your stay is here. For real.

65FqIt2Bnf0OhqnuNaWz1w.text: Angels never really disappoints! I used to live in the Roosevelt Arts district before moving to NYC and this was a regular spot for me. Since I was back in town it was a must (also because my girlfriend loves beer). Coming back to it reminds me that this form of beer spot is preferred, as I love the idea of a rotating draft list.   I went with a cucumber ale that was very refreshing and an order of wings that were surprisingly delicious. I say this both having taking a short break from being vegan, and also I didn't have high expectations as this was the first time I've ever eaten here.   Overall, great place and will also be a favorite in downtown PHX!

MeK5r9VxCw7WzgmMBJ3NVA.text: We were there on a Sunday afternoon. The first impression was not good. They are not in a great neighborhood & because of the weeds & over grown plants out front it looked like it was another deserted building.  Because we were meeting friends we went in. It was a Really Nice Space!  Decor fitting the Millennial  taste.  All 5 of us ordered something different & we were all pleased. Burgers, grilled cheese sandwich's & dessert.

DsAVr6jG8MTdv956hxo7gw.text: I have enjoyed Angels Trumpet for years, until last night. I always come in with my pets. We sit in the patio. Last night I invited two of my friends as well with their own dogs. We waited 45 minutes to even talk to a server after being seated. We asked multiple times about our server and told that your server will be right with you. Never received water, asked for a order, nothing. We watched while 3 other tables that came in after us were seated and served. Made an attempt to speak to multiple servers around us at other tables and mostly ignored. Finally I decided I did not want to give my money to anyone there that night so we got up and left. Very sad since I enjoy the food and beer selection very much. I guess I will be finding somewhere else to fill my growler.

OsI9hFg27oVHA0Rfpfd-7g.text: In town on business and stopped here.  I am not a beer drinker but the Coppola Pinot Grigio was great. We ordered the hot pretzels, wings, flatbread with pesto-chicken-onions and the fried Cantonese rib let's and the cherry pot tarts.  Everything was great.   31 beers were featured.  Something for everyone.  You won't be disappointed.

o9N5EZV6Px1zTC4M7xWwug.text: Love the selection of craft beers on tap. I haven't branched out much with food, but what I have had is amazingly delicious!

7h1lirmacP7AeCt88NLBGQ.text: Came on a Sunday afternoon to meet up with family. We had 4 kids in our party, ages from 17 months old to 6 years old. I was apprehensive because other reviewers have said it's not kid friendly. While I wouldn't say that's entirely not True, they did have a high chair for the littlest one and a kids menu that's fairly priced for the amount of food they give. My daughter had a pepperoni pizza that I tried a slice of. It was really good, not too greasy and a very thin and crispy crust. I had the pork burrito and it was pretty good. The burrito was a good size and the pork had great flavor and was very tender. The amount of chips they give with it was comically tiny, I think there were 6 total and that's not an exaggeration. However, for me, that was plenty considering the size of the burrito. I could see someone who is really hungry being upset though since they specifically mention the chips on the menu.  No doubt about it, their primary focus is beer which is probably why my youngest sister suggested it. I didn't try any but I like beer so I wouldn't be opposed to coming back to try some.

dVkBvVRh1bHJx2fdBa5jEQ.text: This is probably one of my favorite places for craft beer and food. I'm here almost once a week. The staff is always cheerful and friendly and the vibe is laid back and unpretentious. I've had several things on the menu, but I'd say by far my favorites are the meat treat pizza, hummus appetizer, and sausage platter. They do a pretty good burger as well. As far as beer selection, it's great. I'm not big on IPA's. I tend to lean more towards the stouts, porters, or sours and they always have a good variety of what I like. Bottom line: I love this place.

EDziIM5mI1XMvLlm4udJfw.text: Just a solid place for food and beer. Great beer selection. Some are definitely offbeat, so I love the sampler option (six decent sized pours). We went on Tuesday to enjoy TV Dinner night. It was an interesting mix of food - chipotle mac and cheese, salad, rice and beans, biscuit and a margarita dessert bar. Definitely carb heavy, but a great deal for $9. Had to try to the homemade Pop Tart - blueberry with a balsamic rosemary reduction drizzle. So delicious. I was stuffed but could not stop eating it. Comfortable, laid back setting, nice patio, friendly service. A great stop before a downtown event.

C_cTrUsj-vnlBYYWPC1NFg.text: I've been coming here sporadically for several years...I love the food, the beer is good (though despite a constant rotation of beer, they manage to not have a lot of diversity in type) but the service is pretty horrendous. Speaking as a long time server/bartender, the wait staff seems terribly disorganized. Good luck trying to get another beer, have a server check on you after you get your food, or close out your tab. Either they're terribly understaffed, or their employees do not understand table service techniques.   Will I return? Probably if friends want to, but I won't ever suggest it again.

qlp2O0DQwm590IP-FC37Aw.text: Had a great happy hour here after work a few weeks back.   Great venue with a ton of seating both indoor and outdoor.   Large beer selection with roughly 40 beers on tap so everyone in the group should be able to find something they like.   Food was solid. Because they had the smoker I went with the brisket sandwich which was well done.

-dAwIHBECWnb0DE0fDefQg.text: Visited Angels Trumpet Ale House yesterday. The location is great. It is right downtown, perfect location. The ambiance is very casual with a beautiful patio. The beer selection is amazing. We had the verde tacos and they were amazing. Service was stellar. Sad I haven't been here before. I for sure will be back soon!

5Ts5FOBbFm6Z-1f2nZQ4Jg.text: A great place to hangout with friends for hamburgers and drinks   good food and nice customer service. Favorite place to come on the weekends

tMlJKMHN1a7eZtTcHShHEg.text: Service was just OK,  hubs said beer was good, selection of beer was great, there was 1 cider & 6 wines also. Then we wanted to order...took awhile to get our server to come back, then we finally ordered,  took a bit to get the food, then we got our food, well, I  got the wings, I didn't get them "tossed" in case I didn't like the sauce,  well, goot thing,  the honey bbq was so hot I couldn't eat it! But it was about impossible to get the servers attention, so I only I 2 wings. Myy husband's sandwich came with fries when he ordered slaw, it took forever to get that corrected.   Good thing, the place seemed kewl, the pretzels and cheese were good, we may try again sometime, dunno...

vTWs5ynmBdfchBsulPoYzA.text: I think Angels Trumpet Ale House (besides having an awesome name) is a really neat place to hang out with friends, sample interesting beers, and take a breather after a busy week. Service can be a tad slow because of how busy it can get, but the servers are friendly and really helpful. The ambiance inside is a cross between casual hipster bar and comfortable after-work hangout bar. I like the wooden tables and stools, not to mention the outside seating in the backyard when the weather is nice.  Angels Trumpet's claim to fame -- and rightly so -- is their beer flights. The system is to grab a piece of paper with six circles drawn on them, write down the beers you'd like to sample using the numbering system updated on a blackboard, and prepare to be excited. The beer selection is unique and ranges from deep and smooth to tangy and fruity. I tend to lean towards lighter, fruitier beers, and out of the ones I've tried, the blood orange cider is hands down my favorite. I'm not a frequent drinker, but taste comes first in my book, and the blood orange cider was a great balance of acidic, fruity, and refreshing.   While the drink portion of the menu is impressive, I found the food portion rather lackluster, which was disappointing because I find drinks are always better when paired with good finger food.   Hot pretzels: These pretzels were advertised as using beer batter, if I remember correctly, and I was excited for the soft, airy pillows to pair with my beer flight. Unfortunately the pretzels themselves were rather dense and hard on the outside, and they were virtually inedible once they had cooled down a little. The cheese sauce was pretty good, the mustard was unremarkable, and overall I didn't think this was worth the ~$10 asking price.   Hummus platter: This platter was pretty generous in size, and the hummus was pretty flavorful taste-wise. It wasn't as smooth as I would've liked, with some chunks of garbanzo that hadn't been blended in. I liked the cucumber pairing, but the pita bread was dry and floury without much of that freshly-made fragrance I was looking for.   Poutine: The size of this dish was again generous, and we couldn't finish it even between three people, but the positives stopped there. The fries were limp and soggy, even the ones that hadn't been covered with gravy. The gravy was definitely not freshly made, and when paired with the fries, there was an overall flavor of "having sat around for too long" (if anyone knows the proper vocabulary word for that, please tell me!). I wouldn't recommend ordering this on the off chance that it is freshly made that day.  I'd certainly come back for hanging out and sampling some unique beers, but not for the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hot pretzel with mustard and cheese dip.
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Poutine.
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hummus platter.

2NLEnFewBUkfOYrD-hxqxQ.text: Cute place. Loved the atmosphere. Service and food was great. The parking..... well not so much. We had to park kinda far since they don't have a big parking lot but that's something anyone can just look past.

RPsUSzWCwdRX-3GRQVnTug.text: WOW do we love this place!  Craft Beer (so many different craft beers) and wine on tap.  The wings are unique and fantastic.  Great for a big or small group.  Nice outdoor area with bags to keep you busy.  The service has been consistently good.  We have never gotten a spot in the lot but there is plenty of on street (pay with app) parking.

Hi4zQReGPTYl-gbesw-mJg.text: I can't believe I hadn't reviewed this place already. This is my go to place for beers. They're revolving beer board is super cool, and you can find something for any beer lover there. Their grilled cheese and fries is one of my favorite meals in the world. I would also recommend their homemade poptarts. The place itself is super cool with a giant, dog-friendly patio in the back with cornhole.

bc3iRwD44JBXGGz15HzvAw.text: Stopped in here after hiking for a late lunch and beer. They have a great space! Indoor area is modern and open. Outdoor area is shaded and has misters to keep it cool. There are Adirondack chairs and corn hole available outdoors. Beer selection is large but was under-whelming in our opinion. We were trying to stay with local beers but the sign outside didn't have Brewery names or locations so you would have to ask the server for this information. We had the wings and a burro for food. The wings were AMAZING. Great sauce called moose drool that you must get. Finished up with the homemade pop tarts which were raspberry churro I believe and absolutely worth it. Parking lot was small but we got lucky getting a spot. There is parking around the area if you can't get a spot in the lot. Definitely worth checking out!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churro pop tarts
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beer flights!

nFnZyJ0ViD2J6BlpOkOqTw.text: Any time we cant decide where to eat, Angel's Trumpet is our go-to. They have a large seating area, incredible beer and wine list (seriously its a whole wall) and pretty standard but tasty food.  They even have a large patio with outdoor seating, games, and is pet friendly. The only bad part of the place is parking is very limited and the place tends to be packed.   I always go for the Matador but all of their sandwhiches and burgers look amazing. And I love anything on a pretzel bun. They used to have tattertots but the last time I went, I was told they no longer make them (hopefully they started again).  But really the food isnt what brings people into Angel's Trumpet, its good but it isnt anything you couldn't find better somewhere else. What brings people in is their huge tap list, which is always changing. It's their home made poptarts that are incredible, and their Tuesday night TV dinners which change weekly and are only available to first come first serve customers. Ive yet to come in on a Tuesday but I've religiously followed them since the first time I heard about it, and you can see what they'll have on their Facebook. If you're not sure what to think of their expansive drink menu: get a flight of a few beers, try a bit of everything and you're sure to not be let down. The servers are also great at offering suggestions, whether you're trying to pair with your meal or just your personal preference.  The story about Angel's Trumpet is also a pretty cool one, the owner used to own the building for years and when he retired, it was his dream to run a gastropub, so he converted his old office building into Phoenix's very first gastropub. And with all the changes hitting downtown, I love the idea that a local man wanted to create something he loved out of the place he retired rather than just selling the spot to another condominium company.

8tG-F3p-GIdy4o29SqkfXQ.text: This place was super fun. I was in Phoenix for a conference and this was the perfect place for a large group, or for families or for dogs. It's one of those anything goes and it's just lovely. Tons of beers to choose from so I had to do a flight to get all the local brews In. I also did my best to fly back two beers that they canned for me with minimal dripage in my luggage. Rad place. I'd like to try it at night next time.

3JonqruZLhPSo9QP1xBrgw.text: A friend took me to this place, very busy, took a while to be seated, at least 5 min standing til a lady finally seated us. We sat down, our server was extremely sweet and helpful. I ordered a burger and asked for it to be well done, and it came out pretty rare, not at all what I like, felt like I was eating a live cow. I told my server and he went above and beyond and didn't charge me at all for my meal. Overall I give 4 stars for a long wait and for the undercooked meat, but 5 stars and more for our server.

4o3h_huzNkVcnBu3NYfD1A.text: Great place to come and chill. Explore their happy hour menu options and savor their different beers on tap

VrDORSXZv1jw45SlSO3AyQ.text: Love this place. Great atmosphere and the best beer garden. Love the revolving chalkboard of beers, always something new to try, and great size pours on the sampler flight. Food is always amazing as well. Do not leave without trying a homemade Pop tart!

oIE_8mvIlaNKYsIoKdwxLQ.text: Pretty solid brewery. I'll start with food-personally I didn't get any, but a bunch of people in my party seemed to be enjoying it. Secondly, drinks. I tried the pumpkin ale and it was surprisingly good. Draft, refreshing, not super hoppy, with a firm yet subtle pumpkin taste. The environment was decent. A bunch of us just sat outside on a picnic bench and enjoyed our drinks there.

7qz08rHuHqdU7uyfSAwrow.text: My second visit here. Great, relaxing place to hang out and grab a beer, plenty to choose from on tap. Decent variety on the menu. Tried the Matador sandwich at my server's rec...excellent, two thumbs up. Very moist brisket served on a pretzel roll w/peppers, onions and a side of horseradish sauce--well done. Fries were disappointing, although they have great potential. Some were outstanding, cooked/seasoned perfectly, but others, including the first couple bites, tasted bad, like they were old or had been through the frier 3+ times...not a good first impression. I finally gave up on them, and I hardly ever don't finish my fries! Lol. Overall though, still 4-stars. Fantastic service/bartender, thank you Annie!!  Will definitely be back and highly recommend! Sorry no pic, I dove into that brisket!!

0NE-wS10u0FSPZt0DtBOVg.text: Good selection draft beers and really good food. Nice people working here. Indoor and outdoor dining. Very friendly place.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

oMe8vsCQp3XtvJWOmxkYeA.text: Splendid selection of craft beers. Great twists on pub fare and look forward to a return trip. Really enjoyed our food. Kudos to the chef and whoever chooses the beer selection.   Hopefully we will not have the same server. I am notoriously a 20+% tipper. Not tonight. Perhaps because we didn't fit her idea of hipster clientele. Perhaps she's having a tough time in her life. Perhaps because she had to go outside to serve us. We should never have had the wait times we had. We should never have had to ask another server for water. We should never have to flag her down with a question about the beer or the sausages in the appetizer or to get our bill. And she should never scowl at us behind our back and be reflected in the glass windows when I said, "Oh! You're still here!"  And she never cleared our used glasses or dishes.   Another server gave us water. Another server escorted me to the rest rooms on her way back inside. So there are friendly and accommodating servers. Amberly, do not simply write off your older clientele.

LQQJ2gP616daVJ6rYeMBYA.text: Their beer list is wonderful and even has one from New York. It is heavier on the lighter beers and only has one stout (besides an awesome sour Imperial Stout). They even have a good apple mead that isn't dry but not too sweet, either. A bit like biting into a sweet apple with cinnamon and a hint of honey.  Their poutine was great. The gravy tasted like thickened au jus. Their burger was delicious, too. The brisket grilled cheese was odd. There was an almost Italian herb in it. Their salad had good mixed greens and the vinaigrette was good, but that same vinaigrette was tossed over fresh cabbage to make the coleslaw, which was then topped with feta cheese and craisins.   The waitress did seem like her day would have been a lot better if we had decided to go elsewhere, though. And for a table of two, it's a little odd to be met with that attitude from the waitstaff. It's not like we were a party of 10.

2a-6cOVwbTxZQQg9hOPchw.text: Always my favorite stop for lunch and beers when visiting Phoenix .  They always have an EXCELLENT tap list including local, regional and national beers.  Crowler and Growler fills.  Awesome food.  Chill indoor atmosphere.  Great friendly service.    Flatbreads are really good, salads are good and the sausage platter which I just had was amazing.

eiO-O9Jf0RmwCxpKfbOK6Q.text: Wow! First and foremost, I was pleasantly surprised by Angels Trumpet! Traditionally, my expectations for food at alcohol establishments is quite low, but this Ale House really brings it with their menu and food!    Our table started with the Pretzel Bites as an appetizer, yum! These come in sets of 4 bread buns with two dipping sauces on the side. The buns are pipping hot and topped with course sea salt and are nice and buttery. After a strong recommendation from my friends who were returners at the establishment, I ordered the BBQ Brisket Grilled Cheese with fries. YUM! This was a heavy, large meal, but it sure was delicious.   To round off our indulgent meal, we decided to order two desserts to share. We got the special, which was a cookie dough and ice cream roll dipped in dark chocolate and the homemade pop tart. Both were amazing. The cookie roll was very unique and the pop tart was hot and flakey and tasted like a pie. I was surprised to find that the food and dessert were both amazing.   The only downfall to this place is how popular it is! We waited about an hour for our table and the place continued to be packed through the night. It is a popular place for large groups and drinks, so you can expect evenings to be packed.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BBQ brisket grilled cheese with side of fries
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cookie dough ice cream chocolate dipped dessert
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pop tart dessert

hWwjBTFGIZAa_FH0a6kv1A.text: This was a cool find. It was our last stop on a long afternoon and night of pub-crawling and hunger was hitting a few of us. Then we saw the wall of beers, each looking so good... So this place hit the spot. We were there for last call for food (the chicken sandwiches are ridiculously good as are the fries). Also got to sample the beer selections. Between the table we all got to try a coffee stout, a double IPA, a lager or two, a porter...not a bland one in the batch.

ORdW-8Z4SMKCxyJArcLNPQ.text: My husband is the craft beer lover of the two of us, however, we both loved this place. The staff was very knowledgeable and helpful. Drinks were great, good was yummy (and very unique), the atmosphere was very modern-seemed like the place to be if you frequent the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Samples!!

TIm3ObZ6pHU1gqyuVjTEYg.text: I've been here multiple times. I'm a guy that loves beer.   The ONLY reason why I'm NOT giving this place 5 stars...They have a HUGE, actually 2 HUGE chalk boards where they post the 30-40 or so beers they have on tap. Which is awesome. But I like to sort of have a selection of different types and a history on the beers, like where they are from ect... The servers usually know but not every beer. So you either have to ask, know or look up on your phone, plus it's sorta hard to read, just overwhelming.   Other then that, the patio is dog friendly. I've spent a day or to on it drinking with a friend and her dog just relaxing. They even have water bowls for the dogs.   The food selection is a bit limited but they best thin on the menu is the meat pizza, the shit is probably one of the best pizza's i've ever had.  Oh and you can fill up your personal growlers here too.

tYlVlOZnSz6DI7ZWCHe-sg.text: This is a must try if you love beer. 30+ beer taps and 6 wines on tap. I used to live in Portland, and this bar has a PDX "feel" to it. Great service. Great beer. Great patio. What's not to like?

MzlA75pUWHbqgP2h2_Vvig.text: I want that mural in my house.   Everyone mentions the Spam Sliders, and for good reason too: they're awesome. If you have any hesitancy about Spam, just knock it off! They were so good. Spam sorta tastes like a hotdog, with a different sort of consistency. Topped with feta slaw on a toasted mini bun, they're damn tasty.   You've also got an excellent beer selection. It's chalked up on a huge board by number, with a description and ABV and Price. As the tap runs dry, they erase it and put in a new one. The rotation is ever changing. The servers are also really knowledgable about all of the beers and can give you a taste if you're unsure about a selection. You can also do a flight of six if you're looking for a varied selection of beers. No liquor, but they do have some wines.  The atmosphere is lively and loud and the clientelle is all over the board. If you're a smoker, you've got an outdoor patio with heaters.   This is also a great place for a date. The loud atmosphere makes it a fun place to talk and not feel like you have to whisper or feel awkward if there is a pause in the conversation.   I would absolutely come back!

hsLBvUySC2jOeuPWck1pBA.text: Angels Trumpet is my favorite place. Period. We are extremely fortunate to have an ale house of this caliber anywhere in Arizona, and I am so happy they chose downtown to call home.   Where to begin...? The beer!!! 31 rotating taps and a killer bottle list mean that they have something for everyone. The staff are unpretentious and very knowledgeable so if you're not sure where to begin just ask.   The design and furnishings are very well thought out. The food is dynamite and they run all sorts of delicious specials. The mural on the south wall is totally rad. The view of the skyline from the back patio any time of the day is unparalleled.   So yeah. Favorite place. Anywhere. Hope they experience grand success for many years.

1YfHgBjE5dq15y_FTl2S3w.text: Fantastic quality of food and beer. This is perhaps one of the best reasonably priced drinking establishments in Phoenix.

K-f7jivEK8zrXumwuNS27g.text: My girlfriend and I were downtown riding the light rail looking for apartments. We were looking for a place within walking distance of the light rail because it was hot. It was a five or ten minute walk of the stop. It looks a little uninviting from the outside.. Took a minute to find the door.. But once we got it it was really cool. They had a lot of beers on tap - we don't drink - but they had a wide selection. The food was awesome. I got a bacon burger and she got the grilled cheese. The grilled cheese had honey on it , which sounds weird, but she raved about it. It had a hipster sort of feel. They make their own pop tarts which sounded cool but they only had peanut butter and due to an allergy would work. But overall, we'd go back. Maybe once we move downtown!

fLda5D5ea9608NwZt9BMIw.text: I have only been here when it is really busy. I have been happy every time. The food is good and you can't beat their crazy selection. Great place.

YJvbc7LB5D3LiQcqsQuzkA.text: Great beer selection.  The wings and sauce were out of this world.  Cool restaurant.  Loud inside on a busy night.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beer flight $9

0jG4sGgYs5UJBgGdrw6dzg.text: I super love that they have Spam and can add it to things! Love the different types of beer. I had #3, a raspberry wheat by grand canyon brewing; smell of raspberry and initial taste is the fruit with the after taste being kinda creamsicle-y. They also have draft wines.  So, to start off, we had the Mess, which was a mess, but a hot delicious one! The gravy that comes atop the fries was delish. The fries weren't too skinny and didn't get too soggy from the gravy but then again, I don't we let it sit long enough to get soggy. And the cheese curds made for a nice crunch with it. After eating it, I really wanted to add Spam and get a side of gravy lol. Maybe next time.  After the mess, it was now onto the pizza - the meaty treat. It certainly was a meaty treat for your mouth. It had all sorts of meat but with the added Spam, what can I say but 'heaven' (I'm Asian and I love my Spam). Next time, and there will be a next time, there should be a flight involved and another pizza with more Spam lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A meaty treat with Spam!
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Mess. And boy was it a mess - a yummy one lol.

R04Tnt1XOpOVPHM0iCxdow.text: Angel's Trumpet is a nice addition to the downtown Phoenix food and drink scene! I love the dog-friendly patio and the rotating list of beers. I always feel inspired to try new beers here because I can do flights of SIX delicious beers!   Most of the food is great(spud tacos--delicious!) and service has been good each time I went. My only complaint is that it gets REALLY loud in there when it's busy. Loud to the point where you might be yelling for your companion across the table to hear you. Apart from that, it's a great place to hang out with some friends.

x95QxJHExaOUad2cmWTTzQ.text: 31 one brews on tap not including the wine! We had the wings, burger, and tacos. The burger was put together perfectly with a carefully cooked piece of beef and egg. Nothing but a mouthful of flavor in every bite. One of the better burgers I've had here in the valley. The fries could use a little love. The naked wings- on point! Three different sauces to dip in, fried in a good batter/seasoning. Moving onto the tacos.... No shortage of flavorful fish, dipped in a good batter and fried perfectly. The beans are to die for, my only complaint was the shortage of beans... Next time I go, I will order an extra side of beans. This place is a must try with a hipster feel to it. You almost feel like you're somewhere else. They provide water bowls for your animals on the back patio. Great job!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nuff said!
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. What a phenomenal burger! Great flavor cooked perfectly. Big enough for two people. The egg made the sandwich come together.

wMk5wJX-hlygSsex4vUJJA.text: I love this place!  The beers, staff and the atmosphere make this place as amazing as it is. The patio is dog friendly (idk about at night), has misters, corn hole and comfortable seating.  Inside it is very laid back seating great fro groups.  The bar has 6 wines and about 35 beers on tap.  The bartenders and waitress are very knowledgeable and will help you choose a beer that you love.  We prefer to have them help us create a sampler (6 beers) and go from there.  The food is even great!  We have had the pretzels which are amazing the beer cheese makes it.  The pretzel itself is much softer and not as salty as you are probably used to but sooo good.  I have also tried the spam sliders which was AMAZING! haha I know what you are thinking spam gross but it is good and you have to try it!  Only bad thing that I have to say is the parking SUCKS! Carpooling or public transportation are a must!--- Or bring lots of quarters.

J5ASIGgF42BikdcMwic6zw.text: Fantastic place to hang out, great date spot, tons of beers on tap, decent food (sandwich and burgers are the best). Great atmosphere. Staff is friendly. Beers available will change as you sit there so if you find something in a flight you like better order a full one quick. That's Part of the fun.

XaDOqGjuKldOD2pE9LvYFA.text: The place is cool, very hipster. Outdoor and indoor seating with a larger and more descriptive beer menu indoors. Four of us sat down ecstatic about their 6 , 6 oz samplers. Unfortunately of the 18 different flavors we chose, collectively we only enjoyed 2. Really wanted to like this place...It was extremely disappointing.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ah65UwbS_bjznT_Ymcf3_A.text: Cool place with lots of tvs and good food.  Went just before the Cactus Bowl at Chase Field and the place was really busy.  Nice place to chat and hang out with friends.  Looking forward to going back and trying more of the food and drinks.

tSJh85iPr-Hl68wG9bVEPQ.text: A Phoenix favorite! Must try the tractor pizza, and if you're not in the mood for beer they have wine on tap.

sz0AbmBMl-jn8Lw0Na0LQw.text: I liked it a lot!  The beer choice is great though there weren't too many IPA choices.  I'm not a fan of double IPAs nor the wheat nor the dark stouts so that limited my choices.    The yummy chef's burrito was great!  So large I ate only half and the other half in the morning.  I sat at the bar and had a hard time seeing the beer choices on the chalkboard wall b/c of the glare of the light but that's ok, I just stood up and walked around to read them!  Not a big deal.    Fun atmosphere and outdoor seating was great.  Friendly people everywhere.  I rode my bike here and just locked it up outside.  Nice neighborhood feel.  I will definitely return here!  The film bar across the street is a nice activity to follow up with after dinner and happy hour!

RdpmUl10J-NOZQA8DWmXvQ.text: When we want to get out and be around people in a casual and relaxed city atmosphere that has wonderful outdoor seating, this is our go to place! LOVE that I can get a glass of Pali on tap and the selection of beer!

ulwyEPwSdsGsxGKzvH5PSw.text: Our server Sean was very nice and very attentive, and the beer selection was unique and satisfying. This place is only missing one thing.. Vegan food options.. Just add like one or two and I wouldn't have to eat before coming in. Other than that I really like this place and plan on coming back soon!

H9u_Ez2W_Ik0nDpow_OGdA.text: I really enjoyed this place is a good place to hit on the first Friday is your class a Gastro pub reminded me a lot of Portland the food was good the beer list was fantastic and they have beers and wines from all over the country which was really great I couldn't give it five stars because my waitress didn't really know the revolving tap menu which took a star away sorry I'm almost positive Alyssa will get it right the next time on there.... Love her

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Farm!

62uSpyerMiWiLJnmGK3kAA.text: This place is in my top 5 restaurants ever, seriously it's that good. Their Tuesday night TV dinner special is always off the charts good. I've had more then I can count and they never disappoint.  I wish I could say I was exaggerating when I say I've had everything on their menu over the years...and there's not a single thing I didn't like. This time around we had the meat treat pizza and one of the newer items on the menu a fried chicken sandwich, the name of which I can't remember for the life of me but it had a jalapeno ranch on it that was ridiculously good. Whatever you do don't forget to order a homemade pop tart! The flavors are seasonal and it currently blueberry with a balsamic rosemary reduction on top. I wanted to lick the plate.  Oh man I almost forgot about the beer. A rotating selection of 30 craft beers, yes please! Get a beer flight for 9$ to try 6 at time. It's one of my favorite parts about going.  If you're still reading this and not on your way to Angel's Trumpet for dinner tonight Idk what you're doing with your life!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best fried chicken Sammy I&#39;ve had in a long while
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Meat treat pizza
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beer flight. Choose 6 samples for 9$ (good pours too)

iNRwpuJMG8DpwkGf8vSGRg.text: Items ordered The CENTRAL: fried chicken sandwich Review: simple, executed well. Crispy and light batter. The sandwich toppings were perfect cheese, bacon, lettuce, onions, and cucumbers. It all jived.  Poptarts: the dough!  That was amazing. The filling was way too sweet. It was sort of weird. I couldn't figure it out? Maple cinnamon pecan?  Service was slow and tge waiter only came 2 times.  Worth a try.

QODnSnuCefZ4s-7yDOVuDA.text: Actual rating would be 3 stars. Here's the deal. Great beer, not so great service. I have been here lots and have had maybe one server who knew something about the great stuff they have on tap. Do not trust them for a recommendation. This can easily be fixed with training. It hasn't.  The bigger issue is this business's role in killing the Roosevelt BID. Furthermore, arguing that they MADE the area worth coming to when the arts community has worked for decades to bring people to downtown Phoenix. Owners are pompous and show a disregard for other local businesses. If you want to support local (which I hope you do), please look elsewhere. Will not be going back.

vHjNANEaelQXwbf77VoTrA.text: I love Angels, the poutine (I believe they call it The Mess), is fantastic, I actually have dreams about eating it, its that great.  We also had the chefs special which was different meats and pickled vegetables, it was also very good!  I can't wait to go back on a Tuesday and have a TV dinner and I'm still waiting to get a homemade pop tart!!  It really has something for everyone, as I don't even drink beer and absolutely love it there!!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Mess
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

PdxUR1rLUkfVIebO0BUqxA.text: I think Angels Trumpet House may be my first love.   Everything about this place is just a YES! The food is soooo delicious and they aren't afraid to switch things up. I've had their burgers, chicken sandwiches, wings, and taquitos. Those huge taquitos are something amazing, try them! They also have this grilled cheese sandwich that you can add Spam to. Sign me up for three of them!  HUGE beer selection that is always changing. They also have wine, too!  The place is open late and serves until about 11pm on the weekdays, not sure about the weekends?   GO HERE. EAT ALL THE FOOD. DRINK ALL THE BEER.

6-yOLxT_uEg0-aZTIaPYYA.text: Found this place a few months ago and it's quite a gem.  They have different beers and a small wine selection to try.  The food is also good with a slight twist in the burgers and pizzas.  I like that you can come anytime during the week just to grab a cold one.  The staff is super friendly and always have good suggestions for the food as well as beer (because we all have different beer tastes).   The prices for the flights are good (to me)  considering what you get for the price.  I like the ambiance and chill factor this place and come here often when I'm in the mood to just relax and grab a beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pokestop and beer with food.  Can&#39;t go wrong there!

hdtu98QDoAUS15ZiPXEHnw.text: I love Angels and pay a visit at least once a month but yesterday turned out to be a bad experience. We arrived and we're seated immediately but it took about 10 mins to have a waitress approach us to ask for what drinks we wanted. 25 mins went by and the waitress never came back to take our orders. Idk if they were short staffed or why the service was bad that day but we just ended up leaving.

RZE9GnrJqZLAoBBJAtKG9A.text: I have been to Angels Trumpet quite a few times since it opened. The servers do not know anything about beer and can never seem to make a logical suggestion to me. They always insist on calling the beers by their numbers instead of the names. The food that I have tried sucks and it is overpriced. I haven't eaten a lot of food there because the veg options blow.  I pride myself in patronizing local businesses and enriching the community of which I am a part, however the owner of this establishment doesn't care about his community. Thanks for tanking the Roosevelt BID, A-hole. You wanna know what's NOT free? My business!  I was already accidentally boycotting Angels Trumpet for quite some time because it sucks. Now I will continue to avoid this place and let my friends know that it's not a downtown-friendly bar. I'll be sharing this with everyone I know.

NOiIhtUlMEu45fge_Nv33g.text: I have been here more than a few times and have always enjoyed the great service and food but tonight I had the pleasure of being waited on by Dakota... he was just excellent!! My buddy and I found out that he has only been serving four months and he was very attentive and kind to us!!! Thank you D.. you rock my man

s_X8--ksOO2S0jek3tR6sQ.text: I have been to Angel's Trumpet a number of times, and while the building looks great and they have a wide beer selection, the service is slow and waiters don't know anything about the menu. If you're going to have a wide range of beers, your staff need to be able to speak about them, let alone pronounce the names (they always had to search around for the number.) The food is bland and very expensive for what it is.   Not to mention the owner is actively undermining the local arts and creative scene. He works to railroad the Roosevelt BID, complaining that he'd have to pay more taxes while all the "parasitic" artists in the area get things for free (his words...). He moved into this neighborhood and has cashed in on downtown's renaissance (driven by the very people he undermined by tanking the BID.) Shameful behavior from someone who must not value their neighbors or the unique neighborhood. Anyone who cuddles up with Ducey isn't someone who gets my money.

aM4FP-lFQBOcD9QR8u9XXA.text: Great place. Great beer. Surprisingly good food. Issue with a confused or dishonest waiter. Bill comes and is $51+change. I have a thick stack of 20s in my wallet. I pay with 3 $20 bills--2 old bills & one newer multicolored bill. Waiter returns & says I only paid $50-2 $20s & a $10. But he brings me back a $5 and 5 $1 bills. Huh? I add $2 to settle the bill. Waiter returns to demand $40 more. He claims he returned the entire amount I paid him, including the 2x$20s and now needs $40. We ask for the manager. Manager says she knows I paid with a $10 because she made change for it. But why would you break a $10 bill when you were claiming that I had underpaid & you'd returned all that I had paid. Very unsettling, this situation.  Pay with a credit card here so that there is a clear record!

lC__arLmdIrjpsEueag2uQ.text: We usually stop at Angels Trumpet when we go to First Fridays. Impressive beers on tap - around 30 rotating beers. Food is pretty good. I really like their fries. I'm intrigued by their tv dinner tray specials - will eventually have to make it there to try it one day.   Discovered a little fun fact on my visit this past Saturday (first visit not on First Friday), they close at 12am. I really assumed they would've been open til 2am on weekends, nope.  Also, we made it in just 20 minutes before closing this past visit and got poor service from one of the bartenders. She seemed very annoyed by our presence and was very rude in her response to our questions. Also had a resting bitch face on the entire time. So, I'd suggest not to bother them anytime before closing.

IumZaxrFDRpa59N9wKTgjw.text: We had a couple beer flights, which is the way to go if you want to sample several of their 31 taps. They rotate the beer selection often, and witnessed them take a beer off the board and replace it with another flavor while we where there. They had a unique selection on tap, not just your IPA, Wit, Lager list.  Jake was our server and he was awesome!! His beer knowledge was on point, and gave us some good suggestions. I had a taquitto appetizer and my buddy had the brisket tacos, all of which had nice flavors. I finished off with homemade pop tarts and an aged chocolate stout, which I will be fondley thinking about for the next few days.   Angels Trumpet has a great vibe with indoor and outdoor seating blended together in a clean yet inviting style. A short walk from the downtown hotels, do I'll definitely be back.

RoyhONuWy5dqdmhD0pznXQ.text: I live pretty close by so I'm not sure why I didn't try this place sooner! We went on a Saturday afternoon so it was quite busy but not so much that it felt uncomfortable in there.   First, the place is much bigger than I had initially expected and very very good for large groups (I know where I'm having my next birthday!). They offer, I think it was almost 30 at the time, beer choices. I went with a flight so I could try a few different ones I'd been eyeing. They all tasted great but I don't drink quite enough beer that I could really say I knew exactly what I was drinking. Along with the flight, I ordered, "The Mess," which is essentially poutine. It was soooo good! The fries were crunchy, the gravy was stewy, the cheese curds squeaky! Although I made it my meal, it can definitely be shared amongst the table. Also at the table were the well talked about spam sliders and grilled cheese sandwich. All good choices!   Overall, a great experience! I can't wait to come back for a TV dinner Tuesday, another new beer, or a pop tart!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beer flights!

ugOGAspDsYrbQEjsrnz7Pw.text: Good food, great indoor/outdoor atmosphere and 31 craft beers on tap. Recommend starting with a flight or two to sample.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fUCCu-1Dzy05uOkYVIWxcw.text: Good atmosphere and great food.  Burger and grilled cheese were excellent.  Great selection of draft beers.

gWz50Y9840_G0JWW2qFdLA.text: CenPho's latest is a BEAUTIFUL FULL-ON ALE HOUSE!  Just stopped by to check the place out and was flagged down by the nicest husband and wife team who invited me in!   The place is spectacular! A large spacey room and a huge outdoor patio with an incredible view of Downtown.  I'm from Milwaukee and this place sends me back to "the way things are supposed to be" ... it's beer, it's people ... it's HOME!  I can't wait to go back for more!  Oh yeah ... of course they have got a huge looooooooong wall of a gazillion beers on-tap!  Fantastic!!!

UUAyTNMiamYST4is-si8hQ.text: The can make fries and that's about it. The rest of the food I have had there was not worth the money. They have some good beers, but never the same one twice.

wFTj5oYGye_sSu6CStMwlA.text: Over all the food was great. I went on a Friday night, service could've been better. I had a burger with he fried egg made to perfection!!!! If you are looking for a sweet drink, try the cranberry cider  the vibe was awesome, young crowd, good music, chill lighting. Not that great for a date (you'll have to wait for a two person table) it can get really loud. Awesome for a couple of friends.  going back for sure!

Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cranberry yum
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brewlee!!!

QV0bYjZ8EpjvV3908XFdZg.text: We love this place. Great food, good beer always a good time. We especially love the pop tarts. We went on Halloween got pumpkin porters and churro pumpkin fresh made pop tarts. They always have good finds. Hoping to try the TV dinners soon.

Tu61VYiatQ5kzQOOrXq5DA.text: Angels has an impressive collection of beers on tap originating from local Arizona to California- lagers, ales, stouts, you name it, they've got it. If you're feeling overwhelmed by the choices (there are 31 after all, not even counting the wine), ask for a sampler platter! My boyfriend and I got lucky and got a free drink from Fat Bikes who was doing a promotion. If you're looking for a hip location just to hang out with friends and throw a couple back, this is the place for you. The only down sides are that 1. Bar space is very limited and the overall venue extremely packed- there's restaurant seating as well. 2. The bar tenders were efficient but were very low on energy and enthusiasm. It was mildly making me depressed just watching them.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 31 different types of beer!

d8D0y9EDuV_fyPuuG-S6ng.text: We came here for dinner on a trip to Phoenix. It had really good reviews. The atmosphere was really nice. The food looked really good on yelp and let me tell you IT WAS. The food was absolutely delicious. I ordered the Brulee burger. My fiancee got the Outlaw. We also ordered chips and salsa. That's actually the first reason I deducted a star. The chips and salsa were $7 and you get the tiniest side of salsa and the tiniest side of beans. I did not think they were even kind of worth the price. The burgers on the other hand 100% worth the price. The house made ketchup was awesome. We both also ordered ginger beer. Each ginger beer was $3.50. I drank almost half of my ginger beer and saved the rest for my meal(a habit I've always had). I went to the restroom and came back to just a water. I figured out that the waitress had accidentally filled my ginger beer with water. So i told her what had happened and she asked "Does it kinda taste good or?" I was just like What do you think?! Lol. Have you ever had a watered down soda? No it does not taste good.  The weird thing was no one offered a replacement. She just asked if I wanted a new water. I had dumped the ice before I poured my ginger beer into the glass so maybe it didn't look that full but my ginger beer was still at least half full if not 3/4 full. And it stayed on the bill too. I didn't like that I paid full price for a beverage that was ruined by the staff and I was never offered a replacement. I just think it's basic customer service skills to always make it right for the customer, especially if the mistake is on their end. But other than that, I would recommend this restaurant.

pgJWEmk_L48TvVi6mU2qsw.text: Good food, great selections of craft beers and ambiance.  I will totally come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

HMuE63cwb-JbTbz42nX7Mw.text: Great beer selection and good food. Not a huge menu but what they do they do well. And let's be honest, if you're seeking this place out you're probably looking more for the rare beer selection then the food. The good food is just the icing on the cake for this place

uvkZSmEmnK33_KYQRNndGQ.text: Went to Angels Trumpet Ale House for beer, but stayed for the food. On Tuesday's they do a cute TV dinner for $9! They had a plateful of variety, enchiladas, a brownie, and more. I've also ordered the homemade pop-tart on separate occasions and it is definitely NOT the type of pop tart that comes out of a box! Happy to report it's gooey and flakey, just like a homemade baked favorite should be. I've also tried their burgers and it's hearty goodness.  And of course, the beers. There's so many beers to choose from it's hard not to find just what you're in the mood for. Solid food and great place to hang out.

iwLcQzQWJj8ti2eYNBiwXg.text: Definitely enjoyed visiting Angels Trumpet Ale House during a recent visit to Phoenix! Their outdoor area was quite nice and had a large canopy covering all of the picnic tables. We lucked out that it wasn't SUPER hot out, so we were happy to soak up the warm weather. Their beer selection was huge so we decided to try a few by getting a flight. We didn't end up having dinner here, but their food selection seemed to be pretty good as well. I'm honestly struggling to remember the names of the beers we had, but I am confident that you should check this place out if you're in the mood for a Phoenix brewery hopping day.

LTzlwxV2NLubjmhiLZcKwg.text: I love angels trumpet! It's been a while since I've been but they have killer beer, great food and a cool vibe. I would highly recommend this place because the beer selection is probably top 5 in Phoenix, easy.

asx_neJ3Tts9y_my76uBiA.text: Nice place!  Great food!  Parking kinda needs improvement.  Service was epic!  We loved horse radish sauce.  It was amazing!

pOXay-Xv6bbabiZb44HIsg.text: One of the best burgers I've had. I ordered the good ole fashion with a fried egg and my friends ordered the brewlee. We both thought the burgers were delicious. The ketchup they served with the fries was different than normal ketchup it almost tasted like pasta sauce but I was into it. Service was also amazing nice and attentive but also gave us enough space. I liked the atmosphere of the place. The only qualms I had about this place was that the parking lot was small especially for the size of the place.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Good ole fashion w/ fried egg

Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wDm31xiQQiib7-JpYne2qg.text: I've bookmarked Angels Trumpet for quite some time and had the opportunity to visit for my lunch break on a Wednesday. To our surprise, there were only two customers in the restaurant. We sat on the patio enjoying the weather. I can totally see this place busy during the weekends and week nights.   Unfortunately, I did not order an alcoholic beverage but I wish I did. Hubby and I ordered the Outlaw burger with fried egg and the pretzels appetizer.   I wish the pretzels were a little softer as they were a little tough to eat. The Outlaw burger and fries were delicious! I loved how they made their season fries.   Closer to the end of our meal, the restaurant started to pick up customers - a lot of customers and it looked like there was only one server so once it started getting busy, we didn't see her. We had to hunt down an employee, which happen to be the host to give us water refills and to ask for our check.   Overall, I plan to visit again especially during TV dinner nights.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The outlaw burger with fried egg

QzrJiFmzzVv8STVsci_ntQ.text: Perfect patio for friends or families with babies and dogs!! And Big Guppy Fish tacos are the best!!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My Son and my Grandog *Sunday Funday* Woooo!

oKDDBjVYHP_z-lp3hlimIA.text: First off the food and beer selection was 5 stars. All of that was great. We ordered the pretzels, the poutine and the quesadilla special and it was all fantastic.  However, Im sad to say that the service was 1 star. Right after our food was delivered she did come ask how it was and then we didnt see her again. About 10 minutes into our food my husband was ready for another beer and i was out of water. We saw her going back and forth to other tables but she was not close enough for us to get her attention.  It was awkward because we spent the rest of our meal debating: do we go ask the bartender, do we keep trying to make eye contact? We didnt want to come across as rude but we probably should have just gone to the bar.   Eventually, she and i made eye contact and her expression let me know that she had forgotten us and she rushed right over. Unfortunately, we had been done for a while so we ordered some poptarts to go and left.   We are definitely going to go back. Hopefully the service experience was just a fluke. Everything else was really great.

x4QXb9Zv4ztXk3WkwAB9tw.text: Great beer! Like 30 beers on tap and they have wine too.  Great atmosphere, waiters are friendly and great music. It's a nice place to chill and try out different beers.   I tend to have their seasonal food items when I go. Food is AMAZING! I have not been disappointed so far.   Their salad was tasty. The pretzel bites are fluffy and baked to perfection!   Their burrito comes with chicharones on the side. Yum!    Their pizza was delicious, thin crust and full of flavor.  I've also had their burgers with fries. Oh and I've had their tacos as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rubeaus and Twelve Anniversary.... Delicious beers!

5MXGHGNLJEKWH5_Hg_NTIw.text: A bit loud ambiance for my liking, however, I had the best tasting burger (Grandma's Crackling Burger) in a long while. 30+ some beer recipes, the place was a great hangout.

MH0q_FXv1E5zrZggr_LVKQ.text: Service fails every time. Been going for years and it's getting worse. Food is good and beer selection is good but it can't cover for the awful service. Last time at this place.  Too many options in central phx now!

iQ_xk_kwdYew2Kw7IAREjg.text: Simple menu. Great food. Relaxed atmosphere. I highly recommend it. The wings were fantastic!

C5DYw-7KfgPAr9ir7qHKDA.text: Absolutely love this place! HUGE selection of local and out-of-town draft beers, awesome food menu with things like burgers & flatbreads, great outdoor patio area, near downtown. Parking can be a challenge and you'll probably wait for a bit, but grab a beer & wait outside. Great atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burger with a fried egg on top? Yes please!!

93InAMgVtViuzDAxXHBgTw.text: Extremely delicious beers to choose from. To be precise they have 31 beers on draft. I personally recommend Lilkoli Kepilo it is very tasty. They have great appetizers to choose from. The wings are tasty and comes with 3 sauces, they quesadillas are really good especially the Turkey one. They pretzels are really soft as well. Great place to socialize with friends and family

CZoWhBvXcWReU6LJNmj5YQ.text: This place is a great example of a casual bar/beer garden that surprises you with how good the food is. It was bumpin for a Wednesday evening, but it never got too crowded or loud or annoying. There's a ton of beers on tap, and good variety at that. And they do flights. Also, you can you watch them can crowlers behind the bar (lol the machine is fun to watch). I took a while to decide what to eat because the menu seemed ordinary and not very creative. I was so wrong, my sandwich was excellent. I got the "good ole fashioned" with grilled chicken and bacon. Also, the ketchup is homemade which made the fries taste even better. Literally cleaned my plate. The bartenders were super nice and attentive, too. I felt adequately tended to without constantly being bothered, or "over-chatted" with. Always had everything I needed and was able to just chill. Would definitely recommend. If I lived in Phoenix, I would probably come here often.

6Mo49YD_0tZaNbssUCu2yQ.text: Simply the Best and perhaps most daring and creative Pub style food on planet earth!  Well, maybe just Phoenix but I promise, you will NOT be disappointed!  The vibe and beer selection is simply out of sight!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. TV Dinner Night every Tuesday.  Yum!
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vukEtT-vDyL15_5SB8JNnw.text: I have been here three times, and now feel compelled to write a quick review.  Visit #1: About a year ago, we were checking out a "new" place in our neighborhood. Beer was great, service was so-so, food was not good. The ambience was loud and lively, super hipster-friendly, and they have cool wooden tables. Nice, we thought; but the food sucks.  Visit #2: Gave it a second shot, figured we ordered wrong. Nope. Food sucked again. I like good pub food, and I like to try interesting combos like bacon & pesto, things marinated in beer, and gamey appetizers like buffalo meat or venison something or other. They have all these things, and we didn't like any. We ordered a few items, and the waiter said they were out of several ingredients b/c they were changing their menu. Place was still packed, beer flight was interesting.   Visit #3: We saw some killer pics online of their "tv dinners" and succumbed to our boredom and gave this place another try. Maybe the new menu was better, or they got a different chef or something. Nope. Food sucked again, and waiter was dull and silent. That's a grand total of around 4 appetizers, 8 entrees, and about a six-pack worth of crafty beers. Nothing great here food wise.   Tips: Stick to just getting beer. They have no ketchup, only a tomato-paste thing for your fries/tots. Wait staff looked like they would rather be across the street at Filmbar.

o3lLiyH-WEJKIOiq7BBSEw.text: Food...Da' BOMB! Prices...Reasonable. Service...Da' BOMB!  Highlight: Nice atmosphere and ambiance w/ a vast beer selection.

ATSTKG9-14Z7VeHQ3kTikQ.text: Went there for the first time today. Now I see what all the love is about. Great service, amazing selection to drink, loved the wings. The Cherry Bomb cider was soooo good. Will be a regular spot from now on.

BMATopC-7Xj4pzwii3GKKQ.text: Cute backyard area. Fish tacos 10 out of 10, I will be returning, honestly some of the best in the valley. Calling it a house made "poptart" does it a disservice, and I love poptarts. Flavor at the time was banana walnut, a la mode, and I'd likely hand over my first born for another. Needless to say, you should save room for dessert. Beef burger was beautiful looking but surprisingly bland despite the trimmings, we even got it with the egg.

SVRqve0TuHPgEeseBRdw0g.text: I've been here multiple times over the past couple years withe different groups of friends or dates or solo...  And always with the same result.  I want to like them. It's great beer usually and I appreciate the look/construction.  But parking is atrocious. The service has been horrid on every occasion.  Whether sitting at the bar or at a table, it takes forever to get served or have orders followed up upon to put it mildly.    The food is ok. Not great. Not bad. Just ok for the price.    I keep hoping the service improves, but it just hasn't. It has gotten to the point where I only stop in for rare beer events now. And even then I question if it's worth giving them the money given the lack of service/hospitality.   Recommended.  But only if you're not in a hurry...

pQFSaXe2ep_onncIKHoWjQ.text: I really like this place. It's unique and I love all the options! Hubs and I love sitting outside with wine!

R1iBBD6tHlhHF0jdURDEdA.text: I'm usually not one to write a review but I feel I must in order to to maybe help improve the quality of service at this establishment. We came in and waited a 5-100th minutes while the waiter, who looked right at us when we sat, talked to another patron about different kinds of beers. The service was incredibly slow and there were only 4 other tables with 1-3 people there besides us. The bar area was fuller but the bartender was helping them. We ordered the Brewlee and the Outlaw burger which were really tasty. However the fries were burnt and more than half were inedible. We just left them there....didn't complain cause we thought maybe that's how they were. We looked on the yelp site after and the fries looked totally different and not burnt to a crisp at all. Just a couple of ideas to maybe just be better on service and watch the quality of the food since the burgers are $10 plus.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6TF3DA4uYENB4ktvwnjsYg.text: So this place had beer, and it's cool looking, so that's something. Unfortunately it has the same interior sound comfort level as a wood chipping factory. That is to say it's so freaking loud you will not, and cannot have a conversation. Clearly the owners are aware, as there are a handful of acoustic tiles on the ceiling, but they need considerably more.   Service was so so, our server kinda tried but she had way too many tables to be effective. I ordered the pretzel app and I have never seen greasy pretzels until now. Their pretzels are more like mini-baguettes and they are super oily. The app came with a mustard and some kind of warm cheese sauce, allegedly. It was so weird, there was 0.0 flavor in the cheese sauce. None. Nada. Zip. The only thing it had going for it was that it was warm.  Our app came with no napkins or flatware and it took 20 minutes to find someone to bring napkins.   Overall this place is better than a kick in the nuts- but it's not a comfortable place to chill with a cold beer.  It only makes me miss The Roosevelt even more than ever, and for that I tip my 40.

PcMiV30d0lkq9qkQjktdFg.text: Great food, enormous beer and wine selection. Wings here are amazing, but also like the fish tacos and pretzel buns (rolls?). Really into sour beers right now and they usually have one (sometimes two!) on tap. Alway fun to check them out. Service can sometimes be great and other times slow. Thought its typically only slow during the usual busy crowd times (Fri/Sat night) and week day evenings are much, much better.   Love the huge patio!

hgLsEhQloxWGMTSX-kvk_Q.text: I want to say I love it because the atmosphere is incredible and theres a huge beer selection but...I've never found a beer that was truly great and I'm a beer guy.  Also, the food is pretty mehhh.  However, it's a great spot in a good area and a great spot to start a friday night.  Definitely don't write it off.

KsnzuvaXC_V9XwW5YBtRpg.text: The beer selection is always great and the food is surprisingly good. They make a great homemade pop tart which used to be a blueberry but right now it's lemon,  still good though.

gbPOO26dDPv3eBc6Xc0iFA.text: Smoky wings, Outlaw burger, grilled cheese, ginger beer and a poptart were all great choices!Nice portion sizes and great covered open air sitting. Would definitely return. Husband's only complaint was No Titos! (But this is an ale house!)

ouQv4PK-OAZK9HxRa_OYdg.text: Very cool place with good conversation, great beer and food.  Will definitely go back next time in Phoenix.  Try the spam sliders.

PBjOdD6Y2PIhS2bDQCZ0rA.text: I love this place, The energy for dinner is electric and the food is absolutely delicious. Plus they have tons of beer to choose from. Definitely will come back!

4f0uxTE_SGIiapqka8bY0Q.text: The food is great but the service is horrible. It doesn't matter what time you go or if you order for pickup the customer service is just terrible. I'm usually pretty forgiving and I will never be coming here again.

EB2EcjLgLXUPBMnqD-fBpg.text: My hotel recommended Angels Trumpet because most restaurants were closed for the night.  But they are open til midnight.   Staff was friendly, they had a big beer and wine selection.  And my burger was one of the best I've had all year!

8D7Lt6KTGyFtY9y78vlJGA.text: This place is great. They have a fantastic beer selection, there is always beers I had not tried yet. On any given day, there is typically around 25 different types of beer on tap. I prefer dark beer, like stouts and porters. They also can beers for you if you want to bring it home, called crowlers (32 oz. can). This pic is a chocolate porter called Achocalypse, definitely one of the best porters I have tried there. The food is ok. Not exactly your typical bar food, they have a good selection on the menu... I've had the Nutter, which is peanut butter, raspberry preserves, banana, marshmallow fluff & peppered bacon. Not bad at all. Definitely worth trying out.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Achocalypse 32 oz crowler

lqLQO8o0sbGd3Qtx76bKYQ.text: I love the atmosphere and I love the beer. Also our server, I think his was Sean, was excellent and very attentive but without being annoying. If Angel's Trumpet had vegan options, that's the only thing that would make this place better!

BVyF5UZNEXF6ZEqgIxp-xA.text: What can I say? Easy parking, fresh food and service with a smile? No complaints here! We will definitely be back. But next  time-we're playing some cornhole!! Who's WITH me?!?!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Welcome!
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Back patio
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Interesting keg lamps

ofYvPfKWsCuPvkV-iKkLqg.text: So happy about the service improvements.  I love this place and always bring people here when they're visiting the Valley. The beer selection is top notch and the food is always great.  I had a few bad experiences here, but they must have gotten rid of some bad seeds, as the service has been exceptional my past few visits.

mIwzv7DdEy526jDpYNAdRw.text: This is an absolute can't miss in Phoenix. With 31 constantly rotating taps you will find old favorites and new. Beers do repeat on occasion, but there is always something different awaiting you.   If bottles beer is more your style you can ask for that menu and try something completely new. There are also 6 wine taps if that is more your style.   The food is absolutely phenomenal. It's all made in house so it tastes fresh and it is delicious. They have a seasonal menu as well. I really can't say anything bad ... Other than they are closed on Monday.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Czechvar from Czech Republic

2ZlfO-5uut69EeNSwvfc3A.text: I couldn't be happier, I asked Jake to surprise me with a flight and described what I liked and he brought an amazing selection. Love the ambience of the low lighting and music you can conversate over.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My flight before my flight to Texas, strategically placed in a muffin tin.

cz7cX_wI0lbb0R8LtnAUDA.text: All around best experience I've had in a very long time. This is a real brew house. When I was there, they had 26 beers on tap. I told the bar keeper, I was a little bit unsure about dark beers so he was gentle--suggested "Blacked Out IPA"--excellent choice! Overall service was a 5 stars. Did not come for the food but holy buckets was the "Guppy" delicious. This was basically fish tacos, but so much better! I was going to say I would come back for the beer, then thought I'd say I'd come back for the service, but oh yea I'd come back for the food. Great experience. Don't pass this place up.

Pj6l2ohL0g-k25P7XFfqkA.text: My review is only on the food from just one visit and not on the abundant selection of over thirty craft brews they offer on tap. I also noticed a selection of wines on tap and a very nice large dog friendly patio.  I ordered what I think was called the avocado salad and it really was among one of the best salads I ever had anywhere. It was unique and interesting and something better than what I would have at home because I wouldn't take the time to smoke my own beets. The combination of creamy avocado, mild goat cheese and smoked beets with those tasty little just the right amount of toasted almonds was quite a sensation in my mouth. I will have to steal that one as it really was that good. The greens were very fresh and above average and the dark meat chicken option was tasty and cooked just right. I also enjoyed the supreme segments of grapefruit as they added so much brightness and freshness and really cut the richness in the salad. The salad had everything going on it was really good.  My husband had the matador sandwich, it was pink beef with onions, peppers, mushrooms, horseradish Havarti cheese and a pretzel roll with two dipping sauces and fries. I didn't taste it but I thought it looked good. My husband said it was good but would have liked the peppers cooked more and more of them.  I would like to try the beer sampling option next time.  I thought the meals were reasonably priced. If I remember correctly the total including tax was around $23.00.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Avocado Salad with added Chicken option
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Matador Sandwich

ITzwya5cXTAyTPfbkl8M8w.text: This place was great!! Walking in you see a large chalkboard with about 30 beers. They are rotating kegs so when one is finished they replace it with another beer from a different brewery. I had an epicenter which was so great tasting. There are letters that are next to the beers which tell you what glasswear the beer is served in. We also had the farm flatbread. Which was also pretty tasty! It was kind of messy though because it wasn't cut all the way and the utensil they give you is a fork and a really dull butter knife. In the end you just give up and grab what you can and just eat. Lol. I think our waitress name was Chelsea. Very friendly and attentive and quick to serve. Will be back here soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chalkboard beer menu
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Farm flatbread
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Epicenter

JEGYns5n7yC5J1WdUREisA.text: Delicious food, a phenomenal beer selection and educated friendly staff.  The ambiance and decor of this place is top notch. Their patio is so awesome and they are dog friendly too so they will allow you to bring your pooch to the patio.  My favorite dish I have to get every time I go is the avocado salad without the grapefruit and extra beets instead.   They have speedy Wi-Fi too.  I have studied here or accomplished work before the crowd gets there.  The only downfall is it gets REALLY loud in there and there isn't much parking.

hkVg9OVbpuFIxXrDIHyIHw.text: Wow.  I drink a lot if different beers but this place is incredible.  Of the 30 or so beers on tap, I had tried 6.  Great vibe, nice people and a knowledgeable staff.  Food was great.  One suggestion...try the beer sampler, six three oz pours and you can try everything.  One more thing...alcohol content probably averages higher then normal...be careful.  A great place.  Thanks for a great experience.

lJ2A-PA1MJqofhvFqZOD3A.text: Great food , even better beer! Very nice atmosphere with friendly service! They,have a great selection(31) of beers and 6 wines on tap!

cCmvtbbeZEzQBXaZ0xO7UQ.text: If you're looking for a place to grab some good food and beers with great casual atmosphere you've found it. Walk in grab a menu and seat yourself in their large indoor or outdoor seating area. Pick your beers or draft wine from a large blackboard that rotates new beverages in often. The food is down to earth and full of flavor, with employees knowing their favorites and making personal recommendations rather than a blanket statement of what's good or not. Service is quick and attentive without being bothersome nor sloppy. The sandwiches are something unique yet familiar - and excited to try the rest of the menu and rotating specials menu. Great spot for a date or get together with friends, kids would be fine but doesn't seemed to be geared toward them

BJr9SgZ52UBVUa3Mr9tSig.text: Great beer selection. Food is really good. Nice open atmosphere.  TERRIBLE SERVICE. That's the biggest turn off at a restaurant that is border line great. Their horrible service is the only factor that stops me from becoming a True regular here. And I don't mean regular by Yelp's standards. I've checked in twice so now I'm a Yelp regular.    I will be back because the good food and big beer selection, I just really hope they step up their service game.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salted flatbread

hGrxfMoq5jnBHjSMvK79bQ.text: I love the huge variety of beers they have. The environment is very laid back and relaxing. This is a perfect place for catching up or hanging out with with friends. This is only my second time coming here but I've loved both occasions and with definitely be back

EN_TMpDihsV_WY5N4_dadw.text: Fun, active ale house with a strong selection of brews to choose from. Nice to see some options on Nitrogen and that a few local breweries are on tap. Menu is solid gastro fare. All in all, a great spot

vt8njYpaaKT9DpOsVmjiEw.text: This is by far the best place in phnx!!! I come here as often as possible and I live in the far East valley... they have this chef named Ben,  who, from every time I've been there has shown the food nothing but love, delicious we had this madator, brisket sandwich... I can't even begin to explain how amazing it was, smoke for e 12+ hour it was great, I've been lucky every time I come in the same guy " Ben " ironically same name as the chef" had been behind the bar and takes us on a tour of the country and craft beers, dudes an ace when it comes to good beer, today he recommended the " Thai speedway " from alesmith, ca.... such a delicious craft, if you're in the area this place NEVER DISSAPOINTS!!! The owners obviously are doing something right.... can we get a location in the east valley!!!???? Please!!!!!!!

ONKIGKsDqfr87BU2GewRNg.text: I kind of have a huge crush on Angel Trumpet Ale House! If you don't like noise. Try it on a Sunday afternoon. If you do like noise... Come any other time!   The food here is meh... I don't think the burgers are anything to rave about. The Mess fries are yum! But let me tell you... You should try the PB&J with marshmallow fluff. My son ordered one off the kids menu and it was enormous! He didn't finish which meant Don and I got to try some of it. Amazing! Maybe beyond amazing... Life changing maybe. They make the peanut butter in house and the jelly has some spice to it which I love. And the marshmallow fluff just sends it over the top. I tried to replicate this PB&J at home unsuccessfully. My son will not let me attempt it again.   On to the real good stuff. The BEERS! They have an amazing selection of craft beers from all over. They always have some amazing IPAs and double/imperial IPAs on the beer wall. Always with the different styles of lots of high gravity beers. Totally worth it if you like trying different beers without getting drunk. You can get flights of six different beers for about seven bucks. Don't forget to check out the seasonal menu with specials like on Sundays you can get a pitcher of a local brew for six dollars. Pretty smoking deal if you ask me.   Definitely a place I enjoy and will be returning very very soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Moa, Imperial Stout 10.2% abv
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brouwerij Huyghe, Delirium Noel 10% abv
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brouwerij Van Steenberge, Gulden Draak 10.5% abv

6iVzEyO2nQxcVJEN4exUtw.text: Outstanding venue!  Was my regular tap house.  Try the Casper Flatbread, outstanding if you like goat cheese.  Nice selection of beers, rotating taps.  A great place to go.

GafNykIgY1-5p4WX9rBo8A.text: Stopped in here after flying into Phoenix airport.  This location had it all.  Large craft beer menu (probably 30-40 beers on tap), amazing food and a huge covered patio that also offered a set of bags if you were interested in playing.  Highly recommended!

5SV_EDPmZu4thYlVXbWxsw.text: As strange as this review might be, I am completely a fan!    We stopped here near the end of our First Friday night out with friends.  It was insanely packed and so we grabbed a couple chairs in the back corner.  Our waitress was still very accommodating and served us quickly with beer and drinks.  Don't ask me which of the many beers we ordered because I can't remember...  ...Because all I can remember is how insanely divine and delicious our dessert was!  We ordered the salted caramel flatbread that came highly recommended to us by a friend (see my picture I posted, #147).  It is completely homemade on a nice thin crispy flatbread.  Peanut Butter.
