Caramel.  Marshmallow fluff.  Chocolate Chips.  Honey.  Pretzels.  If you aren't drooling yet, I feign to say there might be something wrong with your salivary glands or taste-buds.    I want to head back sometime to soon to try their beer, TV dinner night, and enjoy a table with some good friends.  I'm a fan Angels!!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salted Caramel Flatbread...Peanut Butter. Caramel. Marshmallow Fluff. Chocolate chips. Honey. Pretzels. Seriously divine!

cXd2Peo3faVbZbCbgPz-Aw.text: I love everything about this place. The food is fantastic, the beer selection is incredible, and the atmosphere lively but not overwhelming.

w9-L-KaePgVA2K4hkIloIQ.text: My husband and I were extremely impressed with the food we had last night. We shared the Big Guppy fish tacos, the Brewlee burger, and for dessert we took an order of salted caramel chocolate chip cookies to go. Everything was delicious. Our server was very friendly and took the time to give us info on the food and some of their beers. They said our wait would be 45 minutes but it ended up only being 20. It was definitely worth the wait.   For two entrees(which had plenty of food), 2 beers, and dessert our check was $39.00.   The only negatives... it is very loud inside, not a big waiting area, which could be an issue if it is cold or hot outside, and not a very big place, which means you're more than likely going to wait during peak hours.   We will definitely return soon!

_bwj1pKP6cdQXh9io93hSg.text: Great atmosphere, good music, great vibe and wonderful wait staff. The wait staff was always ready and willing to help. Always had quick service with drinks and food. Had a wonderful peanut butter, banana and raspberry Chipotle sandwich. The other was a burger with fried onions, fried egg, cheddar cheese and bacon. The side salad that came with the sandwiches were excellent and had a salad dressing that had a horseradish flavor.   Will definitely be returning and trying some Ale next time.

myKBFwnGOhC1Hv1fH7Ryiw.text: Nice selection of beer on tap but the food is mediocre at best. The pretzels were good, but how do you mess up a pretzel? The outlaw burger was good in concept, but "medium well", does not mean "well" and the fries were soggy. I will come back for the beer, but will skip the burger and opt for a flatbread pizza instead.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outlaw Burger

93NvjTC3wH6kLjTWpPRiHg.text: Absolutely love this place and I cannot wait to go back. So many amazing beer choices and the food is fluffing good. Thank you for an experience like no other.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. All the Choices!
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Mess

YlJ9Gy0QMbJMcvKjSKe_qg.text: Delish. I love that their menu is unique but familiar, so I'm always open to running with something that's a little out there. This time was the brewlee -- a burger that had some pickled veggies, sriracha mayo, a fried egg, and caramelized sugar on the bun. Cooked perfectly and damned tasty. Service was friendly and available but not overbearing, which I always appreciate.   PS - house made pop tarts intrigued me, but mango covered in caramel is hardly "seasonal" in December. I'll have to wait til next time to try one (hopefully with a better flavors ;) )

H53vyvdHjvyt9UDBSqDe-A.text: I like this place.  They have over 50 beers on tap; and the "hot mess" app is worth ordering.  My burger was good; however there was no seasoning on the meat.  It had great flavor that could have been increased with this simple step.  Grind on the meat was good, the burger was very juicy, and the bread complimented the burger well.    The beer was very good; I picked up a flight; and told them what I liked and what I don't like; and they picked out some samples within those ranges.  They also had some fruity beers; which I wasn't a fan of, but they were good tasting, if you are into that sort of thing.

w9QpRPbEXzxU7hn1JwHjaw.text: From a foodie perspective this place wins.  Great bites to eat here.  I would recommend the spam sliders.  They are spot on delicious.  From a craft beer perspective this place has a lot of good choices on tap and a cool canning machine for take home.  It appears no discount for going with a growler price.  Questionable pours for a flight.  Service is middle of the line.  This place could really use a beer expert behind the bar to push it to a 5* establishment.

brR5W9tv7kwg6ElslwvwKw.text: I can see why people might complain about the customer service. The hostess (we'll call him stuck up hipster dude) was un-engaging and sort of rude. Fine. No problem... we'll just sit at the bar. The guy at the bar (we'll call him lumberjack) was helpful and allowed us to try a beer before we made a decision. We liked the bar, it was comfortable and friendly.   The beer... I love the selections. There is a constant rotation of what is on tap, and the prices aren't bad at all. I supposed the chalkboard style menu can be a bit confusing, but it could be worse. Beats printing out new menus every day.  I got the rodeo burger with extra bacon. HOMERUN. So awesome... the fries very were good, I liked the ketchup substitute they serve... it fit the meal perfectly. I left with a happy stomach!  We eventually moved to a table once our group showed up. Again, stuck up hipster dude wasn't much help. I picked the table I wanted when he couldn't find any words to use.   Our server was soft spoken and reports from the other side of the table were that he was a bit drunk (based on smell). He did his job well though. We got our orders and drinks refilled. Functional alcoholics don't bother me too much.   My friend loves this place and I can see why, I'll be back for many more visits.

AldIH897tIsjf60YYDsqoQ.text: First time here and it was great. Although kind of loud and crowded the wings are fantastic

yBgse_PilJwgte0sjQpfXw.text: This place is great. Simple decor and casual. Love the 80s music! The Spuds Taqitos were amazing! I'm vegetarian and found plenty to eat. I give it 4 instead of 5 stars because they had the patio doors open, and we had to swat the fly's away. That sucked. Our server was great and attentive. We will come back!

Dorn32nDajPzLzNc0D-qtQ.text: Cool spot with great food and an amazing beer menu. It's become our favorite "I don't want to cook so let's go out" spot.

sL1SaEJdnSVrLJ3cYIlcrw.text: Nice place to meet up with friends and have a few good beers. The chalk boards list over 20 different taps, and they have a nice selection of local craft beers on tap. The food is good here but the last two times I went I got the Cashew Butter and Jelly sandwich, and its the best-est!  Angels Trumpet Ale House fills growlers

lIPRx7ch-d05r1LRhwF5yQ.text: I only went here once. Not because of anything in particular, just haven't had a reason to go back. The food was good, but a bit expensive in my opinion. When you sit outside on the patio you get an awesome view of the downtown skyline. We walked here but parking seemed to be a bit limited.  Overall, I'd go back and it's a decent place to grab some food or a couple of drinks.

ZEq4Ulv_PiwGms9ZbHO62g.text: Everything that I've eaten at this joint is top notch. They have plenty of beers and wines on tap, constantly changing the drink menu daily. Just go! You won't be disappointed.

n733POiB8NiGWJrAL-Re3w.text: I am sold the flights of beer!  6 samples of craft beers in one setting will sell me every time.  Exploring craft beers can be a tricky game...we've all ordered a beer that didn't fit our palette and you have to WORK your way thru it.  I explored 3 styles of beers I'd never tried and then finished with 3 favorites to satisfy the taste buds.  There was a nice variety of food on the menu.  They have an interesting take on wings with the sauce on the side. Tried one of the salads which was tasty, but left you a little hungry...especially since it was the same price as the wings.  That moved us onto the Sweet Potato Tacos, which area little more like empanadas, but really tasty with a pesto dipping sauce.  Living in the southwest for so long I'd like to some type of hot sauce on the table or a homemade concoction to bring the heat.  The noise is a little loud, but they'll get the acoustics figured out.  The openness of the floor plan and windows will make it a great year round place for a pint.  It's smack dab in the middle of the Evans Churchill district which is great for a pub crawl

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mural logo
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Packed house!

U14yuWCI66NN5s2FvXm32A.text: Angel's Trumpet is one of my favorite places to eat and drink in Phoenix. I like to try new beers and have never left this place without trying 4 or 5 new ones (via the flights, not full pints - otherwise this would be a review of how nice the toilets are to barf into).  Their burgers are heavenly, their desserts are rad and I can't express enough my longing for their chipotle ranch. I would fill a Camelback full of that stuff and hike Camelback mountain with it, if it wasn't so frowned upon by my doctor.  If you've never been, check this place out. Good food, beer and service. If you really like beer and chipotle ranch, stay very far away because you may never escape.

ngmNvUQiYc0z8M7z4Q9szg.text: The food here was really good! I'm not a beer drinker (not by choice...unfortunate allergy to brewer's yeast) but I enjoyed watching my bf enjoy his flight, which was reasonably priced. The fish tacos were amazing! My bf ordered a burger and the fries had a delicious homemade ketchup-like sauce. He rated the burger as "really good", which strayed from they typical "it was okay" that I usually get. Great service. Not too crowded for Sunday lunch. We will definitely be back.

hlza5VhhCthf4zMqZws7aA.text: Great ambiance and place to enjoy some really great beers on tap.  Every single beer I tasted (out of 7) was delicious.  Even non beer drinkers would have no complaints.    My fav: wings & left coast watermelon wheat-- def gave hell or high watermelon a solid competitor.

pMviJfwSB733x09-JhjXJw.text: Beer and Pop Tarts! That's all.  Well, ok the other food is good but not great. The beer selection is impressive with a wide enough variety to offer something for everyone. Patio is nice but just a bit on the urban sparse side. Overall, a great place to compliment a casual evening out.

jzwnQ4o2QjBx-PVThD4XwA.text: Drinks were good.  Did not eat, but it looked ok.

8wmgNCBmPg3aGMWFmCuJNg.text: I love this place!  The food is really good and the service has always been great. It's my go-to place when I am with friends, clients, etc. And looking for a place to just sit, eat, drink, and socialize. Their beverage menu is very impressive and changes all the time. Every time I come here there is something new to try. Highly recommend this place!

3aw9gV2GBL_o8hK63j3BrA.text: This was my second time coming here and it was excellent both times. The best thing about it is the beer! There are many different, distinct choices to meet anyone tastes. The outside seating area is nice, you can find shade or bask in the sun. The food is solid. We've experienced the flat bread and wings and would recommend both.  We come to the Phoenix area once a year and could definitely see this place as a yearly tradition to visit. The only weird thing about it is the entrance to the restaurant - it doesn't look like one. Our first visit we did a lap around the building before trying the nondescript door. Can't wait to visit again!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fVLFB8V5XPneYoFlle0-Ig.text: Stumbled across this place while checking out The Church grand opening. The fish tacos were amazing! Wings were also good- try both if you can :) The atmosphere & staff were great, decent beer selection & nice patio space (when it cools down). I recommend checking this one out if you haven't!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

EFlOO7SmlqtGCPAa94cvMA.text: I was surprised how packed the place was for a Wednesday night; I snagged the only open seat at the end of the bar. The bartender was very friendly and greeted me right away. I needed a sec to look at the taplist. It was tough to read them all so I checked Taphunter. They had poured the last of a dunkel I wanted to order, but the bartender suggested a witbier substitute, and it was good.  They had some tasty-sounding specials, but I ordered the Brewlee burger with fries, and it was solid. The meat was cooked well, and the carmelized sugar on the burger added something unique. Fries were well-seasoned and crispy. The dipping sauce that came with it was odd. It tasted like a strange attempt at ketchup, like a salty and sweet bloody mary mix.  Maybe slightly more than brewpub prices: I paid $25 or so after tax and tip for a burger and one beer. The atmosphere here wasn't what I expected; it was definitely more happening and a lot of people were there to drink. I guess I anticipated something a bit more chill, but no matter. They clearly do a booming business.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ybaugrard36udIL_bAbJPA.text: My friends and I really enjoy coming here. The atmosphere is great, super chill vibe, great location, wonderful selection of beer and wine great manager, and friendly staff. I've just personally never been too impressed with the food. It's good, but my friends LOVE everything they get. Now, I've never disliked anything I've gotten (hello spam sliders or the mess fries or the hummus...I've had a salad and also the pizza and fish tacos) so again, never UNhappy but I'm never as blown away as my friends are.  The manager is also the sweetest ever. I've interacted with her a few times and she's always nice, looking out for her customers, and assisting any way she can. Which goes a long way in my book!

Yp-5sWFEDx4L3HL0-62CuQ.text: Newest location for Angels Trumpet Ale House also featuring a cocktail bar (soon to open).  This location boasts the same delicious menu as the downtown Phoenix location.  And just as in the Phoenix location you will find yourself greeted by a friendly staff, nice draft wine selections, and over 30 rotating beers to choose from.  If your looking for a bite to eat I personally enjoy noshing on the chipotle hummus plate, tractor pizza, and the spud tacos.  Prost!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Patio
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar Patio
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. View from cocktail bar into the main room

7HHrtr-tUke_GHu28cQeRQ.text: I've been here on several different occasions and it's always a good time. It's a chill environment with a dog friendly patio, and an extensive rotating beer list. There's definitely something for everyone, and if you don't know what to order the servers are usually pretty helpful. Although it does seem they're rushed a lot of the time. I get it, it can be a busy place but still sometimes it can be annoying. The food is decent, we usually just get appetizers. Wings and fries never disappoint. My latest visit, the food came out really quickly even though it was a busy Saturday night. Since they do change their beer list so often, it can be disappointing if you go back and they no longer have a beer you really liked last time you were in, but it gives you a reason to try something new!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken wings
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Order of fries
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wine/beer menu

gQm6QrX0yNN9ogi0IWiFNQ.text: I always love this place for beer and food. I hate the parking and competing for a seat. The bathrooms are gross really get these cleaned up. Normally the food is pretty good however with the cleanliness it's starting to freak me out a bit. Sometimes the pop tart makes you smile but sometimes it makes you wonder why you are spending the calories. The beer selection is really good. The service is either great or you get the weird one who probably shouldn't be around people. Tattoos facial hair and man buns a must. Prices are like meh could be a bit less but not mindblowingly high.

BNKYWmceE9sw_wqo8EvIkQ.text: Salad was delicious and the fruity beer was amazing. Although, the music is kinda loud and couldn't hear my friends at all.

M6Jek2mremTWn5OzUQY6Cw.text: This place is definitely somewhere you could go when you don't know what type of good you want, but you want good food. There's burgers, tacos, pizza, sandwiches, salads and more. I got the brewle burger which comes with your choice of Chicken, Ground Beef, or Veggie burger, egg, leafy greens, siracha Mayo, cheese, and pickled onion. It was delicious! It was made fresh, the bun was toasted, and so big. I couldn't even eat it all. I will definitely be back to try more things on the menu. The vibe is very casual & represents the Downtown Phoenix vibe so well.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

vvzDZLLNhExSYFqTcdwFwA.text: Great atmosphere. Great food and beer choices. My goodness there was even Spam on the menu, lol. Solid happy hour and a great place to hang out with friends for some down time. Service was good.

0BGza3uFOz4jSj7Uht2j4A.text: Been here twice. Loved it twice!  Place is seat yourself. First time I had the Matador Sammy which was great. I was worried about the horseradish but it wasn't overwhelming at all.  Second time we came with a larger party (9 people) and they were still able to accommodate us by combining tables outside.  This time I had the Big Guppy fish tacos. Each taco came with two good sized pieces of fish. I loved this entree even more than the Matador!  Also love that they have a wide selection of beers and change it up all the time.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. VooDoo Stout
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big Guppy - YUMMM
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wine/Beer menu as of Jan 18, 2017 part 2

pT7TZvc894CelvVsicApsA.text: Aw man. I want to love this place so hard. The service was great. Buttttt when you market yourself as an "ale house" please for the love of Christo- have some g darn good beers. This joint has some "craft beers." But, as a beer jerk (I admit it....sorry...) please have some actual crafts that aren't basic. Please get some weird ones. Maybe not even a weird one; can I just have one goshdarn NE style IPA? One kettle sour? Something freaking barrel aged? Something I can't buy In a grocery store? PLEASE?!?

jLEz9Q27lkhdXuuBzTztTQ.text: This is my favorite downtown place. Lots of beer selection - sometimes I do a flight, sometimes a pint. Every food item has been tasty. Really liked my TV dinner (enchiladas), will try the pop tart one day. It is loud inside so I prefer sitting by the windows or in the chairs.

sbae7uAngnl7YWYy5T_mNw.text: Angels?!?!?! Trumpets!??!? Count me in!  We decided to continue the night of fun and games at this place as:  1. It has beer 2. They VERY have flights 3. They are open late for those of us that are night owls  We arrived and the place was pretty much clearing out. The first thing you notice is the dozens of beers written on the chalkboard, the tell-tale signs of a hipster joint. The staff seated us promptly and we had a chance to look around at the pretty standard Oak table decor, with a jukebox machine thrown in "just because."   Since we were waiting we went ahead and looked at the board for our flight selection. For those that don't know what a "flight" is, you choose 6 beers and they serve them all at once in glasses. Simply put, it's a beer tasting except you drink it all. I order all the strongest beer on the menu because...I'm dead inside and have nothing better to do.  They also make home made poptarts which of course I had to try. The poptart comes with a bowl of vanilla ice cream as well. For some odd reason it took like 30 minutes for my poptart to come and another 10 for them to bring the ice cream after I reminded the waitress after one of her long disappearing acts.  I seriously couldn't finish the flight, but it was great! My stomach was so full of liquor and food from the night I could only finish 3.5 glasses (and just sipped the rest.)  Overall, good quality and they give you value for your alcohol consumption. My friends even found a beer that they've been searching for a vendor back in Chicago for months now since we visited this place! Would love to try a couple flights next time.  4 out of 5 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Entrance
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chalk! Hipster be near!
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Homemade poptart

NEDwFsmEIszQBkM07kdnpA.text: Came here for lunch and beer while in Phoenix.  An exceptional draft list. lots to choose from.  The food was above average. I would add more side options.  Love the atmosphere and design.

goSUtOxrTo9Yi6KPIcealg.text: Huge beer selection and good menu. I personally always order the Big Guppy fish tacos-- they are delish. They also have a really nice patio with plenty of seating.

qWvJ5H6yQZWc6MD-8RS2xA.text: Met up some folks here for a few drinks on a saturday evening. It's a chill spot with nice outdoorsy seating. Their beer selection is good and they have some wine and food options. We didnt stay long but a tip...their parking lot is small so plan in parking a bit away or you may get lucky with a spot!

zVxIeWYrFlJbDvS1y3_8pw.text: Not bad at all! I had the wings suggested by our waiter. Hubby had The Outlaw (fried chicken sandwich). The wings were fine. Nothing special. They're served with celery, carrots and in house made sauces (ranch, sweet bbq and hot sauce). Hubby said the burger was GREAT. He thought there was too much bread but otherwise good. We also had a flight of six beers. They were great. My favorite was the cranberry cider. I'm not a beer drinker but I do like coders. I was impressed with the flight though. Overall great atmosphere. Our waiter was great and we enjoyed ourselves!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu

1xGrXEv6Y1Xu8KMdnB-F2g.text: Love this place. They have a great selection of beer and on top of that they have my favorite beer! A Belgium while ale! So delicious! We were too hungry so we decided to ask the waitress which appetizer to get and she recommended the chips and salsa. It was so good, they make everything in house. Can't wait to come back and try other things in the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

iTJXDW2aPT1TyOjXoPpWcg.text: We were visiting friend that live nearby and they brought us here. I liked that they had a variety of beers on tap but there were really only about three choices from what I know I like already, but there were still some we had never heard of which was intriguing.  None of us were really too hungry but we ordered three appetizers for four of us and most of it was eaten. I didn't order the hummus because it was chipotle, but my friend did. They seemed to like it. I got the chips and salsa that came with beans and the chips were really good. The salsa was too hot for me and I ate all of the beans. Another friend got the sausage platter which was interesting and I loved all the sauce options on their plate.  Our waiter never really offered us another chance to order a full glass of beer or anything else for that matter, so we headed out. He fully didn't deserve the tip that was left for him. Not really sure why anyone would leave $17 on a $43 bill, but I guess I have to be happy I wasn't paying, or the waiter should be. lol

U4LYDIk4YluJ8wmQCWf3EA.text: I had reserved a table for a small group of people for happy hour. When we arrived our table had been given to another group. We had to wait 20 mins while they scrambled to put another table together (not a big deal).   Once seated we had to wait 35 mins for someone to come to our table. I believe we had to wait for the next shift to start for our table to be served. Granted they were busy but 35 minutes is crazy.  After everyone arrived I ordered appetizers for the table instructing the server I will be paying for the apps and my drinks. The rest are separate tabs...she said, "no problem!" Then comes the bill...to me for the whole table. The server rarely came to our table for service let alone bothering to drop peoples checks. So after all is said and done I'm stuck with a large bill for her incompetence.   On the bright side the food was very good.

_4J0Pnz1x8kw8ZNiHBj-3g.text: Great spot for beer and food! Atmosphere is friendly and the brand new hire Annie has been very welcoming. I travel for business so I am in town once a month. I will definitely be back. So many options and very reasonably priced. Highly recommend.

XeuppW8ZvunIylvCEh8teg.text: Holy COW!!!  I'm back here  at Angels Trumpet Ale House 4 days later for TV dinner night!!   I also was able to order the Cookies and Cream Pop Tart which was the daily flavor!! Wow talk about phenomenal. Pop tart ordering will become a standard on all trips!!   The $8 TV dinner is so worth it. Tonight was Campfire Mac and Cheese with Beanie Weenie Chili, spinach salad, spicy Fritos, jalapeno corn bread and a s'mores for dessert.  For $8 you can't beat the the complete meal.  Can't wait to try other Tuesday TV dinners!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie Pizza
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chet Burrito
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taking Flight!!

gO7oIufQpC22VMVzqEc9Bw.text: If you want craft beer this is absolutely the place. It doesn't look like much from the outside, but this place has an amazing menu. Their home made pop tarts are a must try. I love everything I've tried on the menu. I live out of town but every time we're in AZ we come back. 5 stars all around for sure.

JbnMhRgjbvwevHU2qZQXRQ.text: Beers  pretzels  good location across the street from film bar and arcade bar. I need to come back and try more food. The Porter was excellent from Founder, Michigan.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nimbus 2000?
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

I19_AsrEfB645WHaRKEAfw.text: Interesting selection of libations, really tasty barbecue salad and an open, pleasing ambiance. The bartender was friendly and attentive. Overall, great find while conferencing in Phoenix. Definitely give it a visit. I would return in a heartbeat.  I'm not sure why it doesn't rise to a five. I think it deserves a second visit and if everything I experienced holds True the second visit, then we have a 5 star.

LMLov1oj-lH6fjBkZstk3A.text: Beer Stop 142 ----  Angels Trumpet was a 10 minute walk from my hotel so I decided to check it out, braving the extreme heat and all.  My first impression of the beer list wasn't all too positive. I was expecting some more local AZ breweries on the list, but rather a lot of the beers were also distributed in San Diego. Oh well. After striking up a convo with the bartender, he did provide (2) local selections - Peoria DIPA and Phoenix Pale. Both were good choices!   Moving on to food, the wife and I split the flatbread and wings. Here is where Angels Trumpet really shined! Delicious food at a reasonable price! How can you go wrong?  I really liked the layout of this place. Maybe the heat effected how I judged the taplist, but there is always time for another visit !

AcKytWCnhyZuL-KSgjFlSg.text: We walked into this place and were a little skeptic. We saw a bunch of young people sitting around drinking beer. But it turned out ok. There were families and some older people (our age) there. They have over 30 beers on tap and 6 wines on tap. We don't know much about beer so my husband and I had a flight of 6 beers. It was a great way to try something new. I had the fun-guy flat bread and my husband had the outlaw burger and fries. My friend had the beef brisket grilled cheese. All of the food was amazing! We finished the meal off with homemade blueberry pop tarts and salted chocolate chip cookies. We walked away full and happy! Give this place a try, you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Homemade pop tarts and salted chocolate chip cookies.
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flight of beer
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fun-guy (mushroom) flatbread

gTcVExf2uxsVm58NxB8pUA.text: Great variety of beers on tap, good food and such a chill atmosphere. What more could you ask for?  I'm used to beer gardens like Yard House and was thrilled to find a place that has beers on tap from local breweries to beers from states like Utah, Colorado, California and Hawaii here.  I started off my Sunday with beers with Khoa N. and an order of "The Mess" aka poutine. The server was really helpful in helping me pick out a beer, I was feeling like having a Belgian and I concluded with a Belgian Rye Ale from Borderlands, Arizona. Crisp, light, with a bit of bitterness at the end it was refreshing and oh-so-delicious with my mammoth plate of poutine. The poutine was hands down the best I've had (though I've never been to Canada to rightly judge). The fries were seasoned well, great texture, turkey gravy was rich and homey and the cheese curds oozed with the heat of the gravy. Not that's a mess I can deal with! The portion was huge, enough to feed 4 as an appetizer!  The server who helped us was great, gave awesome recommendations and checked back on us frequently. The atmosphere is casual, effortless and reminiscent of many of the restaurants in Seattle- think wood grain, black and open ceiling.  The brews, the food and the service is awesome. Two thumbs up for carrying local brews! I'm all for supporting local businesses. Khoa N. and I inhaled as much food as we could and downed our beer leaving our bellies full and left happily!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tuesday TV Dinner: Sonoran- style Enchilada with Smoke Pulled Pork, Spanish Rice, Beans, Salad &amp; Stuffed Churros
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pretzels with Cheese and Horseradish mustard
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tuesday TV Dinner

uFIqjGYXMVW1LLGlSivdUw.text: Coming from San Diego a huge place with tons of craft beer and places on every corner this place definitely reminds us of San Diego and would come back to enjoy the cheap flights six beers for $10 you can't beat that. They have a so, so variety of beers. Def would come back. Food was good. Vegan options, so that's a plus

iC8YQ63GGLINEDzrUd2FmQ.text: ATAH! Just like their menu says. It says you are responsible for drinks that you ordered. But what if the waitress brings you the wrong drink? Which happened in our case. Yet we were held responsible. We tried to hold a dialogue, and were threatened no matter our yelp review it wouldn't matter, and the owner wouldn't care, because of what it said on the menu. I get it. Saw the menu. We are responsible for drinks that we ORDERED. But again, the waitress brought us the wrong drinks. That is why the one star. We should not be responsible for the wrong order. Period. So that is exactly what we tipped, what it says on the menu. Atah! Never be back. You may not care now, but you will when everyone catches on.

tMteSDluDZqhbprObMTLNg.text: Great selection of beer and worth getting flights. Their wings are effing amazing! TV dinner tuesdays are worth it!

CCyywrKHM7OvoRhOwj3YEg.text: The place is very modern, unisex bathrooms. Great place for happy hour, many many good selections of beer. The food, stick to the basics. Pizza is good, wings always a bit dry. Hummus is bla, had the viva something tacos with brisket. I didny enjoy them, brisket was dry and tortillas cold. I will keep going for the beer and pizza. Good date selection.

TrWBa45NVSQIuE1MoWXqxA.text: Best rotating tap beer spot in Phoenix. Great selection range from craft brewers around the country. Fantastic wings, flatbread pizzas, salads, solid modern food twists, and great people.

y-FKVJP10Xr1qsjDYiNWNQ.text: My favorite bar to go to in Phoenix!  Great selection of beers! And the food is absolutely delicious! Also I love the environment!!

K8GlieSCZu7O6rEIzjyYTA.text: That Chix sandwhich looked beautiful and was slammin'! The homemade ketchup with the fries I didnt really care for. Would have liked more ranch on the sandwhich, but it was still good. The cider of the day was kickin! Not a fan of that cookie dough pinwheel dessert, the "high roller". It tasted raw. 4 stars for that cider!

NrDvmimXXk3pPaavrzFCzw.text: WOW!  Huge portions, super delicious, funky, just a lot of fun, and a lot of food fo little money!  We all had salads, and they were HUGE!  Delicious, fresh, and packed with goodness to the brim.  I hate beets and I chowed like a goat!  I was the only anti-ale drinker, but I stuck with a refreshing cider.    GREAT service, fantastic food, great value and ambiance!

_D2gGiDkIpRV9nez3x9NjA.text: Downtown Restaurant Rock and this jem Ranks way High on the list... must come and eat...Lol Amazing Beers on tap huge Wonderful ubscure selection...!!!   Well the  FOOD is a Haven for us Foodies !!! Eat On.... Tue...TV dinners so Great.& Fun

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Matador and 810 very nice....!!!!

h_e2K1f25Xj9ruKfGiCwVw.text: Spot had me excited at first. Has seemed to have gone downhill some. First time in reminded me of some breweries in Oregon, but to be fair there's nothing like the breweries in Oregon. Clean newer outdoor indoor seating. Solid rotating selection of 30 or so beers. Some food is unique and clever. Crowd can be a bit dooshy on most nights. Days can be better, like on a Sunday afternoon. It's not just the ASU influence. Service is weak. Kind of a hipster aloof arrogance to too much of the staff. Yes when crowded the ambience is uncomfortable. The noise is like a crowded dive bar but the environment doesn't match. Parking can be difficult but it is downtown area. For the pricing, the experience should be much better. Owners probably making enough to not notice the management flaws now, but eventually these growing problems will catch up.

a_8S781JLLlaBOfYoOPKyQ.text: The pros., clean restaurant with it's own parking lot which is rare for downtown.  Also, the pricing seems reasonable and the food isn't bad.   The cons., this place is just like every other hipster ale house in town, so it's unforgettable.  It also smelled like spilled beer as soon as you walk in.  Once we seated ourselves, I ordered one of their claims to fame; the homemade pop-tart.  It tasted pretty good, for not tasting anything like a pop-tart and as long as you don't look at the grey mush inside.  Bottom line, don't expect anything special from this place.  The food is fine and the atmosphere is fine.  If you're in the area, not the worst choice, but not the best.

h7kHQKvQPoDLt3_L4ILlEA.text: Stopped by this place on a Sunday evening looking for a decent meal and a good drink selection and we were not disappointed.    -Excellent service = The server was genuinely interested in helping me find a drink I would enjoy -Great atmosphere = Laid back but not too casual like a dive bar -Delicious food = Recommend their pizzas and/or fish tacos

y0tT30pwmZtTTvNcgy3K8w.text: Great late night spot - our last stop on a pub crawl in downtown Phoenix. Loads of terrific choices on tap and good service. We didn't have anything to eat from the menu, but would definitely visit again and try something. Clean, with a pretty hip vibe.

CcpMeR-jlyN2TK8JmLBb-Q.text: Went there Sunday for lunch. Very nice beer selection. Menu for lunch is very small.  Not sure why for a Sunday with games on TV, why isn't there some finger food? Simple platter with some chips,peanuts,olives,wings...??? Definite minus.   Waitress were very nice but seemed a bit confused and/or slow. The cook screwed up  the order which took even longer to rectify.  Why do you call everything with a funny name? Just call it a burrito since this is how the waitress is going to explain it to the customer anyway....  Last, it was about have way full and the noise level was high. Can't imagine how high it gets when they are full. Must look into putting some form of noise abatement.

bFPVi61qlPOBAKS-zyKY7w.text: Went late night with friends and my chihuahua. Nice patio area. Outstanding beer selection. Very good food selection for late night. Attentive service.

lGB0LA6guUl34wszgQrgQg.text: This is a sneaky little hidden place but some how crowed. The menu has a very diverse set of eats, however, I've only tried 2 of their dishes. 1 a salad with some kind of champagne vinaigrette and burger of some sort, fully equipped with a pretzel bun. One thing thats tried and True is the beer sampler that I remember well :)

kVDcQVSFV_40CTyrfXyrZA.text: After hitting up the food trucks at the Phoenix Open Air Market on Wednesday we went to grab some beers and dessert at this place. We had the apple pop tart, which was pretty flipping good. They change the flavors seasonally and had just missed the pumpkin one :( They have a rotating list of craft beers on tap which was pretty neat. And our waitress told us about the great brunch they have on Sundays! I will definitely be returning to try it out.

eDTQlnCTjhUWESYKRk8eWQ.text: They serve delicious, quality food and have an incredible beer selection with a lot of local choices. The only con is the wildly mediocre service. It's not horrible but if they are busy try to order as much as possible at one time because you'll only see the server once every 20 minutes.

CKD7t8yA8EM_6IYgyho4nw.text: This place is amazing.   Terrific atmosphere, great beer selections and amazing food.   Love that they have the revolving beer list so each time I come I can have something new.   The food is terrific. You have to try the homemade pop tarts. Looking for a good sandwich? Try the 810 with the pickled jalapenos.   This place is exactly what downtown Phoenix needed.

Dd5pJmxJJoQPBZ7bO5B78w.text: Super good food! Flat bread pizza, awesome! Got to get the Mess too! Oh and Really great beer selection!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

0S66FjXlgEno7gv9DYX76A.text: Just loved this place.  They know their beer and were able to make some great suggestions for me....because I don't know my beer.  My husband and I drank a beer or two and then turned to the menu.  It's fairly simple fare, but boy do they put a spin on it.  The sandwiches each of us ordered were unique and very very tasty.  The home made potato chips are divine, and my husband was really pleased that his coleslaw was delicious and the portion was large (unlike so many places that give you a tiny amount of  your side dish).  My only suggestion would be that the beers be offered in a larger size.  It was explained to us that, due to the alcohol content, the beer is served in a smaller glass - but it was a little frustrating to hubby to not get a larger amount ---the beer is THAT good.  Keep up the good work, Angels Trumpet Ale House.  We'll be back.

By5-j3m51g4MumgMxX74Nw.text: Great atmosphere, nice list of beers, and some tasty food.  I got the guppy tacos, and they were great.  Two huge fish tacos, cooked perfectly.  I will definitely return next time I'm in Phoenix.

-6f8JQH5sNOHV7cJRgjTWw.text: Where do you find Angels? in Heaven! Thats right, this is heaven! TAPS TAPS TAPS! So did I mention they have Taps?  By the way this isnt a brewery, they dont brew beer here.  They do however carry a revolving selection of amazing craft beers! While I have only been here once for a few hours, I witnessed several of the beers being changed before my eyes. EXCITING! YES?  The service was great! Sean or Shawn? was great in helping me follow my taste buds to the clouds.  Mat the owner came over and talked to me for a bit as well and just BS'd away. Not a bad way to pass the afternoon or pregame for a show at the Crescent Ballroom.   Prost!

hVVHd_4Zi75kqL7cwpdq8w.text: Having been here a handful of times, I think I have a decent handle on it.  -On the positive side, the beer selection is immense, and fresh.  If you like beer, you'll love what's available here.  The food selection is unexpected, and unexpectedly good.   The fries are a hit, the flatbreads are great, the variety of quirky or unexpected takes on what I'll call Suburban Kid Soul Food are creative, fun, and delicious.  That said, I particularly like the hummus because it has a bigger sesame hit than any I've ever had, and I like that.  I'd give the place 4 stars easy for these points alone.    However...  - On the negative side.  Parking is almost nonexistent.  The place closes at midnight even on weekends.  And the staff has some standout nice and helpful folks, but balances out overall at somewhat aloof, dragged down by the likes of Tessa, she of the bitchy body language and poorly hidden eye-rolling.   Net/net, the place is entertaining, but seems kind of clubby, and if you're not in the club, your presence will merely be accomodated.  Maybe even with a smile.  But you're taking up space that could otherwise be used by club members...whoever they are.

kCxZMFieK-6XNeg_z2MWRg.text: Great little spot! Great food and good service. Came in for the beer - stayed for the food. We sat out on the patio and enjoyed the ambiance. Have not been back, yet, but next chance we get will hit them up.

QELmhT0eCLT-Xw-dQ6XTQw.text: Pros - Great beer selection, constantly changing, and you can tell the owners have a serious passion for the topic.   Beer Flight from anything on the board is a tasty treat for experienced beer drinkers, or a nice way for less serious drinkers to explore.  The food was good.   The building itself is interesting on the inside, and has a fun vibe overall.  Yay for a new place in downtown Phoenix, especially next to the great FilmBar!  Cons - The servers don't seem to know much about the beer. We had to order by number because our server was so confused. This might get fixed with experience and training, but I would expect an "alehouse" to at least nail this out of the gate.  The menu has some glitches yet, which our server warned us about. It took multiple trips to the kitchen to figure out which food they had/didn't have. Kind of took the fun out of trying to pair our beers with our meals.  Main building was so noisy we could barely hear anyone our table. Outside wasn't an option because it was pitch black. So if you go at night, you get to see or hear everyone else in your party, but probably not both.  Parking Lot is a trap. We watched seven cars in a row pull in, realize there was nowhere to go, then back out onto the street to find street parking. Surprised there was no accident.  In spite of being told no smoking on the patio, several people were smoking and none of the servers or managers seemed to care. So is smoking allowed or not? Who knows. Mildly annoying by itself, but I think an example of the bigger problem that not everyone here is on the same page yet. Your visit will likely vary widely depending on when you go and who takes care of you.  I had an okay time, but have no desire to return. Giving them 3 stars because I love their idea and love to see something new downtown, and hope others try them out while they work to raise their game.

q_EMUfe_M3nkSXQc_W0XlA.text: Great treat after a 25 mile bike ride, our group of 75+ ascended upon Angels Trumpet and they did an awesome job with the food and booze, wings are great along with the beer selection. Outside patio is wonderful

7jJtPNY7CZznltYDagBv9w.text: Huge selection of local and international beers on tap. I like the changing of the beer menu throughout the night! Awesome college type crowd with plenty groups of women! We didn't try any food, next time. Place can get pretty packed. We got there around 10 pm and was standing room only. A spot definitely worth coming back to.

bYc_E_wYv-7-dMuHqcWQMw.text: Rotating taps. $9 flights. Best pretzel bun in town. I've never left unsatisfied. If I had to complain, it gets super loud in here.

blaBGp1apfJ_Cqd4ilHoZw.text: The beer selection is always nothing short of amazing. And staff is friendly and well educated on the beer and wine on tap. The food here is delicious as well and a bit unique with its taste most notably with the Casper flat bread. But its stellar none the less. Out of the countless times I have been here I have never had a bad experience. Except maybe a wait for a seat at the bar which is okay the beer is more than worth the wait!

VUi8emglEBWnVMv_AJyXcw.text: Honestly, i was avoiding trying this place because I thought the name made it sound like something it was not.  After finally going, I am really very impressed!  The beer selection was incredible and the food just as good!  The patio is super nice and large, and as far as ambiance and decor, it doesn't get much better!  Will definitely be visiting this place again in the future.

06vrnCxI9rIiWW4l3cjpWg.text: When thinking about writing my review, I was going to give them 2 or 3 stars... only because THE BEER HERE IS AMAZING. I've been here 5 times now and have loved every beer I've tried. If you're a beer lover, you can't go wrong here. Great selection/variety for anyone!  I mean, 31 craft DRAFT beers in one place in DT PHX... done and done! Even if you're not a beer aficionado, tell your server what you like and they'll make suggestions as to what you should try, AND are always spot-on. Last time I was there I had the Stone Enjoy By IPA... one of my new favorite beers of all time.  Now of the 5 times here, 2 times my party has ordered food. The first time I did not like my sandwich at all, and my husband thought his was okay.  I liked the names and ideas but felt it was executed poorly.   The second time here we started at one table with a handful of people and had Jake as our server (we've had him in other DT PHX restaurants and he rocks -- as always). Jake is great, friendly, knowledgeable, quick, honest... just an all around awesome guy. Then our party grew and we cashed out and took a table outside. It got busy, we got ignored for the better part of half an hour -- but then when we finally saw our new server he was very attentive going forward. Our food was delayed and we felt there was a lack of HONEST communication. Honest meaning don't tell me the food is coming right now then come out another 40 minutes later and tell me the same thing, just tell me how it is. Our server finally got a manager involved (Waylan - sp?) and let me tell you, he was our saving grace. He communicated the issue and was quick to fix it. It was to the point that we were talking about never going in again and he changed our minds. Our food came out after he got involved, it was great, everyone was super attentive to us (we weren't looking to be babied, that's now how I roll).  I know it's frustrating when something goes wrong and you don't have much control over it but you as a manager/server get the brunt of the angry guests.  So over all, my experience at this place has went from meh, to oh no never again, to great, thanks to the customer service provided by the management team. We'll be in again soon for a delicious beer  or five, and I will give Waylan a high five when I see him, and we'll ask to sit in Jake's section. :)

jMCyC58OqC1oOh8w8bgRnw.text: If you like beer and good, above-average, pub food, you'll like Angels Trumpet. 35 Rotating taps of beer you don't find at other pubs. Would have earned 5 stars if the hostess, some young girl, wasn't rude. Other servers were great. Knowledgeable about beer and friendly. The space can get chilly as the whole back wall opens to an awesome patio. If you get cold, bring a sweater.

qKJXSF4BPLm5NbjMrk30cg.text: I've never seen so many beers in my life. And try the tacos stuffed with mashed sweet potatoes, green chilis and cheese.  YUM!  The place was packed on a Saturday afternoon and now I know why.  So many more things to try on our next visit AND definitely a lot more beer to try!  I loved my beer, its #31...some Pilsner thing.  Perfect for me.

4qFJwxzDYsFtB18KgInNRQ.text: Met up with a friend to have a few drinks and service and drinks were great. I didn't order any food, so can't say much about that. The bartenders were very helpful in choosing what you fits your palapte.

-EaE2KEp-ukL-JkwfqaktA.text: I like this place! No, I haven't tried any of the food, but the beer was pretty damn good. And I know it gets a lot of complaints about being overly loud, but give me a freaking break people...it's a BAR! To me, there's nothing worse than going to a quiet, empty bar. My typical reaction is to turn around and walk out. So when I saw that this place is almost always busy, I was down to try it out. I also liked the crowd of people inside...nobody overly snobby or snooty. I think it's the perfect place to stop by for a drink or two with friends. If you're looking for a cozy, date night out, then this is not the place to go. But I will definitely be back to experience a lively night on the town. And I can't wait to try out their patio during the cooler months!

5o_A4lGvnAPvA-m_y2zwWw.text: Great handles! Best pop tarts in the world. Lots of fun! The taps rotate often. The patio searing is okay. Overall a great place downtown

wkjFSBcaDU0ASDiimPCKyw.text: I don't get it. OK the beer selection is great, beer is good. The place was packed when we were there, full, busy... The service was good, no wait at all, attentive. No issue there. But the food, is mediocrity a trend downtown Phoenix? The Chet was dry, untasty and spicy enough so you can't feel what you are eating, the avocado salad had a slice of avocado laying on dry tasteless greens. Just not good. Go for a beer with friends, yes. Go grab a bite and enjoy beer, no. Loved the setting though, great job on that. Went there with my date, wrong choice.

ovR_XCJ7yBVZ7mcK7vGxUA.text: Do you like a large selection of non-traditional beers? Then I say YES! That is all - check this place out.

wk7vom9Lyt6EksDejiEIaA.text: the interior is not what i was expecting at all. its super bright and almost clinical. wasnt very comfy-feeling. tons of beer and found a great pumpkin ale.  the food was a huge MEH. neither dishes were very good at all. i might come back for a beer if in the neighborhood, but i would go somewhere else to eat first.

r3aY3pZtHyiPuMvYrjby3A.text: Good times would go again great beer selection and wings were really good. Great atmosphere...try new a new beer or two! If you are not a beer drinker they do have some wine choices available.

bt3TApnrX-EWtS2fvSR2tA.text: Solid selection of beers on tap, and a great patio! Food...haven't loved any of the things i've tried (pizza, smoked chicken legs, grilled cheese).

Ak7IF99Fb69fUs5b_rM-Hg.text: I wish there was a 2.5 rating on here. Let me start with the positive our server was super awesome and knowledgeable about beer as well as really friendly. If I were to rate the place strictly on the service it would be an easy 5 star review, however there were some things that just didn't measure up.    We found a table outside and the weather was perfect, so that was a plus. We proceeded to order a "flight" of beer. Which was 6 different samples of selections from the 25 plus handles that are rotated frequently (I think daily, but I could be wrong on that). Here is the first part of the reason for the 2 stars. There are 2 boards to read the selection of draughts that are being featured, and a menu that describes what each of the types of beers are for example  A "Lager" is..... or A "Stout" is..... However there is no correlation that I could decipher that would tell you what "type" of beer that the featured name stood for, so let's say number 22 on the board was Witte...If you are a beer rookie there was no way to know what type it was. This causes one of at least two dilemmas, you can either 1. ask the server what type of beer each of the 25 or so types are (which...."Ain't nobody got time for that" :)  or you can play a little "Russian Beerlette" and just hope for the best, at any rate there are some specific types of beer that I just do not enjoy, and I didn't want the server to have to reel off all of the specifics of each beers that was on the board. I love the idea of the constantly rotating types of draught, but they need to figure out a better delivery system for the patron. The other part of the review was based on the appetizers that we had, one of which was the pretzels. Maybe I am americanized and have been spoiled to food a certain way, but I like my pretzels soft all the way through and really doughy (if that's a word) and theirs just weren't that. The pretzels were not very moist and the selection of cheese and mustard was ok at best. I really hate giving two stars, but I gotta be honest about my experience.  Great concept, great server, poor execution....I might try again in a few months and see if they changed anything.

uFT5Z3igj8Itc4H_2d1R3Q.text: I would prefer that you stay away from this place 'cause too many people could screw up the experience for the rest of us that have been gathering here since Matt & Sherry opened.  But the fact is that it's simply the best ale house west of the Mississippi.  Extraordinary beer selection, terrific food and a great staff.

T0m2JROODtWa7a8WDocj2Q.text: Just gotta love this place!  Love the beer sampler.  You can try so many different types of beers I've never even heard of.  Now I have about a dozen new favorites.  Great time, every time!

TQfnhS8Lmfar9-99hDdymw.text: What a great place for a large selection of micro beers on tap. Staff friendly and helpful and my avocado salad was delicious. There is a nice seating area outside too. We'll be back for sure.

YDqaq1JjBbzGm2p8ih5KgQ.text: This place is in A class by itself. Can't compare with anything else in the valley. It's Awsome.  Great food. Clean restrooms. Not to crowded.

j3ww1M9OjL8MjG5IHE6L1g.text: Great food highly recommend this place to lots of friends. Everyone has enjoyed it so far. I wish they were open for lunch I would eat there more often!

MO5HBarnR6_oLxCRDMyuHA.text: Sat down at the exact time as the guy next to me, who was served promptly.  Had to flag down the manager to get somebody to take my drink order, and the place is only about one-third full.  Waitress, when she did come, got my order wrong.  Finally got my beer, Noche Dulce from Borderlands Brewery in Tucson.  It's a vanilla porter, and delicious.  Had a great conversation with another downtowner.  Enjoyed watching the staff serve beer flights.  Tried to go back later to take my daughter to dinner, but the kitchen closed at 10:00.  Too bad, because the menu looked interesting.

CQaadQ0B9tzp-BndSmsGCA.text: Corn hole! Yes...not many down town places have games but they do..the food is excellent!  And the beer..always a treasure to seek out! Dessert? oh yeah..the pop-tart....yum!

X2wwMZ7tXKMqrVojMRamoQ.text: I love this place! I tried it last June while my sense of taste was gone.. such a bummer. I have been back since but now that I have a wheat allergy (diagnosed) it isn't as fun beer and food wise. I still take out of towners just for the show of the tap wall. I can drink the wines and they have gladly destructed a wrap or burger for me before. I love the atmosphere and it is a great mellow place for Sunday Funday, though you could make it crazy with a few invited friends!!

UO2WpxazcD9pY5yqTfj4gg.text: Parking is tough in the small lot, but there are plenty of meters around the area.  I met friends for happy hour there.  Happy hour prices wound up being over $15 for two beers.  The service was slow.    Despite the issues, I still gave a $2 tip, which I thought was more than fair for 2 beers delivered slowly.  The total bill was $17.21.  It appeared on my credit card statement as $22.21.  There is no way that they could mistake 17 for 22 and no way a $7 tip on 2 beers delivered slowly is appropriate.  I filed a chargeback and won naturally, but if you go here, pay in cash.  Otherwise, they will add to the bill to see if you catch it and maintained your customer copy.

HDwEuR2K1gDRZvF-QEaJdw.text: Great chic bar atmosphere.  There are 30+ beers on tap that change when the keg runs out. The food is also really good. From the appetizers (we got the chicken wings, hummus and pretzel bites) and then there are flat breads and sandwiches (the basic grilled cheese can have the spam or bacon added on, and the nutter (pb&j with banana slices)). There is a whole back outside area (they have corn hole set up in the back and outdoor seating). Better food recently than what has been in the past. I would definitely come here, again!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Apple pop tart with French vanilla ice cream on top.
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Our appetizers.

pSm3d5BmghtGtM2K4pkQmQ.text: Disappointed in our meals recently: server recommended green chili burrito, the famous fish tacos, and cheese flatbread.  We'll stick to sandwiches and salads.

QhLzcf-jydVqo6GoajMaoA.text: Never fails! There is always an amazing selection of craft beers and pub/semi-gastro eats. Have a burger, pick a beer (or try a flight) and must of all: ENJOY!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brewlee Burger, Crispy Wings, and a Vanilla Stout

T_-tYKbIhiBQ3xPOHaRDmA.text: Love it here!  Foods is great, they have healthy options that taste fantastic.  The food even has a bit of a classy edge to it from what you would normally expect from a gastropub.  The beer selection is always many and their beer flights are awesomely priced.  They make homemade Pop Tarts... enough said!

bScrf63FDu_2baS7tFcQ0g.text: Last night we went to Angel's Trumpet with our friends Andrew S. and Erin M.  It is a cool new local restaurant and bar in downtown Phoenix that opened a couple of months ago.  They have a huge variety of draft beers and a great selection of food that you can choose from.    We were going over the menus and Andrew S. was telling us about the Spam Sliders.  That is right I just said "Spam Sliders".  They were pretty amazing. The Spam was fried the perfect amount and it had feta and coleslaw on it.  I will definitely be back for those sliders.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spam sliders

kBGbjwSGtEYC_x36aUMhXA.text: Every single time I'm here is more entertaining than the last.  Right now there's a guy who can help you with your beer floats,  he's friendly  and good looking.  The chefs know what they are doing and the beers are always changing. It's got a parking lot and a happy hour.  Woo.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YVoSkvmhX_12rPniY3JyPg.text: Great spot! Excellent beer selection on tap, and the servers were really helpful picking the right one, or two or three!  Food was excellent. Just the right amount.   Outdoor seating was great!

RKTGAOyUAkInY9u4n_Fx2g.text: So, so good. BBQ chicken salad is amazing. Casper pizza with salami, feta cheese, leeks, and honey drizzle is seriously amazing. Beer cheese pretzels are amazing. Beer selection is very impressive. Love this place! Wish it were close to my SD home!

ZQA6OGSUme2XvjycNLcBDA.text: Great beers, nice location within walking distance of other good places (PHX public market, rum bar). staff is real modern young and hip. Be careful not to come Monday's such as I did cause they're closed. Beer selection through the roof. Not a full bar though, just beer and wine. Compare able to ground control in the west valley.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4aL8RTYClF-CBtcyO6AnuA.text: My first time here, tried a variety of craft beers, my random selections looked like every color to the beer rainbow; there's one named after one of David Bowie's classic hits. The Jefferson quesadilla was really tasty-- should have ordered two . The patio ambiance was beautiful at night looking at the top of the skyline, waitstaff and bartender folk were very sweet and genuine.  I didn't know that the Film Bar's directly across the street from it. Ya vohl, I'll be back!

zDjRsV4bHU44k002rUx4Aw.text: Angel's Trumpet is one of my favorites. When living in Phoenix I would always come in for food, especially for TV dinner night.   I'm really glad that I got to come back as a beer snob after living in San Diego for a while. Because breweries are scarce in the Phoenix area, Angel's Trumpet is the perfect place to try local beers. There were even some from other states that I had wanted to try. We were able to try 2 flights and then ordered pints of the ones we loved. My favorite of this visit was the Bread Pudding beer from Huss. It was delicious.   We were more than satisfied with our visit and the servers were helpful during our beer selections. If you're in Phoenix and you love beer... Go to Angel's Trumpet!

TpxnrXbQsGcmqtFKZ5WZBw.text: TV dinner was delicious (buffalo mac & cheese!) and the beer flight was perfect. They had tons of selections to choose from and the environment was lively with a fairly young, hip crowd. Service was a tad slow on a Tuesday night, but the place was packed!

ihlsrV8QYMIVT0ps_BvsmQ.text: Probably my favourite place to go downtown for a drink and some good, different bar food. The main room is large with plenty of seating and the outside patio is almost twice as big. It can occasionally be busy but most of the time I've found somewhere to sit quickly.  The burgers are all good, the pizzas are great and the poptarts are a good enough reason to go.  They have a lot of great beer on tap and it's not all your standard fare. Any beer snob would be able to find something worth drinking. They also have a small selection of wine on tap, however the red wine on tap is chilled which I'm not personally fan of, though I know that's popular atm.  All in all I would recommend it!

vjp19KGqw1KMG3qUjnKRcw.text: 31 taps and probably the best mix in Phoenix. Food was fresh and delicious. Wings are oven baked, awesome! The big guppy, fish tacos were breaded with the right consistency and the fish was fresh. I will be back!

yjM53OKih5fBORJGqLh-Ag.text: This place was something friends suggested and we went because of their rave reviews. They were totally right. The beer selection is great, the food is unique and delicious, and the atmosphere of the restaurant is modern but also surprisingly cozy. I have made this one of my top places in Phoenix to frequent whenever I'm in town!

wMLuFvkubBvsykQ-ktzTjg.text: Angels trumpet offers a great combination of excellent beer, great food and an inviting atmosphere. The also have half a dozen taps of draft wine. It may be a bit noisy inside, you can always sit out in the patio. Should you desire beer to go; no worries, they offer "Crowlers".

a1zkQmGthsRLP5_6G8Pvjw.text: Really like this place, they have a great selection of you guessed it, ales, I suggest getting the six beer tasting thingy (I forget what it's called), that way you can get a sample of many and find out what you really like. Corey is awesome, great service, people and food too. Only been there a couple times so once I get acclimated I might raise it to 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Matt the owner and friends

MBMCLJ_C8QR7EG137D8mPg.text: Great atmosphere, service , food and drink.  I had the crusher  petite surah 2013. My date had agave wheat. Both were wonderful  Alyssa was our server.

SJjPlbGvEvCDDi3jc0zIQQ.text: Despite the reputation that downtown Phoenix is an afterthought for going out, Angels Trumpet is a refreshing reminder that the downtown area is actually vibrant and full of choices. The revolving draught selection makes each visit unique. On top of that, the kitchen provides both fun (TV dinners, anyone?) and trendy takes on traditional dishes.  The big sell to AngelsTrumpet is the thirty ever-changing beer options. As soon as a keg is tapped, a new and often drastically different brew replaces it. I have some bars to go to for "the usual" and I have Angels Trumpet to explore lesser known breweries.  I have on multiple occasions also gone with the beer flight. Given the vastness of the beer board and my own unfamiliarity with smaller breweries, for a very reasonable price you can order six three-ounce beers.   The beer and atmosphere speak for themselves. Have a drink at the bar, at the table, or outside on an Adirondack chair. You can't go wrong!

VSXCc7rKsvcWqZjRSL327w.text: Lots of good Oregon beers, should replace Full Sail with Double Mountain.  Food was good.  Fairly high hipster quotient, it'd be right at home in Portland.

4csohoxY0462xCOduTcMEA.text: Brilliant selection of beers that are always revolving and interesting.  Cool menu choices as well and always has a good vibe.  Can get very busy but we always seem to get served in a reasonable time. If you are into craft beers, then ATAH should be on your list to try.

LrUM8H8EyZKhFW7YcsV-xQ.text: Enjoyed my first experience. The server recommended the flight to start so we could try 6 different types of beer. The food was delicious! I'm not big on getting salads when I'm out to eat, but we split the Avocado salad with The Tractor flatbread. SO good! I will go back just for that salad!

2jwliG5mqdccdVeCxtp06A.text: Fun beer flights, good food, casual relaxed atmosphere and pleasant service. I'm always happy to end up here.

MyPM0vO3_6RpCxwJRHn8SQ.text: Angels is a fun hang-out, but not among my favorites. I've never had a shockingly great food experience, even with items that would be hard not to like. (For example, I ordered their Casper flatbread the other day, which comprises salami, rosemary, leeks, goat cheese, and a drizzle of honey. Sounds intoxicatingly good, right? They layered no less than 35 slices of salami on that single flatbread, so that you can't even see the flatbread itself. On top, they crumbled a full container's worth of goat cheese--the two flavors were so overpowering that I felt nauseous for the rest of the night, had the rest for leftovers the next day, and felt nauseous all over again.)  What I CAN commend are their homemade, seasonal Poptarts. These things are to die for, particularly their pineapple IPA variety (the strawberry-banana was...meh).  Lastly, their selection of brews is top-notch for this area of downtown, and also for this level of character--although the interior is extremely crowded and loud at virtually all times (whereas their patio feels like a fenced-off parking lot in...well, the middle of downtown Phoenix), I'd take Angels' beer selection and atmosphere over the wider selection and nonexistent atmosphere at the Yard House.

ugKEHp3jzG04TIbpFs5Ukw.text: Two stars for the beer selection: 30+ on tap.  They also have this thing where you can order a flight of 6 beers of your choosing (about 6 oz. each) for $9 if you're undecided on which beer to get.  It comes in a muffin pan.  I ordered the animal burger in beef (you can get it in chicken and pork too), medium-rare.  It was a little overcooked, but still juicy and damn tasty.  The pickled grilled onions went fantastically with the bacon.  The fries were a disappointment because some were soggy and the 'ketchup' sauce on the side tasted like spaghetti sauce.  Our server (Ashley was her name if my beer-impaired memory is not mistaken - she has tats on her calves) was attentive, fast and nice.  Easily found a table here pre-Spring break on a weekday.  Best part of the meal: drunken public cornhole (not what you're thinking - get your mind out of the gutter people).  Otherwise, known as bean bag tossing (ok, seriously, you need to see a psychiatrist if you're still looking for a sexual innuendo).  Loser for each round drinks a shot of beer, making the game everso difficult as time passed by.

dcFeN3-wYO1naKEphBF7iQ.text: Unbe-Freakin-lievable. I just had a pizza with Brussels Sprouts and a sunny side up egg. (Not to mention bacon, Caramelized Onion, and pecorino Romano.)  great food, friendly service, dog friendly and all ages blend together perfectly. Wow.

WA7tUFw7ZvDFox1bdjqWuQ.text: I didn't get a server to come over for almost 10 minutes, I went in the late afternoon and I had a weird feeling that the food would be blah so I paid for my drink and I ended up going somewhere else.

bVFdE9LaMpLWI9rI9r-Jxg.text: Can be a very loud atmosphere, but absolutely amazing selection of beer and the food is awesome.  Tried some very hard to find and some amazing beer here.  The best part of this place though is not something I would normally try; spam sliders. Absolutely amazing and cheap. Normally go in with some buddies, get some beer and sliders and it's normally a completely reasonable tab at the end of the night.

njw6hvzCwOjY0CgM7fAAkg.text: Awesome and plentiful beer choices, Spam sliders, homemade pop tarts, Tue TV dinner night, and super friendly bartenders. I'm not sure how it could be better.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tue TV dinner night. Changes each week.

jdDZxwCcfWLYfOuOxUJVmg.text: This place was really good.  The peanut butter and chipotle raspberry jam sandwich was amazing!  You have to try it.

x-EAXOPLpa-FALjl5jgW3A.text: My first experience here was less than stellar but my love for beer is so deep that I'd sell my grandma to a sex trafficking ring for a growler of high gravity beer.  Denying myself some beer from the nitro taps at Angels has been agony so I came back in against my best judgement.  I sat at the bar for a while before the bartender acknowledged me, no biggie, I was narrowing down my selection anyway.  I started to become annoyed though when he kept pouring tasters to the people next to me without even acknowledging me.  Finally, I get my taste of the beer I want to try and it's this little tiny pour that couldn't fill a thimble much less my mouth.  I thought to myself "is this really happening, why is this guy being such a d!ck to me."  I looked over at my neighbors taste glasses and he was pouring them half way. I tell myself to let it go, it's only a taste, just get your beer and move on.  But I couldn't get my beer, no. I had to sit there and listen to the customer next to me tell the bartender about all the beers in Germany she has tried. When that long winded b!tch took a breath I stole my chance to order a beer. He looked at me very annoyed and nodded his head and continued his conversation.  Then he continues to pour more tasters for the people he is having a conversation with.  Did you get that?  A paying customer tried to order a beer and instead he poured his friends more freebies.  I walked out.  When I was leaving I saw a gentleman that looked like he was important, I asked him if he was in charge and he said he was. I informed him his bartender was a d!ck to me and he apologized for him.    Thank you for that apology, good sir.  You have a really great establishment and I want your product but their are barriers keeping me from getting it. Please get rid of your staff, hire people who know about customer service and let me tweak the decor to make it more comfortable.  Do that and you'll have a loyal customer for life.

pBIOjCn4oLsaoH2ZFgVBHA.text: This place was descent in price and good environment. Try the grilled cheese is soooo good!

BTvTh_f4H0khNAbZHzu1RQ.text: Every time I've been its been ok. The menu is limited and a couple of times Ive gone they have fun out of dishes. Good for them to to sell enough that they run out, but then you leave your customer trying to figure out plan B. They are always rotating taps when something runs out which is cool. I want to go back for the TV Dinner, we just always seem to miss it or they've sold out.

wjXGRx8D6cOX0OKR52WAaQ.text: Avoid the ketchup at all costs. It tastes like ground up tomatoes and that's about it, please stick to what you know or try more spices. Hamburger was ok, but the fries, well I will stick to the frozen kind at home. This bar seems to push their beer selection more than anything else, but I wouldn't get your hopes up in regards to the food.  I'll give two stars for effort, but that's it. It's nice that they are trying new things, but move on from what doesn't work. I'm looking at you homemade pop tarts.

GVPWjcg_PbDFyOhZ-FmVJQ.text: Well I'm a chile relleno eatin' motherf***r, motherf***r!   And let me tell you, I've eaten a LOT of 'em at a LOT of different places and have had some that were a bit lack luster  (i.e. Chino Bandido's Cheez-Its crusted awkward chile relleno) and a lot that were as delicious as I thought (at the time) they could come.   Tonight I had Chef Brian's chile relleno "TV Dinner" at Angels Trumpet that officially takes the cake as the BEST chile relleno I've ever had.  No joke.  So good, in fact, that once I'm finished, I should pay my cheque, walk straight into the kitchen and shoot the cook.  Why?  Because this chile relleno was so good that I fear it is upsetting the balance of the universe and that's what I do; I restore balance to this universe.  Although it was Mexican to eat, I was in the mood for a Belgian and after a long process of consideration, ended up taking my server, Brendan's, suggestion and ordered the Affligem Brouwerij, a Belgian Tripel.  This ended up being a PERFECT suggestion for both my beer mood and pairing with the delicious food.    I have never been disappointed with Angels Trumpet and will continue to go there until my level of satisfaction is severly compromised.  I assume that will be approximately never.

ztLxbXa-hSbaz6AXluFF2Q.text: Best beer bar in town. There's always something great on tap, plenty of room to sit and in the cooler months, the patio is amazing

p9BSeXrYfbuzMToN5zCRWg.text: Really enjoyed my visit. Thank you betsie Boop for the amazing service. Had the brewlee burger and was super impressed. Cooked medium rare and they nailed it. Fries were ok, chipotle ranch sauce was a highlight for me. Plenty of beers to choose from. Nice atmosphere. Great place to enjoy some food and beers with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-HEic97FSVsREXIu3XJVlQ.text: Being from the Northwest, finding a good ale house with a wide assortment of excellent beers is hard to find. Most ale houses in Phoenix offer many local choices. It's great to support local brewers, but it's also great to see what the rest of the world has to offer. This place offers a great environment and beer menu to go with it. Give it a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6-Fp_t78XYvhuSAELpukaw.text: Walk into Angels Trumpet House and it feels like you've left Phoenix and entered a city like SF's establishment. At least that's what I think. The vibe here is very cool, urban, indie, and just simply brewtastic. It's brewtastic because they serve just about every cool beer you can think of.   It's a very open environment with long tables and a spacious patio. Music plays over the loud pseaker, beer flavors line the walls and a large bar top welcomes guests to take a seat. Between the atmosphere and beer selection, if you like beer this is your place. It's also right across the street from Filmbar so a great stop before or after your indie film!

mX3OX8AicLIbKPcbLXjdKQ.text: One of my favorite places! Love coming here for a laid back night with friends, to enjoy great food and awesome beer.

vXArgj6o5F0kZ6Ic-5dwyg.text: This place is loud. Sit outside if you prefer not to yell at your companions. But omg, what a great and ever changing selection of beers on tap! The staff are pros. The kitchen is pretty fast, even when there's a large crowd. And the food is excellent. The 810 is probably the best turkey, ahem, *smoked* turkey sandwich I've ever had. Flat bread pizzas are excellent. You can't really go wrong here. Don't think too hard about it. Order what sounds good the day that you're there and prepare to enjoy yourself.

Q6uFgzsR9-nQlpcYkFJKxA.text: man do i love this place.  excellent and always diverse selection of beer available.  the crowd is a mellow bunch and it's downtown location is really ideal.   the food selection is minimal but the flat breads and pretzels are really tasty.  perfect place to go if you're looking for some really unique beers and a great relaxing atmosphere.

1Yc6Za_8baZLjyTwahmFQA.text: Always has a good tap list, and you can use TapHunter to see what is one tap. I love that that regularly update this. The food is good as well. It gets pretty busy on the weekends. I will say that the service is not great. One time me and 3 friends stood at the bar for 15 minutes without being asked what we wanted to order, all this while trying to get the bartenders attention, before leaving to go somewhere else. I have had other unpleasant interactions there as well, but have continued to go back due to the good beer selection.

QANT23I8pIIV2ZJs2AzKIQ.text: Possibly the best bar in Maricopa county!  Also the food is excellent.  There are over thirty choices for beer and wine.  I often recommend this place when anyone wants to meet downtown.  There is a great patio outside and plenty of room. Sadly Ashley is no longer doing chalk art.

7-lRYkxf_e6i1zuByw6nPQ.text: Quick beer and plate of fries, cheese curds and gravy. In Canada that's called Poutine, in AZ its called "the mess". Loud open atmosphere with a plenty of seating. Not stellar food, but plenty of beer options.

SfCwPD02d04qwbFNpTsFhw.text: Our favorite tap house in AZ!  Angel's Trumpet has a fabulous selection of beers...I have been exposed to so many delicious drinks here.  Love that you can select the beers you want in your flight!  Also, the food is amazing!  As a vegetarian, I am usually stuck with ordering a vegetarian burger at other places, but they have a TON of choices here.  I love the grilled cheese....with pesto and honey.  YUM!  Stop by and check it out!

_Pr6zv4Q_G-d6f-w1zfLrQ.text: Love this place! Great beer options--especially when you're able to get the flight. The cookies are amazing, as well as the pizzas!

Xuvop9W9MFUpdJyA1zloTg.text: Excellent choice of microbrews and food is pretty damn good...love The Mess (poutine) and Burley Burger. Unfortunately, every single time I have been there...the service straight up sucks, so we stopped going.
