Great vibe of a locals haunt, but you get this pretentious hipster vibe from the waitstaff who take 15 minutes before you see them for the first time, then it's like pulling teeth to get them to come back.there is a fine line of bugging the shit out of people and giving them their space to enjoy them self, but they go to the extreme end of practically ignoring you.  I'm very empathetic to the service industry because I grew up in it, but if you expect people to give you a good tip, much less even return, you need to be attentive and engaging. I'd been 5-6 times bc I love the atmosphere, microbrew and great food, but after the continued attempt at giving them another chance and the same result from the waitstaff...I'm no longer going to waste my time or money.

skiN-dQ4m7Cg1LW6BF2Jdg.text: Fun atmosphere. Good beer selection. Good food. But kind of a loud inside. I had the Churchill and it was very good.

_U-3CRsnYHjQoXTIepVA_w.text: very good..sometimes.. youll come across servers that wanna get rid of you if u like particulars and they dont see it your way..   the beer IS EXCELLENT! TRY to make it to special tappings when they have them.. you wont know unless you ask.. and the ones to  ask are servers that are seasoned and have been around awhile  and Thomas Brennaman the GM and Tap manager he knows his beer and how to please his guests.

RNqRX5RpUiltOn_F4ZN97g.text: Food was great (pretzels and the nutter sandwich were awesome), beers (especially the selection) were great and I loved the vibe and location. Though the service was pretty bad. Took forever for our server to get us anything which turned a quick bite into a long ordeal. I will be back but will not expect to be in and out quick.

zv36Zv1u0n58g11CtWWX8w.text: Really good selection of beers, and very reasonably priced beer specials. Didn't eat anything, but the menu was very original and interesting. Met and talked to some cool folks, good looking crowd. Really liked this place.

7kMp6c9lJo1LcQlLOOYyLw.text: I came here about a year ago with a few brothers and a cousin. This place had a delicious burger, had some type of Spanish meat or something. I spent about 1 hour trying to locate this place on yelp, finally found it! Great atmosphere and I'm coming back soon for that burger!

hfQcfG8WjNkf-gv1a5Y9Mw.text: Great food,  with delicious house made sauces. And.  . . A huge selection of great craft beers also draft wine!

8IfhJ_QxUZpLK781AMWoLg.text: Tonight was my third or fourth time dining at Angels Trumpet and I still have zero complaints. The beer flight and the grilled cheese sandwich with bacon jam are definite must haves. The service is great, the servers and front of house staff seem to really jive well and anticipate guests needs. I highly recommend Angels Trumpet!

fTCyIziBgRA87_yZRVh7NQ.text: I really love the food, atmosphere and service here.   Sitting at the bar is a far better experience than at the tables.  Definitely go for Tuesday night TV dinners ($7 dinner, with $3 drink)... they have never disappointed me.   Love the deserts!  Very casual and fun place to go for dinner. I highly recommend this place to anyone.    The only meal I didn't like very much was the sausage plate.  The matador sandwich is my favorite.  But if I go on a Tuesday I definitely go for the TV dinner.  Burgers are also great!  Pizza is better at other restaurants, not my favorite thing here.  This pizza is more like flat bread.

nuPVU0Il3POV09MTekGhiQ.text: Food is very good. Drinks are too expensive. Waitress charged us almost full price for half of a beer when the keg ran out. And a shot of wine was $7.

cya4UvqK2kEzJta4b0-y3g.text: AWFUL SERVICE.  Selection changes daily, which makes it a fun place to go. A couple servers are good and knowledgeable. The food is ok, but overpriced for what it is. You pay for the trendy atmosphere.  We came in at 10:40, and as we were seated, they let us know the kitchen closes at 11, so we should order soon. At 10:50, we had to find a server. She had been servicing a nearby table, ignoring us.  If you happen to order anything you don't like, too bad. They will charge you for it regardless. Ordered a beer, and it tasted sour. They explained how they could not exchange it for anything else, and would still charge me. WTF Bad business to refuse to even offer something different. Worse to charge a customer for something they do not want.

y_TahAG_SMJLK9j69-zJUQ.text: This place has a good selection of beers on tap. I really like that they change up the brews when one is tapped out. The food is also tasty especially the brewlee burger. They also have wine but I'm more about the suds. One of my to go places to grab a brew and have some good bar foods. Excellent place!

DSGlndd8PMKswiF0Sgm8cw.text: Good was AMAZING! My boyfriend and I went here for dinner one night while he was in town and came back for lunch the next day! Definitely get the hot mess!!!

sIVuFTpMT56R-qxJ6qJHaA.text: The atmosphere at ATAH is definitely cozy with a hipster vibe. There are a lot of beers for you to try and I made the mistake of ordering a pinot noir, which was served too cold. I would suggest sticking to the beer if your'e a wine snob; it is, after all, an ale house.  The empanada I tried was pretty tasty. Wings are nicely portioned but I'm not sure if the accompanying sauces matched very well. I also had a few bites of the sausage platter, which was hit or miss. Service was very slow. I gauge slow service by jokingly contemplating a "dine-and-dash." I would never actually do it, but when I keep thinking about it, a server somewhere doesn't want to take our money. So overall, ATAH didn't leave a great impression but I'm willing to give it another chance.

2mBzfKvAM4kSU6Gm9WS7lg.text: The rotating tap may be the best part of this place. They never are low on beer and if one runs out, it is always replaced with something just as yummy but maybe a different style, so your pilsner you had an hour ago may have become a Stout. If you like or well, love beer and want to try more? go no further. I really like the layout of the beer wall and the choices seem endless and they always let you sample, cheers to that.

dS60sycxkQoYUgOjUhkyAg.text: In from Dallas and our party sampled several items on the menu, not one wasn't excellent. This place is amazing and will be an automatic every time we're back in Phoenix. Our server was very helpful and made our visit here that much better. If we could have given 10 stars we would have !

qRnAwBD3IlDRqsYi9SRexg.text: Fun place to hang out on a Saturday afternoon! The spam sliders are crazy good. Awesome service! Beer and wine on tap. Casual atmosphere.

1pTp9tr_8h0lqT5agoT6aQ.text: Love the food and the beers. Just love it all!!!! Always be there and drink a craft beer! The pretzels and mustard are good

epqE9r0OVVEe13C_fffaLw.text: If you love craft beer, this should be your go-to or a night out when visiting downtown phoenix. The ever-revolving selection of beers on tap and available beer flights make beer-tasting an adventure. If I had one complaint, it's the difficulty of finding seating for a group every time I've ever visited, even after calling ahead. This is a great problem to have, but it's a solvable problem.

q8p4YylZBNI_rv1D1RRKew.text: Great place to go for some amazing food and a huge craft beer selection. I have been multiple times and I am never disappointed. They have great pizzas, sandwiches, burgers and a really nice atmosphere.

2CEczsNIk3unhC-_0MV5HQ.text: Atmosphere was fun. Asu game was on. Amazing beer selections. The food-... had the fish tacos 'the big guppy'. They tasted like nothing, with a side of vinegar cabbage slaw and avocado mash that had waaay to much cumin, and sort of made it inedible. :/ the ratio of fish to tortilla was good if we're speaking dollar value but not to enjoy without taking a piece out. Their 'housemade' ketchup is super fresh and amazing for spaghetti- not fries. Thank god my friend ordered the 'fun-guy' pizza flatbread..it saved the meal! All and all more of a beer drinking spot with over priced-hipster bar food.

TdMRGn8OpN0QSa0rBiTabw.text: Staff takes pride of not caring.  "gives no ****s"  for service. Good burrito, tacos need to be three instead of two. If you are use to  attentive wait staff, go somewhere else.

f348eBLSBwDMmNEMLubA_w.text: Very few places capture the essence of eating in the middle of Phoenix quite like this one. With 30 revolving micro brewed beers, a menu that is simply delish, you simply can not go wrong here. My wife and I started with the "Hot Mess Fries", it was served hot with gravy, wonderful. I got the "Animal" burger, blue cheese and onions along with a custom sauce, best burger I have had in a long time. My wife got the "Trucker" pizza, loaded with bacon. Combined with a couple of micro brewed beers, and we simply could not finish everything! Our server was extremely knowledgeable and friendly. Eating on the patio offered a wonderful view of Phoenix, and there was more than enough room. Don't delay in trying this place out, you won't regret it!

ay7yIeEf4fq1fV9cbYRiTA.text: The outlaw burger may have changed my life. Awesome food and even better beer. XXV from North Coast, CA is excellent. Great little joint. We were in and out quickly and everyone enjoyed the experience. I highly recommend.

_UX2eGstjZIf68xsBDfuww.text: Awesome food and great service! I went here for my lunch during a work day and they were fast and the food was the most delicious I have ever had for "bar food". Great for a Downtown Phoenix stop for lunch or dinner! Plus it has a great atmosphere!

M5HLA4tLTRn-kWz6u7qiRA.text: Went there last night.  Had a great experience...fun patio, great beer and food.  A must go to location in downtown Phoenix!!

2htDWMKm3qt1vUU_NuOzrA.text: I loved the beer selection!  My feedback is that the inside seating is quite noisy.  We were fortunate enough to be there on a beautiful evening so we could take advantage of the patio.  I plan to do that again.  I don't think my evening would have been nearly as enjoyable sitting indoors, as there seems to be nothing to absorb the sound.  Waitress was a little slow getting around, and we had to wait a bit for our tab.   I will be returning for a social event this week, hopefully I'll be able to have a 4 or 5 star experience, in which case I'll upgrade my rating.

qPbCNn6pdlYVKi7FOWGUxg.text: Great food! We had the Poutine and Spam slides for appetizers and beer. Cool vibes and great local selection.

gTWDka7h__MoteeYY5tLXQ.text: Found this a week ago, been 3 times. Food is great, service is great (kudo to Brittany, Betsy and Braden). So far we've had the "outlaw" burger, the ? burger the one with the fried egg on it, the flatbreads, the sausage snack, the pop tarts, the dessert flatbread, and the salad (the one with avocado). I didn't like the fries but my wife loved them. I loved the cole slaw...vinegar and oil dressing not mayo. We went on TV Dinner night (Tuesday)...fried chicken dinner - excellent.  We've asked them to "customize" things like the salad and they accommodated us 'no questions asked' happy to make us happy.   The beer selection is excellent ...on the downside, when the keg is empty, they move on to the next one. So we had the Scotch Ale (great!!) in the beginning of the week, but on our return it was gone...we were forced into another discovery ...we tried one of their 6 glass samplers...we picked the 6, and discovered a new "favorite!"   The clientele is a mix, old, young, casual, professional. Tables and chairs are basic but comfortable, inside or out on the patio.   Depending on the beverages ordered we've been out the door for $30-$50 for two of us on each of the 3 visits.

kYVdgsfncv1PTomBX9jZGw.text: Really, really good choice. Outstanding beer selection, good menu, good staff. Don't miss the "Big Guppy" on the menu.

r8mnmycSIlO96rWZQWXycQ.text: Disappointed the proprietor participated in a selfish and ultimately successful scheme to subvert a local initiative to establish a district to improve the neighborhood. He's got a great place, but for this 25+ year downtown resident, a shop that just opened in 2012 is a relative newcomer to the scene. I choose carefully where I spend my money, and the nature and character of the owners of an establishment influences that decision mightily. There are too many competitors downtown now. We now avoid Angel's Trumpet. I do miss it, but...

ns5Wa5qST5r30iBo7panSg.text: If you're visiting from out of town, I think you'd appreciate this. It's not too Phoenix, but it's in Phoenix which makes it cool. Tons of beers on tap, that change out all the time. So if you're a beer drinker then this is your place. The outside patio is really nice and the vibe inside is great as well. The menu is unique, they make their own catsup and that's interesting. good meat plates and good veggie plates. I'm positive you'll leave here with a smile. The only reason I didn't give it a full 5 stars is that most of the waiters/waitresses I've had were just not up to par in speed and friendliness that you would expect from a place like this. There was just some excitement missing from them.

8yufepIHnTrBxy_ggxifUw.text: BEST BEER SELECTION, house-made everything and a fun atmosphere, especially if you want to bring your dogs.   Get the wings (order them extra crispy) with the Moose Drool sauce and the wild game sausage platter.  Their rootbeer beef tacos are delicious, and the fish taco portion for the price is crazy!  This is our go-to spot to bring visiting friends and family.

kI-gwd-CosAGyDMVeVXZGA.text: One of the best places to get beer downtown. The food is fantastic, great sized portions, and great for hungry American eats. The atmosphere is fun and the outdoor area is really wonderful as well. Not a place to go if you want a mixed drink, but then again, why go to a beer house?

vOb00SsLYMXMNAAyNEgaEw.text: If you love beer more than you love most people, Angel's Trumpet Ale House is for you. With over 20 taps of the finest craft beers, you're sure to find your perfect match. If beers aren't your thing, let me tell you about the food. It's all delicious. All of it. They make everything from scratch (and I'm talking even the ketchup), so you really can't go wrong. They serve gastropub favorites like wings, sliders and hot pretzels, but they are in no way typical. For dessert they have sea salt + chocolate chip cookies and HOME MADE POP TARTS. The proprietors are lovely people who are dedicated to bringing you the best brew and best foods. The patio is big and comfortable; bring your entire contact list. You'll be a hero.

NS3oxI9J2HDrAPvQCtUmVA.text: Came here for my second time bringing a hopeful vision to replenish my so-so reflection of prior memory. Beers are always a plus, and I suppose it's an Ale House so the emphasis isn't weighted foodie. With that said I would value it just so, the food is your regular bar food with a new American spin with a focus on fresh. I ordered the Matador which was basically a steak sandwich with a side of fries. Decent it was, amazing it was not. I would come back for a couple brews and a hot pretzel but not again to saturate False hope with a average to good sitting.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pretzel, hot cheese and spicy mustard.

Cz0WJoNUkFXMf7o4LhhKhA.text: Had a red basket special (catfish poboy) and it just melted in my mouth ! And the tots were perfectly fried and the sauce was delicious. First time here, will be coming back for sure. Plus the waitor was very pleasant and informative.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

va485uEH8Qq9oY02QKBepw.text: Popped by for lunch before I had to do some work. Our server came over with waters nearly immediately. I ordered a fantastic cranberry cider. She recommended the pesto grilled cheese sandwich with spam. Yes, spam. IT WAS GREAT. I mean, I could eat that sandwich for lunch everyday. And it's a few blocks from work, so I might!

a98hf8anHKZgFwNsKc55aA.text: Two words: TV DINNER.  That's right, every Tuesday, pop on over to Angel's Trumpet for a massive, hearty, down-home TV dinner served on an actual compartmentalized tray filled with good old fashioned comfort food.   If that brand of gluttony isn't your thing, try any of the sandwiches and you'll be totally satisfied-- the food here is a major highlight, no question.    I'm a wine person so the place gets one demerit for the very limited (and usually not-so-tasty) wine selection.  But because it is billed as an "ale house" I can't get too picky about it.  My beer-guzzling family raves about the beer selection and the flights that let you try a little bit of everything.  If they're happy with it, it must be grand!    The atmosphere is my favorite thing about the place.  The lighting is perfect, it's spacious but cozy, and there are a variety of seating options including a great outdoor space.  It's great for small gatherings and large happy hour outings alike.     A few words of advice:  1.  TV dinners start at 6pm and they are limited quantity so don't expect to show up for a late dinner and nab one-- they'll be sold out!  2.  ATAH is closed on Mondays!   3.  They don't open until 3pm Tuesday-Thursday so don't expect to grab lunch or an early happy hour during the week.    Cheers!

7dv_hveA008S6q7mrB2gig.text: We decided to stop for happy hour and glad we did! Although I'm not a beer drinker, wine for me, we thought the reviews looked good.  I had the Fun Guy flatbread and it was delicious and plentiful! Hubby had the grilled cheese and brisket sandwich. He eats for real and couldn't finish the whole thing.   He enjoyed a lager and I tried a couple of really good wines.  The service was exceptional and friendly.

2lFCCf-DEWR5UUQbpqy7QA.text: 1st visit. post golf lunch on a Wednesday afternoon:  Lots of available parking.  Cool ambiance/atmosphere. Half indoor, half outdoor. Whatever works for you.  32 beers on tap plus wine. Good selection of varied brews.  Low key wait staff. No rush, no pressure.  Pints, tulips, and snifters, depending on the beer. Something for everyone.  Hummus, pita, & veg, to start. Awesome.  Paisano (?) Pizza - today's special, was fabulous. Great crust that held up, didn't get soggy. Tasty sausage.  $52 (before tip) for 5 brews, appetizer, pizza. Completely satisfied.

kfcNcf-GOYZk4G5gpQjJsg.text: Great menu choices. Awesome feel and vibe w descent service. Would certainly return. Loud interior for a Sunday night. Overall great place.

rpzU-9GsrBi95DPATMkq9A.text: This place has become one of my favorites. I love the large craft beer menu! I've never met a beer I didn't like and the flat bread pizza is so yummy. Our server was very friendly and helpful. I told him the type of beer I like and he brought a flight over and they were all delicious!

3c-WC_SxwKz0qaMDguaXKA.text: It was quite crowded on the night of first Friday event. Service was a bit tough at the bar -- not that responsive to our orders. But once we got out table, we were taken care of pretty quickly.  For those ale drinkers seeking some new options - do try out this flight combination: 6(kunig Ludwig), 18, 19(corne du devel), 23(krombacher), 30(saison), and 31. Quite tasty!  Also tried the farm pizza from the menu - have to say the pizza was tasty and the cheese on it tasted expensive ;) though it seemed as though they poured a whole salad packet onto the pizza to give it a "farm" feel, overall the pizza was delicious an with the flight -- perfect combo!  Good place to hang out and chill in downtown phoenix!

bKq_cwQrn1yFDFFKCXBYjw.text: The pup-friendly patio, neighborhood location and rotating beer taps are what keep me coming back.  The menu- I like the concept, but the execution could be better (with the exception of the grilled cheese...honey & pesto! Yum!) I have heard good things about the TV Dinners on Tuesday, so maybe I'll have to try that out. I don't think there's much of a happy hour either, maybe a dollar or two off a beer?  The service- Almost always painful, and painful to watch around me, especially at an outside table. Pretty slow, negligent, and they don't seem to care. The strangest thing is nearly every time I have been here, I have been asked to close out so the server can "get their drink on, too." Multiple occasions, all different servers. Were they trained to say this? I get it, but it's also a bit lame.   If you're really lucky, the bar service can be a little better. But then I can't bring my dog which is half of the reason I like this place... & now I just confused myself.  I do keep returning. Guilty.  But not nearly as often, and each time with hopes of improvement.

cr51hlF3NOKjGznns5lJYQ.text: Good food, great beer selection, decent atmosphere, and poor customer service.  I was compelled to try this place because of all the awesome things I have heard about this place and I feel a little compelled to give them a great review . . . maybe I missed something but this place is a hair better than mediocre.  Meal:  I had one of the hamburgers and their version of poutine.  I also had a few of the craft beers.  Taste:  The hamburger was almost tremendous.  I asked for medium rare and came out a hair under well done, but other than that, it was spectacular.  The poutine was very good too . . . maybe not Canadian great but very good. 7 out of 10.  Value:  I thought the highlight of the meal was the portions.  I couldn't finish my burger and poutine.  I came hungry and the prices were more than reasonable. 4 out of 5.  Service/Cleanliness:  Service was extremely slow and the waitress had little to no fucks to give regarding doing her job well.  She botched our order twice.  Rarely came over to check up on drinks where on two or three different occasions I had to flag down another waitress.  She had no clue what was on the menu.  But her beer knowledge was about the same as a 18 year old walking into his first fraternity party and asking for a natty ice.  I would imagine if you work at a place with "ale house" in the name, you would know a little about the beers.  There are a 25+ beers on tap so I know its a little hard but for Christ sakes, at least know 4 or 5 really well.  4 out of 10.  Atmosphere:  Decent.  Nothing so special that it left a lasting impression.  3 out of 5.   Overall:  Will I go back?  Probably but only if every other option has been exhausted.  Hopefully the service improves by then . . . 18 out of 30 points, 2 out of 5 stars.

Ize8y5GpJm-jjStvfVFRtw.text: We're visiting Phoenix, trying out the Angels Trumpet Ale House on a recommendation overheard from others. This place is incredible! There were 31 craft beers on tap and they served 6 different wines on tap as well. We split the Matador with slaw and the Churchill Grilled Cheese with fries. Both were incredible! We'll be back to Phoenix, to eat here again!!

nd_jJfdy1Yh3dkCbttUa1g.text: We arrived at Angel's Trumpet at 10:30pm last night. After being seated and waiting another 20 minutes for a server to address us we proceeded to try to order out food. The served then asked us if it was 11:00 yet. It was 11:00 on the dot. After informing her that we had been waiting for 20 minutes and could have ordered on time she simply shrugged her shoulders. I have been to this restaurant before and the beer selection is amazing, the food is good, but the service is seriously lacking.

OzAeaGArQdh00kAXsrqAwg.text: The 30+ minute wait was worth it! Packed place on the Saturday night I visited. I finally had a chance to check this place out with friends and was not disappointed. Granted, I only had one beer but it turned me onto what is now probably my favorite brew! I had a Lost Coast Brewery Tangerine Wheat. It had the perfect amount of citrus, was lighter on the tummy than say a Blue Moon or Shocktop; the typical Wheat beers that are available at most restaurants.   The temperature of the beer was perfect. Staff was very knowledgeable about the beer selection, which changes every day. Actually, after my glass of Tangerine Wheat, they had just ran out and replaced it on the giant chalk board display with a new wheat selection, it was called Heife WEISS Hell! My visit was complete or else I would have tried that one, too.   I did not eat on this visit but the food passing by for other tables looked delicious. I'll be back for some grub and possibly enjoy a flight next time so I can find my next favorite brew!

m_Q0Qv5w5wg6LfCRnSBRaQ.text: First time here and fall in love with this place. Great beer great food! What more can you ask for???

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grill cheese
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 810
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Meat loaded

TMZhzs2K8cBblMwMmmXnDw.text: Don't let the blase exterior (with the exception of the amazing mural) fool you at this joint... it's MUCH bigger than it looks from the outside.  The only food I tried was their margherita pizza, which was fresh and tasty - but far from my favorite.  I will reserve judgment on the rest of the menu items until I try, but their beer selection is just impeccable.  Rotating taps with every kind imaginable, a great happy hour, and friendly service = must try if you love beer.  I really loved the open design, the back patio (especially between October and May) are perfect for this part of Phoenix.  It's like, for a moment, you forget where you are.  Very zen like, and peaceful place to enjoy a drink - at least until they get busy, and then it's still great, just not as quiet.  MUST TRY if you're needing a drink downtown, I will surely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Much bigger inside than it looks.

HmueWLLowgB0mOGpjBeEpQ.text: I live within spitting distance of this place and I love it. It's just a great place to come, drink some strange beer, eat some unique food and chat. The staff is always extremely competent and knowledgeable about beer, though they don't small-talk much as the place is almost always packed! The owners are consistently there working along side their staff, and they take a lot of time to speak with regulars and make sure the service is on-point. The husband/wife team run a tight ship and their love of this business definitely shines through.   If you ask me, the only problem with the place is that the inside chairs are pretty uncomfortable, but I usually sit at the bar so it doesn't really matter.   This is the type of business that helps a city grow and gain character. A beautiful, clean, professional place with good service at a great price. I'll always be coming back.

W7kFXPib77DwxS-ReZocIA.text: Awesome food, good beer and wine... great prices..try the desert!! ... Disgruntled waitress.. Cranky,not friendly nor a sense a humor! Great place to hang out with friends.  Edit.  Was here over the weekend. With friends. After many many beers I think 3-5 hours. We where here. Completely different service. It was quick and friendly. Maybe the previous waitress had an off day. We are only human. Still recommend this place

fY8fm3BbANEPeV6Q-t363A.text: As bad as I want to give this neat little tap house a full 5 stars, I can't because yo, that bartender chick with the terribly drawn on eyebrows has a hell of an attitude! She also can't pour a beer to save her life so I hope you like a lot of foam. Other than that, the waiters and waitresses are great, the food is better, and the beer selection is the best!!!

F7dGWuXCX6p69z3DlAICQA.text: Tuesday Night is TV DINNER NIGHT! woot woot.  Angels Trumpet is a great place for dinner (avocado salad is on point, just like the fish tacos, their hummus and pretzels)  Keep in midn hte portions are BIG, so if you want to save a couple $$s sharing is caring and split some plates!  Oh and did I mention it is cheap? You get your bang for your buck in my opinion. Great flavors, great house wine and beers.  And its dog friendly in the patio!

fpbWbCmRO_JXXXgq3ldCXA.text: A great place to go and spend a lazy Saturday. The patio is amazing. A robust list of local beers adore a chalkboard above the bar and outside. The food is great asswell, I would recommend the pretzel appetizer and the Chet burrito as a main.

LeEmXFbeaJmqDq30nAmGbQ.text: I was able to get six Saison and/or Belgian biers in my flight. I think they had like 37 beers on tap that night plus 8 wines. Friendly clientele. Very good sausage platter

gBQFNCSJ0hHR64d2J2HN1w.text: Such an awesome joint! They have one of the best salads (for a person that is TRYING, to eat healthy) and the most ridiculously delicious burgers (for someone who doesn't care about their weight aka: my husband). We've tried multiple burgers, deserts, and drinks, and they have all been yummy. Definitely love there home made ketchup and different take on ranch! We'll need to head over again real soon!

7XeqIEuDBbGSr-1zftGIlg.text: Was on a walk in downtown Phoenix and as I walked by was reminded I hadn't eaten here in awhile. No reason other than absentmindedness. So I decided to grab lunch.   First, this is one of those fun hip (yeah I realize using that word may make people question eating here but don't.) places just off downtown. It has a huge beer selection that cover a broad spectrum of tastes from a variety of brewers.   Second, the food here is great. In the past I've had wings and several sandwiches, all exceeding expectations. Today, was no different.   I have 5 words for you: bbq beef brisket grilled cheese! What more could you ask for! The brisket was tender and juicy and the sauce was not overpowering. The cheese was gooey and perfectly melted me it was served on thick white bread, grilled perfectly to be crunchy on the outside but soft inside. Plus it soaked up all the sauce so nothing was lost. It truly was a delicious sandwich. Now I got the coleslaw today and unlike a traditional slaw, this was a oil and vinegar based slaw but lightly dressed. It had a nice covering of feta which gave a tangy salty finish to each bite, plus had craisins mixed in for a sweet balance to the salty feta.   All in all, lunch was great. Perfect way to break up a Friday.

-y4_oJ7WOEvBto6zejBTJw.text: Exceptionally fast service from start to finish, and the food was good (had spam sliders). Would love to see them up their game on the beer list - lots of tools out there to allow for more details regarding what is on tap.

3LWM0lA2Z5tZHBTd3QXQeQ.text: A group of us came to angel's trumpet yesterday afternoon for an early dinner before a concert.  They don't take reservations but we had no trouble getting a table for 6. Our server was really nice and attentive and was happy to give my sisters a few samples so that they didn't end up with something they didn't like.  All six of us ordered different entrees and they were all fantastic! Overall we had a great experience. 4 stars because I would have liked more ipa's on draft and the parking was a bit of a pain.

2EjqhKDRCXKSwTVJNzAI-A.text: Have been several times and each time had a great experience. Delicious food, wonderful selection of beers on tap, great service, what more could you ask for?

zjWtXFBghpTvpmobIJmKsA.text: Love this place, food is delish and the beer is always different  and we love that! I always get the flat bred and my husband loves their burgers. The atmosphere of this place is really chill and laid back, we will always go back to Angels Trumpet!

rnTpFzvc-dFeqH4IBlSoQw.text: The food is pretty good and the beer selection is great. It's a little noisy in there but not so bad. There is outdoor seating as well.  I've been here a couple times and the problem with th is the staff.   The waiters and waitresses can be pretty inattentive to those sitting outside, especially if you're just getting drinks and not food.  I also watched a bartender refuse to serve a customer because the customer hadn't tipped him for his last drink.   Basically, a lot of the staff has that can't-be-bothered sort of attitude. If you're okay with that then you should definitely go. If you like to have some respect, you should try elsewhere.

BdXOkaMXehSFhM2G5tTo9w.text: Very pleased with the service, food and beer. Will be coming back to try other dishes.  Ordered: Spam sliders- loved the slaw and the sweetness against some spiciness.  The Mess- it was good but not something i would order again.  Not enough curds for me and a bit of an aftertaste... not sure from what; Chet Burrito- Favorite dish, loved the fries and spiciness in it; Pepperoni Flatbread- my son loved it; Smoked Pork with BBQ- I'm not a huge fennel fan and this was a little more than what I like. but the onions were nice and crispy and the bun was great. Lemonade- eh

C-e1i3FdVvvH-nED5gRzVA.text: Very generous owners donated gift certificates to teachers of a nearby school for Teacher Appreciation Week.  Our staff love this restaurant, its patio, and vibe.  It is a great place to decompress, laugh and rejuvenate after busy day.  Food is great and servers are friendly and attentive.

vPFKossTVSYlUFTQcBgeuA.text: Fantastic spot for a beer. Always something new on the menu and if you ask for a recommendation from the staff, you almost always get something worth trying. And... the food is good too! A must-visit for craft beer fans. Also honorable mention - the staff is awesome. They remember you when you stop by and even remember what types of beer you enjoy. Great neighborhood vibe.  Highest recommendation: the Brewlee burger. Unbelievably good. It comes with a fried egg, peppered bacon, pepper jack cheese, fresh leafy greens, pickled red onion, and Sriracha mayo. The the bun is toasted with a drizzle of caramelized sugar - really puts it over the top. One of the very best gastro burgers in Phoenix.

L3gLHZg9eI-3qvUc-DybEQ.text: We were looking for a place with outside seating and followed the yelp reviews here. We all really enjoyed our meals (oddly we all got mexican: guppy (fish tacos), chet burrito and verde tacos). All were excellent. There was one item of our meal that was hugely disappointing however. There was a specials menu and Thursdays was tater tots. Not something we'd normally order, but for some reason it just sounded good to all of us. First off, there were no prices. This always annoys me when restaurants don't put prices on a menu. We asked the waitress who 'thought' they were $8, but assured us it was a big basket. They were small, but tasty, and for our party of 4 we'd guess we each got about 5 tater tots. She was right, it was a big basket, unfortunately there were hardly any tater tots in it.

LM0-n-bQqYkYw8FGzgVsIw.text: Looking forward to trying this place before it opened. Got to go and I had a good time yet the staff came off as a bit too cool for school. Other than that, great, great beer selection. If your a newbie, try to beer flight for a great introduction.  Good thing to share with friends. The food had variety such as Spam burgers, which are fantastic.  Price about average meaning a little steep ranging from 5-10 for a beer. About usual for these places though. Overall, will probably go back hoping the staff's aloofness was a one time thing.

Wvu23mvOG29XgDFrwKlIxQ.text: Amazing food. One of the best pizzas I've had in a long time. The Tractor with added jalapenos is crunchy, smoky, and just so good. The rotating beer list is always a fun scavenger hunt for new beer. Solid pizzas, great burgers, and unique beers. Count me in.

E9iKsLezBJcagkiLCfsQoQ.text: Picked this place based on the reviews from yelp while at a conference for work.  If you like scratch made food with eccentric ingredients you will love this place.  Hip clientele and a nice outdoor patio make this a great weekend, dinner, lunch or weekend eatery.  Beer is great.  They only keep small kegs of beer so the selections changes continuously throughout the night.   Beer selection is on a chalk board.  Fun!  I had the matador and it was great.   We shared the sausage plate and wings and it was probably too much for four people.  I would save room for the entree.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sausage plate

qtI0Ts1vBiiwgYKpK1_yIw.text: People cream their shorts over Trumpet Ale House...why? Maybe it's because it's the only Brewery Downtown? Who knows. Breweries are pretty ubiquitous in Tempe and they don't RUN OUT of anything. Does this make you think that the beer you're enjoying is some how more exclusive? No...it means they don't have room for extra kegs, because they took up the only available slab of real estate in the Arts District.  Also, pretty sure that grandiose sense of self, that the staff possess, has gotten passed down the patrons...  It's a place to people watch and "been seen". Ugh...People treat you like shit, and if they manage to crack a smile while staring in your general direction, you somehow feel like part of the club? This isn't High School...and you aren't in Mean Girls Part Deux.  Thing is? I really wanted to love this place : (  3 Stars because they serve (fantastic) food and beer downtown. Minus 1 star because they run out of shit.  Minus 1 star bc when I order a lambic, I expect the rest of the bottle. I know what I am getting when I order a Belgian Framboise. I also know ya re-corked and reused what I paid for, after you poured a meager serving into the champagne sized flute. Give me what I purchased (like every other bar does).   I'd go back for the food, and not show up on First (Fight the Pretend Art-Loving Crowd) Friday...

wi4GemPPT0YUEXcSmlnygA.text: Food was a nice twist for bar food. Wings are unique and tasty. Matador brisket sandwich was very good. Fries were good as well. Nice variety of beer offerings. Decent prices. Staff was very friendly. The service is excellent. Very close to downtown Phoenix and hotels. Great place to grab a beer.

aKGPHp0FOCOvzxWrJfK3_Q.text: One of the best burgers I've ever had. We were a group of 6 all varying in ages & everyone loved their meal. Great staff & nice environment. They even have a space out one the patio for dogs :)

lUTFbO2dI8aboZqM6ZGDCA.text: Don't let my 3 stars fool you.....I am actually a pretty big fan of this place and look forward to returning. I have been twice but the experiences were different, hence the 3 stars. The first time I went with my husband and we were seated at one of the community tables. They asked us if we were okay with that and it is was fine. The more the merrier! I had a glass of their rose wine and ordered their salad that came with avocados, grapefruit, beets, mint, arugula, goat cheese, and a orange vinaigrette. I asked them to leave off the grapefruit, beets, and add salami. I thoroughly enjoyed it, wow! However, the second time I had it, I ordered it the exact same way (but for take-out instead), and when I ate it, it was way too tart. I could barely eat it which stunk because I was really looking forward to having it again. Other than that, i liked the environment. It is really chill, I loved all of the windows which brought alot of light into the restaurant. I will definitely go back especially since it has become a fave among my husband and friends.

aJVV3hHp6kcmzTB5n9KkEQ.text: This place is pretty awesome. If my future experiences are anything like my experience last night, this place would be a definite five star. I went with the BF and a couple of friends and we were seated right away (around 9 ish). The bar was hopping. Our server knew a lot about beer and we each gave him a description of what we liked and he picked beer for us. It was awesome! He clearly likes his job and is very good at it. They also have a neat way of doing flights, they have a piece of paper with 6 circles on it. You put the number of the beer you want to try in each circle (and there are like 30+ choices.....ah mazing!). They bring out the six fairly large sample sizes in a muffin tin (cute idea!). We got two flights and tried some crazy beers...a lot of beers none of us had ever tried before. It was also cool that the beers were changing throughout the night...like when one keg ran out, they replaced it with something totally new. We didn't have any food, but it smelled and looked good. The ambiance is comfortable...they have an open wall out to the outside and tables throughout. It is a large bar and has plenty of seating. I will definitely be back!

e9yA0DMaCvHqR54PFsJkuQ.text: Okay....so my first experience there...I couldn't drink. Damn.  But the beer looked amazing.  Next time!  Food:  I had the smoked chicken legs and seasonal vegetables.  Chicken was really good, a tad dry (but this is likely due to smoking then grilling) and the veggies were spot on delicious and a great variety of carrots, parsnips, and butternut squash.  They meant seasonal and took it seriously....and seasoned them well too!   Pricing: Food--everything was about under $15; flight of beer $9....good prices in my  book. Space:  Looks great!  Very modern and clean, but the outstanding use of wood butcherblock furniture and what appears to be upcycled wood for wall decor warms the place up. Cons: Not a lot to drink if you aren't drinking beers. No coffee, no club soda, no iced tea.  Only offer a handful of wines. They do have a soda fountain somewhere.  I get it. It's a craft brew pub.  No mixed drinks. Only serve the frothy and fermented.  I support that.  But have some decent non-alcoholic bevvys on hand: iced tea, sparkling waters, and good coffee.  You don't need an espresso bar, just a good machine with a high-quality bean, and someone who knows how to make that work.    I'll go back!

YRaoDlQEAwAipmpHjgQU3w.text: Stumbled upon this place when looking for something somewhat near the Airport. Food was amazing and not your usual run of the mill menu. I'd recommend the Casper pizza. Beer selection is incredible too. Great outside seating area with a cool hipster vibe. I'd eat here whenever I am in this area.

zwza19rQ9Fhfx85-rqgYqQ.text: Fun spot!   Tractor pizza is amazing!!

f8JkJtBqAALz1dDIvxn3jg.text: TV Dinner Tuseday is SO FUN! When we went, we had buffalo chicken nuggets, bleu mac'n cheese and a bunch of other awesomeness! Dessert is decadent. Prices are fair. Atmosphere is fun and family friendly! LOVE this place.

96TITdBY4HY41V8A7RW12w.text: Met a buddy of mine here before a concert down the road - was spectacular!  Great craft beer selection with plenty of IPAs on tap.  Server was very knowledgeable about brewers, locations, etc.  The burger I had could have been the best burger ever!  Also, loved the slaw it came with.  Definitely a place I would visit again!  Could be the best kept secret in all of Phoenix.

I65EwibZOUt04SzgILQ8Vw.text: Saturday afternoon during spring training and it's very open. Nice staff. Comfortable seating including outdoor. Lots of taps with great variety.  Food has interesting bar food options. Grilled cheese with bacon jam is great!

5YJKUur6RDjcv5EpVwJuRw.text: The flights are really fun since they have such an awesome selection of beers!  The decor fits the place great.  Knowledgeable bartenders can give you advice on beer selections and the food was delicious too.

fsxa3VXye7efnmMUVXJzvQ.text: Really hip and fun place for GREAT beers and yummy delux burgers and sandwiches.  Actually loved that the exterior tends to make this place look secret.  GREAT vibe, good service.  Love the crowd that goes here. YAY DOWNTOWN PHOENIX!

fKRPJ99ZIpOe8ovbEQ8ymg.text: I have been here twice and this place rocks. They have a fantastic selection of beer and the most amazing beer-battered fish tacos I have ever tried, The server was great and the ambiance is always nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. THE BEST

keK2hspQvka0j9xn0kDbqQ.text: Great beer but very crowded; though we did go on first Friday. I would definitely go back but would make sure to get there early to ensure we get a table.

gbFm7iHsn0qWXrL_iIC5Xg.text: Pretty solid selection of craft beers Service is weak. Prices are too high.  As a home brewer and craft beer lover I was really exited about this place opening. Their selection of draft beers is pretty good, but on all three of my visits I experienced very poor service. Each time I've taken a seat at the bar and have had to flag down the bartender to ask for a menu and ask for a another round all while there has been only a handful of people in the place. I know that they've only been open a couple of months but this place needs to fix these issues if it's going to stick around. Come off your prices at least a buck for each specific pour and offer a happy hour. You're in the wrong locale to command such high prices.

SWGxGpaykgrDVK2ODP-uOg.text: NYC prices in Phoenix? Nice idea but downtown Phoenix will continue to be second rate if this what is tolerated. Sub par customer service and food is lackluster. Been here 4 times now so I gave it more than a fair shake. You may ask why have I gone back then? My friends didn't believe me but we're all now in agreement. Another nice attempt that misses the mark in downtown Phoenix.

ge395I-_0puGulTYUZufgw.text: I was looking forward to their opening and now I feel I need to wait a few months longer before I try again.    On a Friday night, a hostess/server greeted us after a good 5 minutes of waiting by the door and asked us if we would be ordering food since the kitchen was backed up.  If we were to order, our food would arrive well over an hour of our arrival.  Naturally, this was all the information we needed enough to say "No, we're just here for a beer or two."  Soon after, we were seated and placed an order for 3 pints.  We waited a good 15-20 minutes for our beers.  During that time, we noticed lots of servers standing around one POS (point of sale).  It looked as if servers were waiting in line to put in their individual orders.  Our suspicion was confirmed later that evening, only one working POS.  I wonder why they didn't have a backup plan-paper tickets?  I would think people would be more inclined to walk out on their tab because of the excruciating wait than management have to worry about losing money with paper tickets.  Our waters were refilled twice before our first round of beers arrived at our table.  Two of my buddies call this place the "Water House" because that's all they got when they visited Angel's Trumpet Ale House.    Once we received our beers, we asked her to place another order for another round of beers because we figured that we would receive our 2nd set of beers just as we finished our first ones.  It worked!  If ya plan on having another beer, be sure to place an order as soon as the first beers arrive so that you don't hafta wait long for your second beer.    I think the night was best portrayed by a sneak peek that I got of the owner- he was rubbing his temples and obviously under stress.   I am inclined to give them a star or two more once the timing has improved.    Great building, good ambiance, wonderful patio (hope it's pet friendly), excellent location and a good selection of beers.    Oh, I like the idea of three bathroom choices instead of the typical two.

qsTege5NDlwV1gOWEOWTwQ.text: Angels received two stars only because it has a great draft beer selection.  Poor ownership/management decision to have last call @ 10:30 on a Thursday night and crappy acoustics ruin this place.  Downtown Phoenix has been dying to have a place like this.  So extend the hours of operation and install acoustics please!

7kJI7PDVJrX_iqSL4fIp_Q.text: Got the Brewlee burger. Got it cooked medium rare just as I asked, and it was really good. We also split wings and pretzel apps that were very good. I'll definitely be back to try some of the other cool menu items they had!

NLPaNSpioODBsP1ibLdXlw.text: Always good food, but the beer is why we come here.  The beer and wine selection is great.  Would like a few more local beers and wines from bodega pierce would be a great added selection.

2_n3uEkwqOcJqdgmO9tJFg.text: GREAT food, great service, great beer selection.  We had a lot of fun and, if i lived here, would totally come here all the time.  Definitely the spot if you like better quality food and craft beer.  Not too expensive either... about $30 bucks for 2 beers, an an entree and an appetizer.

UxOf71icbsabG9n4y9CvVQ.text: Food and beer here are amazing.  I live downtown and try my hardest not to go here all the time since I want to try other spots. The service is pretty good even when busy and they have a TV so I can watch some games.

hL3QZ_erJJpbIed1lgrUKA.text: My friends have been ranting and raving about this place for so long, and I finally tried it over the weekend. VERY HAPPY.  I stopped in for a late lunch, and I had the avocado salad. It was filled with fresh produce and flavorful, fresh ingredients. It was exactly what I wanted on a hot AZ summer day. Perfect.   I couldn't leave without trying one of the homemade poptarts. They are seasonal, and the ones I got were pineapple and spiced rum with brown sugar on top. SO SO FAB. It was like biting into heaven.  Will definitely be going back. Lunchtime atmosphere was comfortable. Not too crowded, and there was a ton of good music playing.   Overall A+ experience.

6YWKbrVFZvZ9CwzRKbfspA.text: The only knock I have on this place is that they're closed on Mondays. Great food. Great beer. Awesome happy hour (2-6). They have 30 something beers on tap. The burgers are awesome. The pizza is awesome. Relatively inexpensive.

2R2KaNJc5fWnEI1khFyeEw.text: I cannot speak for the food, (though the menu looked unique and tantalizing), but the beer selection was great, as was service. We arrived on Saturday night, the first weekend Angels Trumpet was open, around 10 p.m. for drinks. There was a large group of us, 9 people... though there weren't any tables to accomodate our party we were able to stand/be seated comfortably around one of the high-tops.  This place is great for smaller parties who enjoy a good beer. The selection cannot be beat in downtown Phoenix -- 31 craft brews on tap of every taste and style... and they're always rotating. I had the Biere Blonde & White... 4.5% alcohol, light, sunny taste. Reminded me of Four Peak's SunBrew.  The selection ranges from hoppy IPAs at 10% alcohol/volume to the lighter, summer brews and everything in between. There is literally something for everyone, even a few wines on tap for the non-beer drinkers.  Our server was very nice and accommodating.. and though the place was packed she got us our drinks pretty quickly.  A couple reasons I didn't give Angels Trumpet the perfect '5' star rating:  Disorganization-- Seating was sort of a nightmare... and we kind of waited around for one of the high-tops to open up and just snagged it. Ambience-- I enjoyed the nice, open floor plan but the restaurant-style and dozens of tables/chairs was a bit puzzling considering the kitchen was closed when we arrived. I couldn't hear any music above the conversations in the room and the huge, 60" TV screens weren't turned on. It'd be nice for weekend nights to boast something a little more special. If you're going to close the kitchen, allow people to walk around and mingle more.  Overall, if you're looking for a nice place to kick back with a small group of friends and try some awesome, unique beers on tap, Angels Trumpet is it. Their prices are reasonable for the quality offered. Haven't tried the food, but the menu is pretty diverse offering a spin on traditional bar food like flatbread pizzas and sandwiches.

1FuXsIHpr1Qp9ab6o5H0qg.text: Get the pop tart! Every single one has been mouth watering. The beer selection is great and the ambience is nice. I'm not a huge fan of tap wines but you take what you can get.

0Ub5zTXSkDoNtWNYNIVJGw.text: GO TO THIS PLACE.  Tucked away in a little residential-esque building, Angels Trumpet Ale House is the coolest new place in RoRo to grab some brews. I went here with my older brother on a Friday after work and the place was popping. Strolled through the door (whose handle is an entire broomstick, wicked cool looking) and grabbed a table by the big bay windows over looking the patio. Not quite full yet but within 20 minutes the place was full and the patio was too. People really like this place. The beer was good, I got a cider and it was very tasty. We weren't THAT hungry so we split the Meat Treat  pizza and it was BOMB. The bacon was nice and crunchy and the veggies weren't slimy or overwhleming like they tend to be on flat bread pizza.   I cannot wait to go back here, especially this fall when the patio (which overlooks dowtown PHX) is nice and cool and enjoy plenty o drinks.

JDVNcB_4k1cQHZ8UR1TrXg.text: Awesome food, awesome atmosphere, awesome beer. A little cramped, but who cares? Has a really nice patio area.

a2PcW6QerBiVjZTyzdAIdg.text: Excellent selection of beer.  Come here for the beer.  The food is average.  My brisket tacos were adequate, but the brisket was kind of dry. Close your eyes and pick a random beer if you dare...  The ambiance is also excellent - a lot of space, nice wood tables.  A lovely place to enjoy a beverage or become...ahem...a little more inebriated.

0VyTC5_2lX8LYmg7yo8b3w.text: Didn't think I could find craft beer in AZ but lo and behold I found this place on yelp nearby and it is awesome with an excellent selection on tap. Place looks hard to find upon arrival but once in it is bustling with folks of all ages. Food is also awesome! Highly recommended for the eloquent drinker in town looking for craft beer.

aOCCfYBooCofQ3YuWdV1lw.text: Loved this place. We went with friends a while back and everyone had a good time. Liked the set up, the atmosphere, ect. My husband and I split a few appetizers and a sandwich because we always try a bunch of things on our first visit somewhere. Nothing was a let down; we liked all of it and that's saying a lot from my picky husband. We went while I was pregnant and I was super bummed I couldn't try any of the beers after I saw the huge selection. My husband got a flight though and I thought it was clever how the glasses are served in cupcake/muffin tins. I've been really wanting to go back since and try some of the beers myself and the homemade pop tarts.

ZwoBjGa9rOXlryRRLFcXbg.text: This place knows beer. I come here for Theology Pub, a thing my local church hosts where we come drink and talk about spirituality on the first sunday of every month. It's great! What I usually do is get a flight of beer (I think they're $9... anyway, the price isn't bad) and try a bunch of different types of beer. Their selections are always changing, so it's hard to say what's my favorite, but I really come here for the new experiences anyway. I also like that it's close to FilmBar (if I want to catch a cool indie film) and other stuff on Roosevelt. I hate how the neighborhood is becoming gentrified, so I hope places like this last a long time. I've eaten the food here once, but can't say I was impressed.

fF5af3_B00pjJt9VC91_2g.text: With open and loud seating, this beer bar offers a great selection of tasty brews from all over the world all micro in nature. The big flavors of lagers, IPAs and porters, among many others, are available to customers as pints or in flights for tasting. Though the menu could be a little more creative, it leaves you with several yummy choices to accompany your beer.   If you're a beer lover and like loud, hip places, this is one you should definitely check out!

npOxS_SJp5zE5CjD2LcsMQ.text: Living so close to this ale house is awesome... gives us a new option in the downtown Phoenix area.  We peddled on over to Angels Trumpet Ale House and noticed a BOATLOAD of bicycles chained together at Angels Trumpet Ale House and across the street at FilmBar's bike rack.  I think they need a larger bike rack... like a large parking lot sized bike rack.  I was worried when I first walked in because there were many people standing at the entrance... but we got right in and were seated (this was a little before 9 on a Friday).    I liked the energy of the place... and how excited the imbibers seemed, however I'm torn... I want to rate it a full four, but then I thought of the loudness and also the "ok" food.  I wasn't looking for an intimate evening with my man, but yes, I realized I was shouting after a while.  I saw the overwhelmingly large selection of craft brews on the large chalk board... and really neat looking taps.  I went up to the board and figured out which ones I wanted and got a flight.  I don't drink tons of beer... but I enjoy craft brews.  I did take a peek at their wine selection and was disappointed to see no local wines.  This is a running disappointment for me... but that's for another rant.  But I made my selections and we got a taco appetizer.  The tacos were okay... but the chimichuri was REALLY good.  I found a new love... I REALLY liked the Hazelnut beer.  I'm definitely going back for that one.  I picked a few that weren't totally to my liking... but others that were.  I really like trying a few different flavors.    We ordered the white flatbread pizza... which was a little better than okay.  I don't think it was bad, I just know that I've had better flatbreads in downtown.  Not to say I won't have another... or I won't try some other food there... I've just had better.  So  I'd probably give this a 3.5, because I want to support anything downtown.  I think there are some kinks that need to be worked out... nothing horrendous.  I'm glad to see more local businesses down here.  It warms my heart.  Yay downtown!

gv5qSeTulTNlUB4g-do4RA.text: Hipster gastro-paradise. Love the food here, but what really sets it apart for me is the IMMENSE selection of craft beers on tap. I'm so picky on what I like, and this place always has something I enjoy. Also, try the wings! Amazing flavor. Four stars because the service could be a little faster.

HQnWPx0XrQjIqyuZf1XD_g.text: Super delicious!    I recommend the gaucho (shredded pork tacos)   the burgers looked ridiculous and the wings and warm pretzels were bomb!  Pass on the Cole slaw.  Great prices and awesome selection of drafts.

3PadCaUPUKg3umUjntie3Q.text: Our friends have been telling us about this place for a long time. My husband and I finally got to try it out on Friday night. There was a very small wait but we were super lucky to score a spot at the bar while we waited. We were very impressed with the 30+ beers that they had available on tap. We appreciated that each beer had an explanation of the type it was as well. The bartenders were very gracious and even offered samples of beer too. Both beers that I had were completely delicious and the amount I got exceeded my expectations. I believe they were 16 ounces a piece. Our friends also kept telling us about how delicious the food was. My husband and I each got one of the Sammy's (sandwiches). They did not disappoint! I highly recommend the Matador!! For dessert we tried their homemade pop tart which that night was a bananas foster type. So incredibly delicious, it reminded me of a toaster strudel but gourmet. It was quite a busy night and we did have to sit outside, and it was quite warm that night. Hoping to sit inside next time. Will definitely be back to this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. So many beers to choose from!
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My husband enjoyed an IPA pictured on the left, and I enjoyed the Anvil, an Amber ale on the right.

T8aXk4OaZbEME5W1rKQi4A.text: We visited here in the afternoon before heading to a friend's wedding later that day.  It was exactly what we were looking for, and it gives me hope for the Phoenix area.  The downtown area is a huge contrast to the urban sprawl of the rest of the Phoenix metro area.  We didn't have any food on this visit, but it looked really good.  The beer list was impressive, a good variation in type of beer and brewery location.  I tried the Dragoon 3 Goons Belgian Tripel, The Petrus Aged Red sour ale, and the Founders Porter. They had good music and a lot of seating, including a great outdoor patio.

YZAzNu_L3756zxGe2zlw7A.text: Great beer list, but its a little pricey.  Some of the pints can run $8-$9.

QKfPHb4bFXJY_M75RcgTew.text: Beer selection is is really kick-@$$, 3 stars is for mediocre service and long waits. But the beer selection and knowledgeable staff make it worthwhile.

S1iYDoe13o9sW376vSEFvg.text: Placed a phone order for take out that was incorrect on pick up, also they have no clear place for pick up so you have to hover awkwardly at the end of the bar dodging staff as they come in and out. Which is frustrating when you are waiting for your order to be corrected.  If it weren't for that I'd give them 5 starts, one of the best burgers I have ever had albeit I got the outlaw and they forgot the onions and bbq sauce. Their dressings and ketchup all taste like they are made in house, and their side salads are generous and fries well seasoned. Had everything been as ordered, I would have been blown away!

L_g5uwYLh_TvAELEvy7ZSA.text: This place looked strange from the outside but the food and atmosphere were great. The service could have been a bit better, but in their defense, the place was packed.

sTw7KqRXTpttBBKIzFnmew.text: Listen up people. Try this place.   Two words: Burgers and Beer.  What else could you possibly ask for?  They have an almighty chalkboard with their rotating beer menu on it and it is legit.  The outlaw burger is always my go to. (Add avocado...you're welcome.)  They also have super bomb pizza as well as sandwiches and "the mess". (Poutine)  If you are looking to crack open some cold ones with the boys or have a GNO with some craft beer and junk food involved, Angels is the SPOT.  BB's Rating: BURGER + BEER = IN THE CLEAR

Oy7k0QQ94O73LjQnUOtz_g.text: I'm very disappointed with the service. Small blonde hostess had a face that something piss her off! We sat next to entrance and every time someone came in she was not smiling just blank stare. Our server was also such a disappointment she look like she can careless if we got helped or not. The only reason I give this place two stars is because the guy with long blonde hair was super nice and attentive and I think he was the busser. So sad this place has the worst service it has a lot of potential to be great!

KBty200BVpqDIhkO0NwirQ.text: First time here, and called to notify the owners that we had a large group coming on a Sat for a birthday party. The owners greeted us upon arrival and saved a spot for us, let us bring a cake, and accommodated about 25-30 of our guests on a busy night.   Lots of local beers on tap, great food options, and Micah, our server, did an awesome job. He was on it, attentive, and all our guests commented on how great the server was.  Only gripes, parking is a bit tricky, as is any spot in downtown, or along that central corridor. The seating where we were, back, right, next to the windows were a bit hot. It was humid and we were in the sun. But other than that, we had an awesome time. We will definitely be back to try more beers.  Ask for Micah, he rocks!!

PT7cKlGFt2pjhir0Jfo7RQ.text: A few of us stopped in late fit a few beers. The bartender was great. If I lived here I wood be here a lot.

Sri4l8v9ifxS5rkdJ2WblA.text: Wine on tap... All California.  Can I get an AZ option?  Beer selection on fleek.  Big guppy tacos- beyond delicious!  Nice crispy hot fish with a spicy Slaw served on the side.    Saturday night at 10:30pm we sat at the bar and enjoyed the casual ambience. A tad noisy but appropriate for the time & setting.  Walking distance from the Nash & across the street from Film Bar.

w-ZiwWzJfNOU4IPZc-JfiA.text: Come thirsty y'all.  Tons of draft beer to choose from and if beer ain't your thing they have a handful of wine on tap as well.  But flights of beer is their signature order.   Unfortunately the 10" pizza we had was bland but you're coming here for beer which will not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flatbread during happy hour.
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My contribution to the wall of draft beer.  A very cool place to drink and be merry, expect to wait to be seated.

qxDoXQ8Spf1UvWPwWVMaDA.text: Great place with a wonderful dog-friendly patio. The food is well done and creative. Love the homemade pop tart.

Y3hR6_WvX1JjZewc0Y-iPg.text: Love the varieties of beers and the way they run it with rotations each night as they run out of things, new things replace it. Food is always good but a little pricey.

jwTkA_M5CZDTcrEaGWQnAQ.text: It was good.  Totally packed on a Saturday nite.  Very attentive service, beers we had were OK but not super.  Right across the street from the theater - good sequence to have a beer here first.

7KW2BmyNgiaxAjf-Qu2_6w.text: A buddy brought me here last night after going to an escape room event. It was my first time, and I was impressed with the overall vibe. While very busy, it still felt open so you really don't notice it being crowded.  The bar area is tiled in white, which gives it a clean, modern feel. And with 25+ taps most anyone could find a draft they would enjoy. The board also listed wines they have available and the selection appeared to be broad.  The special of the night was a Hawaiian TV dinner which came on a partitioned black tray similar to old style TV dinners. It was a pulled pork sandwich with grilled pineapple and an island inspired BBQ sauce. Sides include a salad with citrus vinaigrette, island style macaroni salad, coconut rice, and a banana cake with cream cheese frosting. All items were excellent.  There was a nice siEd outdoor patio area with abundant misters, but given it was over 110, we opted for inside.  It is worth noting parking is tight, so you might need to park elsewhere and walk in the evening, so an accordingly. Still, this place seems worth the extra effort.  I'll definitely be going back!

IccknMmZ_iB2SeEawdXAEg.text: Tuesday's are Tv Dinner Nights @angels_trumpet_ale_house  Just 8 dollars and you get a redesign of what you thought was a TV dinner in a box, but a TV dinner on a plate!! They put on a different plate every week of the month every Tuesday after 6pm get it fast before it runs out of the night! This right here is a Catfish Po'boy , sweet potato waffle fries w/ Cajun spices. Dirty red beans & rice, fresh shucked corn & basil salad, and the best I thought was the lemon goey bar for dessert! Definitely will come back with the cool downtown Phoenix atmosphere, chill ambience.  #downtownphx #phxeats #azfoodie #foodie #instafood

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tuesday&#39;s TV dinner special, different every week

SEtjkyCbEQ3GJ9kvGNhSDg.text: Just visited for the 1st time. Naked wings are the bomb ! Best in town ! Service was good. A few times the server walked by without looking, but acceptable. I will return.  A++++++

gH0Y6z2shaInuIZKlZ6OFg.text: Not only does this place have a fantastic beer selection but their lunch and food is super solid.  Had the 810 turkey sandwich it was fantastic great flavor fries were fried perfectly and love the house make ketchup, definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3Zv6tWdqGcIYgQ7__eAmsQ.text: It's one of the most casual beer places with pretty decent food. Their wings are on point, and the flatbreads are usually my go to. Burgers won't disappoint you either. The only drawback is the long line on weekends but you can just grab a pint while you're queuing.

o0Ux161GvGri0dq1CE6MKw.text: Not family friendly as there are no menus for kids however it is a house of brews and more suited for young adults and a classy laid back crowd. I enjoyed there big guppy tacos but wasn't blown away it was okay not something memorable. My mom and husband ordered the burritos they said they were good. The food was fresh and although they had a small food selection I would come back again. I wish I would have ordered a hamburger and tasted there beer selection although that will be for another adventure overall pretty alright place not at the top of my list but yeah I would go here again... without the kids.

-OGetgqQOTJ9rfl4ozaPMQ.text: Always a great time when I visit here. The variety of beer for the beer snobs, like me, is a welcomed sight. The outdoor seating is comfortable and plentiful.

gDU1PbKnNaQ-NDMJ8FAWTg.text: I liked this place! The service was great which is most appreciated. The place was quite packed, but since it's open seating/seat yourself it was difficult to find a spot to accommodate a 9 top. Several of the employees helped us gather a table. They have an extensive beer list on the chalk board, so although it was a little tough to read through them all and choose, it was exciting to try some new brews! Food items were simple favorites with a unique twist; fish tacos were delicious and everyone else seemed to like their picks too! Seems like they have some fun special happy hours so I'll definitely be back. Again, service was awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The beers are in white, and where it&#39;s from in blue
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The beers are in white, and where it&#39;s from in blue
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The beers are in white, and where it&#39;s from in blue

81Y5dEcoA1NvqqUI1Ty8BQ.text: Headed out on date night with friends and decided to try This place for dinner based on the pictures on Yelp. Anytime my husband can get a good burger and good beer he is happy. They have a super small parking lot so you will most likely need to park on the street. We were kind of early so there was plenty of parking around when we arrived but it had filled up by the time we left.  There is a huge board behind the bar that lists all of the beers available. While we were there they erased and replaces at least two that I saw so if you see something you want order it! We tried a flight of beers so we could sample multiple. They have a good variety.  My husband had the Outlaw Burger and enjoyed it. I had the BBQ grilled cheese which was very tasty. The fries were also really good. My friend had the Fun-guy flatbread which was also very good.  Even though we were on the full side we decided to split some desert. We ordered the Blueberry pop tart and the salted chocolate chip cookie with ice cream. The pop tart was amazing! Definitely a must order. The cookie was too sweet for me but the guys loved it.  Overall great experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blueberry Pop Tarts
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salted Chocolate Chip Cookie
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. OutLaw Burger

aFbbu39W6mPHX_UaEUOq7A.text: Angels Trumpet has a wide variety of beers -- I suggest getting a flight when you come here. Their food is pretty good and the environment is very relaxed. Staff is typically helpful with drink selections and will let you sample!   When I went here I felt like the service was fairly slow for there not being a lot of people in there. I used to go here often in college when I went to ASU. Service was typically the same and kept me away at times. If you're looking for a night of trying some beers and having good bar eats, I suggest checking this downtown spot out!

bCeiuXjr2LcJPFPQKDPwsw.text: Great beer on tap selections and a cool Outside area when it's fall would be great to go and sit and relax. We had the mess which is basically a poutine! (Fries, gravy and mozza cheese) it was good not the best but good. Has a nice atmosphere, will definitely go back. I love that you can get a beer can to go, they will fill it up with any beer on tap and then they will seal it up to take home.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Get any beer on tap and have it sealed in a can to Take home.
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The mess

KuFJ527avHRaq1FWNNAI2A.text: I've been to Angels Trumpet a few times before heading out to different events downtown. I love the laid back atmosphere and the giant chalk wall beer menu. I usually get some kind of IPA (recently a 20 year old college kid told me IPAs are for "old people.") so I'm still processing that. Anyways! I regained enough pride to order one anyway. The poutine fries and sliders were to die for! The egg on the fries added the perfect salt/savory taste with the curds, gravy, and fries.  For dessert we ordered the famous homemade pop tarts! They really did melt in your mouth and were warm, soft, and the middle was expertly made jelly.   I've only sat out side here but the service I've received has been consistently good with each server providing great menu recommendations. The decor inside is trendy and they have ample bar space. I'll definitely keep coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sliders
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Poutine fries

efX4vK23SD8ZOww1jcSlKg.text: We have good meals today at the Angel's Trumpet! The service was just okay, I felt like both of our servers were out of the loop. They didn't seem very confident in the beer offerings. Maybe they were recently hired, I'm not sure.  The parking is very limited, most people would probably have to pay for street parking. The area seemed very safe and the architecture was mid-century modern and seemed nicely kept! The bathrooms could probably use a cleaning but I've seen worse!  I enjoyed the Brewlee Burger! It was nice and cooked to medium rare perfectly. We shared both the pretzels and hummus appetizers with family and while good they weren't amazing - I'd definitely try other things.  All in all it was a good place to try! We all walked away happy!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

U-4cQCHPJaiOvAsmBTB1Mg.text: My wife's favorites on Nitro... Cali Creamin' and Rubaeus... love this place! Watch the kegs rotate and enjoy the growing downtown vibe. Just wish they had Mac n Cheese

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rubaeus Beer... On Nitro

YX7xOvzCD0Tua5rqM8dN-Q.text: Well, I just found my favorite brewery. Get the imperial red. That's all I have to say. The appetizers go very well with the beer and I love that there are so many other has that are close by in downtown Phoenix so you can just bar hop! We got the poutine fries. Bro a huge fan of gravy but these were delicious and compliments the beer well.  They have a wide variety of selection to choose from. I have to come back for the homemade pop tarts everyone raves about.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Imperial red is my fav

OE1C3lH4spoY3hL_JXUOAA.text: Every time I visit Phoenix, I make a trip to Angels Trumpet. They always have an amazing beer selection, and their food is great too. I got the wings this time, and a flight of assorted craft beers. A nice place to visit with friends, with a nice ambience.

ZWcAB6cC0L3MKWprrl5Gfw.text: Great place for food and beer  Burgers are big and the Tuesday TV dinners are cool  Fantastic beer selection, rotating taps, always some great selections. Wine looks good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

h3029ON3Ydxbnc6eApjR1g.text: Yea ok- No. One of those places where you will better want it their way.  Well we (party of 6) did not like your home made ketchup (sweet potato and carrot)? No one liked your version of any of the dishes. Normally when a restaurant has a very small and limited menu, they knock it out of the park, your servings were just weird. When your menu states "cooked to order", maybe you should do that. No one in our group would not only reorder their selection,  everyone agreed that they would not come back.  The service was good and the restaurant has a great look.

9nY6d7B53XQKDW2dmxdUvg.text: Was headed to a concert on a Tuesday night in Phoenix and my friends and I wanted to grab some dinner before the show and I have been wanting to try Angels Trumpet for the Tuesday night tv dinner, so this was a win win for me!  The Tuesday night tv dinner for that night was beer battered chicken strips with creamy siracha sauce with zucchini fries, green salad, potato salad and smores for a bangin price of 9 bucks! You really cant beat that!  We were sitting out in the patio area and I was checking out the beer board and decided to go with the #25 (?) the peach tree shaker, this was a solid good choice! It was a great tasting beer!  I've been here before and knew I couldn't leave without getting one of their homemade poptarts! The poptart for the night was a tart cherry with dark chocolate drizzle, it was the perfect end to a delish meal!   If you are in the area, you really should give Angels Trumpet Ale House a try, they have a great selection of beers and selection of food!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

AdOkBour27RJuW7LBwzo3g.text: I've been here three times now, both for an early dinner and late night for drinks. Each time I've had a good, consistent experience. The vast, rotating drink menu is fun, but also dangerous (so sample new ones before committing). The food is pretty good with some unique options -- try the gravy fries on the appetizer menu!  Service is so-so. No one seems especially happy to be there, but they're not rude, so there's that.

JjhvVDfjG3hp6anncQL0CA.text: The food is great with a lot of choices, nice vibe and setting. They also have 31 taps for beer!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

fx_56IzRkl0tO_DyTA095g.text: Started off with the wings (half buffalo/ half bbq) which were fried perfectly and the sauces were delicious and kept the wings crisp. I got the Brewlee burger which I got with the mess (their version of poutine). It was really tasty and made for a really satisfying meal! I love the space as well and am looking forward to checking out their new Arcadia location!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. the wings
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The mess
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

JqFxjQDBBEFyelcgnYhRzA.text: Always a great beer experience! Mix match find your flavor! Staff is great and food is fresh! Good look!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ntgnAlkKWE4RZo1qF0ZV6g.text: This place has a GREAT beer selection!! They rotate them and have great pours on their flights. I really love the outdoor patio at this place and its dog friendly :) I haven't tried a lot of the food but I've honestly heard mixed reviews from friends. HOWEVER, they do homemade pop tarts...yes homemade pop tarts!! They are incredible and I highly suggest ordering if with your beer this spot is one of our favs!
