vsxVN-S4SZP5XSGJDuYTtA.text: The food was really, really good-very interesting selection. Great beer menu, too. I had the "Big Guppy" fish tacos-delicious!! Can't wait to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big Guppy fish tacos
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar menu

vjLIlYUel4aHgPWVd-Ekmw.text: Their house made poptarts make this restaurant very special. I've tried their apple flavor, chocolate flavor, and lemon lavender flavor. Their flavors change monthly so it's always exciting to go and see what flavor is available.  Their food is very good also, especially their quesadillas.

etV57YbEf4pJvZ4XPL_5fg.text: I had heard a great deal about this place and was not let down by the food and beer, but the service was TERRIBLE!! I had the matador with a nice pint of El Tecnico. Both were amazing.  But our server; Amberly, not so much. Not even remotely attentive to our needs. At one point,  I had to even ask another server to bring us water refills, with which I was rewarded with a full glass of water and a glare.   I will return again, but hope we have a different server.

XsdBcDx5fZ9DPpCyxofOEw.text: Oh my, the beer wall is amazing. There's something for everyone, including wine on draft.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

LII96SysPQdcSv2tPfcPrw.text: I literally cannot say enough good things about this place. I take all my friends here from out of town, my boyfriend and I go at least every other week and we are never disappointed.   Everything I've ordered off the menu has been good. Specifically the sweet potato taquitos are amazing and such a good option since we are vegetarian. I also really love their BBQ pizza flatbread and their sweet chili sauce pizza flatbread.   Not to mention their beer is also awesome, they have so many to choose from and my boyfriend share a flight so we can try a bunch of different ones.   There are a lot of things I haven't tried off their menu that I'm assuming are also just as good. You definitely need to check this place out!

7MGMYIf0Ov9rXxUJU56YdQ.text: Amazing food! Great service and great beer! It's such a fun atmosphere and popular with the locals. They even have a lawn to play corn hole!

bcuay_GeAOyZGXg-d8ofEQ.text: Two Stars for Meh service! A group of 12 people came after work and the server was annoyed that we had so many people. She had an attitude and messed up my beer order 3 different times. I didn't complain the first time. But I did the second and she was visibly irritated. She didn't really care much about our business. I have been here twice and it really is just a Meh. I do like that it is dog friendly :)

tKx7k8rN0e9aY1h27f0-vQ.text: I love Angels Trumpet.   Really great space, cool vibe.   Awesome beer selection, and amazing food. The only complaint would be how loud it gets inside, sound just bounces around in that place, but what can you do?  Everything else is so great and I always have such a great time when I am here that after diving in to my beer flight I hardly even notice.

5cyrPlMD06549KL8afMUhw.text: Certainly one of the tastiest burgers I have ever had was here. Unfortunately I cannot recall the name but it had bacon and an egg on it so you certainly can't go wrong.   They have a pretty great selection of beer available which they change daily however, they do not have a formalized beer list but rather provide a chalk board style selection of everything which is a personal pet peeve of mine but... its ok. I would suggest sitting at the bar or a close table if you plan to read it.   ** Updated to 5 stars. Have had amazing experiences since my first review and highly highly recommend their t.v. dinner night on Tuesdays. So good!!!!

Uj96StJ6z7Bur73AVM3P_A.text: What a great stop....loved the spud tacos! Had a delicious guppy with all the sides!!! And a tractor pizza!! Loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A tasty tractor flatbread!!!
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My side salad...
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My tacos with pesto...

9S6wwxVBhJKcPhf2GUTtMA.text: Great, Great, Great. Did I mention Great? What a cool spot, I'm sure to be a regular. It's located right across the street from Filmbar on 2nd st and Just South of Roosevelt. I LOVE the huge selection of beers. I did the sampler, which cost a measly $9 and allowed me to try 6 beers (around 4 oz each). 3 of the beers were great, 3 I hated, but that's the bonus in getting a flight! I also had a sausage sampler with housemade chorizo, some germain sausage and wild boar sausage. All of it was awesome. it was served with housemade ketchup, a fwe mustards, grilled onions and some potatoes. I can't wait to go back and get the same plate. Awesome ambiance, I was suprised how bright and airy the interior was.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tractor Flatbread-Bacon, Eggs, braised brussel sprouts, smoked mozzarella and tomato cream sauce...get it...now

p7q395w3e9ws-R96rZXpKw.text: I would give three stars for service and consistency; but bumped it to four because the beer and food are so darn good. If you come, bring your patience and a good attitude. You never know if you'll have to battle a crowd competing for wait staff - or if you'll be blown away by a super knowledgeable, attentive server. Either way, get over it because the atmosphere is awesome - a relaxing, indoor/outdoor, beer lovers haven. As to food, leave judgment at the door and give the spam sliders a chance. I know: Those who grew up on spam are no more anxious to relive childhood trauma. And those who've managed to avoid this long would wonder why start now. Just do it. At least once. It's a novelty done well and a fun food adventure. We also love the flatbreads and TV Tray Tuesday dinners. A great character place to hang out with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wings- meh tonight.
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spud Taco- surprisingly yum!
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spam Sliders

B9rLNcAaBbz0MNztnnaJ2w.text: Great food! The wings are amazing. Pb and j bacon sandwich was different but had so much flavor thanks to the bacon. The burger was perfectly cooked, juicy, a little kick of spicy with an egg over easy.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

gmo29XSBrhPatjaXPE9-1w.text: I liked the restaurant environment. The beer selection was really good. I thought the food was just ok. I wouldn't do back to eat but I would go back if I wanted to nice, fun place to enjoy some beers with friends.

yXXs3viA84Z80cLloghFJQ.text: Home run with service, food flavor, price and ambiance. This is my second visit and both times I have had a fantastic experience! I had a peanut butter and jelly sandwich that was great! Everyone else at my table enjoy their food immensely.

yTqbaDigT5jeDnzs9g9UjA.text: Great destination for craft beer aficionados or anybody wanting to try new brews. To compliment ~30 of  the finest (and rarest) handles around, the kitchen is putting out great food. Great patio and good service as well. You can't go wrong.

OpSIEs9OWS4PNn0yfZCF_A.text: I remember being very excited when they were putting this place in a few years ago. I've been a few times over the years, and am not a fan.  The food is decent and the beer is plentiful, but the place has no personalty, or if it does it's a bad one. The huge patio is boring and kind of ugly. Service is so so. There are so many interesting and unique places downtown,  but this is not one of them. I'd be content to never go back. Still waiting for an actual local brewery to show up downtown.

n8JD5D_nm1znqAIeuDDd4A.text: Great food and service! Although, it is a bit loud inside, they have a great atmosphere.

TASunqcxwrSL2lsQoA3M8w.text: Definitely a solid selection of beer, loved the rotating board of choices! Everything we tried was delicious.   Brewlee and Outlaw burgers delivered with sweet and savory flavors but both were rarer than they should have been. Would want to come back and try TV dinner night with some friends.

apVHMUJZR3jObWJgPXljhw.text: Went on a Sunday after a game.Big beer selection and nice looking menu. I was surprised  and disappointed that our sever didn't seem to know anything about the beers. I was seated in a place where I really couldn't read the chalkboard beer list. The food was pretty good, but maybe have a printed beer menu with some descriptions.

RFRggYLKWDtW5aoArvepIA.text: Second time in and I'm still going back.  The atmosphere is beer centric with great food compliments to set off a solid meal. There's a back patio with cornhole and plenty of seating so you can enjoy killer Phoenician weather this time of year. The selection of beers will keep you going for quite some time, my friend had a flight and although there wasn't much guidance of the random beers we knew nothing about its will fun to try and learn and ask questions from their lively bar crew.  It's places like these that are really helping develop the Phoenix food and drink scene.

5R2yW28hKAUuBpgE-OPHJg.text: Ridiculous selection of beers. Parking is limited but ample street parking nearby. Angels Trumpet has a patio with mist sprayers for hot summer nights.

1jbycJPVycKqMOFAk36ycQ.text: This was my first time I had been here and I had heard nothing but great things. In my own opinion, the food was just OK, nothing special and the beers were plentiful, but only a good option if you already know a lot about beers. If you don't it can be over whelming. Our server was not helpful in selecting.   Overall, fun place to go with your beer savvy friends!

cXmom9Z1eViSsQ5Tl7OI0w.text: Great crowd, excellent beer selection, Tuesday night is TV dinner night, was a nice meal and had all the major food families! Will definitely come back here in the future! Sat at the bar, nice people behind the bar, guys next to me from Minneapolis and Portland OR, both beer aficionados, learned a few new things about the beer I'm drinking.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Taps galore
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Mike Hess Grim Ave session IPA
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Angels Trumpet looking away from the great bar!

OascRsf7lalrKrDz_nSMSQ.text: I've been to Angels Trumpet House a couple of times and I'm a big fan.  I am already a brewery junkie so this review could be biased.  Angels Trumpet is located in the heart of downtown Phoenix and it's a great alternative eating and drinking option for the area.    I love the ambiance and decor.  It's very hipster, natural in a really good way.  The outdoor patio is amazing and just laid back wooden tables which are perfect for enjoying a delicious brew.  The beer selection is extensive.  They have 20+ unique offerings on tap at any given time.  They are unusual but high quality beers that you won't see at your typical brewery or bar.  I'm an avid craft beer drinker and all of the beer choices are always new to me.  They are written on a chalk board which makes it a little difficult to see from your table.  I suppose that's my biggest complaint.  Having something at your table would help better chose your beer of choice.  The beer is also a little more pricey than other places.  Probably about $1 more than your typical brewery but the alcohol content is higher, so I like to think it evens out.  Now let's talk about the food...  YUM!  there are definitely hits and misses on the menu so just listen and plan accordingly -  Grilled Cheese - if you're a fan, don't think, just get it!!  It's so good and one of the best in the city.  Get it with the bacon jam and you won't be sorry.  A delicious blend of tomato, pesto, cheese and bacon jam on crusty bread.   Flatbread - good choice and good for sharing!  If they have a daily special one, go for that.    Fish Tacos - was a daily special one night and really good!  One of my favorites in town so far  Service is great too!  Everyone is friendly and very helpful with the beer selection!    Tip - visit during Happy Hour time if your life allows it - much better deals on the beer

H5yvPY3wFUqPAt8DSoJeiQ.text: We stopped by after a movie at the Film bar for a few drinks.  Sat on the patio with the misters going.  Good service and the wings were great.

LuQG5WiXH8JiKtOt_12UMg.text: Met up with my friend and her mom for some day time drinking. Was not disappointed with this place. Great beer selection and the poutine dish was perfect. Will absolutely be returning

Q0oH75NNS_Hi5mHJ1sAt2w.text: Amazing food. The pop tarts are pretty much the most delicious thing in existence. It's a weird week if I haven't come here at least once, and it's always consistently wonderful.

B5wYreTs6QRwFmr6j2mVVQ.text: Amazing pre-movie dinner for party of two. Started with a flight off their large selection of brews and proceeded to share a steak sandwich and a hot mess. Both great choices and large portions perfect for sharing. Always a ++ with the pet friendly patios!

G324xs3LrFKvZj0CBVrm-A.text: Great beer selection and has an awesome patio!  Dog friendly for all the animal lovers. Good food and friendly service. Definitely going to become a regular.

NeIWZVIhiUj5QNQOR474xA.text: Great place to get some awesome beers. I always have fun picking out the flight combination of the night. I realized that I'm a "save the best for last" kinda guy! The food is really good too. But I wouldn't bank on getting in for dinner during peak times...I probably wouldn't even want to with how busy it gets.

f5n2YGuSdanHRrXHYGKhlw.text: Headed here on a 'red basket Thursday' with some friends...WOW! This little gem is tucked away and when you find it, you won't regret it! The variety of beers is amazing, truly something for every palate. We got two flights and tasted a dozen different fantastic ales, stouts, blondes, IPAs, you name it. This day's red basket special was a brisket chili dog - delicious! Then we found The Mess (poutine) on the menu... *drool* They do it right, with delicious seasoned fries, real cheese curds, and thick turkey gravy. Everything we tried was stupendous, I recommend this spot for all!

J55Ev9ec3yq4xxxNoxGroA.text: The rotating beer selection, location and buffalo (?) bacon dog are great (whatever, I always get the same food). The patio is pretty nice on cooler days. The noise level inside makes me go a little cross-eyed, though the interior decorating is my style. Average all that subjective ish together and it calculates to 3.5 stars. Oh wait, I can't pick 3.5? Fine, I'll round up to 4 because that's the rule in maths.

yi-7OXyKgHioIAd_IgMIQw.text: What a great place!  Awesome beer selection, food and atmosphere. Downtown Phoenix has a much needed gem of a draft house. I will be back as much as i can.

jT6Z2pf12NYk276AGBB1SA.text: Our second time at Angels and we will be back for a 3rd! Came here after a Dbacks game on a Sunday afternoon. They have $6 pitchers for local beers!!! Awesome! We had a pitcher of Mother Roads black IPA (best black IPA I've ever had) and a pitcher of 4 Peaks Raj IPA. Can't beat that deal. Each pitcher is about 2 glasses so made it $3 a glass. We will make this place a usual stop after Sunday games.

FY82WhY0C4wtRIcaERyXsQ.text: I Absolutely love this place and all the selections. Only problem in my case majority of the time is the cider selection is slim.  95% of the times we have been here the females as our waitresses have been awesome with service.  As far as the one male my friend and I had during a Sunday lunch hour was so slow and unhelpful and seemed to not care too much about our table.  The Fries are so good with their buffalo wing sauce.  Their Churchill Grilled cheese is absolutely my new favorite as well. My boyfriend loves the 810 with a fried egg and the chicken legs.  I cant wait to try more on the menu.

eemtGM-NbRvI8IK9ZQX2rQ.text: Wonderfull joint. Kinda reminded me of a library walking up but inside far from it. Cool bar with huge beer selection. Nice themes for food on different days. Got the brulee burger with fried egg and sugar baked into the bun. Spectacular taste. Now that was a unique burger. Big, tasty, and sweet with arugula, onions and bacon. Definitely get that again. Huge portion. Had to share with the wife. Nice patio that allows dogs. Really enjoyed this place.

RwM110XKLnFgVXgqgTC8lA.text: This place rocks.  Great location, plenty of parking available, awesome service.  LOTS of beer options and wine on tap.  The staff is educated on the huge beer selection, and very friendly.  I don't think I've ever waited longer than 10 minutes for my food.  Tuesday night TV dinner is awesome, creative, and the quality is good.

LJu5UkadOY-JRd6AOnzhuA.text: What a gem!  The food was great and the beer selection was magnificent.  The staff was highly educated on beer their beer selections.  Atmosphere was great and there is some good people watching.  It's a must do if you haven't been there and it's kid friendly.

m3Lutzp2cUD5FYZyuxZXjw.text: Maybe I'm getting too old, but I hate the set up if this place... Concrete with concrete and more concrete makes for a head-splitting experience in a place that could be so perfect for a first date or a night out with old friends. I love that they have so many dark beers on the rotation and delicious pretzels and salads. I'd return, but only when there isn't a rush. I generally like to hear the people I sit with. I'd give the place an additional star (1.5?) if the bar staff even pretended to care I was there.

3KQRkvk7MfpE-VJA3t7t-Q.text: Great beer and good food had gaucho tacos liked them but not loved, pretzels were ok and nuttie flatbread was a very good dessert!

hdsVQgVzX_z5NNwhnRrtgA.text: The beer selection is great and the food is delicious.  I had the best grilled cheese sandwich that I have ever had.  The ambiance is great all around with a great patio area, if you have little kiddos.

SF75PtfkAPqQFRUUiGOLLw.text: Stopped in for a beer.  Just awesome selection and superb service.  Would definitely recommend for foodies, beer snobs, and folks looking for a cool place downtown.  Check it out!!!

qzJrYRp1syMuy8gPiU9zMQ.text: I like the new kid on the block. Delicious drafts and wine on tap. Great service, nice location, and homemade freaking poptarts. I've gotten entrees and sides, wine and smiles. I am quite satisfied with this place. That is why it has earned my five.

IEJOlplizHYsC8-m0wlYIg.text: Love this place when I'm in the mood for a craft beer flight and some great food. I've had the poutine which is delicious, and I most recently had a burger and asked for the poutine gravy on the side for my fries. It was also tater tot night, so my friend and I had those for an appetizer. The tots were good but nothing to rave about, but they came with three dipping sauces, which was nice. There is great seating outside, but I prefer to sit at the bar so I can fully view the beer offerings as they often change one or two taps during a two hour visit! This is a downtown staple for me.

go0R1dq6jqqADUbmbbDoSQ.text: My roomie chose Angels as her jumping off point on her birthday weekend. They have a pretty awesome beer selection! I had a couple Belgian beers, which were both very good. Too bad I can't remember their names... Blame the cocktails I had at subsequent bar stops. ;)  I digress.... They write the beer selection on a GIANT chalkboard behind the bar and it is ever-changing as the beers run out and new ones are tapped. Most of our group ordered food and everything looked really tasty.  I tried a friend's sweet potato tacos; sounds unique and they are! Deep fried tacos full of sweet potato and mild spices; tasty!  Bf ordered a meat flatbread... This thing was larger than expected and a great deal for $10. He picked the meat off a piece for me to try and it was quite yummy. The sauce is a roasted tomato and gave the flatbread a great layer of flavor.  They also have a great big back patio... It was a little too warm for our group to sit out there, but over the next month I imagine it will be a really great place to chill with friends and enjoy some brew.  =)  Hope to return soon!

grxOHvthktxwVoJz9KK9Fg.text: Awesome beer bar if you love beer. Great service and great environment. Food isn't too bad either.

LaEDdW7SYdCozhzUN1jzOA.text: Every time I come here this place blows my mind! The beer and ale selection is fantastic and challenging. I feel like a better, more educated beer drinker when I leave. The food is F'n amazing. Pardon my French. The flatbread pizza, pretzels, spam sliders and burgers are amazing and the menu is constantly evolving. I live out of state but whenever I'm in Phoenix, I'm here. Cheers mate!

Ef1TNuTxPyruyOu9ELW8uw.text: Went on this past Wednesday evening for the first time. They have a small private lot but it was full when I got there at 4pm. There's plenty of street parking around, both paid and free, so you might have to walk a few yards. The beer menu is a giant chalkboard on one wall. They are numbered for easy ordering and seemed a pretty varied selection. I tried the Moa Breakfast from Moa Brewing, New Zealand and a strawberry blonde from The Brewery in Pine, Arizona. Both were good and very fresh tasting. My dad tried three different IPAs and a couple samples of various beers; he liked them all. I'm do not like IPAs at all but they have plenty of hops-free selections. I was a little sad at their lack of ciders - I was hoping for find a place when at least one new cider on tap but they only had one - Woodchuck - which is good but hardly difficult to find (you can buy a 6-pack of their many varieties at most grocery stores).  I also got the Churchill Grilled Cheese and their "home made" "Pop Tarts". The grilled cheese is mozzarella and fontina cheese, honey, house pesto, and I added bacon for an additional $1. The tarts were more akin to "toaster strudels" and were really good - the flavour of the day/week was grape.   The only major problem (which has been mentioned in a few reviews) are the acoustics. When we first arrived, it wasn't bad because it wasn't that busy but by 6pm, it was full and I had to just about yell across our small table to be able to talk to my dad. Not really a place for conversation.   5 beers, 2 meals, and dessert all came to $70 with a nice tip. A little pricier than I like to go for a dinner but alcohol will easily add up. Nevertheless, I would definitely come back for the selection and the food. Definitely a place to try out when looking for a small, local eatery downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Home-made grape pop tarts
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Moa Breakfast and an IPA
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Strawberry blonde from That Brewery

2bXTqWGw68_dHfHeFWgSXg.text: Super impressed by their super quick service. Got our food within fifteen minutes of arrival. Love the beer selection, food is really good but not unforgettable.  Will definitely be back.

QK6FV1UyRSNEdeSHntMptA.text: Great place for happy hour or a weekend funday. The wings are totally awesome, highly recommended. They have an excellent selection of beers too. Great location and close to a lot of other downtown establishments.

2eO97AleirwmN-naZAbNwA.text: A great beer selection, with knowledgeable servers.  The food is a bit strange, but not bad at all.  I have been here now 4 times and will happily be going again.  I'm always in the hunt for places that serve beers I've never had, which is rare, and I always manage to find a few here!

VBpGh3FS-qQTCbVFncs6NA.text: 6 flights of the sampler brew is the best way to go and try numerous kinds. Pork Animal burger is the best burger I've had. Definitely will be coming back.

XTTtu03kO3Y5c1eu417z4A.text: Began the evening with a flight of ipa's.   The selection was outstanding and the bartender patiently answered questions about each brew.   They break the norm of craft brew houses I've been to by not saying "everything is totally like amazing" 10-20 times.  They asked what we liked and matched our food preferences with good beer choices.

Vw9HqwsToCAQqXr59Qnokg.text: Angels Trumpet is a really cool place to grab a microbrew, and the food is good too!  They have a great selection of beers on tap and they always have new stuff to try.   The staff is very knowledgeable makes good recommendations on the fly.  Grab some friends, sit on the back patio, enjoy the view, and try a new brew.

mOKDz5hxjs9BCdPrm_P1Uw.text: Great beer selection, great ambiance, a great place for a downtown hangout

liieJS6tOEoOg-_MBzfKMA.text: Definitely stop in for TV dinner on Tuesday nights; as though the ever-changing draft list wasn't enough. Their wild game sausage is also tremendous.

PpxxlWyLTZDYSI2nkKqsYw.text: First time we went, it was five star experience. Great food, great service, awesome beer list, strawberry pop tart... We went back this weekend and it was pretty much the opposite experience. Service was terrible - she never offered me a beer after our flight and I couldn't ever catch her, we didn't care for any of the beers and the "special" burrito I tried was gross and missing half of the ingredients - too bad nobody came back to check or I would have sent it back... This place is always packed, you're gonna wait - check out tap hunter first and make sure you like what beers are on the menu. Its a cool place, we just won't be back anytime soon. Oh and if you can't see from a distance, bring your glasses/binoculars, the beer list is only on the wall.

2o0QL1XQMJw_pDG49xLLOg.text: Always fun to explore the beer selection at this place. They change it often. the place has a trendy vibe. being close to downtown, on most evening finding parking can be a challenge. Food is creative and presentation is fun. I am big fan of the grilled cheese sandwich.

yw05nmJmXyDLu_4eXFJvAA.text: Business did not consider party within "ale house" standards. Did not and will not compensate them for disrespect.

sXxf0k7Y9aQthCT-z6BQYQ.text: This was our second visit there and I'm glad we went back.  The first time we went there they were serving brunch and I believe they no longer do that.  Which I am glad to see - they brunch dishes weren't that great.  This time we were there about the same time - between 12 noon and 12:30 - on a Sunday and not busy at all.  We had a great server who was easily able to recommend one of the 20+ ales on tap.  I had the Nitro Milk Stout and I cannot remember what he had, but it was similar to a Newcastle Ale which is what he wanted.  We both had one of the flatbread pizzas (Garden and Meat) - very good and enough for a second meal.  We also shared the "pop tart" dessert - very good and highly recommend.    This place had a lot of locals because of all the bicycles coming in and a very interesting menu - we are definitely planning to return when we go to the symphony.  This past visit was ate there prior to going to FilmBar - i.e., this brew pub has a pretty good location.....  3/3/13

JsbnV4UfkU5so6R6ONoJYg.text: The food is decent, the beer list is fun, and the bartenders are knowledgeable. However, I've never encountered a more rude or unwelcoming wait staff. I won't be returning here unless obligated, because of the horrible service.

VlZfuGiMXdGMiXr8KkFe2w.text: Might have been great if the server ever brought us our drinks. Waited 25 min, said something, waited 5 more, and bailed. Not even crowded on a Sunday night.

7p0HLxCgNdHlscjqS3H6UA.text: Had a great experience here. As a dog lover I am first of all in love with the decor which is photos of dogs which are up for adoption and their stories. In addition they allow dogs on their patio which is so nice. The staff is great. They have a very wide selection of beers on tap and you can get a flight of any 6 they have which is also great. The food is super yummy and the desserts are also great the dessert pizza and home made pop tarts are well worth the trip.

kSxCIxwfXVy_WifwzUzeoA.text: I checked out Angels Trumpet Ale house at the tail end of First Friday, on Feb. 6. The space is airy and trendy. I loved the patio with all the lights strung up in the air; it made for very a nice ambiance. I tried their Tripel and it was excellent. It had a sweet finish and a beautiful gold color. It was served with just the right amount of head and it was less bitter than most Tripels I have tasted. I will definitely be back to try one of the flights I saw everyone ordering.

B7OjwKYS0Am-oqpIBl8xog.text: Great foods and superb craft beer selection. Definitely a stop if you are into beer tasting. Oh and they some really good crafts that you normally don't see a places like this.

n29NGyL4zXaRiL-FYFzjFQ.text: A favorite downtown bar for me!   Location: This is on 2nd street and a bit hard to find if you don't know. The sign faces south. There is street or metered parking nearby. I am able to walk!  Food:  This is more than just bar food. I have had some of the salads, the hummus, pretzels, peanut butter sandwich, and the homemade poptart.  Everything has been tasty! The pizzas are excellent!  The pretzels are probably one of my favorites. They come with mustard and cheese.  I have also had the fries with gravy (not a fan).   Drink: Multiple local / regional beers are featured, and the cider on tap changes daily.  I absolutely love the ginger cider and the cherry cider. One can order flights of beers of their choice.   Service: For a busy bar, the service is quite good.  I have been at least seven times in the last year, and every single time, the server is checking up on us numerous times. The servers are friendly and helpful also.   Ambiance: There are TVs near the bar, and there's an outside patio area for when it's nice out. They have some games out there, like corn hole ( I hate that name!)   This place can get packed on Thursday and Friday evenings and weekends too.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salad
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Avocado salad
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salted flat bread. Peanut butter, honey, choco chips, marshmallow fluff + pretzels. Yummy!!  This is a half order!

m7MHB4fMnhI2HaLseiV3PQ.text: Road tripping across the states & ended up in Phoenix last night. After some research online we found Angels Trumpet and originally went to try their Tuesday special of a TV night dinner.   Sadly, they were out of the TV night dinner as I guess it's a pretty popular thing in Phoenix.   Instead, I went for the grilled cheese & dad went for the special quesadilla of the day. I am a major fan of a grilled cheese, and I definitely wasn't disappointed. I had jalapenos added to mine, which definitely gave it a kick, but I love a bit of spice so it was perfect! Dad's quesadilla was incredible too and we would definitely recommend the food to anyone thinking of going to eat there.   Alongside this, they had a beer flight of 6 tastings for $9 and trust me, their portions are generous. I went for all IPAs, because I'm obsessed and dad went for a different array of drinks.   Anyway, all in all, definitely a must visit if you're ever in Phoenix :)

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beer flights
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Grilled Cheese - heavenly.

MNDlrjIElaHcICSzHd40Sw.text: Great restaurant/bar! Right across the streets from Cobra Arcade. The bartender recommended it and I am glad we have it a try, my brother had fish tacos and I got a BBQ grilled cheese sandwich, both were delicious! They had a lot of different unusual beers in tap with a cool glowing wall describing each one! Got in and seated pretty quick and the best part was the food came out very quick. Our sever Lauren was very nice

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BBQ grilled cheese and Fish Tacos
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The current beer board was way cool

ZjnfGYgNHFnjQR_ZSHen4Q.text: I can see how this place can be popular but they really skip over some details. The pizza was under cooked but the fish tacos were bomb, the beer was amazing but the bathroom was out of soap. Had my Pizza been cooked properly and the bathroom been stocked with soap I easily could've given this place five stars but those are two critical criteria's I judge a place on. So, if you're looking for a bar with pretty good food and yard games...bring your hand sanitizer and you won't be disappointed.

WSDfx1RuOTFaG-cn8Ws2MQ.text: We stopped in for lunch after visiting the Phoenix Open Air market and it was delicious!!! I had the fish tacos and oh my goodness the coleslaw was so good and the fish was so crispy! They came with an amazing pico and gauc - give them a try!!! My friends both had grilled cheese with fries and they devoured them. Of course they have 31 different beers on tap as well as a few wines on tap, you'll find something you love!!! Eat here and drink here you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish tacos
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fun logo

gGabUkIdxuuYdoBqJf52FA.text: It was date night with the bf and I've been wanting to try this place out.   I didn't know what to anticipate and it was not what I expected at all. It was about a 30 minute wait for a table on a Friday night that we went. I ordered the Spam sliders and some Nitro chocolate beer that they had on tap. The sliders were good but very messy. I didn't like my beer since it was too thick for me and tasted a bit bitter.   I was a bit disappointed in this place. First, it wasn't hard to find, however they have a tiny parking lot so you will most likely have to look for street parking. I think that it's great that they have over 31 beers on tap, however they have this huge chalk board that they just write everything on. There's no menu with their beers on there. I already have bad vision so I would have to get up and go up there every time I wanted to look at their menu.  If you sit in the inside it's extremely loud. I couldn't hear anything my boyfriend was saying. Their website doesn't even have their food menu or anything on there so I can't really even describe my meal or explain to you what my boyfriend ordered.   The service was really good. However, I probably wouldn't come for dinner. I'd probably come for maybe a drink on their patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spam sliders

WLVGchlKxE4Qf9vpGyvLsQ.text: Normally I go here on Tuesday for the special they run with the TV dinner. This time I went on a Thursday for something different. The food, as always, was amazing. Get a flight of beer, having to choose from 30 craft beer is hard and the flight lets you try lots at once. The service is always friendly and fast.  Love this place and you will

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This was one of the best meals I have ever had.

tGK44yQcWA67bPy3OcuuNQ.text: So glad I finally got to stop into this place before a concert! Wow I am impressed.  Great beer selection. Loved the ambiance. Their food was excellent,  had the taquitos  as an app and tacos as dinner. Yum! Definitely recommend. Located near  Cobra Arcade which is another cool spot to check out afterwards. Can't wait to go back again!

Rra7AiQi8V8fCblNFejZiA.text: After seeing a review on PBS's "Check Please, Arizona" months ago, we finally made it down to Phoenix to try the Angels Trumpet Ale House. We chose Tuesday to take advantage of TV Dinner Night and it was uniquely presented and tasty. A great deal for the price. We also would recommend the Fish Tacos.  The inside was loud and vibrant. Everyone appeared to be having fun, but we will sit outside next time if the weather permits.  4 out of 6 glasses of the Beer Flight were really good, but they need to describe their sour beers as sour on their big chalk board. Instead of beers with a hint of fruit, it tasted like a liquid Sour Warhead Candy.   The parking lot is small so bring quarters or plastic for the parking meters on the street.  If you find yourself thereby one afternoon, it is definitely worth the stop.

iFoJefeHYTw4ywaVro2nrw.text: Great atmosphere, beer selection and the food options seem insanely good. I eyed about four or five different dishes that I wanted to order which is rare for me when I go out.   I ended up getting a grilled chicken sandwich that came with BBQ sauce, cheese, bacon and onion straws. Everything tasted great and the portions were generous. The french fries were killer! They serve the food with their own homemade ketchup which is something I hadn't experienced at a restaurant before.  They offer a beer flight which is always a must if the place offers it. Another plus, their beer selection is constantly rotating. While we were sitting there, they had at least four beers change from their menu.   I'll definitely be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. BBQ brisket grilled cheese. Lots of brisket, not a lot of cheese. Very good tho!

ehBv0rZDstFzNMgkmzpmRw.text: Honestly, we were trying to go to Phoenix Market cafe but they were closed for a private event. We found out about this place and it was the greatest blessing. This place was quite quaint and even though we got appetizers, it was so filling. So filling to the point that we weren't able to eat the dinner we had planned with other coworkers. Churro Raspberry pop tart was everything! The cauliflower pizza was delish. Who would have thought that the taquito sweet potato's would have tasted so amazing with those two sauces on the side. I should have taken pictures!!

y2sQ83Yf1C8hd5_tJDOahA.text: 5 stars for the beer.  3 stars for the food.   One of the best beers I've had in the valley. Food on the other hand is just okay in my opinion. Won't be begging to go back for dinner but would like to come by for a happy hour to get some good brews.

K-omCihOhhgkMD5Qn9HDRA.text: Was very underwhelmed by the food. Gravy was very different on the poutine, a gelatin consistency and I felt as if the slaw did not pair well with spam on the sliders.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

H416HywTdmsXDLDKhBP1mg.text: Good bar food with a great selection of beers to choose from.  Nice large patio and great for large party's.

NPahOeZMEX17FSEaG1RKVg.text: I've been here several times and I can now safely say that this place is just not my jam.   It's super loud. The food is just so-so. They don't take reservations. They don't seem to have a way to shield the sun from blinding us inside the restaurant during the early evening. Every time I've selected beers for a flight, I only end up kind of liking one. I swear, I like beer. I do! So finding a new brew shouldn't be this rough.   I do like their fish tacos. Quite a bit actually. Same for the giant angel mural by Breeze and Lalo. So there's that.

CMtj2LjKkngXZn3yqbAaPA.text: Ate here as a visitor in town and loved it. Excellent menu and draft wines available. Fun atmosphere and walking distance from the convention center. Great for groups!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

kCTYfKQsi1UmfeESD8GICg.text: I love gastropubs. I'm a sucker for  fancy bar food. And Angels Trumpet serves just that.  Usually, when I visit states and cities, that's the search word I use on Yelp "gastropub"  I chanced upon Angels and further review of their patron photos and menu, I realized they had poutine -- and it looked legitimate too! Fries, gravy and most importantly, cheese curds.   We were staying in downtown and had no inkling Angels was for the most part, on campus, a hangout for college students, nearly 2 miles away.  We already felt old-ish complaining about the seemingly endless walk, well, after stepping inside, in the company of all the hipster kids,  we felt even more ancient haha.   The menu was interesting, though wasn't unusual for gastropub fare. We ordered a variety of things: chicken wings, poutine, a burger which had onion strings (forgot the name) and the churchill grilled cheese.  I won't go into detail into each entree because they were all just OK. The item I enjoyed the least, surprisingly, was the churchill.  And of course, as expected for many hipster spots, NO regular ketchup. Well don't worry that didn't affect my review.    I really, I mean really enjoyed the poutine.  It reminded me of my days on Montreal when I ate it literally, thrice a day.   If I ever returned to Arizona, I would come back for the poutine.  Much more accessible than Montreal.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Not a fan of the churchill
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burnt wangz

d0A4uXbpK1iXvq-zQXP2WQ.text: Holy crap, that was good.  Had dinner here last night after a super fun time across the street playing video games, and we left duly impressed.    I had the seasonal Summer Salad with assorted greens, candied pepitas, feta, mango, strawberries, red onions and side of grilled chicken (extra), and my better half had the smoky beef tacos with a side of refried beans and freshly made chicharrones, which he sweetly split with me.  Our food was fantastic, our server was friendly and efficient and the price was fair.  We will be back...soon.

ARXv1koNyNGqbIVTbe2mCQ.text: I absolutely love the beer here and most of their menu items. My favorite is the San Tan Sex Panther and their selection of ciders.That said the customer service could have been better.  I will return though.

opNuJUnjICj0Q5AHA00XqQ.text: I've been here two times since I've lived in Phoenix. And both times I really enjoyed it. I love the craft options. I love the food too.   I recommend trying the wings and the Hefeweizen. I like the salad too. They have a snack that's on an ice cream bar. I don't know what it's called but get it. Split it with someone though. It's a little too much sweetness for one person.

-1mbgUFAqeZa-bZKP3CjKg.text: This IS not a place to run to for happy hour.  You've got a 10" pizza with two choices for $8, three beers only!?$! For $5 and draft wine for a $1 less.  Lame    But the normal times/prices  rock!!  beer prices are right on -great. Currently drinking a great coffee brown by the shop - Az. Yum $6 -22 ounces.   Screw happy hour- come here simply for the good food and beer prices.   We are gonna be new regulars   4 stars minus one for questionable happy hour  Our waiter Dakota was pretty cool to have for our first time. I love employees who give genuine service.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast burger $12.50
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Coffee brown beer Arizona local - the shop
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Small avocado salad

kEOGoYyb1EWVx9YlH6_wzw.text: My family and I bravely ventured out in the heat to First Friday in July so we needed a good spot to eat and a place to take refuge from the blazing sun for a while. I have had Angels Trumpet Ale House bookmarked for a long time now and my yelp app told me the restaurant was within walking distance so we decided to give it a try!   I was pleasantly surprised that they were able to get us a table right away and the service was pretty quick. We were with our 3 year old and I was delighted that they have a kid's menus with several options. My daughter opted for the chicken nuggets and they provided a huge plate filled with fried chicken bits and french fries. She liked the fries more than the chicken.   We decided to split the chicken wings because all of the reviews raved about them. They were giant, crispy, and they came served with several dipping sauces. I didn't love the sauces and to me, the wings could have been a bit more seasoned. We were wavering between the pretzel and riblets but since fried riblets are more unique, we decided to go with them. Again, very generous portion, came with two dipping sauces and fried onions.   On the blackboard I saw they were offering a house made lavender lemon pop tart, so even though we were already pretty full, we had to give it a try. Two warm, giant pop tarts were delivered to our table. The flavor of the lavender and lemon were faint and most of what I tasted was the fried dough from the exterior of the pop tart. I am not sure I would order it again but it was fun to try something with such a unique combination of flavors.  I can definitely see the appeal of this spot. The vibe is definitely chill, hipster, and fits right in with downtown Phoenix's culture. It is geared more towards adults so I really appreciated them being so family-friendly and accommodating.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. House made pop tart - lemon lavender
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Riblets

hfP3voB3Vmm6C51KaHyhLw.text: Been here few times and the food is consistently good. Sliders were flavorful, we love it. It's my favorite among all my orders. Poutine is also deliciously warm and yummy, brewlee burger tastes good as always. I love being in this place, good food and good service.

4F1m7Rs1BLenp6jLG2oICQ.text: Stopped by this location on a Saturday after some volunteer work .. place was busy but not packed .. sign at the door tells you to grab menus and find a table.. the waitress was at the table in no time.  We shared the pretzel tower with kicken mustard, angel wings are crunchy on the outside and moist on the inside .. the dipping sauces were good but the dry rub on these is delicious.. chips and salsa were basic they come with salsa & a bean dip   They have an extensive drinks menu on the wall .. including beer, gluten free beer, mead and cider  I had the 810 sandwich .. the artificial smoke made it hard to eat.. it was overwhelming .. The bread was good but it very quickly soaked up the smell of the smoke .. the bf agreed it was bad  He had the brewlee burger with the fried egg, he enjoyed every bite of the burger .. fries on the side were good dipped in that mustard from the pretzels   We shared the homemade strawberry pop tarts, served warm with vanilla ice cream. This is a must .. one serving comes with two pop tarts .. the chunky strawberry filling is delicious and this item the perfect ending a meal  We had great service.. waitress was on top of it .. drinks full, dishes cleared, checked on us often..   We sat inside plenty of seating, there is also a cute patio out back with additional seating

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pop tarts
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 810 turkey sandwich .. too much artificial smoke

b6T5XwEL03C5iK3oPUM7Lw.text: We hadn't been to Angel's Trumpet in a while, so we decided to try it again.  I remembered the beer list to be more varied than it was.  It seemed to be a mix from AZ, CA, CO and a few others sprinkled in.  There was not a ton of variation in breweries, and there were a lot of beers from "big beer" companies.  Not really my style.  We ordered an order of  va-va verde soft tacos and a farm flatbread.   The slaw that came with the tacos was very bland an seemed to be out of a bag.  The beans on the side were cold.  The tacos were bland and left a lot to be desired.  The flatbread had a good amount of toppings and cheese (although I couldn't taste or see goat cheese anywhere on it) and the tomato sauce was very bland.  Overall it was a very underwhelming experience.

KrFFI1pG-M4phHO_mBRGLQ.text: I must say I had an EXCELLENT experience here while visiting Phoenix.  I was attending a conference and needed a place with drinks and decent food options to take my team of 20+ people to for a relaxing night out mid-conference.  I checked the website and didn't see a way to make a reservation so I called and was told to send in a email through the contact us on the site and that the managers didn't take reservations normally but often will approve one if you ask.  I got a quick answer and was able to book a table for 15-20 people outside -- which was perfect because the weather was still nice and the reservation was for 6pm.   When we arrived we had a very long table set up for us on the patio under the shade with several strategically placed trays pointing out some suggested appetizers.  We were all able to order $10 flights of 6 beers or our favorite single and I asked for water for the whole table to keep my non-desert dwellers hydrated.  Several servers delivered all our drinks and the water quickly.  For my flight I didn't know what I wanted and asked for heffeweisse, fruity and light and was given a great selection.    For the food, many of us ordered 'the mess' which is poutine as an appetizer and being from "nearly Canada", NY we all thought it was very well done, authentic, and tasty.  Some people tried it and then ordered it as their entree in fact.  The sausages plate was amazing as well.  For dinner I ordered one of the amazing fried chicken sandwiches.  I loved that it was an option for various sandwiches to do: fried chicken, grilled chicken, burger, or veggie burger.  What an excellent idea.  My fried chicken sandwich was delicious and this southern girl was pleased.  Everyone enjoyed their food and drinks and the service was A+.  We were treated so well.  For 21 people with drinks, some appetizers, and meals it was only $620 including the 18% gratuity.  Excellent food, drinks, and service for a great price.  I'd definitely return!  I will mention that the bathrooms are non-gendered inside and I think there are 3.  First time I've seen a MAN waiting to use a toilet, made me smile.  Bathrooms were clean and spacious.  Inside of the business was nice as well, full of people enjoying the food and drink.  Lots of patio seating room to be had as well.  And beautiful murals on the building outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Central chicken sandwich with side salad and flight of beers.

TCGkMVK419USIoh5eK_dog.text: Love the atmosphere ... very relaxed even though it was pretty busy for a Thursday.  Beer was great! Tons of on draft choices and a super smooth stout.  The mess was good ... but needed more gravy.  There were a lot of leftover dry fries.  We stay in this area often and will be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awesome dark stout ... ask for the mess with extra gravy! Fresh fries were awesome!
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Many many beer options! ... draft wine too!

O0cCCzjXD2B0tbxkT_4Rww.text: Came here after one night in Phoenix. The vibe is similar to a hipster laid back bar with plenty of beer on tap. I always love that judgmental free area where everyone can relax. The turkey quesadilla appetizer was a must try since I never heard of a turkey in a  quesadilla. Fries were homemade cut and tasty. They had homemade ketchup that has a little bit of sweet and spicy element. My fish tacos were amazing with the side items added to it. I was stuffed after everything. I wanted the homemade pop tarts but didn't have it in me. Also great service on the Sunday evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Outside Mural
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Turkey Quesadilla...An appetizer with some kick
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big Guppy with AMAZING side guacamole

eOXyLuSSpz5mARyn48RlYg.text: Everything about this place is fucking awesome The food is unique and made to perfection The beer is full of different flavors and cheeky names. And the service was top notch Great chil atmosphere Come check this place out

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. We got the matador burger The Riblets and The chicken adobo pizza Fucking FIRE

MT5qJbXno1B1NiBo61Jk2w.text: In the mood for a tasty chicken sandwich and a flight of beer in downtown Phoenix?! Look no further! My husband and I each enjoyed the Central chicken sandwich (so refreshing with the veggies piled on top) and a flight of light, amber, and dark beers. A flight is only $10! Great place to hang out with family and/or friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A flight of beer
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Central sandwich with fries

WFyRvV5uWgmEro4OxreM1w.text: Very cool atmosphere and a huge selection of beer (30+). You're greeted by a sign that tells you to grab whatever menus you want (food, specials, and flight) and find a table.  I ordered the Big Guppy (fish tacos) and my copilot ordered the Matador. Both dishes were very tasty and filling. The two fish tacos are large and filled with 2 pieces of fish each.  The beer list is very impressive and it is full of great beer from all over. The service was friendly and attentive but it was pretty empty around 2pm on a weekday. The prices are a little high but the quality is matched. The happy hour only includes 3 different beers and the one my copilot ordered was only a $1 off, which brought it to $5. I ordered an Epjc Brewing beer that was $10.  Overall, an awesome atmosphere with a great beer list. Definitely recommend trying this place out.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Big Guppy (bottom) and Matador (top)

G-Sp1_QohClJdzUNNEAh5w.text: I ordered the Big Guppy which came with two fish tacos topped with roasted corn relish and a secret sauce. On the side was: a spicy coleslaw, pico de gallo, refried beans, and an avocado crema. Everything was absolutely delicious!  The atmosphere is very relaxed and this is reflective in the interior design and service. So you'll have to be a little aggressive if you need some help, are ready to order, etc.  The music was nice, they played 80's (Cure, Smiths) and 70's music (Queen).  Food is a bit pricy, but it's worth trying at least once.  They also boast 30+ drafts (beer, cider, wine, and more).

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. They were featured in Phoenix Magazine this month. So they have 37 drafts apparently.
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Big Guppy, 2 fish tacos with some lovely sides - delicious!

_cHbTpIIWqYbHIlIwc1KOA.text: Popped in late Friday night for a beer and to try their current homemade pop tart. I always appreciate Angel's expansive beer options and their creativity when it comes to not just their dishes, but desserts even. This was their Lemon & Lavender Pop Tart which oozed out a delicious, warm creamy yellow filling that lended such a pleasant texture and temperature contrast to the side of ice cream. Definitely a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lemon &amp; Lavender Pop Tart

SXeKt12hnnn7E2n06I8wQQ.text: Great energetic crew of servers & bartenders.  We also loved the sausage tray with hot mustard and vegetable appetizer with hummus.  Incredible selection of ales and nice variety of vino.  Big 6 top tables inside & Beautiful outdoor space including gravel pit for outdoor BBQ and corn-hole.  Great visit!!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

MlyrvH1gY8wQhqFifSn4ZQ.text: So I want to start with this being my second time at Angels but my first time at this location.  There were several fails of the night that is the cause of this rating.    To make a reservation you can only do so online.  There is no direct link online to reserve.  I had to call and someone told me they had no idea how to reserve but there was a contact email I would send asking for a reservation.  Finally I was able to reserve table for a farewell party for a party of 20-25 people.   Got there early to set up.  Hostess put us in the wrong location (private room).  Then she realized we were not in the right room as there was another party waiting.  Our original reserved tables were given to several other parties.  She had to make the people move so we had tables.  The tables were tall tables with stool, even though they knew I had an 8 month old baby.  Tables were bolted to the floor and seperated... defeated the purpose of a gathering.  They were letting gueat from a birthday party next to us sit at one of reserved tables because that party was in overflow.   Tables were so dirty, covered in filth.  I saw them wipe them down but I dont think there was any soap on the rag.  My baby wipe, without scrubbing, took off quite a bit of dirt.   We had to asked several times for silverware, napkins & plates. They never cleaned off the empty plates and cups so we piled them on the table next to us.  The waitress was slow to bring food, take orders and never cleared the table.  We had to provide direction on where to place the apps.  Come on, they are apps for the table to share, put them anywhere.  Also, the waitress had no idea we had a cake in the fridge.  We had to ask for it and it took her 15min before she came back and asked us what it looked like. 10 min after that, she brought the cake.    Now to the food...fried were really greasy.   Bland sandwiches.  Only thing tasty was the pizza and hummus. My group did give compliments to the drinks.

OsXA3Uxpr3O_utanHDvlXg.text: The wife and I stopped in for an after dinner beer before heading home. This is our favorite spot to grab a drink in downtown Phoenix. We have eaten here previously, but we just had a drink this go around. Both their food and beer are great...can't go wrong with anything on the menu.   I was excited to see there is another location of Angel's Trumpet that opened up near 44th Street and Thomas. We'll be checking out that location as well. I highly recommend heading on over to Angels Trumpet for food and beer, you won't regret it! Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Draft Beer Menu Board at time of visit

6QOWXWUMUo_RU0pqvilONw.text: When I bit into my "matador" sandwich I could definitely hear the angels trumpeting so I knew how this place got their name. This was the perfect sandwich as it was roasted top round, peppers, onions, mushrooms and a horseradish Havarti on a pretzel bun. Why are pretzel buns so good?! This was definitely a great alternative to getting a burger. You get a choice of fries, cole slaw or a side salad and I got the side salad. The ranch dressing that it came with the side salad was so good that I ended up dipping my sandwich in the extra dressing, yum! The beer I got was not as memorable but they have a large chalkboard display behind the bar with lots of interesting choices.   They have a "seat yourself" philosophy, which was fine but we did wait just a little while for a server to come over and take our drink order. Our server was pretty attentive after that, though.   They have a really nice covered patio area which unfortunately no one took advantage of the day I was here since it happened to overcast and rainy (weird for Phoenix, right?) The interior was nice though, with the wooden tabletops and chairs and the open layout.   Overall, a great spot so I can see why the Yelp reviews reflect this! Definitely one of my favorite meals I ate while visiting Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The matador with a side salad

6KdkBu3WT52tGwMiPlpjug.text: I've been here twice- once for dinner on the patio and cranberry cider (yum!) their beer selection is quite extensive...there is something for every body! I had a chicken sandwich and fries...it was delicious! You'd think that with an extensive bar, the food might suffer..but that is not the case! Lots of people outside...really fun atmosphere!  We returned last night to just have a few drinks and hang out at the bar. The bartender was extremely friendly and attentive. I had a glass of Sauvignon Blanc that they have on tap, and it was delicious! My hubby got a beer and thought it was good as well!  A fun quirk about this place is they self- can to-go growlers is you want one of their selections to take home!

Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Take a can of your choice to-go!
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Just a snap of some of the beers they offer!

jd8FIHNS5C5GLD9PZvmzEw.text: Yes, burgers and beer, beautiful modern rustic place with patio! The selection of beer is superb.  Service is great! I would recommend this place for any occasion!  Casual environment!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My fly!
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The grandma&#39;s!
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bar!

tTVE1GBgE-dE_A1FKb3GPw.text: Wow what a refreshing establishment in downtown Phoenix. Growing up here I never was very fond of going into urban Phoenix because there was not much going on, especially for quality young people.  Angels Trumpet is the sort of place you wouldn't expect to find in Phoenix, Arizona. It feels more like a chic-contemporary atmosphere of a more progressive city, Austin, San Francisco, Seattle...but in the desert!  I enjoyed the diverse (31) options of beer on tap, including the apricot cider. The menu had its roots in pub food but with a very refreshing and eclectic twist. The kitchen and chef clearly care about providing unique and high quality food. I ordered the 810 "sammy" with smoked turkey, bacon, avocado mash, and onions on toasted bread. The taste was phenomenal but there is nothing worse than eating a sandwich with parts without any meat. The corners of my sandwich were unfortunately all bread which was a shame because it had such an amazing smoky smell and taste.  My friend had a gourmet grilled cheese with a unique bacon-jelly, and she loved the taste. Our server Arika was very friendly, professional, and provided a great service  Overall I would like a little more consistency in the quality and presentation of the food, but it is one of the most unique, fun, and quality ale-house/restaurants in all of Phoenix. Definitely worth the visit. I will be going back anytime I am in the neighborhood.

oxpGNtSNCysD6uzIAGlJHw.text: Love this place! Always have great service and their specials constantly change.   They have a massive selection of beer and wine. I always can find something to drink.  Gets a little bit noisy at night.

muIvxfZso7KrtPSqbCTjDw.text: We waited over an hour to get seated with a server that seemed completely annoyed that we were there. It's really sad that the service was so awful and unfriendly because the food was actually very good. I'm not sure I will be back though for some server who's job it is to enhance my dining experience, to roll her eyes and be "annoyed" by me. No thanks!

D8oarXBlFRDhX02GHj0KNA.text: Beer 5 star Food 3 star Service 1 star Atmosphere 1 star  Not as awestruck as I had thought I would be. Food was very hit or miss. Recommend reading the menu very well or you could get someone's attempt at a sweet savory burger that is too far in either direction to blend well.   Do try the wings and the hot pretzel. The Matador was pretty good too, reminded me of a Philly steak sandwich but on a pretzel bun.   My husband had the "Meat Treat" flat bread pizza. It was good but we had to ask the waitress where it was, she returned to tell us "they are remaking your order, it will be up in a few (was not a few) minutes."   I realize it's Friday night, and they were busy, but after our initial seating we had to flag the waitress down for everything and then she would disappear again. Once I flagged her down, she would immediately dart off, and I'd have to say "WAIT.." or she'd take one person's order and leave without asking if anyone else needed anything.  The ketchup that was served with the fries, was pretty awful. That needs to go.   The house pop tart, tastes very much like the Pillsbury dough boy made it. I'd recognize that overly sweet vanilla icing anywhere.

g7WO4v3xvGE7GofqpGcZlg.text: I was looking forward to trying this place after reading a number of the good reviews. I should have read more of the bad ones because unfortunately they better reflect my experience.  The boyfriend and I visited on a Friday night. It was busy so we put our name on the list - no problem. The hostess said it would be about 20 minutes. It was very crowded by the host stand so we went and waited outside, right by the door. 20 minutes came and went and we never saw her come out so we went inside. After a minute or so, the hostess came up to us and said "oh, I couldn't find you guys. I can seat you now." Couldn't find us? We were RIGHT outside the front door. When there are 20 people waiting in the "lobby" wouldn't you think to look outside?   So she takes us to our table but did not bring menus so she said she'd be right back. She never came back. The waitress came up to greet us and we had to ask her for menus. She must not have liked that we asked for menus because she was crabby and short with us the rest of the time we were there. (Actually, I assume it's because we didn't order beer. Or she was just a B.)  Boyfriend ordered the burger and I ordered the grilled cheese with spam. We both got fries. The fries were meh, the ketchup was weird - more like pasta sauce and the sandwiches were pretty meh too. They weren't bad but they weren't great. They were forgettable. Writing about my sandwich now I honestly can't really remember it vey well. Not a good thing.  After we finished it took forever to get our bill and they never cleared our plates even though we were clearly done eating. We ended up just shoving them to the side and left with barely a thank you from our waitress.  Needless to say between the crappy service and the sub-par food we won't be back.

RuZWnmby__hyZvNWpbjYfw.text: Great spot downtown PHX! Great number of drinks on draft.  Fish tacos were super good. Others in my group got the Old Fashioned Burger and the Pork Grilled Cheese. Fantastic food all around. Great location. Staff was friendly.  I will most certainly be back! Great job Angels.

0UTVb0xvHflsr_d8xekQ4g.text: So my 1st time here.  I'd love to say the place is ok but all things human related here bring it down.  Allow me to explain.   So you walk in, awesome! Tons of unique beers on tap, outdoor patio area, sand pit area to play cornhole/bags!! I said to my friend "great call"...then the disappointment began.  1st off...no beer list.  Oh wait...there is..it's on a chalkboard back in the main area and a completely obscured moving chalk board across the patio.  Ummmm WTF? I have great eye sight but I can't see around the fatty, heat lamp and dude with his ass crack hanging out.  Ok, so I guess this is a "get up and look at board" type of service.  Great.  So that's what I did.  No description of beers other than a #, name, type of beer.  Guess this place is for professional beer brewers only.    2nd...service took forever...and it wasn't even that busy.   3rd...food...also took forever for a simple pizza...ahem..they call "flatbread".  I guess i differ on that.    4th...beer...well, I can't complain here...I tried a sampler and they were good. Some real strong ones in their rotation of 27+ beers.  So at least they got that right.    Note to management.  Really that hard every day to sit down and write out what beers are available that day and a little description and then photocopy that 100+ times? Really? Chalkboards? Basically your laziness=causes customers more work...and people don't know really what the hell they are ordering. In other words...not all IPA's are the same. So can ya fill some people in?  If you are a big beer fan and brewer by all means, this is your place.  If not, I'd say seek your libations elsewhere.

M1SnDvU0lrDLBoYhyslTuQ.text: Was there a year ago in the heat and for some reason they had left the doors/walls open! Ugh! But they redeemed themselves on my last visit!  Love that they have wine and beer on draft, their flatbreads are great as are their wing and fries!  A great place to meet friends after work!

JJaLxnQDBR49VSTd54PJqA.text: Had the Caesar salad and the outlaw burger. Honestly. Nothing special about the food. They do have a lot of beer but only a basic wine selections, and very cheap wine at that. It is definitely not a date night spot. It is so loud you can't hear and are kind of force to join the loudness because the only way to have a conversation is yelling. To top it off my glass was cracked. That makes me wonder about the judgment of their staff to think it is ok to serve drinks in broken glasses. I left with a headache from the cheap wine and loud crowd.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yes that is a cracked glass they served my drink in.... changed mind about coming back.. kind of careless

lc9SFP7TiPVXWFFdizu4HA.text: This place can get a little boring, but you know- if I'm in the mood to sit in a lit up beer house and eat man food- all delicious, but everything heavy and meaty. I suppose this place will do.   The beers are great. It's much better to do beer flights though, as the slection is so broad, you always feel like you are missing out... at least I do.  Vegetarian food options suck. Pizza is okay. The burger looks fantastic, if only I ate burgers. I always end up getting a pretzel, I like the beer cheese sauce stuff.   I wish they had some lighter small plate options. The pretzel seems to be the lightest warm option they have.

bwk67nNYl1kzsl5O9wSG_A.text: How does yelp know where I've been? I was brought by a friend because I brew my own beer and LOVE this place. Thank you Rory!

8cMbReO2dBYVyV1QORXF2A.text: Once again this place has made me happy.  I wish they were closer.  The tractor pizza is so amazing.

qUXly8VQkscskPyKxpcRbg.text: Spam!  They have Spam! Yeah that compressed, salty, meat from a can.     Ok, ok...I realized I may be the only one excited about this, ESPECIALLY since they are known for their FABULOUS rotating beer selection, 30+ on tap at any one time.  They also offer some wines on tap as well.  Order up a flight or 2 (6 tasters of  your choosing of any of the listed beers) and expand your beer palate or go for a pint of your favorite. Their menu is quite complementary to their beer offerings.   Ok, now back to the Spam.  Now trust me on this,  when Spam is done right it can be quite tasty.  They do it very well here.  Their Spam Sliders, as a meal if you enjoy Spam as much as I do, or nicely shared.  It is fried to crisp perfection and served on toasted Hawaiian bread  with a Sriracha mayo coleslaw.   My other Spammy favorite is a Sammy, the Churchill Grilled Cheese, you pay a lil extra for the crispy fried Spam goodness (or bacon, you really can't go wrong here) but it goes so well with the melty deliciousness of smoked mozzarella and fontina cheese.    You have to come and check out their Tuesday TV dinner meal.  A TV dinner like compartment tray comes to you filled with yummies that vary every week (Main dish, side or 2, and a dessert). These are not Hungry Man meals  but you won't leave hungry.   Make sure to follow them on Facebook to see what they are serving up that Tuesday and get there early because it has been know to be a sell out option.     I love this place, but, "Why only 4 stars?", you ask.  Well, it gets quite loud in the main restaurant area.  Every sound kind of carries and you spend your time speaking loudly to have a conversation.  So when the weather is good I like the patio mostly because the noise issue does not carry-over to the patio.    Always, check their Facebook for fun and educational events and "classes".  I recently attended a "Cider School" here on a weekend before they opened for business that day.  In attendance were Woodchuck and J.K. Scrumpy brewers/reps.  We tasted 6 types of apples commonly used in cider making. Tasted several ciders, including some that were not even on the market  yet. Oh don't let me forget the food pairing.  The most fun I have had in a long time.  [That event itself was a 10 out of 5 stars, LOVED IT]

nOPgoTlWq6oQIyRJluaOAQ.text: This spot has a cool vibe but what was not cool was the fact that the sprinklers on the outdoor patio were not on continuously.  It was over ninety degrees out and the sprinklers were only on every 15 minutes.  When I asked that they adjust it, they never complied.  You can't offer outdoor seating if you're not going to offer some concessions for the heat.  We live in the desert!   As for the food it was ehh.. I ordered the BBQ burger.  Too many onion straws and the BBQ sauce just wasn't good.  It added no flavor value.. The highlights were the bun and the side salad.

1OBF7BBszAmdMpuyKE1yDg.text: This place is SO good. Found this gem on yelp and I am so happy I did. I couldn't pick between one of their popular burgers and their fish tacos. Ended up picking the tacos and they were GREAT. highly recommend.

Q6QnawSB11lHtA7oPo5lrQ.text: Amazing! Great atmosphere.  Great beer selection.  great food.  Great beer! Wish I lived closer!

Friends got me to try the spam sliders here (first time spam eater) and they did not disappoint. Their pizzas are on point as well. Good ambience. I'll be back.

imZd_lm32-2WWkvAuxjIXw.text: This is a long overdue review from several months ago.  I went with a group of friends for brunch and got a dish with a rotating wild game.  I can't remember the name of it any longer.  The game that day was alligator sausage if I remember correctly, and my table ordered four of them.  One of my friends asked for something to be held out of his.  After some good conversation our food started to arrive.  Strangely, everything but the three unaltered dished with the rotating wild game came.  When our server stopped by he was surprised that they were all missing and went to investigate.  He came back and told us that the printed copy that went to the kitchen was difficult to read and looked like there was only the special request my one friend wanted even though all four were on there.  He rushed the remaining three dishes out, and they were excellent.  When It came time to settle up our tab, our server had the manager take the three delayed meals out.  We didn't ask for that and no one in our group had any kind of complaints about the service.  He got a great tip out of it.  We had a great experience and will definitely be making more trips here.

4PA-p2QieBWWNf-cOIHfvA.text: This place is 3 stars and no more. Reason why..I've been here 3 times now and I will say the environment and people who are customers seem cool but the staff needs a complete overhaul.   It just doesn't click. This place could very much be a great place but the waiters just don't rub me the right way and haven't since the first time I have visited here. At times they aren't attentive and at times aren't kind.   Try this place, and see for yourself.

My husband had tacos and my friend had the bbq brisket grilled cheese. They both enjoy their meals as well. We all had local beer and they were all great!

N0GEQCL_RSbjrObTIBZBzQ.text: Terrible service on Saturday 2/13 although the restaurant wasn't full. The beer was ok, food was ok. But we will not be back. WNIDdlCpQNGjCBsHNOdNPQ.text: Updated Review (5 stars): Been here several times and it's earned 5 stars by now.  We've never had a bad meal here...in fact, the food is always top notch, service is good, environment exactly what we expect.  People we've gone with have mentioned that they like their beer (we still don't drink the stuff).  The Matador is always a staple and the vegetarian taquitos are great (we're not vegetarian).  We've also had the tacos and one of the other burgers.  Old Review (4 stars): This review is coming from people who don't drink beer. But we love the food! Have been here twice, and both times the food has been awesome. Big, quality hamburgers and brisket and the seasoning on the fries is great. Plus, who doesn't love homemade ketchup? We'll be back!

JPqVHGCNCTdifDm4JEZdJw.text: Love love love this place, best pub food downtown bar none. Pizza, burgers, and sandwiches...oh and the beer, could go on and on about this place. Meat treat is my fave pizza, 810 is my fave sandwich, big guppy gives you enough fish to feed two people, and burgers I can't decide!! Love this place and it's my go to spot...

nNTcjyp-jg8voTaEFzcQOw.text: Celebrating two birthdays- the food was delish!  Meat pizza, green chili burro enchilada style and fries chicken  salad were all a amazingly! Definitely coming back

9gZJlNdk1RUzdtROWFdP3Q.text: I went to this place for dinner last night with my boyfriend and had a great experience. We sat at the bar in hopes to get the lunch tray meals that they have every Tuesday. Unfortunately we were too late and missed out. However, this was not a downside because the menu was fantastic.
