PqWew20WBylL3VrpAD4a3A.text: Angel's Trumpet Ale House is the perfect addition to the growing Phoenix beer scene. In fact, I've been waiting (with beer-baited breath) for some time now for this place to open, even following the building process on their Facebook page, because it is a great downtown destination for a quality beer after work. With FilmBar right across the street, this block is possibly morphing into one of the coolest parts of town.  Let's talk about the beer. I like the rotating 31 flavors (or is it 32?). Either way, it's more fun than being a kid at Baskin-Robbins, eyeballing the beer selection as one barrel is emptied and another unusual selection takes its place. Sometimes I think it would be better if they had a standard line-up of six beers or so, as it takes some effort to pick a beer that suits your mood. There's a lot of information to absorb from the giant list including brewery, region, beer name, beer style, etc. and many of the beer styles are fairly exotic. However, it is a great beer adventure...  The food at Angel's Trumpet is some good stuff too. I had to try The Nutter after reading a review of this place in a local paper. Get this: peanut butter, bananas, raspberry-chipotle jam PLUS housemade marshmellow fluff and peppered bacon! This was a fabulous grilled sandwich experience you're not likely to encounter elsewhere. The pizzas and Asian-style wings were also pretty damn tasty, so I think they've got all the right elements any respectable alehouse should have.  My only gripe (yet not enough to give them less than five stars) was that it was not made clear that a 20% gratuity would be added to my bill automatically. We started as a group of four that grew to about eight, and the staff was incredibly accommodating. I ended up tipping 20% (on top of the already-included 20%) for my meal, which made things a little pricier than I had anticipated. I want this place to succeed, so I don't feel too bad about over-tipping, I just think they need to mention the automatic gratuity for parties over a certain size.

RkzMDMiJRp9ZtZToClOgVQ.text: Theres really nothing too say about this wonderful establishment except I love it!  All good food the only I had once was a brunch item, and it just was to earthy to eat if that makes sense.? lol.  I love getting flights and trying all of them.  Sometimes a lil disappointed when they have tons of gose, quads, triples, or sours on tap ( they are all to lite for me, I want a real beer like an Imperial russian stouts.  Sometimes they have no stouts or just one!  No stouts makes me sad.  But always good to try something different you may love it. Good service, in fact I almost got into a physical fight with a crazy man next to me for being rude to the server!  Oh tv dinner nite amazing!!  I'd get there early, as this place gets packed!!! I like coming around 3-4 right before the rush really hits.    Oh and watch out if you park in the asu parking lot, thats where I always park and never pay, maybe they don't monitor on the weekends or late at night because I have NEVER been cited before.  But last time I got cited, a warning, took pics of my license and car blah blah blah.  Good Food, Good Beer, Good Times!!

rUmsTRZDUBUhHe-hpXCV7A.text: Happy hour deals are amazing here.  $7 flatbread pizza are generously portioned.  $4 draft beers can't be wrong either.  Food was excellent

jZ-vpg_UKh5XafZnrG2iTA.text: Love it. Hip indoor-outdoor bar/restaurant in downtown with loads of seating, 31 beers on tap and a good food menu.  The building is huge and its got a great modern feel to it with exposed brick and brushed concrete floors. There are lots of windows, so it feels nice and bright on the inside. There's a huge bar and loads of tables and hightops, but even late afternoon on Saturday this place was packed.  The outdoor area is fun, with Adirondack chairs and Bags, and an awesome view of downtown. And the outdoor patio area is dog-friendly! Next time we'll be bringing the pups!  With 31 beers on tap you're spoiled for choice. And they rotate the beers with some local and national microbrews, so its easy to try something different.   The menu is stocked with, interesting appetizers (spam sliders!), big hearty sandwiches and cheesy flatbread pizzas.   Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spam Burger!

iYy-FKUeOiLg64ZQU8bo5g.text: Found this place online & checked it out for the beer selection.  We were not disappointed, a great craft beer selection with flight options so you can try a few before you commit.  We were pleasantly surprised at how good the food was too.  Tried the fish tacos and a "fun-guy" flatbread.  Both were very tasty.  A warning on the fish tacos, if you don't like cilantro you should avoid them.  I love cilantro so they were great for me, but wife despises cilantro and she couldn't finish them because the cilantro was overwhelming for her.    The only thing that kept it from being 5 stars for me was the noise level.  At times it was hard to hear my wife from across the table.  It wouldn't stop me from coming back, but just know what you are in for.

QhYNp1NuM4jrUfJFKp6l1w.text: Huge beer selection of rare beers, knolwedgebell and freindly staff, a great patio all add up to a good place.  Beers range $5-8 a glass so it is on the pricier end, however most of the beers are higher end micro brews. Our server was well versed in the brews and brewries which is nice when you are spening as much as a lunch on a single beer.   The patio has many tables as does the inside, making it acceptable for larger groups (6-10 people). There is also plenty of spance to stand around and drink.    They do have a full menu of intresting food items but I was just here to enjoy the beer this trip.

42ReAS-ko9MhA-2gs65sig.text: Angel's does a nice job of being a solid beer bar & dinner spot. The food is good, to the point and well made. The menu has a nice variety and pairs well with the beers.   The beers on tap are diverse for all types of beer drinkers. The place is spacious, the staff is knowledgeable and friendly, and the pricing is very reasonable.    Even though the place isnt very comfy and the decor is cold and uninviting, I can still see myself coming here pretty often. The beer selection, food, vibe, and staff are really good.

LCOKm4PvO_MgTVU8AinRjg.text: High quality beer for every palate!  Health choices for food!  I'm a fan.

oaUjo7B5BY0iIuHmELGzGA.text: The house was packed last night. There was a wait list so I told Mat put me down for two.   I gave him my first name and last initial, because this tells Mat we are yelpers and that is a good thing. We head on over to the bar which was packed and in a moment i was acknowledged and ordered two beers off the black board live alerts. I also asked if there was a cask tonight, "next week" the sweet gal replied.  Beer number one: Konig Ludwig Weiss draft poured into a clean shaker glass, this beer is an easy-drinking, satisfying wheat beer with emphasis on predominantly hefeweiss yeast. The flavors are heavy and saturating on the palate, but clean and refreshing. An 84 point beer $6.  Beer number two: Green Flash Trippel poured into a large brandy snifter, hazy orange gold with a tall white head. The beer smells of apples, pears, spices, and malt backbone. The taste is that of a classic trippel. The hops do add some nice balance throughout the beer and the alcohol is well-hidden in the flavor. 83 Points $7.  We walk on to the patio and have a seat while we are waiting for a table to dine. Outside is very comfortable with views the Downtown sky scrapers. There is a quarter moon in conjunction with The Westward Ho tower. It's pretty nice.  Mat comes and finds us happy and chatting away. We walk in and are seated on a two top. I begin asking my neighbors what are you eating. They were super friendly guys and began to show me their food. Drum sticks called Smokin Legs $9 that looked great and a near finished burger$9. Most interesting looking item on the menu was the Bison BLT in a blanket. $8.5. a bison hotdog topped with bacon, seasonal greens, tomato and house made mayo. My gal got herself a Churchhill grilled cheese $8.5 smoked mozzarella and fontina cheese, honey drizzle, seasonal greens and pesto. Side of fries. I ordered more beer.  The house is in need of acoustics. The party was loud but super fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

OLJNHVDWiypMi-EcUCJsOA.text: Rob was the best server we've had in a while anywhere. He's usually the bar keep so I guess we were lucky to get him for a table server. But that's ok I'll just follow him to the bar next time. Rob was pleasent, beer informative & then some. We had the wings which are delightful but if you're not a couple or don't like sharing dipping sauces then ask for extra. The wings were crispy perfection & hot (temp). Just great! We also ordered the warm sausage platter & boy freakin' howdy was it a platter. Definitely either getting one or the other next time but not both. Just a lot of food. We could have easily  shared amoung 4 people. However I'm happy to report 3 beers & an hour later we managed to get all of the meaty goodness down. Thanks Angels Trumpet Ale House for the great service, food & of course BEER! We'll be back.

9TY6mcBmdPR3qyISe_cZdg.text: Love this place and so do my kids. Lots of beers to choose from and try, plus the food is really good. The kids love the free WiFi and pizza.  Any issues that might arise are always addressed and dealt with right away. The staff is always very nice.

NNi6bBEBdUSVSdpOgLFnHQ.text: Fantastic craft beer selection. If you like wings, you won't be disappointed with the "angels wings". Nice safe location downtown.

AliWc8AFgIeZP2-hOH3V9w.text: Beer and spam. Let's goo!  I wanted to go here for a while and happened to walk in with some friends, not knowing the name. I looked at all of the different beers, the cool patio and interesting menu. Finally someone told me where we were and it all came together! This is a very cool spot, fairly unassuming from the outside. Once you're in, they have TONS of craft brews from across the country. Take your out-of-town friends here. Each have a decent alcohol percentage, so watch yourself.  There is a good assortment of interesting items on the menu, including spam! Other dishes are pretty creative and add to the mystique of the place.  I wasn't able to spend much time here but can't wait to go back.

J33HasikVO5bekEnfMt0jw.text: Hip gastropub with a cool vibe. Most of the ipa's were super hoppy so I didn't care for those, but the food and crow made up for it. Mixed crowd from tattoos to polo shirts. I recommend their pizza with egg on it!

-vtytKmFdTocbyRcmo0Txw.text: On a recomendation for a restaurant in a neighborhood I didnt know very well, Angels Trumpet Ale House it was.  Super easy to find and just steps from the nights final destination FILMBAR. Prior to arrival it was Yelped and Googled and this beer centric gastro pub seemed to be the perfect spot to catch up with an old friend prior to a movie.  My beer recomendation was fine as I took my sugestion of the server that offered 3 THREE fruit beers, because I wanted someting lighter. The peach ale was tasty and I cant wait to get back and try some of the other 9000 beer selections, belly up to the bar, and wash those down with the Poutine or as known there as The Mess.  I have heard about this dish that is a late night staple in Canada. heck all  14,000 Canadians cant be wrong. The chefs must hang out in MY kitchen because they used the perfect amount of fragrant black pepper ( my favorite seasoning) near perfect gravy and plenty of deliciouce fried cheese curds on top of expertly cooked fresh skin on fries. This dish was a perfect 9... or 10 or somewere in between that.  I plan to get around that menu but we both ordered the same thing, a turkey sandwich by the numbers. Mine would have been stellar without any chipotle, but the rest of the fine ingredients overshadowed the one overplayed flavor. The turkey was fresh roasted, great avocado and the VERY BEST toasted bread I have had in years. The side of chips were a great option.  The space is really cool, great chairs and heft tables, if not a tad noisy (screeming baby) prices good and this yelper says its a must try when in the Rossevelt Row.

ky_9fjH2thJdSamcUkRo5w.text: I really wanted to like this place, I did. But their food was nothing to write home about.   I started with the pretzel ball appetizer. The pretzels themselves were delicious. However, the "nacho cheese" it came with tasted awful and grainy and the second dipping sauce was horse radish. That's it.   I ordered the old fashioned burger with all the fixings. It just didn't blow me away. I feel like I've had better home made burgers. The fries were over done and I got mostly crumbs.   I'd say the plus side to this place is the beer flights and their beer selection. Can't say I'd be back for the food.

hyYf6nRWDCqHYZUyDW7f7g.text: I just want Angels to know how happy they made me by sitting my party down 10 minutes before kitchen closing and making my poptart demand happen! Excellent customer service. I've heard great things about this place and they were definitely up to par. Desserts are my life and their simple gesture of willingly taking me in at last call to get me what I wanted on a busy Friday night meant a great deal to me. All the staff I encountered were warm, friendly and attentive. I love the vibe and homey feeling of the whole restaurant. I will update next time I come in and try the food. But these stars are well deserved already.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banana cream pie homemade poptarts
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chocolate chip cookie dessert with caramel sauce
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. SPAM SLIDERS! Like everyone else said... EXCELLENT! MUST TRY!!!

jVkAh5tl-CKtM3Hwe_8pCQ.text: Like all new restaurants, this place could stand to have a little more insulation to keep the volume levels below deafening on busier nights. I've come to avoid Angels Trumpet on the weekends just because I know how unbearably loud it's going to be inside. Thankfully, the patio is enormous, well shaded, and nicely laid out. So if there's availability you can find solace outside.  The beer selection is, of course, unbeatable. There's something new every day, so you better not fall head over heels for a certain brew because it won't be there for long. The service has always been impeccable and I've come to really trust each server's recommendations.

_sRwEnBows3rL8Tq0U1PoQ.text: A fun, chill place with a rotating list of beers on tap. Many of the beers they feature are adventurous and unique, and you're not likely to find them on tap at other local bars. Get a sampler flight so you can try a bunch of them!   They have a few wines on tap too, and their food is great!

WMO8xgsru7frL_urUBGqLQ.text: If you're a beer lover, you'll probably love Angels Trumpet Ale House, which has more than 30 beers on tap in downtown Phoenix. The spot also serves up lunch and dinner, with a menu full of sammies, pizzas and hamburgers to be enjoyed in the large communal dining room, at the beer bar or out on the patio.  I love that the bar and eatery is right across the street from FilmBar, which makes it an ideal place to grab a bite and drink before a show. When I last went there, I got a Churchill Grilled Cheese Sammy ($8.50), which I got with fries. It wasn't my favorite grilled cheese (I would leave off the pesto next time), but the portion was so huge I could barely finish half my meal. It was a great value.  My companion got the Tractor pizza ($11), which was one of the most unique pizzas I've ever seen -- it came with Brussel sprouts, bacon, caramelized onion, and even an egg on top.  As for beers, there are giant chalkboards describing each one, and the servers are really knowledgeable and can help guide you toward a good choice.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Churchill Grilled Cheese Sammy
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tractor pizza

k2nKpUvyaO1H5Gt8z9kqmA.text: Outstanding daily beer selection with fantastic food, excellent service, and approachable ambiance.  A go to place every time I'm downtown.  With over 25 beers on tap, you are sure to find whatever brew wets your whistle from pedestrian to bold and food that is far above average to accompany it.  The Angel wings are awesome with 3 different sauces, the smokey brisket on/in anything is amazing, or go lighter with the 810 sandwich.  The staff won't lead you wrong whatever pint and/or plate you choose to bury your face into.

MUcFTNACoXJZ5Utxwkitqg.text: Awesome! Great, always-changing beer list that's on a chalkboard, organized by taste. How cool is that? Good, upscale pub-type food with burgers, pizzas, and my favorite, the grilled cheese sandwich. Amazing atmosphere inside. Very "upscale-hip Phx" is how I would describe it, although I'm not sure exactly what that means. Quick service, although not always the friendliest. Huge patio. Welcomes kids (thank God! Side note: I am a beer lover who enjoys eating, drinking craft brews, and hanging out with my kids! More places like this please!) Downtown location.  I only wish there was something similar in Vegas!

VWd5RL2w5U1EeBgzdQ1gZQ.text: Been here a few times the last year and just leaving as I write this review! This place is great as I usually go here in tandem with Cobra Arcade.This place has a vast beer selection and there is usually something new, so if you are the adventures type this is definitely a spot to check out. The food I would say is okay as it is the typical American dishes with a hipster twist, but with the pretty awesome atmosphere and the selection of drinks it is definitely a must spot to go to if you're around the Roosevelt area. Check it!

q7td0dyEVn40OHE6ZKmzVg.text: Really good food for the price.  I got the casper pizza and hot wings, both were delicious. They have a really beer and wine options. Atmosphere is nice, kinda loud on a busy night. Service was not great,  our server took our order then we never saw him again. We sat at our table for at least 20 min waiting for our check. Still worth going to

dqynkMY5CHFP7U8neYb1cA.text: There's not a lot on the menu for someone who is gluten-free, vegan, or both. I'd recommend getting the fries - yum! - and the spinach/avocado salad that comes with smoked beets.   Oh, and the beer -- great list which includes local and regional craft beers you may not be able to get anywhere else, let alone on tap!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

WyfSfGyFJe37_geh_S9mMA.text: The beer menu at the Angel's Trumpet exerts the sort of fascination over me that the Dairy Queen's 20-30 possible milkshake flavors did when I was a wee urchin and DQ still had goodies like pineapple milkshakes. There are about 30 flavors on the big board at any time, and it includes "weird" varieties like chicory stout (which was splendid), along with all sorts of microbrews. I cannot possibly actually drink enough to fully appreciate what this place has to offer.  If you're there for food, the ideal is to hit the happy medium of "a bit of buzz, a bit of clatter" but stop short of showing up when it's jammed and the servers are starting to look panicky. My first trip hit that medium perfectly (little did I know!) with the result that my Outlaw Burger was Revelatory!Burger, OMG!Burger, SeraphimSingPraises!Burger. It was every juicy, flavorful thing a medium pub burger should be. And in that context, the space is really cool -- it's like a coffeehouse in that there's a sense of community gathering regardless of which specific party you're with.  My second trip was on a swamped day, and my medium burger was well-done. The kitchen's still working with quality ingredients -- the buns are very fine buns -- so even a meh burger is still a pretty good burger and worth the $9. But flights of angels did not actually sing over this burger.  On the up side, the kitchen positively coated the ribbon chips with red and black pepper, and since I love spicy food, that was so far beyond amazing that I considered asking for more, then decided not to push my luck.  Rumor has it that one can ask for take-out and trot the food across the street to FilmBar.

V4QyO-oYdVS6-agCy5Gr8w.text: Saw this place listed in the AZ Republic as one of the ten best new places in 2012 and decided to check it out.  We sat at the bar and had a flight of misc brews.  Thought that was fun. Some we liked, others not so much. There is a great selection and I would like to return.  The atmosphere is upbeat and simple. Loved the keg pendant lighting along a row of tables and the patio. The place was busy on a Wednesday night, most patrons in their 20's/30's. The location is ideal. The menu was eclectic. The recommended Mastadon sandwich was boring although the fries a winner. The bison hot dog was delicious although the accompanying coleslaw a miss.  It was pretty on the plate with craisins and feta but dry in the mouth with no dressing or herbs. Next time we will enjoy a few beers and skip the food.

a7CuEFe0-l9I8BNbmOqjeQ.text: I was here with a group for Smunch on Sunday.  Nice thing about a group is you get to try more than one dish.  All of them were OK.  It seemed liked the biggest hit was a scramble with wild game, that week it was boar.  I had a fish cake Benedict, that week the fish was cod.  It was good. Of interest to note: the fish cake was both the protein and the base.  With a group of 8 you would think the food would come out in a 5-10 minute window.  Actually it was more than a 20 minute window.  The waitress was pretty attentive most of the time but a couple of times we had to flag her down.  Two of us drinking coffee had to ask for a refill.  The beer wall gets it own paragraph.  For good reason.   There are something like 30+ beers on tap plus a few wines on tap.  All of them are listed on the wall with a bit of description and their alcohol content.  Some of them are pretty potent.  You can get a flight of 6 sample glasses for $9, you pick which 6 you want to try by filling out a card, which comes back with the flight so you remember what is in each glass.  I wasn't really impressed with the space.  I liked the look but as many have noted it gets pretty noisy as it fills up.

4nm0RrKrs9AR14MQnxw76w.text: Awesome service- Jake was very personable and knowledgeable. Terrific beer selection. Dynamite Brewlee burger and fries! I highly recommend this cool joint.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Awesome Brewlee burger. Fantastic flavors in a sweet bun!

CAMEYsOdWrpt5cU1yLDiAg.text: Stopped here for lunch while we were walking around downtown Phoenix. It was worth the walk, but I would suggest driving. They have a small lot. We started with the spam sliders! The cranberry slaw threw me off a little but it was surprisingly tasty with it. I added sriracha for a little kick. Delicious! I got the avocado salad for lunch. It was  light in flavor but still filling. I love the combination of the yellow beets, mint, avocado, and grapefruit.  My sister got the big guppy. The guac was creamy with a hint a citrus! Her boyfriend for the original salad with brisket. The brisket was smokey. They had a few beers; all of which they liked. I had the abita rootbeer, made with real cane sugar. Very refreshing and strong in flavor. The price was reasonable and food incredible.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Spam slider! Added sriracha and it was perfect! The rootbeer was yummy.
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Avocado salad with mint, beets, grapefruit, and almonds. Amazing!

c_oCT-SDeRnLwiILTdsPfg.text: First time here the other night, and it will definitely not be the last!    The vibe is cool and I kind of felt that if I were a dude, I would have needed a gnarly beard or fancy mustache.  Tons of beers!!  Huge line of taps with numbers, so you are forced to read the large chalkboard above.  It was a little much for my brain, so I just asked the server to pick a tasty stout or porter for me.    I was pleased to see a decent amount of veg-friendly options (veggie pizza, veggieloaf sandwich, daily special with a veg option, grilled cheese).  I opted for the grilled cheese (I know...I like cheese sometimes, don't hate.) that came with pesto and tomatoes, fries and a side of house-made roasted tomato ketchup.  It was all divine. M'lady had the vegetable pizza, which came topped with lots of seasonal veggies (watermelon radishes, squash, fingerling potatoes, mushrooms, onions, and more).  It was equally as pleasing to the palate.  Our friends ordered the special, fish tacos.  Came with two tacos filled with fish and fried calamari and toppings, rice and beans.  Spicy, but very good and flavorful.  Back to the beers for a moment:  I only ordered the single bevvy, but our friends ordered a flight (any six beers of their choosing) and it came in a cute little muffin pan:)  Kudos all around from the decor to the food!  These folks know what their doing and I like it, I really like it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Avocado salad! So tasty:)
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie pizza
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie pizza

u0EpKLnewAtEwr0Hg_2Tsg.text: Decent spot, good place for drinks. Food is creative but seems to describe an experience larger than what's actually served up. Everything seemed "salty"...from the Caesar salad to the wings and spam sliders.   Selection of beer is definitely better than the food. If you're a gastropub person, definitely top by but don't plan on a memorable eating experience.

c9FYwcRxBSUtulbWAJzxwQ.text: Time to toot this ale house horn at Angels & Trumpets! While the ambiance could turn the music up a notch and open the dining area up, I was still pleased with the overall experience. The Avocado salad hit the nail on my taste bud heads but the homemade pumpkin pop tarts were the cherry on top! I see only bright things in their culinary future. Definitely would love to see some mural/art on the inside!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy customers after eating homemade pumpkin pop tarts!

mno0qx5xxi37we41kQ8rOA.text: A Haiku Review of Angels Trumpet Ale House:  Attention beer nerds: This is your official bar. I'll see you there soon.

cT3vdWhu_Gffwj2qdrTNxw.text: Angel's ketchup is so amazing. I literally go here just to buy Angel's French fries and ketchup!!!! Amazing on top his sells the best burger in Phoenix!

uQq6bCQHPAHkut9TYbnsSw.text: Overall I like this place.  Great and ever changing selection of beer.  Food is pretty awesome. The wait staff are nice, and pretty attentive.  Parking sucks, but that is typical of downtown Phoenix.   Decidedly for the 20-early 30 something crowd.  Does get pretty noisy,  and when busy you can't hear yourself think let alone talk to the person next to you, as a beer hall should.  Sort of hipsterish.    I'd recommend Angel's Trumpet.

Ix6jDRl4lnaHOAfxOQ7mog.text: The burger had a charbroiled taste and it came with this marinara sauce. the French fries were seasoned with sea salt. They also have a great selection of beer but I really couldn't  tell you  how it was.  The restaurant had a environmental friendly outdoor look. They also have bottle coke

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. one of the best burgers I had. nice flame broil taste. French fries were nicely sea salted kinda like the fries from 5guys

kOFg1nFpBEyRnYv3lJfF5A.text: I guess it's about time I got around to writing a review for this place. We eat here almost weekly, and have for the last two-plus years. We have a couple favorite servers but really most of them are good. (There have been some iffy ones in the past, but those seem to be gone.) Because of the service, we walk away almost every week saying how much we love the place.   Beer selection is always interesting. There are usually a couple that appeal to any taste. The flight option is great and you really get a lot of beer for the price. Wednesday's are usually their special event tappings and sometimes you can get a free glass for buying a beer.   We typically go on Tuesdays, which is their TV dinner night. This is the only reason I don't give the place 5 stars. TV dinner has been very hit or miss in the last 6 months or so. We've had some great ones and some terrible ones and some that are just okay. The old chef did a better job at being consistently good. But, if you get a good one, it's a solid amount of food for not much money. I haven't had anything bad off of their regular menu - wings are solid, burgers and sandwiches very good, guppy tacos are fantastic. The desserts are also quite tasty!  Parking can be painful since it's downtown. They have a small lot that is usually full. There are a few un-metered spots but most are metered (most accept cc's now at least).   Oh! Dog friendly patio, and they'll bring water for your pup. Only recommended in nicer weather though as they don't consistently turn the misters on when it's hot.

qKAgmxRtWA8BLR38nlqUGg.text: This is the best bar that I've ever been to.  When they opened, they had one mediocre thing on the menu, but they removed it.  My friends and I have attempted to try everything on the menu and 3 of us have had everything but the salads.  Sorry, I'll go somewhere else for a salad.  I'm here to overeat and drink great beer.  Try:  spam sliders, pop tart dessert, sausage appetizer, and good luck deciding between the fries with their awesome ketchup or the cranberry coleslaw  They do a good job keeping interesting beers on tap.  I dislike that the flight price went from $9 to $15 though, that kinda ticked me off.  You could bring a date here and split a flight or two and be able to talk without chewing the whole time.  BTW We are the glass stackers!  And last time, we finally broke some glasses.  Well, I did.  I broke your glasses.  :(

5jptezOGT8Tv7BewEXcvSQ.text: I love this place. This is always the place I come to whenever I meet up with friends that are from out of town. Their wide selection of beer is great, and the food never disappoints! I always get really good service when I go there too which is awesome!

eIB6NoI-2ApfOgR7j-sDwg.text: Amazing place, no signage so you might miss it. It's nice and open inside, great selection of craft beer and the food is to die for. Betsie Boop was our waitress she provided great service and recommended the Brulee Burger, hands down the best burger I have ever had. Will definitely be going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brûlée Burger.

xedYi2DcW-vTrSMXniX06Q.text: Great food, lots of great beer and I think the prices are really good. We always feel we've gotten good value from our experience there.

FYG9EFPvzUP_IJSnPF6z0g.text: Really enjoyed Angels Trumpet Ale House.   Great assortment of delicious beer. The food is really good as well. I recommend the fish tacos... they were surprisingly good. The only reason I am not 5 stars on these guys is some sub par service from a server and a bartender.   The 'Beer to go' option is epic. You can pick your favorite beer from their tap and take it to go in a sealed house beer can. Pretty cool  Highly recommend this place!

hyb2z40c_xZwbXwS32q2BA.text: Chose to stop in here last week when I arrived into Phoenix kinda late for work and they were near where I was staying and open late and boy am I glad I did. Great food, great service and even better selection of craft beers on draft. Cool laid back feel and could def see how it'd be a fun spot to hang with the large open outdoor patio area. 6 wines on tap and 30 some rotating beers ranging from local selections to others from around the country and loved that they offered samplers as well. I ordered one of their sandwiches in wrap form (which I found out was possible from a guy that worked there) and was very impressed in how it turned out. Would def come back here if I were in the area again.

esrmGwaAunyetTWrP7uHLg.text: Food is good. Real good. Burgers, brisket, pulled pork, spam sliders, The Mess!!!! If you can't find a beer, well then...

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brisket grilled cheese, The Mess

WJyFQsypw8c-VgdzvT97jQ.text: Absolutely the best beer selection in downtown, and a great food menu to accompany. Service is generally very good and the staff is all friendly. Great atmosphere with a large patio that is pet friendly. Love this place.

HqGLinVYhiwdcOJE543MQA.text: Unfortunately, my review will have to be brief, as was my visit.  My lady, kid and I were in town for the Thanksgiving holiday and made plans to meet up with a friend at Angel's Trumpet (his suggestion).  We only had a little bit of time, which sucks, because I feel like we could have spent all night there.  The beer list was impressive, and featured a number of top-notch brewers that we can't get in our current hometown due to distance/distribution limitations.  I was able to select one brew I hadn't had before and one of my favorites that I can rarely get...and it was on nitro.  Good Lord, it was beautiful.  It was like angels singing...or blowing trumpets or saxophones or something.  I was pleased to learn that they rotate selections rapidly, I'm sure that if I lived nearby I would spend plenty of time there finding new beers to love.    The atmosphere was awesome, the patio area was comfortable, and the appetizers we had were quite tasty.  Though our visit was short, our experience was very positive.  I will go back the next time I'm in town.

Tl8zMzBRn-ozT4IGHecLPg.text: Went here with a large group (planned event - 200+ people). Food was mediocre, no food specials for a large group, beers were pricey, slow service, long lines for bathrooms. Those are not ideal things. However, having a manager that was rude when a simple question was asked (to open a window) is unacceptable. A simple explanation could have been provided, but instead, a rude response was given, and the manager walked away without further clarification. Turning your back on a paying customer? We have asked the group to change spots for next year as I am sure there are plenty of places that would gladly welcome 200+ people, and their business, for a scheduled event.

a0-0ui9V20npFi8BneUtxw.text: Pretty loud, but amazing beer selection. Good food as well.

iKFOWl4_acaNTShjPVLwgg.text: Beer selection was excellent with 31 micro brews. No bud light here. Great happy hour with $3 for 3 diff local beers.  Homemade pbj, grilled cheese and moose drool ale wings. The deserts are most impressive with home made pop tarts and salted flat bread with house made peanut butter house made marshmallows Dark chocolate chunks and honey drizzle

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beer selection with 6 wines on draft

ttwGHkHCf9H5qpEfmaaq9g.text: We have been going to Angels Trumpet since they opened. Let me tell you, this restaurant NEVER disappoints! I love getting a beer flight because, come on, they have sooooo many great options to choose from!  Every time we go, we start with the spam sliders. Oh my....so yummy! You have to try them!  Every dish we have tried, from the burgers, to the tacos to the hilarious t.v. Dinners are just really, really, really delish!!  This is a great spot for date night or out with friends. Grab a beer flight and enjoy the yummy food!!

rfjxS-NAV3547Y0WFEyoog.text: First time I came, some kind of beer fest was going on so place was packed! No space for me so I turned around and went somewhere else. Well I came back and really glad I did. Beer selection is awesome. I ate prior to coming so didn't order any food.  I did my usual which was a flight (6 beers here) and had the waiter select them for me. When I told him I was letting him choose, he told me I made his day.  He chose some really solid beers. And I finished with a 7th beer, a cranberry cider which he claimed was the best cider he's ever had. It was mean good. I think very close to one of the best ciders I've ever had also. Great choice for a great selection of craft beer. Will try some food next time.

6CdzxuQtvhzlEHOX-zA7tw.text: Call the stewardess,  I don't want to miss a flight.  With 31 different beers on tap,  I'm not fit to be flying alone.

72zlQtiSSxNy-K21J7B2yw.text: Great food great beer, service is a little slow at least when I usually go which is late so maybe it is not like that all the time. It has an outdoor space that has great atmosphere. I usually get a flight of beer because they have so many. Servers are very educated on the beers they offer. I have had quiet a few of their dishes and don't really favor one over the others everything is really good and has a slight variance to what you would usually find in the exact same item elsewhere.

N4qGWLMVnSinc6G3ZO8EvQ.text: I've been coming here pretty frequently for a few years. I used to work down the street which made popping in for a post-work beer very easy.  I've since left that job but moved closer to Angel's, so I'm basically a Sunday evening regular at this point.  32 beers on tap, plus about 5 wine selections on tap as well. I'm more a stouts and porters girl, but you never know what you'll find at Angel's! IPAs aplenty, stouts, porters, gose, sours, fruit beers, ales of all kinds, a cider or two, and seasonal beers are all common finds. There's usually 2 on the nitro tap, and a rotating selection of a few Arizona beers.   I mostly sit at the bar when I stop in, and the bartenders are all quite friendly without being overbearing. Some forget to give you a glass of water unless you ask for one, some give you one automatically.  The place is not a sports bar, they have two TVs playing some manner of sporting events (usually football or baseball) with the sound off and closed-captioning. Music is also usually unobtrusive, thanks to their random Pandora offerings. If you're the type who prefers a rowdy, sports-centric bar, Angel's ain't the place for you. If you want a somewhat lively bar with a nice, large patio, extensive beer selection, and solid food options, this is the place.  Oh, the food. Their menu isn't huge, but it delivers in unique-ness. My favorite thing on the menu is the Central, a fried chicken sandwich with lettuce, tomato, pepperjack cheese, bacon, red onion, jalapeno ranch, and cucumber. The cucumber is what makes it, for me. Their fries are quite tasty, thicker than shoestring fries with a house seasoning that may just be seasoned salt for all I know. Be warned -- their ketchup is made in-house, and it's nowhere near the usual Heinz stuff. In my opinion, it would be more complemented by mozzarella sticks than fries, but if you go in knowing it's not your usual ketchup, you might be pleasantly surprised.  I've also tried their soft pretzels app with beer cheese and beer mustard. Very good, light and fluffy hot pretzels. The Outlaw burger is also a solid selection (pretty standard BBQ sauce/bacon/cheese/onion string burger), as is the Matador sandwich (brisket, cheese, horseradish, peppers and onions, if I recall).  I'll be back. Obviously.

508VMtz7TIj5VVqNwvoCKg.text: Service is leisurely, but beer selection is well curated and food is top notch  bar food.  Patio is great on warm evenings.  Highly recommend.

GJsajFUihr1CwJ7Fun7Ebw.text: Fun place with delicious food. I live the central sandwich! Best chicken sandwich in downtown.

9P-MeSULBZnOMKz4C6WV8Q.text: My friends and I were in town and stumbled upon this place.  We actually wanted to try it out because we saw fellow Yelpers mention TV dinners, however when we got there it was only served on Tuesdays.  Bummer.      There was a football game on so many of us were loud and screaming due to the game, but I'm not sure what the atmosphere is like on a regular day.   This place reminds me of a bar you would see in downtown Vegas.  Being a gastropub, they have tons of beers on tap to choose from.  You can also buy beer in a can and take it home in a brown paper bag.  Super classy hahah     Food.  To be honest, the food was just ok, we ordered pizza and burger, but my four stars goes just to the desserts !!! homemade warm poptarts and warm salted caramel chocolate cookies topped with ice cream ...  I guess they change up the flavors of the poptarts so make sure you ask what the filling is.    If you want to try this place out .. I would recommend to skip the meal and go straight for the dessert !

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. crowler
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. tractor
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

neyAqkWSDCEDBN276P0Xqg.text: I've been here a handful of times now and I can say that I've had a wonderful experience each time.   TONS of rotating beers daily, ~$5 beers, ~$11 beer flights, AMAZING burgers, yummy appetizers. I have yet to be disappointed. If you are looking for a nice quiet place, this is definitely not the place. This place is loud and full of energy.   There is a VERY small free parking lot in front, but good luck getting parking there. But you'll easily find street/meter parking nearby.   Environment: 5/5 Food: 5/5 Price: 4/5 Service: 4.5/5

T7xePy0ENhDmblSPcGjeHw.text: The vibe is great. But way over hyped. I was not satisfied with the food. The pictures can be deceiving. The food looked better than it tasted. I got the bbq brisket grilled cheese. The brisket was way too chewy and had a weird taste/ texture to it. Everything was over salted. They didn't even have normal ranch or normal ketchup. The waitress had a  terrible attitude. She seemed like she didn't want to be there.

cKLmsF9cTOcxLwkzj_2y3A.text: In town for a brief visit..found this place. Food was good, service was very friendly. Prices extremely reasonable. Lots of craft beers. Mostly hipster crowd but you won't feel out of place if you're not. We're retired and look it. Lol.  No one will look at you funny. Highly recommend

wBBWDzZ-ZAPwOb25xA1C5A.text: Worst customer service EVER! They don't care about takin care of their customers. First and last time I will ever come to this place.

J9IdTkNvB-qF21qHl2Y3iQ.text: Really like this place. 30 different taps and very good food. Looking forward to utilizing their patio area when it's not 1,000 degrees out to bring the pup. Definitely will be back!

eUCTgwIo_McAfpp0z1uM2w.text: This is one of my go-to downtown eateries because the food and libations are always good. We tend to go with a large group and the staff is always cool and accommodating. I like to take my out-of-town people here because I've always been happy. Check it out!

y5Eb8yGm9cG6a6dIuqiBzQ.text: My gosh I love this place.  Honestly, one of my favorite places to go with a group of friends or a date night with my husband. Always fantastic food and service. Host/Hostess is super friendly. Beer, well, yeah, the beer is outstanding and the selection is unreal. Great patio for starry nights. Loud, fun vibe!  Only con is the bathroom situation...waiting sucks.   Go eat, drink and be very merry!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. First Friday.

CD5LQEDOIxfjPS3vIBfObQ.text: Few places in Phoenix can be rated top 10 places to eat. Logically. And Angel's Trumpet happens to be one of those places. And this place deserves to be in that bracket for sure. Their food is fresh, and their beer selection is incredible. The beer flight is a classic, tried and True method for trying new beers without having to chug entire glasses down.  I came here with a friend and discovered some really interesting favorites that I hope will be on the menu. A beer I tried had a very herbal, sage taste to it in its finish and it paired very nicely with the burger and fries that I got.  One thing to note, while I did give this place a full five stars, I personally don't recommend the brulee burger when drinking.   "But Russell, why did you give this place five stars if the brulee burger isn't five star worthy?"  ONLY when drinking. See, drinking can cause hypoglycemia. But then you ask, well, eating a brulee burger, which has sugar, seems like a good idea right? Here's the thing, it's straight up sugar. Which, for me personally, makes me feel sick. Eating potatoes or any form of slower intake of carb calories mitigates the stomachache issue. But maybe that's just me.

SEQ9T-cZDtsmgROaNVrtBw.text: This is a great bar and place to go with friends. The flights are wonderful and they display the beers in a fun way on the chalk board. My favorite thing I have eaten here was the spaghetti and meatball pizza. I do not see it on the menu online, so it may been a special. Either way it was delicious. Love the vibe and the simply scrumptious food.

cqpxb06mc5fegskZCjfkIg.text: Great place to go for a beer in downtown Phoenix. Some nearby places like cobra and film bar too. We had the tacos and they were great, would recommend.

17TCzVOVBZlsM7Gc6v1Dkg.text: Beer bar - a lot of places getting titled or tagged as such but few really deserve the moniker.  Angels most certainly does.  If you're looking for high quality beer (and a voracious selection of it), stop here.  The beer selection is exemplary here - around 30-35 taps.  Nice mix of local AZ selections with other world class options.  For examples, there when I was there they options from AleSmith, DogFish, FullSail and other dope breweries.  Ample selection of styles were represented too - not just IPAs - sours, sessions, bourbon-barrel aged stouts - no matter your tastes beer-wise you should be able to find something that suits you here.  They are also on point in terms of glassware for beer - i.e. you aren't going to get served an imperial IPA in a pint glass.   I found the bartenders to be really knowledgable style-wise so definitely ask if you have any questions on style preferences when you are there.  The food menu was also great here - I went here a few times and the option that stood out to me was the big guppy (fish tacos).  You get two tacos with the big guppy but don't let that deceive you - these are BIG tacos.  They come with Angel's "secret sauce".  What is - I have no idea - but it is tangy/spicy and fits the dish well. On top of that, the tacos are buried in avocado mash and slaw which adds up to a recipe for success.   Besides the tacos, food options include sandwiches, flatbread pizza and a number of other appetizer-like selections.  As stated before, this is a top notch beer bar and the food delivers too.  Definitely worth a visit if you are in the downtown Phoenix area.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beer board of epic proportions.  Draft wine too.

GdEVvToY7P9ILad0C8Nr0Q.text: The draft wine & beers are really good and there is a huge amount of beer to choose from. We started with the flight and then each had our own favorite choice. Chenin Blanc also really good and just the perfect cool temperature (I can admit I'm a wine snob when it's not chilled properly and in 108 degrees outside a cool glass of wine is so delish!). We had the big guppy fish tacos, tractor flatbread, and a special of the day cauliflower flat bread and everything was great. Portions are large. Not enough room to try a pop tart because they give you a nice size beer too. Happy hour! I will always come back when I'm in town, love the laid back crowd here, it's got a hip vibe and the wait staff are so nice and friendly. Actually I just changed my 4 stars to 5 because I couldn't think of anything I didn't like about this place.

iX2eaZX9pqVUzPP_kUYkQQ.text: Maybe I shouldn't have had such high expectations. I was so stoked on coming to this Ale House. I have had it on my "to-do list" for about a year. When I finally got the opportunity, I was super disappointed. I did really like the building and the bar set-up, the atmosphere was alright, the patio was pretty cute, but nothing special. Just like everything else.   To start, they didn't have the first 2 beer's I asked for. The 2 Sour's that were on their tap that evening were out. The bar tender handed me 2 samples "Here try these." I thought. Ohhh well that was nice of him. Well... lucky for him I am not very picky. The beers he handed me were NOTHING like Sour's. Not even Ciders. I'm pretty sure they were Pale Ales. Ok, whatever. So I picked one of them.   When we were seated it didn't take long for the server to see us and our friends. Pretty friendly guy. But that was the end of that. Our server was hard to track down the rest of the evening. Especially at the end of our meal, when it came time to pay. We sat there for a good 20 Minutes, we waited to catch him and ask for our checks.  The food was probably the most disappointing part for me. The best thing I had was The Mess: house fries, brown gravy & fresh local cheddar cheese curds. But even these were lacking of much needed flavor. The Cheese Curds were the best part. Salty and creamy. For our meals, my husband and I split both the Bbq Brisket Grilled Cheese: root beer braised brisket, pickled onion, tomato, smoked mozzarella, fontina, house bbq sauce  And the Nutter: house ground peanut butter with raspberry chipotle preserves & banana. The Brisket Grilled Cheese, #1 Where's the cheese!? Nowhere to be found. The BBQ sauce was gross. Not tangy or spicy, just bla... The Brisket itself was fine. And then for the Nutter, no flavor. Just nope. I had such high hopes. Dashed...  And here's a pro-tip. NO TALKING, you won't be heard. This place is SO LOUD.   I may have set my bar and expectations too high.  If I do go again, I know what to expect. And that is that.

BDShO-dL24_t3uVAZUj9WQ.text: After going to a great show downtown, we were looking for somewhere to go to have a couple of beers and some food. A friend suggested Angels Trumpet Ale House.   We arrived about 9:30pm on a Saturday night, fully expecting a crowd. We were relieved to see there were many open tables and our party of 7 was sat right away. Great! We're off to a good start! After studying the menu and deciding what we wanted (we were starving and thirsty), we patiently waited for a server to come and greet us. 10 minutes went by. No server. 15 minutes. No server. 20 minutes. No server.  While I would usually be understanding if it was busy (I used to be a server myself, so I have a high patience level), MULTIPLE servers were walking past our table looking like they had absolutely nothing to do. One male server was actually strolling around whistling with not a care in the world. We were absolutely in shock at the lack of acknowledgement we received by anyone other than the hostess. After waiting 25 minutes and still not being approached we all got up and left. On the way out, the hostess said cheerfully, "Thanks for coming in! Have a great night!". Sure, we probably would have had a great night if we actually would have been served.   It takes a LOT for me to complain about service. As I said before, I have been a server, and I know how stressful it can be...when it is BUSY. This place was NOT busy and had plenty of servers. We ended up leaving frustrated and hungry.   We will not be giving this place a second chance, nor can I recommend it to others after the experience we had.   Horrible service. Absolutely horrible.

Oak34AnlnKXdsqYRv3ALtw.text: Best pork rinds ever!! Love the cool local vibe. Great food, took me to a happy place!!

zLBrBmfekKtQRcv8OVYVmg.text: Great Downtown choice! Killer craft beer selection and scrumptious comfort food.

GDPbvFLocXfS1g9Jvjk_eA.text: Angels Trumpet Ale House is one of the BEST places in downtown Phoenix. The food, drinks, beer and service is top notch! I highly recommend you stop in, and enjoy yourself. Keep up the great work!

h2-SPcObNl-FgT3i50gX1g.text: Cool place. Best selection of beers on tap! Beautiful clientele. I just wish the skinny dude brooding behind the bar would smile. I don't like to be grimaced at when I am trying to chill with my $7 beer!

bkGp0uggpIXsszD50mkSzw.text: Large craft beer selection and great events.  The food is great and the atmosphere is contemperary trendy.

0qnd7JQ4uxMk_qmGlKwTxg.text: Our first time was an overall good experience. The beers were tasty...the selection is awesome! The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. The atmosphere was pretty cool...loved our seats at the bar! The food was Meh (I've experienced better!!). Not what I was expecting when the food came out as everything else at this place rocked!! I got the fries/brown gravy/cheese curds plate. There were like 4 cheese curds on the plate and the fries were soggy and not that good. They did not have an condiment options other than their "homemade ketchup" that wasn't even close to ketchup. My husband had an Italian wrap and he didn't care for it either. If we go back...I'll be just drinking...not eating.

9aDlH2wzbIItku25Zsbv5w.text: Great food and beer selection with a cool relaxed atmosphere. The avocado salad with smoked turkey was superb as was the 810. It's a must try!

TBE4VB2OP08FeFD4F3IT0w.text: I love this place for their many rotating taps, because they almost always have at least one Sour on the menu, and the service is usually very good.  However, their food leaves a little to be desired.

pAlQGnp25d5UsT16P_vnXQ.text: My newfound hang-out!! Went here yesterday with my friend who is a beer connoisseur. The bartenders, Tommy and Thomas, were such awesome, friendly, helpful and accommodating guys. They made us feel totally welcome and we had a great time.   We ordered a flight in addition to a few more beers. Zero complaints. I recommend the saison from Funkwerks Brewery. The Holiday Cider and Decadence Stout were other favorites, but like I said, all of it was excellent. Fantastic beer selection---best in the Valley that I've seen.   The food is also noteworthy: the alligator pear flatbread = out of this world. We also ordered the salad with spinach and grapefruit (can't remember the name) that was equally amazing. What a great experience!! I can't wait for my next visit.

4JYmMICXlHh41KCG0B42gw.text: Have been here several times and every time it's a hit....from the great selection in beers to the food. Everything is great.  We love the fact that it's always a different list of beers. Their hamburgers and fish tacos are delicious!  Their homemade pop tarts are great too...sometimes, that is all we have (and beer too, of course). Great laid back atmosphere, a great place to come hang out with friends or to have a date night. Love it!

dKx_MVvIgRC1ksHYQUNxeA.text: If you like beer, might be the best place in AZ.  Prices are great and the staff is really down to earth and helpful.  30 beers on tap. Food and atmosphere is up scale but very homey and relaxing

VMMx6wm1bJTl4spuryBmBA.text: What a great place! Brought the dog on the patio and she even got great service! Had the grilled cheese and pumpkin pop tart! Delicious!

pXVQnMR731CFHOmmo1AzUQ.text: Great food, great beer, great atmosphere (except for acoustics which make the place hard to carry on a conversation.  patio when not so hot is much better).  Loved this place.  not anymore.  not with the plethora of other amazing restaurants downtown.  took another couple with us tonight. had 8 beers, appetizer, and food.  One of the girls ordered a beer that was listed as a peach flavored. she was thinking it would be similar to the 4 peaks peach.  turned out it was an awful tasting sour beer.  we sent it back  and requested another.  When the bill came we were charged for the sour beer.  Asked the waiter to talk to manager saying we didn't think we should pay for a beer we didn't drink.  She came back and said manager said he wouldn't take it off.  nice customer service!  on a beer that probably cost them a buck.   ruined an otherwise nice night.

woytyIREtx1-bEhQvnTycg.text: Great modern spot and an amazing beer selection. The hostess had a major attitude problem and the service was awful, it took 10 minutes for someone to come to our table. I'll try it again but if hte service is the same I won't return.

sm6xSRcxr-ImnKY7UUSmbg.text: I really wanted to like this place, I really did.  My husband and I sat at the bar, and after about a minute my husband had to point out to the bartender that the table needed to be wiped down. Were given menus. We stared at the beer menu on the board, and we probably looked like idiots, but no one ever came over and asked us anything. We finally waved a waiter down. Asked for some suggestions, all i heard was mumbling, didn't want to help, gave us a sheet and told us to put the numbers down of the beers we wanted to try. Gave us our flights, never came over to ask us if we liked anything in particular or if we had any questions... nothing. We also ordered the Porky pizza. The concept is great but there was waaaaaaaayyyyyy to much sage on the pizza, totally overpowering. I had to dig in and take the huge pieces off so I can eat the pizza. We paid, got up, not a thank you for coming, nothing. Don't care.  Thats fine I don't care either and I won't come back.  Go to Four Peaks Brewing in Tempe. Great crowd, great beers, great atmosphere, great bartenders!!!!!!!! Or Brat Haus in Scottsdale!! Great food and servers are very knowledgeable and actually CARE if you like the beer or not!!

r22JcBtPJq-8_T1JMq-yfw.text: This has just become one of my favorite Ale House's/Pub's not just in Phoenix but in the world!  It's got a great vibe right in the middle of Phoenix's emerging Central City area with lot's of good beers on tap and great food - We visited last on First Friday and were expecting it to be crowded when we got there around 5 pm but it wasn't too bad - It did get busy later around 7 when we left though - Need to go back to try more of the food - excellent and well priced!

aOKKp5mW80nqn6N2NiwZWQ.text: Great food and 30 beers on tap. I had the BBQ brisket grilled cheese which was outstanding. The french fries are nicely seasoned and they make their own ketchup which was awesome. Top it all off with good service and reasonable prices and you have the recipe for a winner.

T9Le0M1yQJ2g7d79kMLmGA.text: Great beer selection and casual yet hip ambiance . Burgers cooked  medium to order and you can substitute with a chicken or smoked pork patty. Only one salad dressing on an all spinach salad. I would pass on the dressing myself as t was a bit blah. Great service and good prices.

-hHgZxsnrEWopW4762n6MA.text: We stopped at Angels Trumpet Ale House on Kerry M.'s birthday. I love the look of this bar! Very open and modern looking, also very hipster-ish. They have an large outdoor patio and don't even get me started on how tasty their pretzels are! What I loved about this place is that they have ~40 beers on tap and when one is empty, they add something completely new and then update the 2 chalkboards. It leaves you wanting to know what's gonna be tapped next. Love it!

L3DZ7xk_a5m_VqinelLTcQ.text: Been here a couple of times now.  It's pretty much the closest thing to a microbrewery you'll find in downtown Phoenix.  Tons of beers (and some wines) on tap and the choices always rotate.  This time around I got a Hefe from a brewer in the Czech Republic.  For lunch I got what was essentially a BLT on steroids with super thick bacon, lettuce, tomato, as well as pesto.  Really nice compliment to the beer.  The place wasn't too busy since its a Saturday afternoon, but I'm told this place is packed with downtown workers during weekday happy hours.  They have a nice outdoor patio that is ideal when the weather permits, though I kind of wish they'd put something else out there like cornhole toss, a live music stage, or something along those lines.  Overall, the food is pretty good and the service I've gotten here is pretty friendly.  The food and ambiance won't knock your socks off, but the beer selection is really hard to beat.  Nice to have a decent brewpub downtown.

BUcLCyi7C09KLupMk3xBOw.text: Great knowledgeable staff taste bud explosion must do when in Phoenix go on weeknight if possible!

IH1pkOkxmlHT3gN2rqQfKg.text: Great beer selection and place to come with your friends!

kmJu0DXW9StZ0NMwXLB30Q.text: Great beer selection. Friendly atmosphere. Had the Farm flat bread. Delicious and nutritious! Fun place to go after a dback game. Highly recommend.

0O_OuI_PCRaXkVQ0cG6eqA.text: I love the place. It looks like everyone comes here, no matter what's you age. You will see a college student and a retiree. I guess anyone will find a beer among 30+ available beers. The food is great. We ordered a couple of flatbreads and those were great. I can't wait to taste other things on the menu....

r1idEVvtFo9pEVft_90ppg.text: Incredible ambiance that matches a unique menu. The salads are delicious and the simple menu packs a punch of flavor. A huge drink menu will pair with any of the menu items. This place is a jem.

4mxthGtoCz4YuJbGDhODZQ.text: Great beer selection, TONS on tap. Also lots of wine to choose from if that's what you are in the mood for. I had their brisket tacos which I highly recommend. Outdoor/indoor patio style seating. A great place to people watch there are a large variety of people from all backgrounds and ages that comes here.

0NuJ11c0d2Pa7dB96xub9g.text: Horrible service time after time after time. I'd like to say it adds to the charm but it just doesnt. The staff isn't rude or anything. They just have a habit of looking right through you. And if you want silverware to accompany your meal well forget it. Still, we come back week after week after week because they really do have an awesome assortment of beer and who can resist the Tuesday tv dinners?!?

SByZ8FM0SrtCfOkI1GlFNA.text: The food is AMAZING! I have to stop in when I can have a beer (or two), 'cause the selection is beyond anything you typically see in PHX. This will continue to be a "let's grab lunch" spot, regardless of my ability to imbibe (or not).

4Rllrh6_f59d3nwyPt1Maw.text: Great selection of about 30 mostly European beers along with maybe five wines on tap. A pretty basic food menu. An $11 order of tacos gives you two tasty tacos, probably not enough for a full dinner. Nice, pretty spacious outdoor patio. Definitely go for the beer.

UaEgsxhHQ9dnojKxUf32TA.text: Okay the food was good, delicious creations and vegetarian friendly. The only problem I had was when that huge Marmaduke dog showed up and a couple of the Waitresses/Waiters went to rub him. I saw not either of them go and wash their hands. That's the only reason they don't get five stars.

8YiP2ACNeBQTl16ezSgC5w.text: Fantastic beer selection & the food was great. With 31 beers on tap this place is for serious beer lovers. They even have 5 wines on tap. The food was great; the wings had 3 different sauces for dipping. The service was prompt & friendly. I will definitely go back!

dw6pSvET3NV3x68uCesrtg.text: Great patio, great selection, but the service needs to be better.

gSuQuIuKhvYeYcuxf94-Aw.text: Great beer and great food.  We had the pizza and it was very good to go with our flight sampler.

V2Ff-EQYjuRloe4pLHcNgQ.text: The Angels Trumpet Ale House is a Downtown Phoenix delight. An exhaustive selection of beers combined with a delicious menu for lunch and dinner. One of the largest outdoor patios downtown. Indoor outdoor fun in the sun with a cold beer.  A must stop for a thirsty urban adventure. I have dined there on many occasions and have never been disappointed. Parking can be a challenge at times but worth the visit.

mSPqw6hpVg13jE3v3E6Ong.text: Just finished up with their smoked pork and chicken enchiladas, green chile corn bread topped with white bean chorizo, Arizona rice with smoked onion and charred tomato (best rice I've had in a LONG time) and finished it all off with a scoop of fried ice cream w/ sugar puffs and ganache that they kindly kept in the cooler until we were finished with our meal since we were on their patio.   One of the best TV dinners I've had here.  Chef Travis is a great new addition!   Washed it all down with a couple tasty Joseph James NV Collaboration Imperial IPA's and an Avery Samael Barleywine.  Service was awesome with Cyndy and support of Josh, Nicole & Amy all lending a helping hand.

TLuCVFkpzCcT2qF42iu7Ww.text: This is a cool place in a good location. Great beer and lots of selection. WAY too loud inside and the food is average to below average. Great place to meet for drinks if you can handle the noise.

6vZJUBgRNS-cwBXfSdedBQ.text: Great selection of beer and tasty menu of creative dishes (though definitely not a healthy menu). The garden out back is fun!

zNzrT03IGxStz6YX1DlgGA.text: Tried the pizza - with brussels sprouts - amazing! The egg on top is fab!

AXibNFjR0WK6LsaumYiejw.text: It was fine, but it isn't the kind of place I normally go for lunch.  The food was a little out there for my taste.

Q2yTLiJqcBgAx5yUc2L6rw.text: I come home once a year for the Christmas and I all make certain I stop in and have a nice cold Beer and I order the mess with an egg along with their great chicken wings!!  I wish that I could find a place in Wisconsin where I currently live.

Ftob6WVbecukVsk5cyCr5w.text: The food was very good.  I've been there twice and had the Matador (roast beef sandwich) and the paisano pizza.  Both were fantastic.  The beer selection is amazing!  A chalkboard covering an entire wall behind the bar lists the current offerings.  About 32 total and I've tried 12 so far.  Get the flight of six samples of your choice.  They are busy so be prepared to grab a beer and wait for a table.  But the wait times really aren't too bad.  I'll be making this place a regular stop.

Ka9QmBAA2vbw0apOpnZdJQ.text: Was so good. I love the pizza with salami honey and goat cheese!  The atmosphere is great

0adXHyksPKc2wNeMY2eWsQ.text: Now that I've had time to reflect on my recent visit I've decided overall I did enjoy my experience here.  At first I was a little put off by the crowd but I now realize it was a based off a preconceived notion I had based completely off the location and building.    The food was very good, the service was great and I love how close it is.  I will give this place another try in the near future.

V62IBoI5vBxqOz1ceEEqmA.text: One of my go to place these days if I'm looking to chug (I mean drink) some good beer. The selection here is one of the best I have found so far in the Valley and includes 20+ taps of a multitude of beer styles.  The offerings range from common year round beers and seasonals, to imports and some of the slightly harder to procure stuff (If only I had actually enjoyed that Bourbon County Brand Stout - woops).  Service is usually pretty quick even when crowded (as it can be on the weekends) and the food menu is delicious, sober or otherwise.  Definitely a fan of the wings, and spam sliders.  Need to try the tv dinners in the future.   They have a nice outdoor patio and seating area as well where you can enjoy a game of bags/cornhole.  Who doesn't like cornhole?  Honestly, if you are into craft beer or just beer-curious you need to try this place out asap.

DAldZfsWL-lUe7LYsensIg.text: What a great place. It has great staff and good vibe. located in a part of town you wouldn't expect and brings you next to Film Bar, another fun place. I've been many times now and have ordered the wings ( A+) burgers and flat breads. The desert I could only comment on it not being the greatest, but fortunately we fill up before getting to desert so we never order it. The beers are all good and the staff is excellent at guiding you to the right choice. The patio is dog friendly and fills up quickly. I love this place and find myself going back as a loyal customer.

SFSUszHwlZBZ0GhKoaG1VA.text: The beer list was huge and the snacks we got were delicious. It has a "yard" feel to it but without the little kids running around.

dFASGOziqVA7ZlexNxM_Xg.text: The burgers here are to die for.  I love the way they are constantly adding new beer taps to their menu.  The atmosphere is great!

g-QW5TXfDobOuRYYic1eJw.text: Don't know anything about the food.   The drinks are awesome! I would recommend this place to anyone. Their craft beer selection is outstanding. The enviroment during happy  hour and evening is great! It is walking distance to downtown and across the street from Phoenix downtown market.

KYRjKzmJzqjrmYf5ed7vPA.text: What a cool place. Love this place. Want good beer, go here. They have like 50 on tap all of the time and the service staff knows their stuff (they get a "shift beer" when they work, even). I like their outside area but they need to enforce the no smoking. Inside I always sit at the high tables.   Their pork burger is to die for. We love their PB&J and their pizza is to die for. The only thing I hate is their ketchup, which is like homemade crushed tomatoes. Yuck.  I'd go more if their WIFI was stronger. I have to sit near the bathrooms to get a good connection. The staff promises they're trying to fix this. Also, please please make a huge north facing sign so more people know you're there.  If you are lost, find Film Bar. They're across the street.

81V-YjKoy1D_Y9WaMYlxCQ.text: sometimes i wished we lived in dowtown phx. there are just blocks and blocks and blocks of cool eateries and bars and people. such was last night on our night out to visit some friends for drinks at Angels trumpet.   the interior space is beautiful...a mix of exposed construction with clean wall tiles and accessories. there as an enormous patio but don't know if they allow dogs. parking tonight was tricky because it was also first friday and we were told not to park in the dirt lot behind the bar or we'd get a ticket, so we found a close street spot.   our service was excellently friendly and prompt and kept the water glasses filled. but of course the draw here is beer. OMG the beer! and great beer.....a wall of taps of the nectar of the gods. the pints are reasonably priced and you can do a flight of 6 of any of their beers, even the expensive ones! from 9% to 3% alcohol content, heavy stouts to light lagers and everything in between, you are bound to find an option of beer that suits you here...only problem is, you may get wasted in your efforts to find your favorite!  the food was pretty good...a small selection since the focus is beer but my fish tacos were excellent and my wife raved about her arugula salad.   what a great find!

thDAPx0sHKlclfAXod_CpQ.text: Had matador burger tonight spicy yummy. We also had another burger and the peanut butter pretzel dessert.  We have been here many times and always great service and food.  Bison hot dog,  the nutter,  all the apps. you really cant go wrong here   The beers change all the time so you never get bored. And they have the wine on tap so it's a reasonable price.    The kitchen DOES close an hour before the actual closing time , so be sure to make note of that.  Also, you wouldn't think it but they have a great sunset view from the patio.  Note the sunset time in PHX and don't miss it !!!! Cant think of any other ground level downtown place with a great view .

xdcvIfULTU4EkRVR8aICig.text: Stood there with mouth agape perusing the chalkboard again, again and again.   The pressure to choose the right beer... no, make that the perfect beer!  Do I feel like a larger today? (yes)  IPA (yes) Amber (yes)  Stout (yes).  With thirty some craft beers and wines on tap, beer drinkers are frozen with indecision which probably is annoying for the bartender.   You just can't go wrong here --  you just can't.  The problem is both good and bad: the kegs are constantly rotated so you can never develop an affinity for a favorite beer (bad) but you're always discovering new beers (the good).  I never met a beer I didn't like.  Any rate, I stopped in for lunch and a beer.   Today, I ordered the Big Guppy tacos and wow!  4 good size strips of beer battered cod in two tacos with slaw, guac, salsa and some killer beans!  With food though, you can establish a favorite and the BIG GUPPY is now my favorite and comes highly recommended!  Then again, the Wild BLT wrap is  a hard one to kick to the curb.     Oh yea, that one beer become 4 or 5 as conversations at the bar are easy to start and difficult to end -- especially with all that good beer flowing!  Kind of reminds me of the public houses back in the midwest -- (those with fish fry fridays!)

2ZBzkcEV_ugRwG9Z2aew6g.text: Really cool atmosphere for a downtown spot.  Another yelper and I went on a first Friday and the place was packed.  Hardly any parking and the area behind the ale house is someone else's private lot however many people were parking there and then asked to move it.   The waitress was nice but usually invisible when we needed her. So service wasn't the greatest that night and it was hard to tell who was the staff versus guests.    The food was really good.  We had the flatbread with leeks, bacon and egg, really really good.  Plus fries with gravy and cheese curds, this was a huge serving and will feed a table of four!  Only thing, it took forever to get the food, bur we waited patiently however could not hear each other since it was so loud.  If you go , try to get a table outside. Inside, you will have a conversation with yourself since no one else will be able to hear you.  The beer choices were good and as big as some other places. The glasses weren't that cold either and by the time the food came the beer was warm.I will go back just not on a busy night and will ask to sit outside!.Cheers!

GqxiklrHG3eJcoPXjtvKjQ.text: Phenomenal place with an awesome environment. The beer taps rotate often and it's everything I would drink. Every freakin beer! The wine on tap is perfect too. Great balance. The vibe is neutral and fits any generation. They have a wonderful main stay downtown and this place is where you need to be. Don't think twice if you are downtown. Angels Trumpet is the bomb.

e1cgJ8sIDhmUidGPPv3Xhw.text: Really good food and awesome beer selection, but the place can get packed at times, and their hours are quite limited. If you have 2 hours for lunch on a Friday, and you want some good beer and good food, you really can't go wrong.   Parking can be somewhat of a hassle, but look at the meters on McKinley if there is nothing available in their parking lot or out front.   Hot tip: if you like variety, their 6-beer sampler is not a terrible deal at $9 because their pours are always more than the advertised 3 oz each. Also, they have a phenomenal selection of stouts right now, if that's your thing.

xsP0lg6jFG2n98HoGB-RMA.text: Great place. Have been here twice now while visiting Phoenix for work. Very good rotating beer list. There is always something good to try. The food menu is great too. Weekly specials and it's often not the norm. Get the spud tacos as an app for sure. If you go on a Tuesday and they have the TV dinner, get it!

Qf6vtOGQcwzUnZZo5O6GGQ.text: Angels Trumpet is a great spot to grab a drink with friends and kick off a night downtown. Table service is sometimes a bit slow, but they have a huge selection of rotating drafts, and every Tuesday they do a TV Dinner that gets you a full meal including dessert for roughly $8. They are able to accommodate large parties as long as they have a heads up, and have been the landing spot for the No Pants Light Rail Ride the past few years. Go!

CPB4nTCcu4ByJSynlApzxQ.text: Lots of beer to choose from here. I love the cycling selection, but it makes me a little sad because I usually don't get to try everything on the list. unless i want to be a raging drunk...which never happens.   I have not tried the food, but all the pictures look delicious.  Get there early if you want to have a group table to enjoy drinks. Otherwise suck it up and wait.

M_zwwbWcCqmhBV8I7Iw2gg.text: Great selection of beers, good food and plenty of smiles from the staff. Oh and good prices too!

9LvLbmvLAhvKbuUp0_uvRA.text: What?!!! Darn, I hate being pressured. Okay, a review. First, somehow, 'my' bartender always recognizes me AND know what I want to order; next, I love love love the clean white tiles for the splash back of the taps; next again, I love the chalkboard of beers on tap; they have a dog friendly OUTdoors patio; the bar has PLENTY of room; the (small) growlers are cute (see the pic); the NAME of the place; the door knob (know knows the significance? It has NOTHING to do with angels); the beautiful cross stich the Fates featured in the hall leading to the water closet; okay, I much prefer incognito, but did I mention my server? Thomas; the food? Every plate that leaves the kitchen/is served to the person sitting near me looks delectable.   Okay--done

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Vqe-u9NYrGaV7eNxWx1oYA.text: YUM!  The chalkboard of brews and wines on tap rocks! This is a definite must visit if you're around the convention center at all. It's an easy walk from most hotels and will keep you out of the crowds.  I got the gaucho tacos and a glass of red blended wine. Be forewarned, the wine will be chilled (which isn't all that unusual). The tacos arrived with spicy coleslaw and beans. I mixed some of the guacamole in with each taco which also featured mango chutney. It was delicious! I couldn't eat fast enough! This place is a solid restaurant choice with a fabulous ambiance. Don't be scared off by the location, it's worth visiting.

R_qne28Uw2097vcYyV_6Sg.text: Great beer and great people. This a new favorite area for me. Huge, and unique, selection of beers. Love the one keg and move on philosophy. Highly recommend this place for all locals and travelers passing through.

karYlFF8qo6KaFTl2eol2g.text: I have a hard time deciding what to write about Angels Trumpet, not being a fan of beer, it's hard to give any of the breweries around town a fair shake. On their menu they've got items like spam sliders, home made pop tarts, flatbread pizza. Their beer menu is lovingly written on chalkboards around the bar and there's a huge ton amount of them; a real measurement BTW, look it up in any engineering book, if you can't find it right away, just keep looking.  Again, while we've already established I don't really love beer, I have partook from time to time, it's unavoidable when all your friends are doin it ;-)  I do enjoy their tasty salads, have sampled a number of other items from the menu and have never experienced anything I wouldn't order again; except for maybe that weird dessert pizza thing. It's like a big mixture of things from around your kitchen that you would make and scarf down when you've had one or two-welve to many. I love the hip downtown atmosphere and it's a great spot to gather with friends or randomly run into them, cause everyone is usually already there.  Happy Yelping Phoenix!

xg6HLwpr_nZaqM_m7Vc6vg.text: Every time people from outside of Phoenix see pictures I post of Angels' TV dinners (only served Tuesday nights), they are astounded that that much food only costs $7. As my visiting NYC friend said, it's practically free _ or at least a killer bargain.
