It is a little bit like Christmas morning when you look and see on Facebook what Chef Brian will be serving for TV dinner. Past entrees have included fried chicken, meatloaf sandwich, pulled pork sandwich and chicken skewers. They always come with sides (thank god there's only enough to fill those little TV tray compartments) and a dessert.   I would already be a fan of Angels without the creative TV dinner nights. Even though I don't drink, the atmosphere here is fun, lively and so not pretentious. And it's always fun to people-watch. I used to think it was dominated by hipsters but I see white-collar office workers, men showing up in a bowtie and jacket look like possibly an ASU professor. It's very rare that you encounter someone crazy boozy. Also, the patio is a treat. They turn on the misters in the summer and they have a board out there as well with what's on tap.   The comfort food on the regular menu is amazing as well, the pizza and the sandwiches (you have to have at least once the nutter--peanut butter on sourdough with raspberry chipotle jam and marshmallow fluff and for an extra $1, peppered bacon). They also have big, fried spud tacos with sweet potatoes. A little too spicy for me but otherwise delicious. My only beef (or should I say pork?) is why on Earth would you serve spam sliders? I tried one on opening night and I could barely make it through half. Not worth the skyrocketing sodium levels. For the desserts, the "pizza" with marshmallow, pretzels and chocolate is so-so. But the housemade poptarts, I could inhale. A definite treat worth getting!  This has become one of my go-to spots for visitors or if I feel like I deserve a treat for the week. It's one of the best gastropub-restaurants to happen to Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. TV dinner of Salisbury steak, crisp green beans, green chile mac-n-cheese, mashed potatoes and strawberry shortcake

hlZ1UP8_iANVFQtz-BUHww.text: This is a great place!  31 beers on tap and Great food.  The beers are ever changing and they have an awesome selection/variety.  The food is very good.  Fun place to hang out!!!

Ejb5VWaQx9nREkrRHKs_tg.text: This busy, bustling gastro-pub makes for a fun night out.  Cool, open decor inside with a long chalkboard displaying a tempting list of great craft beers.  Part of the fun of drinking and dining here is anxiously watching as one of the staff removes one beer from the list and replaces it with a new one.    And the food -- so good.  I had the wings and pretzels (just appetizers for me this time) but the burgers, sandwiches and pizza my coworkers had looked good too.  The wings were seasoned and flavorful, cooked perfectly and served with a unique chunky buffalo sauce, an awesome chutney and perhaps a ranch or tzatziki sauce (I wasn't a huge fan of this last one except for dipping the accompanying carrots and celery). The pretzels, though awesome, served mainly as a delivery device for the savory and delicious beer cheese sauce.   Lastly, don't pass up on the homemade pop tart!  Our table split one order and it took a lot of willpower for us all to avoid buying individual ones for ourselves.  That night they served apple cinnamon ones.  They were more like toaster strudels, but that's a good thing!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sausage Platter and Pretzels
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pretzels and Wings

pG9FA2sSVW4pmeAGyd9VGg.text: Really fun place!  So many options for adult beverages!  Came here after a dBacks game (we won!) it was busy! Good food too

oPkXRJ27yFeSrcJIDk1mAw.text: Amazing food.  Amazing beer.  Great vibe.  There is nothing not to love!

TaeD4TEk4ijuN0bkni44tA.text: Five stars just for the beer selection. Four stars for the food and four stars for the service. Never a disappointment. Location is 5 stars and this place is clean. Overall, I round up and it gets the five star.   I am not a five star tramp stamp.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beer

6cHLT_HX0G22YKh3dHpiLQ.text: I'm a HUGE fan of the Tuesday night TV dinners. $7 gets you a generous portion of a creatively presented, inspired meal. I've experienced the Salisbury steak and the carne asada tacos and found both to be exceptionally enjoyable!   I truly think the whole place is clever! I really like what they're doing and I plan to keep returning.

78j6LYsCFZ-_9spfAHaWiQ.text: Visited with a girl friend a few weeks ago for the first time and cannot wait to go back. Great selection of beers on tap, wanted to try something different so the waiter brought over a sample, loved it and ordered. So nice to be able to taste it first.  Fish tacos were AMAZING, as is the grilled cheese.   Will be back for sure.  Only complaint is parking, and that's really a location issue in Downtown, park and walk, it's worth it.

YxZ_RT_-HJ1ytTXfnIUK7A.text: Great place: Nice selection of local brews. Really great to find a bar that doesn't sacrifice food quality. Four of us ate there and everything was excellent: guys raved about the burgers! Angel wings and avocado salad were also yum.  Only drawback was that the apple strudel could have really used a nice scoop of ice cream. Oh, well.

KG6tXPh6V3oBrnjiNo1Tcw.text: Love this downtown location! Angel's Trumpet House has a great mix of professional, urban, hipster locals in a great and fun environment.  You can't miss it from the street: with the brightly painted angel mural taking up the full length of the building.  Inside, they have a huge selection of beer, with plenty of seasonal selections. On the most recent outing, I tried a gingerbread lager which hit the seasonal spot.  I haven't met an item on the menu that I don't like. I could go on about the pretzels- amazing! I order them every time I'm there. But I can't overlook the flatbreads or the hamburgers. All are delicious.   During the summer, it is nice to grab a cool brew on the patio (which is also dog friendly).  If you are looking for a great spot downtown- add this to your list!

IBkIGm5sb9mbgZ2WptmXxA.text: Oh. My Word. HOW have I never yet reviewed you, Angels Trumpet!? Of all the many places I've come to adore in the Valley, Angels Trumpet Ale House remains King of the Hill. I can still remember my first time there - the way my eyes crossed when I saw that massive chalkboard loaded full of delicious craft beer options!  Angels Trumpet Ale House officially offers THE BEST selection of quality craft beer in the Valley. It offers THE BEST grilled cheese sandwich, THE BEST burgers, THE BEST fries, and THE BEST ketchup. Did I just say THE BEST ketchup? I did. Angels Trumpet makes their own ketchup and it's good enough to drink on its own! (Seriously.)  Angels Trumpet Ale House is THE FIRST downtown eatery I introduce my friends (and any newcomers) to when given the opportunity. It is THE FIRST restaurant on my mind when I get hungry. I now live all the way up in North Scottsdale and still make a point of traveling the 45+ minutes south and west just to eat here.  The beer list of 30+ craft beers rotates constantly, so you've always got fresh new options to choose from. The beer flights are VERY reasonably priced and serving sizes are always more than adequate (for both food and drink). The homemade pop tarts are freaking delicious, too, and I don't even like sweets or dessert foods.  If you have yet to experience the Angels Trumpet difference, you need to. And don't just go once: visit a few times - get to know the menu. I've never ordered anything here and been dissatisfied. The ambiance is wonderful, the service is outstanding, and the food/drinks are out-of-this-world delicious. Give it a try!! I'm confident you'll love it!

5h8u2hrsVCifTrZ2pHqgNA.text: This place is awesome for every reason. Music, Food and the ever growing beer menu. Only thing is hipsters gravitate to places like these.

bZMj20sMEfqOE95ZuHFeFg.text: First visit was a great one.  Had a blast with good people and tried probably too many beers.  Thankfully I wasn't driving :)  The place was slammed SLAMMED, but some friends had already been there for awhile and had been able to get a table before I showed up so there was no waiting for me.  Straight to the beer!    That said, there's a lot of craft beers that you may never have heard of.  Do the sampler, try as much as possible, that's my philosophy.  Some of this stuff will catch up with you.  The Beast was 19% ABV!   Wut?  :)   Glass wall at the end of the huge cooler gives me something to stare at and drool over.   Love the huge outdoor patio.    Lots of patio heaters out there.     Parking can be a challenge.    The only thing I can think of that might be undesirable is that there are homeless people hanging out just on the other side of the back wall to the patio.  They even have mattresses and junk out there, so it appears as if some of them sleep out there.  I'm not so worried about them, other than that they lend trashiness to the area.  My girlfriend, on the other hand, was a bit uncomfortable with going by herself out to her car to get something she forgot, and I can't blame her, so I went instead.    Great spot, except for the very limited parking, which might force you to have to interact with the homeless people.

00WGXpmscpjr7kZnzJBqkQ.text: Being a vegetarian all my life and trying different wraps and burgers, this place has super delicious vegetarian wrap.

a3c6OyZdd8XSvrYQVP5ZsA.text: Food was Ahmazinggg!!' Britney our server was awesome! Came for a quick trip visit and love trying new places! Found it on Yelp and love it! Great atmosphere  we had the summer special shrimp scampi flatbread so refreshing light and tasted phenomenal! Va-va-verde brisket tacos so flavorful, homemade chicharones. Best was the wings couldn't help ourself they were a perfect blend of sweet and spicy. Had two beers and they were great! My favorite was the homemade poptart!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-xW8KwUO6TOh6XP6VOCyNw.text: Had the most AMAZING grilled cheese with bacon jam!! Don't miss out on this treat! Great beer selection, friendly service, and the food was beyond excellent. Appetizer wings exceeded expectations and my boyfriend had the burrito with homemade pork rinds, which were both super tasty. Will be back again for sure!

a3R5ZDhQ_3jn1-7WocIDfw.text: i was torn about this one...we were looking forward to the craft beers and wines on tap. i was underwhelmed by the wines. i was also surprised that they served both the malbec and the imperial stout cold instead of room temp... the salads we had (avocado and cobb) were awesome...my friend was underwhelmed by his flatbread pizza...found the chicken dry...it was fun to try something new, but next time, we'll probably try another new place rather than returning here...another thing, it is wicked LOUD in the restaurant...the acoustics are out of control. you're far better off sitting outside...

OiBZL_fCAD_cRhABIPbA-w.text: Excellent beer selection. Best fish tacos I have ever had. Very cool vibe inside.  The service was top notch also. Three of my friends and I got a table for 4, and 2 others showed up later and got a separate table on the opposite side of the restaurant. We asked the waitress for a larger table to seat all of us. They stopped at nothing to make us happy. Even on a busy Friday night, they were able to cater to us and eventually got the 6 of us together well before we began eating. The waitress earned her high tip. We'll be back again, no doubt.

dfNjyxBh0Zjq4Pm2obz4aQ.text: First of all, what's up with the downtown area? I've been living in the suburbs of Phoenix for 20 years and I never thought of the downtown area as being a "happening" place. When we got off I-10 and proceeded south, there was traffic and people every where. We were really surprised.  We went to Angel's Trumpet on a Friday night and arrived around 7 p.m. The wait time was about 15 minutes and we were able to pass the time in comfortable chairs on the back patio. A waitress came by and offered us water or drinks while we were waiting. Even though it was about 110 degrees that day, the misters kept the outside area cool so it was comfortable when the first available table was outside.   Beer: The beer selection was great and they seemed to have various styles for everyone. I love amber beers, and although they only had one selection (Sunset Amber), it was a tasty beer. As is typical of most bar establishments, the beer selection was heavier on the IPA, porter, and wheat style beers. My boyfriend and friends tried several kinds (unfortunately I was the DD so I couldn't try as many) and they enjoyed each one. A particular favorite was Sculplin IPA. If it wasn't so hot outside I may have tried one of their wines "on draft."  Food: Amazing flavor combinations! It took us a long time to decide what we wanted to eat and none of us were disappointed with our food choices. I had a sandwich ("Bingo")  from the daily special menu with french fries which were served with marinara sauce instead of ketchup (delicious). We had the poptarts which is why we tried Angel's Trumpet in the first place. The seasonal poptart was bourbon peach which had a type of oatmeal crumble on the top (no frosting). It was delicious - flaky dough with fantastic flavor.   Service: Not great for us, but tables around us had much better service. Angel's Trumpet was busy, but our waiter was either not very organized or just slow compared to the waitress buzzing around to the other tables around us. I wish we would have had her instead. For instance, a table behind us on the patio was sat at least five minutes after us and we hadn't even been greeted yet. Then the people who were seated behind us had drinks and food (appetizer) before our beers even arrived. Our slow waiter was very irritating.  Overall: It's a long drive downtown just for food, but we will definitely be back (hopefully with the stellar waitress and not the slow waiter). We all enjoyed our time at Angel's Trumpet and liked the energy of that area in general. It was also fun to see so many different ages congregating in one place.

R66GffyBE5NbNWmKtXo_yg.text: The food here is always good, best restaurant vibe in Phoenix, and tons of rotating taps. Totally awesome stuff.

tkdm4zCIQs-uiRdr17321w.text: Flight of beers to sample the ever changing menu of craft beers is what I recommend. About 31 choices on draft of local breweries! Server was very knowledgeable and recommended great choices also. Burgers were great and so were the seasonal home made pop tarts! Food and drinks were reasonably priced.

xX6aHP1zg2cXG-4H2dC_mQ.text: They don't have an coke products and very few non alcoholic drinks. That is not very good for DD drivers who are trying to be safe. Also the service was super slow tonight.  I wanted to try the nutter and add the marshmallow fluff but of course they couldn't get that right either. I thought the place was a bar but its a family place with obnoxious kids running around in outside area. I wasn't impressed as much as the last time I was there.

tK4wkFI5XLb2BUI_P2hueA.text: Great food, great service, large selection of draft beers, will definitely be back. You can't go wrong with the Big Guppy or the Brewlee Beef Burger . This is definitely the place to go if you're downtown Phoenix.

9iyFXoFLGQOPC_vqCXz1jQ.text: delish food. great large selection of beer/wine, but waiter seemed a little unknowledgable about the beers, could be a fluke. will def be back, nice outdoor seating

HU6VTZAIXPzKGYWLZRVUgg.text: Celebrated my daughter's birthday there last night.  The beer selection is intimidating- 31 taps!- but just ask for a sample if it's brew you're unfamiliar with.  The service was excellent, the food was very good- and different enough to set ATAH apart from similar places, i.e. Yard House, etc. The only possible drawbacks- and these did not warrant less than a "5'" rating: no reservations accepted- I knew this and went a little early to grab two tables for our party of 8; other than beer and wine, the drink selection is limited to canned soft drinks at $2 ea.; the place is loud acoustically- it was difficult to hold a conversation with anyone other than person seated next to me.  ATAH "web presence" is solely Facebook, they have a webpage that just links to Facebook and Twitter.  Look forward to visiting ATAH again soon! BTW they are closed on Mondays.

yLn_SMAFfirFz7iCNiasJA.text: This place rocks. Great atmosphere, great food and more great beers than you could possibly imagine.  If you're downtown, definitely check it out.

3ELWbbbS5QorlZB7eTgxDQ.text: Nice location, would really like to see more places like this downtown.  We liked this place overall. We went on a Saturday night, and it was busy but we didn't have to wait for a patio table. Service was good, always nearby when we needed something. Had the wings to start, but were a bit dry and over cooked. Comes with 3 different sauces, but small bowls and can't dip.  I'd skip them... Had the Chet for dinner, lots of ingredients, focused on beans and chorizo.  Wasn't a huge fan, it was spicy and no contrast, beans and French fries.   The beer is where its at though. They have about 30 taps, all craft brew many of which rare to see. They had "Enjoy By" - Stone Brewery, handful of Dogfish, Firestone etc...  Easy to pick your flight, just write the numbers on the sheet.  Overall enjoyed this new place, just going to try some different food options.

hUvgkynpMJAaKj9A9v6L2A.text: I hope it gets better.  It took nearly an hour to get our food and when we did 2 of the 3 plates we ordered were cold and one of them "the nutter" didn't have the extras that we ordered on it.   The lamb sandwich had a good taste but again was cold and the bread took some sawing to get a bite sized piece.  A bit overpriced for what you get.  4 beers an appetizer and 2 sandwiches set us back $63 not including tip.  Service was friendly but very slow.   I really want to like this place, especially since it's in the hood  but as of now I have mixed feelings.   I will probably give it another shot in a month or two.

QZuI7hazkToQsEGkvXtxiw.text: Fun atmosphere, really quick getting my two flights of beer. Had the smoked pork outlaw burger. Pretty good! Lots of folks having a good time with beer on a Tuesday night. Will return next time my quest for beer brings me to downtown Phoenix!!

EHPTQwXZGEqDKdA09je-MA.text: First time here. Service was awful and slow af, on a Thursday night at around 9 pm. There was hardly anyone there so it's not like they were busy. The bartender was a stuck up, rude, hipster, bitch. Like come on, smile, fake it, and work for your damn tips. I wondered how the hell she even got hired. It was my friend's and I's first time and we met a group of 4 people there who had already racked up a bill of at least $75. They also said she had been rude all night to them as well, ignoring them and rolling her eyes at every little thing. I wanted to slap the attitude right off her face. We were so nice, polite and patient with her, for her to be treating us like shit. After ordering our drinks, which took 10-15 minutes with a bar that only had 5 people at, we closed our tabs immediately and moved to a big table hoping to be served by waitress instead. But there was no waitress to be seen, my friend went up to the hostess after about 20 minutes of sitting there, then she sent someone over to us. She was nice but kind of an airhead. She brought the food to us and there was a long black hair on the pizza. Sent it back and got another one, it was delicious. Also the beer I was drinking was wonderful, my friends enjoyed their beers as well. Yet it was $9.65 for the smallest glass of beer I've ever seen.. I want to come back here for the beer and food but that horrible service is really stopping me, I don't think I'll ever be coming back. Unless you want terrible, slow, rude employees to wait on you, hair in your food, and over priced delicious food and beer come here.

V-Oj4_NsN9FdIRS7h-zp0g.text: Decent service, love the house made ketchup and seasoned fries. Stay away from the 810 the artificial smoke flavoring on the turkey is overwhelmingly chemical and gross. Get the matador instead

6hUgTV7Ubrt5QG7gndC54w.text: Large selection of beer and very laid back ambience. Perfect for a relaxing saturday night with good friends. Would give it 5 stars if I didn't have to setup my own corn hole boards. How hard is it for them to already have it setup so I don't have to do the hard work?

riizsHb9iLUnzcyKTMnduw.text: What? I'm Sorry... excuse me? What!?!  I can't hear a word you are saying. That's basically the theme of the night so be warned. This is my fifth visit to Angels Trumpet House for the fantastic beer selection. I usually don't review on first visit because my opinion might change and I believe a review should be on average. Every establishment has their on nights and off nights. The 31 tab beer selection is outstanding if you are a beer drinker and not looking for the run of the mill domestic beer. The food is interesting I had the chorizo and polish sausage appetizer. Not great but not horrible either. The acoustics of the place are kind of a nightmare, it is truly deafening and very difficult to carry on a conversation with someone right next to you. If they are across the table-game over! It's definitely more of a Phoenix winter place so you can sit out on the patio and not suffer from tinnitus by the end of the night. So if you and your buddy love a great beer selection and don't have much to talk about this place is for you!

NuDWpraJ-MwC3FrJWv-4VQ.text: This place has an awesome selection of craft beers and you can try a 6 for only $9. The only down side is trying to figure out which ones to try and the at least my server wasn't too eager to help me choose. So so I randomly picked the 6 I thought sounded good, I wasn't disappointed but I don't know a whole lot about beer so it should have been nice to get some suggestions. So the service wasn't too spectacular but the beer was fabulous and the food was pleasant as well. I had the pretzels and wings. Personally I like that the wings come with the sauce on the side because I enjoy crispy wings and it's way cleaner. Oh one more thing since this place is located downtown there are very few parking spaces so be prepared to park a a meter.

fYh9yfNiPwYrGwT2FY1TDw.text: Wish I lived closer, great place for good beer.

U4i6K2wpKi0wphCpku9o6g.text: Loved this place! Went with a group and stayed longer than I should have because it was so fab. I loved the open feel and casual set up.   My BF was sooooo excited they had a local brew (Vermonster) from near his hometown. Score for the day!   The service staff was great and helpful with suggestions and tastes. Visit this spot- you won't be disappointed.

_AbBkt8Jkui5o9FouvG7wg.text: I would really have to nitpick to find much to kvetch about at Angel's Trumpet.  In full disclosure, I know and like Matt, the owner.  My biggest complaint is that the place is not open for lunch.  I was stunned when I suggested the place for lunch, only to find they open late.  The other night, I had three beer snobs out for drinks and dinner.  As always, the beer was fantastic, and the quality of the food has become consistently excellent.  The real star was our server, Chelsea.  Pretty, funny, and prompt without being obtrusive.  She had a ton of tables, and literally ran herself glistening making sure that everyone was taken care of on a hot summer night.

_qnKWLf76VCqPcQ9k50C7Q.text: Wonderful place to grab a brew.   Pretty neat place. Nice patio which I hear is dog friendly And lots of brews to choose from which is always a big plus in my book.   We grabbed a few pitchers of beer here; one pitcher equals 2 glasses and at 6 bucks a pitcher it was a good deal.  I saw that they had SPAM sliders, and I do love spam, so I badgered my other half into ordering them.  I really enjoyed my Spam sliders, they were cooked crispy and came to the table nice and warm.  They went perfectly with my pitcher of Mother Roads black IPA.  Our service was a little on the slow side, unless you are sitting at the bar.  It has always been moderately busy when we were here, but not too busy that it is too loud (I hear that is a major complaint).  Since I don't like overly loud places where conversing is a problem, I think I will continue to come here during off peak times.

n5BYT0w8LQzvxBKkEFiK6w.text: I can start by saying, their food was GREAT. I had a pizza with an egg which sounds crazy until you have one. I cant complain about the food one bit!   My boyfriend loves beer, so this place to him is a no brainer! Their beer list changes literally daily [they changed 3 different ones while we were there] so you gotta check the menu when you're there.   However, I'm not a huge beer drinker, but I do enjoy some cider and a glass of white wine on occasion. My only wish for this place was they had a few more ciders. Guess I'll have to go back to their revolving beer list to try again!  Also, I thought this place was super hipster urban and fun. They have a great patio as well. If you're downtown, CHECK THIS PLACE OUT!

KWMJGvT8rN90aZu55ozJNg.text: I love this place! This is not your typical bar, stays pretty well lit during the day and there are no billiards, arcades or other bar games. Nope, in this place the beer is the star!

cHHl_xW8JRox976T9BpeBg.text: This place continues to wow with an awesome rotating tap selection, unique craft beers and bustling atmosphere.  I cannot get over waiting at your table for greater than 15 minutes for service, so usually have to saunter up the bar, order a beer, pay and peramble back to the table before the server even acknowledges our existence.  I wouldn't usually complain about this, but it has happened on more than one occasion.   Will always come here for the great beer selection, and you should too.  Best in downtown Phoenix, bar none.

fJuZ-YreL8pDAXEFAKIBjA.text: I tried it for a second time... and yep I still hate it. The beer list is confusing - good beer but confusing, the ambience is atrocious, and the bartenders have a lack of knowledge about the beer. This place is very disappointing.

lGqdAJCe41BxiEmwGOXPug.text: Fantastic Spot..in town for a conference and tried the Angel. The atmosphere was very garage, gastro with great beer selection and a simple yet delicious menu. I would recommend to anyone. As a bonus there is a indie film house across the street which is beside a vintage arcade bar..score!!

quW6u8tseEx-i9qgm5GTWA.text: We went here for a friend's birthday dinner / happy hour and they quickly seated our large party of 15 on the patio. The ambiance is...brightly lit, industrial warehouse look, definitely not romantic but I would say fun for a first date. Not too loud so it's easy to carry on a conversation which would make it a good place for a business meeting or lunch (note to self!)  I ordered the chicken, pesto & spinach pizza which was yummy. We also splurged on the homemade "pop tart" which was really more like a puff pastry turnover but was good. On Tuesdays they also do a "TV Dinner"  which a few people got and enjoyed. Someone else mentioned that there aren't many gluten free choices and my GF friend and I shared my pizza - she scraped off the toppings!  They have a decent beer (around 30) selection, which they write on a chalkboard because the beers rotate in and out. A bunch of people tried the beer flights and I sponged off my friends flights lol. I ordered a full pint of what I know I like (raspberry framboise & guiness). I'm not an adventurous beer drinker.  The service was excellent and our waitress was super friendly.  I'm only giving it 3 stars because somehow this place lacks the appeal of wanting to go back and make it an official watering hole. It's OK. Maybe if they added music or something it would  make it more cozy.

WlQ5s41IJ6cgLxhfSKA-gg.text: Love new concept restaurants but I'm going to keep an eye on this one. I LOVE beer but I love food more. I'm a lil concerned about this spot because of the limited menu. The Spam sliders are surprisingly good but I do believe eventually they're going to need a full service bar not just beer and wine. The owner and GM are great and I wish them both nothing but great success!!

FvRGepIv6zMJ_rGpSJHP-Q.text: FOOD People are griping about the creative license the owners took with the names of their food, but my issue is over the fact that it is almost always tepid. I don't know if it's the server's fault or the cook(s) not timing things correctly but I don't think I've ever had a sandwich/burger that seemed freshly cooked.  Two or three weeks back, I dined with a friend and he ordered one of the "specials"- some sort of veggie sandwich that had decent ingredients but the different flavors just didn't go well together. I don't think he even ate half of it.  As a heads up, they make their own 'house' ketchup and if you don't like the taste, you are SOL since they don't have store-bought ketchup.  BEER Maybe people love how often they rotate their beers but I'm not made of money and can't hit up their place every 2-3 nights for their $6+ beer. I'm also not really a fan of how their beer menu is presented- the bar area doesn't need to be that crowded. If they had a weekly rotation, they could print out weekly beer menus. My favorite bar in IL did this and it worked out just fine. Maybe learn how much beer to order or be okay with not having 31 'flavors' at all times?  Also, people rave about how amazing having flights are (really?), but I don't think it's a really good deal. The pours for the flights are about as much as the pours for a sample- if you're with at least one other person and you both get 3 samples, BAM! a free 'flight.' Increase the pours on your flights, or decrease the pours on your samples, otherwise it is infinitely cheaper to keep saying "Can I have a sample of X, please?"  SERVICE Not consistent.  I'm not sure how many have actual beer knowledge but I'm betting they use the 'beer list' as a crutch. I get why they have the beer list as I'm sure they don't want to answer annoying questions over and over but this is the ONLY place I've been to that does this and I would honestly prefer a beer menu and use google if the server can't answer my beer question.  OTHER I've been here a handful of times; twice when it was really busy (2nd night they opened and the grand opening). What you'll take-away from your experience is how incredibly LOUD it is inside, whether they're crowded or not. They need to invest in some dampeners or something, and considering how much they charge for their beers ($6 is the average, a few $5, rounded out with $7 and up), I'm sure they can afford it.  While I like the idea of their TV dinner night, I went once and the experience was lackluster. It's on the patio and the screen is TINY. Unless you're in the first 'row' or two of tables, you won't get a good viewing experience. In addition, you can't hear anything. I thought they'd have it streaming on speakers or something, but no. So if you're expecting to watch a movie, expect to be ignoring it instead.  I love their mural. It's maybe my 2nd favorite in PHX (after the 'illegal alien' sombrero one on Calle 16, also by Lalo Cota).  They don't currently have a happy hour but they do have a 'Ladies Night' on Wednesday. $1 off drafts.  They don't allow smoking on the patio. However, their patio is dog-friendly although I've yet to bring my dog since I live walking distance to the Main Ingredient (they have all day happy hour on Sundays and Mondays! $2.50 drafts, folks)  I expect I'll bump my review up to **** stars eventually since I really like the appearance of the place and the beers they bring in. Maybe after I get a hot sandwich?

4esPipNY_4nsBD0DgIX2Jw.text: Went there for valentines day around 8pm. Our waiter came about 5mins after we got out seats and we ordered our drinks. I ordered a lemonade and my girlfriend ordered a Mexican bottled coke. 15mins go by and our waiter stopped by and told us they're making our drinks. Finally after another 10mins he brings the coke but never brought me my lemonade. I didn't know it takes 25mins to bring a botttle of coke that they don't even have to pour just open the bottle and take it to the table. Our waiter had terrible customer service. The food overall was pretty good and the atmosphere was nice, just terrible service from the waiter.

eic7W2xOAkDWDXcQSas2cA.text: I agree with the other reviewers the service is subpar, and I sat at the bar. The beers are good, but the board(of beers on the wall) is lacking in details I want to know when doing a tasting. The restaurant also feels kind of empty. I know their going with a minimalist theme, but it's a little over the top.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4jI_014sxekUvfogaV1Nfg.text: Excellent food!  Excellent beer!  Good prices!  Full of good looking but not pretentious people!  A home run on what an ale house should be....

BoI_XWzv_LovVxAYi5F_xg.text: Everything was great except the service. Hostess was unfriendly and the server even more so (Micah). Probably the most impersonal and stand offish server I've ever had. Grilled cheese was awesome. Fun ambiance. Unfortunate service.

dqhznri24o3V6GE1H6IbiQ.text: It's a great restaurant - plenty of space, lots of open architecture and multiple places to see what the drink options are and how they change. The food...fantastic. Parking can be tricky but if you're willing to walk a bit, you'l find something.

adNTeyROxof5OIIvzBBDiA.text: Best burger place in town!  LOVE, LOVE, LOVE it!  I'm not a beer fan but my friends are and they are way pleased with the assortment of varieties available.  The crowd is urban hip and very attractive.  I have been several times and not had a bad experience yet!  Oh, and the French fries are to DIE for!  Mmmmmmmmm

0ZH7MbPCVxakJoASNlKj_A.text: My husband and I had a dinner at Angel's Trumpet for ~15 friends to celebrate our elopement. We came in at 2pm on a Sunday. It is an awesome space. Perfect open-air seating and spacious layout. As soon as we got there, the manager immediately started putting a row of tables together for us on their patio. Our server, Brendan, was clearly knowledgeable about the beers (noting their alcohol contents, nuanced flavors/characteristics, pairings) and provided polite and timely service. Our food was delicious! Brendan also gave my husband and I a FREE and absolutely scrumptious homemade pop-tart: chocolate cherry, so GOOD. I will let my photos speak for themselves. My *ONLY* complaint is that it was really tough to find an updated menu online. Their business website needs work. Other than that, I had a wonderful experience. Keep up the good work, Angel's Trumpet!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. ridiculous cherry-chocolate pop tart
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. my husband&#39;s spicy chicken sandwich
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. one delicious sammy

3pFiOZzXen7oqtGpen4YXw.text: I have been on a bit of a mission to find the perfect blend of beer and food, the Gastropub. I think I may have found my favorite. Walking in you are greeted by an enormous chalkboard with the current 31 beers on tap as well as the cask fresh wine. An amazing selection of Arizona and other beers. The red ipa was particularly good. Foods is excellent also, I had the avocado salad and fish tacos which were awesome. Nice people and understated service was good, I could see why people may think service a little rude but the are guys that know their beer and are not in your face over friendly which I kind of like. Go check it out.

X9b3BerEFTTmc6u41ncWZA.text: I have to give the 5 plus stars for the utterly amazing selection of craft brews on tap. I stared at the chalk board menu completely dumbfounded and paralyzed by indecision and it took me a few minutes to settle on the Full Sail Amber which was delicious (though you can'r really go wrong with Full Sail, can you?)  The minimal-artsy decor makes it right at home in the downtown arts district and the bar and layout make for a loud, lively atmosphere. I don't think I'll be coming here for meetings because the place is very loud and the beer is just too damned distracting.  It reminds me of the lovechild of Postino and Lux, with Bliss and Lost Leaf as the step-parents. The crowd seems to be a mix of the downtown artsy folks, some of the ASU crowd and the post-work working crowd such as yours truly.  They have a LOVELY patio with beautiful grass and meticulously groomed plants that I would have LOVED to trample on and destroy when I was a kid. This is PERFECT now that the weather is hopefully cooling down....at least at night.  It is a shame that smoking is not allowed on the patio, it is sizeable enough and it makes me sad that I cannot enjoy my beer while indulging my filthy habit. Other than that, the staff are friendly and enthusiastic and the wings look amazing so I think this is going to be a great addition to downtown.

_wH_v5Bbx_SXH1oprIOtGA.text: Great place for an "urban" experience but let's tone down the hipster attitude...you're not that cool.....it's Phoenix.

h0tlX7aPGcmPVu82r-ZPlw.text: Cool place.  Lots of beer on tap.  You can get you beer custom canned to take home.  Really sweet machine that does it.  They have nitro on tap huge plus for me. Indoor outdoor place which is great in the warm Phoenix evening.  Food looked great too but didn't eat.  I want to go back for food.

3RdDo3eFSmggBXvfNOupEA.text: The beer selection here is fantastic, which is why I keep coming back. They have a huge patio which is great for hanging out with some friends. The food on the other hand, has not impressed me at all, so I wouldn't necessarily recommend coming if you're really hungry.  If you're downtown with a group, and looking for a place to grab a beer, I would highly recommend coming by Angels.

D_DyVZO1XLUsnVko9vHghA.text: Good place to meet up for a drink after work. Good selection of brews, wait time too long.

RzDDFiji8V78EoO4wunK0g.text: Great staff, food and beer. The beer selection is always changing and never disappoints. The food is great. Not the best but really good.

KtgtQbpxWYVU5uuc2_0aDQ.text: As a microbrew enthusiast, nothing quenches my thirst like a beer I've never heard of. Angel's Trumpet has tons of those, and one would be wise to follow their Facebook and keep watch for elusive elixirs like Dogfish Head 120 Minute IPA.   Initially, I wasn't impressed with seeing Crispin, Rogue, and Deschutes, but my bartender was able to find the right pint for me. It was categorized as a "Sahti", and it is was freaking delicious.   The food here looks like common grub anyone can enjoy (pizza, burgers, etc.) but with an emphasis on finer ingredients. My friend ordered the pop tart, and it looked tons more fancy than your average breakfast snack!  The atmosphere is calm, everything is super clean, and there's a great patio. This is a place to have a nice sit-down dinner, or socialize in a quiet, almost classy environment. I'll be back to try some dinner, and I'll keep my eyes out on the taps!

ZFOxKXF3vq30FyaJl1bjRg.text: I'd had my eye on this place for a while and we finally got in to check it out this weekend.  Nice open area with a good sized patio too.  We sat at the bar to watch the Derby since we ran out of time to get anywhere else.  They had it on TV but without sound, oh well not a big deal.  We loved their beer selection and the bartenders were all on top of everything, helpful and efficient.  We had a great time and all the food coming out of the kitchen looked awesome.  We only tried their 'pretzels' which are actually just a few little loaves of pretzel bread, not the same but not terrible.  The stools are not the best and not very comfortable but in the end we enjoyed ourselves and were glad we got the chance to visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. So many options

iHGN-ptpdpV00nCmVHW1RA.text: Angles Trumpet Ale House is what every bar should be like. If i had this place anywhere close to me i would be a hardcore regular.   Parking: Only bad part, small lot and metered parking on the street  Decor: Awesome modern decor with a full indoor outdoor area. The whole place opens up and mesh's awesomely. At least in the spring/fall/winter. Might be crazy hot in the summer  Service: They have a lot of people working there who are all very knowledgeable of their crafts beer and in love with their food  FOOD: I don't want to sound like a white girl but OMG. Everything was just stupid stupid good.             Fish Tacos: They are just dummy good. The amount of fish you get in these things are just stupid good. Every bite was a little bit of heaven. By far the best battered fish tacos I've every had. Cabbage mix, beans, crumbled cheese, uhhhh falling in love again just thinking about it             Burgers: All the patties are delicious. The buns work perfectly with all the additions they put on them. If you love egg on everything like I do, just get any burger and add an egg. It's so good!!!            POP TART: This made me reevaluate my life of desserts. Seriously the flakyness, barryness, sugarness. Just every part of what they got in that thing is crazy good.     Just go, don't think about it!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blueberry homemade pop tarts
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish Tacos already ate but I had too
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Matador!!

yoQhItCgCt5L6VmfxATFYw.text: This place is such a wonderful little hangout. It's hard to get people to argue against an evening at Angel's, and for great reason. The beer selection will have something for everyone, and the food is pretty darn good. You can drop in for a beer as part of a stroll in the neighborhood, or you can snag a table and post up for several hours. The place can get crowded, but it's not they're fault they're doing the things right.   The staff are great with recommending beers on the 31-draft rotating menu based on what you like, and the prices and ABV are right on the menu as well, so it's hard to be unpleasantly surprised, even if you're not the adventuresome type.  My only critique of this place is that if you prefer spirits or an alcohol-free evening, Angel's has very little to offer. Without the fun of exploring the beer selection, the food goes from "pretty darn tasty" to "I'd rather have gone somewhere else."

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 31 drafts and cans to go!!!

XT2wjRkUY4JwAKRmE7RdZQ.text: My sis recommended this place on our recent visit to Phoenix, and my husband and I were both impressed! Not only with their long list of beer choices (with locations listed, as well as price), but with their menu options as well. I can't remember everything I ordered, but I know we ordered the poutine. So yummy. Canadians got one thing right, I suppose.  We ended up staying most of the night here after eating dinner. The staff were nice and accommodating. The crowd got younger and louder as the night wore on, but it was still a fun place to be.   I wish we were closer, because I want to try one of their tv dinners! We would definitely return.

xhEmNSe7kZitMTKZ7Nq31w.text: i love Angels Trumpet Ale House. This is such a cute and hip place for friends to enjoy for beers and excellent creative food. To start, we had their famous spicy spam sliders. Oh man! That was definitely one of most creative sliders that i have ever had. Kudos to Angels Trumpet Ale House to balance out the salty, spicy, and sweet flavor of the spam. This is a must try if you visit here! Furthermore, pick from their over 20 different selections of craft beers! You will start the night well with these. I also had their famous tractor pizza, which was again mind-blowingly amazing. Overall, I really enjoyed the experience there with their wide variety of beer selection and creative food. If you are looking for a fun and relaxing night, Angels Trumpet Ale House is definitely the place to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tractor pizza

Olgs9do_g6Jz5_1WZt_Nuw.text: Gonna be short about this place....GO! If you like tons of crafts, great bar food and a chill vibe.

tznCiiTQE-THQpvm2wHEdw.text: I've heard only good things about this place, and I was meeting a friend for dinner on a Saturday night, so I decided to give it a try. The dining area is very spacious and they have a huge patio. We were seated promptly and then asked what we wanted to drink, their beer menu consists of 30+ beers all listed on a chalk board above the bar. I wanted to try a bunch so I decided on the beer flight, our server was very helpful and informative in the decision process. I told him what kind of beers I liked and didn't like and he wrote down his suggestions for my flight. All of the beers were very tasty and I decided on a few faves. For our meal, I chose the casper pizza and my friend got the fluffernutter, both were very good and the portion size was large.  I will definitely return to try more beer and food, as it's good spot for getting together with friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beer tasting

IvSJNbBhoT7TNr4LArdekA.text: First time here... everything was excellent.  Great vibe, good service, unique beers, and awesome food.  it was too cold outside but they got a nice patio for when the weather warms up.  I look forward to the next time i return. I want to try the homemade Pop Tarts!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. pretzel marshmellow desert thingy. need i say more?
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. short rib? grilled cheese with fries + homemade katchup. as larry david would say &#34;pretty, pretty, prettty good&#34;
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. the pretzel app. cane with 4 pretzels and two dipping sauces (cheese and mustard). So Bomb!!

Z6OOctsWMwaV9Uo2eRXS-w.text: My wife and I first visited Angels Trumpet in September 2015 after being told we needed to check it out by some friends from the burbs (apparently this is better than Applebee's). It was kind of "good enough" but had some decent beers to give it a notch above mediocre at first take. That said, the server couldn't tell us much about the beers..... I'm pretty sure we got the "light beer" vs "dark beer" comment, or something of the sort - very disappointing for a server at an ale house (she later admitted, "I'm not really a beer drinker"). Overall a kind of "meh" experience.  About a month later, a client recommended meeting here and I thought it was worth giving it a second try. This was a better experience than the previous one, but still just not hitting it on the head for me. This place is seriously missing something in the way of ambiance or otherwise. It feels so bland and mediocre, and yet I feel it has so much potential.   I've been back a few times since last fall, reluctantly - to meet up with friends/colleagues - each time getting yet another "Well, it's not Applebee's, I guess" kind of experience. As of March, I've decided to put an end to the repeated disappointment. I made my last visit there just before learning that the owner sabotaged an effort to build up the area's appeal to residents like me, which was supported by an awesome group of nearby bars/restaurants and others. Wow, seriously?! Way to ensure that your ambiance never improves! Angel's Trumpet: not Applebee's and not feeling good in the neighborhood. Go somewhere else if you want quality, service, and genuineness from a pub.

oXCkePZol7uszI7XImR7zQ.text: Is it really possible that I've not written a review for ATAH? Apparently so and its LONG overdue.   I've probably been into Angel's about 20 times over the past few years, attending their Anniversary parties, Beer Week Events, Tuesday TV dinner nights and, most importantly, as a pre-and post-game ritual before Dbacks games. This year I got myself a mini-season ticket package so have been in about 5 times in the past couple months.   This is THE beer bar in downtown. The selection is awesome, I always go for a flight because the pints can be a bit pricey but the flights are always $9 unless they have a rare beer on that's not flight-eligible. The food is incredible here, from the pizzas to the burgers to the salads and of course the homemade pop tarts. The staff can be hit and miss, but, if you sit at the bar you're pretty much guaranteed an awesome conversation with a top-notch bartender. Sam has been working the last few times I was in and is a great beer-fan to talk to get recommendations from, but every bartender has always been really good there.   Downsides, hmmm...well its very loud in there at times, super noisy building. Oh, and they close at 12, which is a bummer if your game went extra innings and you were ready to drink up a few rounds of awesome beer afterwards. But, they don't serve liquor, so I get it -can always head across the street. Really though, this place rocks. Come in, sit at the bar, get a flight and enjoy the awesomeness yourself. You'll be glad you did, Cheers!

Wki6vAx_lwSPKQ2JWkwoRw.text: I thought this restaurant was overhyped for what it was. The poutine was very underwhelming and the spam slider were not very impressing. The service was good though, maybe the kitchen crew just had a bad day.

v2CnJTcrrAe645hnuPPFdA.text: A great recommend by someone from work.. a wow culinary experience and a brew pub superb choice . With wines from my own experience in northern Cali a blessing too . Great experience and I look forward to my next visit and I will surely sit outside to enjoy the city view and misters garden zen view. Will be back soon to partake

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Angel with the devil
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Doesn&#39;t get better
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Love this place the menu is amazing . Trying the avocado salad and black and blue burger ..atmosphere is hoppie!!!like my brew

QthmuHCb-S1XMaSZz-ad7g.text: Since moving to Phoenix a bit over a year ago, Angel's Trumpet has become my favorite place to grab a craft beer and a bite to eat.   It's a great spot to meet with a group of friends or to just belly up to the bar and try a new beer. Be prepared for a possible wait if you want a spot at the bar though. I've rarely come here when it's not hoppin' (no beer pun intended... actually that's a great beer pun).  Since they regularly change taps, you'll never get bored of the beer selection. That's truly what keeps me coming back again and again. The atmosphere is laid back and the service has always been friendly as well, so that doesn't hurt the return factor either.   Aaaaaand that's my no non-sense review update, Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy National Beer Day! Abbey Brewing Company ~ Monk&#39;s Dubbel
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. AleSmith Brewing: YuleSmith (Winter) Imperial Red... IBU 48; ABV 8.5

n3s1CQETJtZ77AP5796cUQ.text: Great food, amazing beers and good atmosphere. What more could you wish for! They brought out corn hole for the kids and a bowl of water for the dog. Love this spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_LWDU354PMKp5Ji8icRApg.text: Stopped in for a pint and a bite.  Great bartenders!  Told them what beer I liked and they gave suggestions for my next (with tastes first to be sure before I ordered a full pint).  The matador brisket sandwich on pretzel roll was amazing.  Two thumbs way up from me!!

cnX_CESHsVUNMKx3Dun5lw.text: EXPENSIVE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  The beers are at least 2$ overpriced the meals are good but again slightly overpriced. My frozen fish stick tacos were twelve dollars for two of the and a small ketchup holder of beans. They use pizza pans to serve their food and all other dishes (aside from beer glasses) are plastic or styrofoam (water cups).  Basically you pay 65$ for four beers and two meals with chips and salsa.  What you should pay is about 45-50 for the same thing.  Oh and you can expect poor service to include missing ingredients for you meals and a lack of concern from your servers.  If you choose to eat here good luck.    They get two stars for the great selection of beer.  Otherwise it would be one star.

UIsmyP-Le--p3bhOB4Uw-A.text: It's taken me a while to write this review because I didn't want to write it seething mad.   However, its been three months and the experience is still on my mind so I have to get it off my chest.    I was so excited to take our close friends and family to Angels Trumpet to celebrate my husband's graduation.  Angels is a local spot, and since we were downtown residents I wanted to make sure we took them to a special place.  Some of our guests had never eat there and it had been on their "must visit" list for a while.  After my husband's graduation ceremony we made our way to Angels.  We were taking a group of 9 people to celebrate his day.    We ordered our food and everything was fine until my dad tried his food.  He took a few bites out of one of the chicken legs and was turned off.  He asked my father in law next sitting to him to take a bite out of another leg and my father in law was turned off as well.  I didn't try it, but if it was enough for both these men to not want to take another bite, I decided to notify our waiter and hopefully exchange it for something else or maybe just take it back to the kitchen in case it wasn't cooked correctly.    The waiter seemed fine at first, but then when he went to consult management he came back with a much different attitude.  He came back very snarky and patronizing because two of the legs were bitten into.  He said that since they had eaten "half" of the order that they couldn't do anything about it.  Okay, back up for a moment.  My dad took a bite and then my father in law took a bite of another leg to see if the taste was just my dad's dislike or if the chicken was really bad.  It's NOT like my dad ate half his plate and decided he was full and wanted to get a free out of it.    My dad is a little more passive than I.  He didn't want to make it a big deal so he placed another order for a different dish.  I was seething!!!!!!  My dad basically gave his place double his business because his first dish was awful.  This waiter was going to make us pay for the awful chicken, and had the nerve to get offended that my dad didn't like the chicken.  It was as if this waiter was the one who cooked the chicken.  Really guy???!!  We were a large group and, no doubt, we were going to be faced with a hefty bill.  The least they could have done was not give us a flipping attitude.  I decided to look for the manager.  Turns out it was the bartender.  He told me the same thing the waiter told me.  So at this point, it makes sense.  The waiter is just relaying same awful attitude and terrible customer service as his boss.  In the end, they offered to just let us pay half of the cost of the chicken plate.  What a headache and we still paid for half the chicken even though we didn't eat half!!  Look, I don't want to split hairs on what they should have done or what is considered good customer service.  But the attitudes of the manager and the waiter were absolutely unacceptable.  Thats what made it such a bad experience.  Sure one of the dishes was bad, but if they just apologized or did something nice everything would have been fine.  I felt bad for our party because we were there to have a great time and Angels' staff was less than accommodating.  This restaurant is STINGY, rude, and I don't recommend it to anyone.

AjDwosimVoCjmNjJSgHmxw.text: Made a quick trip to Phx this weekend and while there we decided to check this place out.  Wow! What a great decision on our part.  We wanted something located in the downtown area that offered a good selection of food and brews.  This place was perfect.  We had great service, great food and plenty of good beers.  This will be our "go to" spot every time we come to Phx now.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

lnNxrkdMghswN2tqhgAlIA.text: Beer selection was 5/5 100%.  Food was really meh and heavy. Even for a "gastropub" it wasn't what I expected. Service was fine, not bad but not super good. We would come here again, for beer only though.

z_hUJV0Bq-G50DU-JqALNQ.text: So disappointed. My husband and I went here tonight for the first time and were so disappointed. The reviews and photos are great, but our experience did not match. I had the grilled cheese and salad. The salad was good, but the sandwich was mostly bread. The filling was so slim. My husband had the BBQ Brisket sandwich and it was the same for him. He had fries and they don't have regular ketchup. The server was nice, but wasn't around much; we had to get his attention for our check. Not sure we'll go back since there are so many other restaurants we want to try in the area.

oISo_9XhSiwoPQGnG04hYw.text: The food and drinks were great and our server,  Lucille was wonderful. Will definitely be coming back!

n6YmjmJE6cwcfImzpy2VUA.text: After my flight arrived at PHX I randomly selected this place to plop down for a couple hours while I waitED for my daughter to get off work.  After my Uber driver dropped me off I realized on entering the front door that I have been here before, over a year ago, and loved it!  The Hop Chowda IPA went well with the Big Guppy tacos.  Nice casual vibe to the place.  I will be back!!

nIA_N7Le2q_yhsPNGaqBIA.text: Great little gem to stop by for a beer on a low key kinda night. Nothing fancy but their list of beers is endless. The flights are surprisingly cheap and a heavier pour than I was anticipating so I was happy! We also tried one of their daily dinner specials and let's just say there weren't any leftovers.

1GSceHhpSq-Xo-PPriTrqg.text: Angels is the correct term for this place because there must be some angels in the kitchen and serving the ale. Such an awesome place and so good.

k0iKWWVQvpryO_Txavu7sA.text: Went for my daughter birthday and had the most delicious cider had a wonderful time. Large variety of beer, cider and ale.

YRIL6uABLd02BQYrArI9Yg.text: They have a GIANT chalkboard filled with beer and wine on tap. Yes please! The food was also really good. We are so glad we found this place. We will be coming back fo sho!

YmTk61Y65dFE6AvLMTOQZQ.text: Here are my 2 biggest gripes about this place. It is loud. Like really loud, so loud you have to really come close to yelling to be heard.  Also the service is mediocre at best. I really don't think this is anyone elses fault but managements for running the place, what seems to be, threadbare  at best. The staff were hustling on a Friday night and even so they were clearly overwhelmed. Maybe on weeknights, this can be a quiet little place to go to but don't bother on the weekend. Every single time I have been here, it has been packed.   The beer selection is excellent, they do offer samples if you cannot decided what to get before you get a full pour. I wish they had more Belgian beers on tap but there's so much variety to pick and choose from that it is impossible to get everything up there anyway.   The food selection is good and I mostly stick to the appetizers or snacks when I'm here, I mean lets be honest I'm here for the beer and so far it has not disappointed. The waits were not too long for the food regardless of how busy they were , so kudos to the kitchen staff for hustling like no tomorrow.   Great place for large groups, the outdoor seating area has some games and is nice when the weather outside isn't oppressive. The patio is dog friendly so bring your puppers cuz they need some love too :)   Fun fact: Enjoy the mural outside by the empty plot of land before someone throws up apartments all over it. Angle's Trumpet Ale House and the Goldwater institute sued the city to prevent a taxbreak to Amstar/McKinley LLC over a proposed 6 million taxbreak to build micro apartments on that empty plot of land. Not sure how I feel politically about this, but hey, beer.. amirite ?

Z-R3ejmH6oyRxjPMc8Rqkw.text: Great beer selection and a very chill place to hang with friends.

NXvcMWHJlJb_HVe_B-pKmA.text: Amazing food! And they helped us out making a couple eggs for our little one without hesitation.

bO2phsrlNW9y6RZagfHKxQ.text: If I can sum up Angels Trumpet in two words: hipster beer.   It's located in the RoRow district [location along makes anything hipster-ish], and they have a crazy selection of rotating local, seasonal, and craft beers. Both times I've been, the chalkboard has been updated a few times. It's a positive and a negative if you find a really good beer to drink and they run out. Happened to me recently when I came to hang out with friends, and to my surprise the beer I ordered was not the one I drank.   If you have to wait for a table and want to get a [cute cupcake tin] flight, definitely write down beers from the big board while you wait. Don't write down the names, just the #'s as that's how they fill the sample cups. And keep an eye on the board if something changes! They also have a complimentary matching mini board outside if you decide to sit in the patio area.   My first visit was with a fairly large group on a fun light-rail beer crawl we planned. Angels Trumpet was on the plan because of its proximity to the Metro and Yelp told me they have a lot of beer [both True]. One of the girls arrived ahead of most of us so she was able to secure a few high tops next to another - wasn't a problem for the spot. I can't remember our servers name, but he was pretty good for having to deal with ~15 drunk-ish people and all of the beers and food we needed and getting our checks not mixed up. Make sure to order wings mixed in the sauce! They are so bomb dot com.   The most recent time I came my friends and I sat outside as one of the guys brought his puppy! While the beer, wings, and company were fabulous, the service then was just bad. We had a hard time keeping up with our waitress's location when we needed her to order anything, get water refills, and get our checks. I noticed she would disappear for 15min at a time or so. Luckily though another waiter tried to care of us in her absence.  I hope by my next visit that the service improves. Definitely want to check out their cheeky tv dinner and trivia night!

X8oWvJyxYa9IRCsz08jJ1A.text: Trust your fellow Yelpers and order the Spam sliders. First time in YEARS I have even thought of ordering sliders and they didn't disappoint.  Just the right amount of crispy and then the slaw on top was perfect. Just do it!

iWKfVABvcsuaaoQLgufRUQ.text: Great craft beer selection. Food is yummy. The vibe is pretty cool, it just gets wayyyyyy too loud on the weekend. Other than that, I love this place.

DY23Emh7eBvjaA1x0WEtAg.text: I have been here a couple of times; one time mid-day when it was not too busy and this time during evening. It was very busy and parking was a little challenging. Fortunately someone was leaving so I took their space. The beer selection is large with more than 25 taps, and all a good variety of styles. They also have wine available if beer isn't your thing. I ordered a stout that I have had before and enjoy. My friend had a cider. This time I also ordered food. Looking over the menu they have a lot of variety, but I happened to see an odd tray someone left on our table. It was a cardboard compartmentalized tray with words written in each box. What the heck? Then I noticed on board by the wall there was a listing of specials. One said TV dinner, and that is what this tray was advertising. The special tonight was a Hawaiian pulled pork sandwich with a grilled pineapple & island sauce, Hawaiian macaroni salad, citrus vinaigrette salad, coconut rice, and banana cake w/ cream cheese frosting. I asked how much and it was $10 and change - cheaper than a burger. I was also intrigued by the special "Homemade pop tart", but I didn't order that. I went with the TV dinner and it was a lot of food. The pulled pork was excellent, but the cake stole the show. Man, what I nice meal that was - like no other TV dinner I have had, that's for certain. The decor and ambiance of the bar is relaxing - very open, nice subway tiles, and an excellent staff. I highlight recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hawaiian tv dinner special. So good!
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;TV Dinner&#34; special

jcIx42WeZY96GQO0GuOT4A.text: Visited here on a Sunday for lunch.  I had the veggie burger and my husband had the jalapeno burger along with a Pilsner & Amber Ale.  Both burgers were large portions and delicious.  The habanero slaw was ok - hard to keep this dish fresh unless you cook/prepare with each order. Ambiance/patio is great when the weather is nice.  They advertised a tv-dinner menu worth checking out for a future Tuesday evening.  Gave three stars because they did not have all the beers available on the chalkboard menu nor do they serve any domestic beers, which can and would be an option when the selection is sparse (and IMHO it was slim pickings for our palette)!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

P4vQjPPney7Cld6xlZJEGg.text: A good and varied beer selection, with affordable flights available. They also appear to have Crowlers available for takeout.  The menu is simple, with a few sandwiches, some tacos, and usually two salads and varies from day to day.  My experience with the food has always been positive. It's not gonna knock your socks off, but it's better than most casual beer pub food.  The service has always been very good to outstanding. Although the crowd is mostly on the  younger side, I've seen plenty of older folks and a few families.

WOa8oNdEuXr7pMZ4LdjR9g.text: One of the first things I noticed about this place is that they have wine ON TAP! WHAAAAAAAAAAAT! Even though I love wine and I think it's cool they have it on tap, I always go for their beers. They have a huge selection. I went there on a Friday night once and even though they were slammed, the bartender made sure to attend to us promptly and even made a suggestion based on my preferences. He let me sample a beer first before I committed. That's always nice. Their wings and pizza were okay. Wings weren't that crispy and the pizza wasn't the freshest, but it did the job of filling us up. I'd come here to drink again. Maybe next time I'll skip the food.

KujoNmKtet4hG18KW4z0Fw.text: I love this place! Talk about great beers! There is something for everyone, the taps are always rotating and they're always well-poured and perfectly cold.  The food is also solid. We ordered the pretzels, which were SO GOOD. I probably could have eaten the whole plate but I like to keep my friends.  I also ordered the hot wings, which were crispy and delicious. Everyone was pleased with their food.  Angels get s busy on the weekends, so be prepared to wait. We went across the street to the Cobra Arcade Bar to have a beer and play a few games while we waited to be seated.  Cheers!

wqhXhMs9QJSDRpw3bky8Ug.text: My friend and I stopped in tonight for dinner after and were pleasantly surprised with everything! We split the spam sliders and each got beer flights and flatbread pizzas. Yoooo   Beer Flights: stouts are still not for me but everything else was delicious and the cupcake tins were cute.  Spam Sliders: all my friends are super hype about spam and I've only ever had it in masubis so these were yummy! very flavorful and the buns were perfect.  Flatbread Pizzas: I love that you have an option to add fried eggs on top. Eggs make everything better. The fun-guy was one of the best pizzas I've had in a while.   Great service and atmosphere too! Would definitely come back to sample more beers and try the pop tarts.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tractor Pizza
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fun-Guy pizza + Eggs
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beers and Spam Sliders

dGJwyira_UblpI-ivYOWPA.text: Loved this place, I have been back many times.  Great beer selection and the food menu was terrific. Wait staff knows their product and gave great tips on ordering the food. It is such a cool place inside, very hipster.

RvTSaqykn9jKfqmJUGtnng.text: Delicious food, friendly service and a huge selection of IPA what more could you ask for ? The atmosphere is very cool I came here with my husband and our two young kids. The only reason I couldn't give a 5 Star is because no official kids menu which I knew before we came so I just packed my picky toddlers pb&j's. If they would have or will eat some chicken tenders and fries it would have been perfect. We live in scottsdale and where on our way to the circus and so happy we found this place we will make the trip down here again it was so good!!!! I highly recommend the Outlaw burger they where kind and where very accommodating for my request of no bun and places it on some lettuce it was cooked perfect and the flavors where amazing , my husband ordered the fried chicken sandwich which he said was very good. He's a bit of a beer snob and was very happy to see the great beer selection. Hope they open one closer they would do amazing in N. Scottsdale / N.Phx area .fingers crossed

-YPsMoxDkKO-dOpJlJyx6A.text: It's not a bad place to come and get a drink.  It's not a brewery, they just have a lot of beers on tap. Area is cool as filmbar and cobra are across the street. Had some food and nothing really stood out to me, I don't remember it being bad.

DWA3x64zHdoY05V_t-9Uyg.text: I love this place so much me and my friends have been coming here for a couple of years now the food is always so yummy

ZFIaZReoLz4tK9QRF5HSXg.text: This is definitely one of my favorite spots in downtown.  They have a extensive selection of beers on tap. They do a 6 beer flight for 10 bucks, which at that price is so amazing! Their wings with their house made hot sauce (make sure to say tossed wings) is good. The sauce had the most unique taste I've had had on my tastebuds. Spivey, tangy, sour and sweet all at once that just works so well.  My girlfriend ordered the sweet chili chicken flatbread and I got myself the burger. I have to say from the start, this is probably the fattest burger I've ever gotten. Every component in the burger was perfect. The burgee was cooked perfectly medium rare. The fries were delicious. They even come with house made ketchup that was honestly probably the best thing on my plate.  My girlfriends flatbread was equally amazing. The chicken was flavorful and not dry. The bread was soft with a nice crunchy bottom.  Absolutely coming back for the wings and that flatbread. Be warned guys, come with a big appetite.

ClA4_vg1jgf_KpYtK82j0A.text: Everything was fantastic. We are not downtown very often so I just did a quick search and this place sounded interesting.  What a great choice. Not much to look at from the outside but you pleasently surprised once you open the door. Your are greeted buy a hip urban tap House with ample seating and a dog friendly patio.  Very extensive brew selection and although the menu isn't huge it has some really great items to choose from.  The food was fabulous and the service was attentive.  Not sure if I will get back to this area of town but I hope so

OhWcMJyhFBueJIu9BTdo4Q.text: Stopped here to grab a drink and supper before a Diamondbacks game.  I was impressed by he beer selection and unique menu items.  We had the pretzel bites, chicken tacos and the cauliflower pizza.  Food was amazing.  The service was great especially for it being a very busy time.  Would come back next time in Arizona.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

mjAaGzZknnyWt3IqnsA-4g.text: What a great place! Went here with a bunch of people from work for happy hour. They were crazy busy, but still gave good service.   The grilled cheese I had was amazing. I can't explain the delicious combination of flavors, but it involved honey, bacon, & various cheeses. Go there & get it ASAP. I can't drink beer, but I had a good New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc. Overall a great experience.

WJHpJCRwZVW7vpg5VM5yxw.text: Fun, quirky place with plenty of drinks to choose from. I appreciated that they had a cider for me to choose as I don't drink beer. I thoroughly enjoyed the fish tacos for dinner and friends all had burgers. Very delicious! Favorite thing was the pretzel appetizers that we had to get because we were so hungry. Friendly service and decent prices for the quality of food we got. Only downside was the wait. It was 9pm on a Friday and when we walked in, we were told 15 minutes. However it was almost an hour. We stood there the entire time (a group of 3) near the hostesses and they never once reassured us that it would be soon. A friend went up to them to ask if it would be soon and they couldn't give us an answer. We were pretty hangry by the time we got our food. That's the only downside, though.

zZ_3xdMSf25BmqCja7D9nA.text: If it's a Tuesday and I'm in Phoenix, then I'll be at Angels Trumpet for TV dinner night. For $8, you get the most amazing selection of dishes. Each week is a different creation. Last week I had meatballs, pesto pasta, mushroom salad, garlic bread, with a cannoli cheesecake. Even if I'm not in town, I check the Facebook page each Tuesday to see the TV dinner meal.  On days other than Tuesday, I enjoy the pizzas. My favorite is the Tractor with 2 eggs, bacon and a variety of cheeses.   The continually rotating beer list is always top notch. Great variety and selection from breweries around the country. If there are a couple I have my eye on, the beer flight is a good option.  Always a great meal and drinks at Angels Trumpet!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. TV dinner Tuesdays

gZT2Icg2kkS26aRsLev4WA.text: We went here after a Dbacks game on a Sunday. The place was moderately busy but loud. They have a HUGE selection of craft beers and a decent selection of food to go with it. The service was so-so. They had 3 guys working behind the bar and only one really took the time to converse with us.   This is one of the newer business on Roosevelt Row so it is a typical trendy place in downtown Phoenix. Overall, not a bad place to grab a beer downtown. Just don't go expecting much conversation with your bartender.

dbSkGAFbsXStpI80K3oLEA.text: Delicious food and great beer selection. We had the spud  taquitos and chipotle hummus. Both were excellent and the service was jovial and prompt.

pY0j8tMglAPowg6ozga1Fw.text: Went here last night for some dinner with friends. Let's me start off by saying I didn't drink here so I can't comment on their beers, which I know is huge. I did have their grilled cheese and it was good but not great. The cheese was like it had been melted but then sat out for a bit so by the time I got it it somewhat rehardened. My friend was extremely impressed by the wings, so maybe I just didn't get the right thing. I will definitely give this place another try to experience their beers and try something else off the menu. Dog friendly patio is a huge plus too. All in all not blown away but not discouraged from going back.

9bt5e_ylo6Pp3a5jS9FvLw.text: I found this place completely by accident and was so glad I did!   What a cool brewpub with surprisingly fun beers and experimentally delicious menu!  Initially, the service left a bit to be desired, but after finally being seated, my waitress was fantastic!   I did a flight and I like that you order by beer number and write it down, so there is no confusion as to what you ordered or what you are getting. With the large selection, this is definitely a solid system to have in place. I also like that mix n match is an affordable option here.  I had the reuben, and it was decent and an order of the house made poptarts, which were delicious! An all around solid beer and food find in the Valley of the Sun!

bP2PT03oQMoLxVlVF5Zpfw.text: Quiet on the outside, but full of energy on the inside. Seems to be a great place for friends or couples. Music seemed too long for dates, but you can get away from that on the patio if you want. The honeycomb/chicken wire plays well to the classy-hipster theme.  Well staffed. Our server was attentive when he needed to be, and not overly but didn't miss filling waters, beer, food, either. Nice work on that hire!  Beer: Beer selection is great, and staff knows what to recommend based on what you're in the mood to drink. Or, get a flight, and you'll get a range. The flights are served in a muffin tin so you can easily carry and go play bags in the patio, or sit until your table is ready. I saw wine, but my group stuck with beer.   Good ole fashioned:  great, medium cook for me and was cooked correctly. Fries come with natural tomato ketchup sauce (awesome!!). The Cole slaw is a healthy portion as well.  Farm flat bread:  recommended by the server and he was right, it was delicious and a more veggie friendly option.  Riblets: Healthy serving, great bbq sauce. (Bones included in the but size pieces.) I couldn't find on the menu so not sure the menu name of what my friend ordered.  Chipotle hummus:  healthy serving, big pieces and easy to share. Quantity and quality trumps the presentation.  Hot pretzel: Cooked perfectly, soft middle with crispy outside. Cheese sauce is delicious. Literally everyone orders these so look around if you're hesitant. I think 4 on a platter. We are them too fast before I could take a photo.  Pop tart: I heard and read about this, but we were to full and I'll have to come back to try.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Good ole fashioned, Cole slaw
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Farm flat bread
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Good ole fashioned, fries, natural ketchup.

pHBp5z12bLglR98ilGa_Lw.text: Parking lots not huge but the foods great, the beer selections good, the staff is friendly, plenty of indoor and outdoor seating (with heaters)

0tFp9ZIfxEZE48FFlFWrVQ.text: This place was recommended to me by a few local Yelpers. So after arriving a day early for a business trip, my coworker and I stopped here for a few beers and a late lunch.  The place is interesting with a long bar, high top table seating as well as regular sized table seating, a mid-century modern corner seating area and a large outdoor patio with plenty of additional seating.  The beer menu is on a chalkboard above the bar. I had two dark beers while I was here which were good but I was eally craving a sour which they did not have any on tap. Oh well.
