For lunch, my coworker and I both ordered the Matador sandwich which was beef covered in havarti horseradish cheese, peppers, onion and mushrooms on a pretzel bun with a side order of fries. The sandwich was great and beautifully presented. The one criticism is the pretzel roll was a bit dry. The fries were good also and the ketchup was amazing.   Really enjoyed the place and talking to our server. But still would have liked to see a sour on the beer menu. Apparently sours aren't as popular yet in Phoenix as the rest of the country.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

v-tG8rvwgKZv740miab_dA.text: Cool vibe the antithesis of Scottsdale. An amazing,eclectic selection of beers. Nice outdoor patio. If you're downtown, don't miss this beer lovers  hangout. Have not eaten here but food looks and smells delicious

tfzpQYBUxyTAZVmASU1PlQ.text: (Lyrics - Robbie Williams - Angel)  I sit and wait At Angel Trumpet Ale House And do they know The places where we go When we want a drink...... 'Cause I have been told That their craft beer sets the bars up high So when I'm thirsty for a drink Thoughts running through my head And I feel the love is dead I'm loving Angels Trumpet Ale House instead  And through it all Angel's offers me 31 taps of selection A lot of food and confection Whether I'm right or wrong And down the waterfall  Wherever it may take me I know that life won't break me When I come to call, Angel's won't forsake me I'm loving angels Angels Trumpet Ale House instead.  Angel Trumpet Ale House is located in the heart of the cool and hip part of Phoenix.  What I mean is its where all the hipsters hangout.  It's all good!  I actually enjoy the atmosphere here.  It's not over the top nor do I have to dress my ass off - though I do anyways!  Like most hipster bars, I feel like I should ride my bike with a banana seat except I don't have bike nor would I get one with a banana seat.    Anyways, I ordered a special tonight, which was called the Garfield.  Not sure why really I guess the Chef's name was Mr. Garfield maybe.  It was pretty much a low carb tortilla wrapped with turkey and the fixins' along with some fries.  I didn't think much of it.  My friend ordered the Smokin Legs, which was roasted chicken legs, but she got 3.  It was obviously a lot for her since I think she only ate one and nibbled on her sides.  Needless to say, I'm not a fan of their food!  Then again this is an Ale house!  I really do like this place because their selection of crafted beers.  Daily changes one what is brewing so that's awesome.  Instead of your usual Stella, Bud, or Peroni, Ale house offers some funky ass names and taste I can't describe.  Over 31 selections so it can be overwhelming, but take your time Angel Trumpet isn't going away anytime soon.  I say start with what you usually drink flavor wise and then work your way into the adventure side! - Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

xuyATsu9NefSwsTI_2aWIw.text: We came in on a Sunday afternoon after a spring training game. We were impressed on their space and beer selection.  I had a beer flight, $10 for 6- 3oz. pours, a great price as they don't have restrictions or upcharges for pricier beers.  Location-close to downtown.  Parking- metered only, $1.50/hr. Inside- nice size bar, open main area inside with large patio.  Ambience- decent/chill, not loud or rowdy A big Con was the limited and pricey food menu. We really wanted to snack on something but nothing looked appetizing or worth the price. Overall, still would definately return for the great beer selection.

-DUWKfq6o4foodbJ3GJUhg.text: We've been here twice and both times had good service and delicious food. The fish tacos are amazing, particularly the Big Guppy. They have both indoor and outdoor seating with umbrella heaters outside. There is both table and lounge seating outdoors as well. The parking lot is small and this place is popular so plan for metered parking on side streets - most take debit cards. Due to its location & the arts festivals, this place is VERY busy on the 1st Friday of each month.

PX0Qf-edtjQs6TxdnbRhkQ.text: So disappointed we called 3 times, emailed 3 times, went in once to make a reservation for a party of 25 for our sons rehearsal dinner party.  When I went in I was told to email only, never got response from 3 emails, so I called 3 times was told to email, then was told they would call me back.  I was told on one of those calls "we don't save tables".  I explained it was a party of 25 on a Thursday night and felt the cost would go to at least $800 to $1000 all cash!  The employee said he would at least run it by the owner and no matter what get back to me in the next two days. It has been two weeks and no return call.    My son took his fiance there for their first date, the song they were playing is now their song.  They were so disappointed that we could not do the dinner there...Even just a phone call back or a quick email, saying your money is no good here, we would rather turn it away!  Well Angels Trumpet you don't have to call we are going else where....

uRdIjpGnFNjIJ0v2Lqo8ww.text: I've been here a couple times and love it. The food is amazing and the beer selection is great. Parking kinda sucks, but well worth it. Prices are great as well. When I'm downtown, this is my go to place to eat.

o2d5faRlTvfax9dM8CHaNQ.text: Angel's Trumpet is one of my favorite stops to hit in downtown Phoenix. Really nice atmosphere, excellent and friendly service, and a fantastic rotating beer list. Definitely a good spot to grab a bite & a brew. Super bike friendly w/ a great patio area.   Tuesday's are the best, when they have a different weekly "TV dinner" special for only $7. You get a variety of delicious items that fit within a certain theme, served on cute "school lunch" trays.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. TV Dinner: smoked turkey enchiladas, pasta salad, &#34;Juan-tons&#34;, cornbread w/ chipotle raspberry drizzle &amp; Horchata ice cream.

M08Lm9tCR1atbTCTuzax9g.text: What a fun place!!   I don't drink beer, but I got the chocolate beer. wow!  I loved it! Four of us shared  5 appetizers.  They were so good!  We got 2 different types of the riblets, the pretzels, a trio of taquitos, wings. Our server was so nice!  He was full of information. You are missing out if you don't try it!

UkBLVnkzctsbPfo8m6z_hQ.text: Was really excited to try this place.  I'm a big fan of German, Irish, and Belgian beers so I was convinced that I would really enjoy my experience here.  I came with my wife and a few friends and decided to try the beer flight.  Unfortunately most of my beer choices were unavailable.  How annoying.    On top of that the service was sporadic.  Ordering took a really long time because the cranky server was always buzzing by our table, but never stopping by.  The beers I ended up trying were just so so.  Another problem with Angels is that I actually enjoy talking to people, which at the decibel level maintained in the ale house is pretty much impossible.  Due to the awful service I chose to decrease the tip for the server.  Probably to about 10 percent, which considering the service was generous.  The server then had the hutzpah to follow me out and ask me if I had a problem with the service and ask for more money.  I complained to management about this, but they did nothing. Suffice to say, I will not be back.

JydYM8nlD14nIE7zcHsOaQ.text: Can sum this place up in a few sentences:  1. Great rotating beer selection (albeit the menu is a challenge to read from several tables.) 2. Amazing large patio (which is great because this place gets overly crowded.) 3. Meh food (but hey it lets you try more beers without falling down.) 4. Loud (you didn't really come here to talk to your friends, did you? Good. Drink more.)

l3B6q-zudYH9iiZPOU7_Ug.text: solid beer selection thats changed regularly. had the green chili enchilada, very good and hearty...could use more chips with it but good flavor. will be back. solid bartender and staff.

hTifhxcVLfryixxRM8SsPA.text: Love this place for a nice day and some good beer and food. Staff is on it. Been there multiple times and each is helpful when selecting a beer or food and your drink will always be ready for a refill. Love this spot!! Only, you'll need to park down the street and keep up your parking meter, don't ever count on parking in their lot. Still love this spot!!!

VbygNMIeGEOCNAtgl-4PtA.text: Beer is good and there's a large selection of craft brews to chose from. Food is good. My only complaint is that it's super loud!!!

LXDM38yRRZPaZlbZn1HQLg.text: So Great!!  Some fantastic food!  There is great craft beer and wine, but the food is to die for!  I had a grilled cheese, with tomato and pesto and then they added bacon jam.  That's right....bacon jam!  It is like heaven!!  I finished off my meal with their homemade pop tart!  It was filled with peaches and had goat cheese and mint on top!  I can't tell you how great my entire meal was!  The bartender helped me select beer that went with my meal....just awesome!!!  Run...don't walk there!  I'll be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

I had the tractor flatbread pizza which was an unusual combo of bacon,  brussel sprouts, and sunny side up eggs,  but it all worked together perfectly! hubby had the Matador with beef brisket, onions, peppers, cheese and horse radish dip with a side of Cole slaw and that was yummy too! 6qX_YpG3SMvIIivnUjJWfw.text: We decided to have a late dinner here right after we flew into AZ. Lucky us! We ordered the spud taquitos (much larger than we expected), full order of wings (cooked to perfection & BOMB accompanying sauces), & meat treat pizza flat bread annnnnd of course they offer a large selection of beers! Our waiter was attentive and had great recommendations.

sC5SFjIYjq9iykHAABhxHA.text: Only gave 4 stars cause long tables are hard to get out of. The food was very good. We had pretzel bites with amazing mustard. I had tacos, very filling.my ding complains had the fish, grilled cheese. Very noisy but a great patio.

mHVrlFAOnc-BBjuCpgAe-Q.text: I came here last night to try for the first time with my friends and I loved it! We all got beer flights for $9! There's a board of about 30 different beers to choose from. I would definitely recommend the 805 and the Raspberry Cider. The flight comes with 6 3oz. cups in a muffin tin. It was cute.   This place has an inside and outside seating area. Our waiter was super friendly and helpful. I would recommend this place to others.

oZ87-17riw6ZiKXvd2SZlg.text: I'd give a 5 rating for their beer selection. I love that its constantly changing drawing you back to keep trying new beers. But I work downtown and have been wanting to go here for since they opened. They close at 11 everyday other than Friday and Saturday when they close at 12. They've been closed every night that I've tried to go. This past Friday I walked by just past 12 and they said they were closed. Even with a lot of people still inside. A lot of people heading to the Turf.   I finally had a chance to stop in when they were open. As I said the beer selection was amazing. I had no intentions on eating there since the menu seemed a little too far out there. We ate anyways. I had the nutter sandwich. Sounded interesting. Pb&j with raspberry-chipotle jam, banana, bacon and marshmallow cream. It was ok, but tasted like candle wax. I'm not sure why. My wife had the stroganoff burger. Not bad, the bun was burnt and cheese not melted. None of the food was hot. Fries were really good though even at room temp.  Their homemade ketchup tastes like sweetened marinara.   I would still recommend trying Angels Trumpet, but only for beers or even their wines on tap. Dine somewhere else.   We sat at a table inside and didn't have any issues with their service and didn't mind the noise. We could still talk to each other without yelling. The music playing in the background was good but could barely hear it.

vlrLK_TOnjZUJGaTwYo0Sw.text: I was not a particular fan of this place. Went on a Friday evening after work. A friend wanted to try it because we always enjoy supporting new, local places.  They do have a very large selections of beer but the process is very confusing. All of the beers on tap are written on a very large chalkboard above the bar. They use several different colors of chalk for each selection making it very hard to read. It may be easier if they pick one color of chalk for each type of beer, that way it is easy to find what you want. Or have #1-5 be one type of beer, #6-10 another and so on. My boyfriend spent so long trying to find a beer on the board because of this. Two of our friends were so overwhelmed with the way the selections were presented they just asked the server to surprise them with a choice.   The acoustics in the place are terrible. It was so loud inside that it was hard to carry on a conversation at the table.   Also, no happy hour. This would be a great way to draw in an after work crowd.

yiaQN6wGu4zW-GE8hoDAEg.text: Fantastic beer selection for those seeking something different! Can be a bit loud. People mix is diverse but may lean hipster.

VxRvjOz4xpMUIJzBz0Tk3w.text: Service was horrible. Food was ok, but why in the name of everything holy are restaurants making their own Ketchup now? The Home made Ketchup here is terrible. If you are going to make your own at least offer an alternative.

osiZCcjXRO0KQXzQopL9ZA.text: This was an amazing spot! The wait staff is my only concern since the hostess did not seem what was going on but sitting at the bar was the best! I did not eat any food but trying the sampler beers was amazing. I would have wished for a bit more education on the types of beers perhaps next time. Totally going back!

2mhb9OS5b19X-W2Eveffbg.text: Came here with two teenagers thinking it was a brew pub.   Felt very out of place.  Planned on us drinking a few beers and kids having a few cokes.  Then we would eat a burger etc.   no fountain drinks for kids.  Very limited menu.  Really  a bar with a bunch of microbrews.  No local beers???? We left and went to four peaks brewery

HhXohc6486IAAnkXjPjlBA.text: Mat and Sharry Engelhorn have a big hit on their hands. Angel's Trumpet Ale House, so named because of the meaning of their last name and their passion for all things craft beer, is my new favorite place.  Service: Generally speaking, opening nights are fraught with disaster, poor service, and mediocre food. Not so with AT, everything was as amazing as I would expect it to be when the place wasn't jam packed with people. Our server was pleasant, pretty speedy, and explained a few details to us. She was in a hurry, but she didn't hurry us, and that's a really good thing.  5 stars for service.  Food: The FOOD! Oh yes the food was incredible.   I can think of no greater sin than soggy wings, but these wings were crispy and tender, with an incredible spicy buffalo sauce, and a delicious bleu cheese dressing. Instead of throwing a few carrot and celery stalks on the plate, they were made into a salad with a few radishes for spice and color. Let me say again, the wings are AMAZING.    My honey ordered the pizza with peppered bacon, sausage, pepperoni, and leeks - it was crispy, just enough cheese and sauce without being overwhelming, and the ingredients were amazingly high quality. I ordered the Southwest burger, and it was incredible. I love that you get to choose your protein - I chose beef, and the beef patty was moist and perfectly cooked/seasoned. My only "complaint" is that I wanted MORE Adobo sauce for a bigger kick, and maybe a bit more cheese, but those are easy modifications to make next time around. The burger bun was light and delicious, with perfect flavor to compliment the patty and toppings.   They also have featured seasonal dishes on the chalk wall as you walk in, and they sound absolutely incredible.  Dessert was fantastic and a fun play on childhood treats. We ordered the seasonal pop tart which was strawberry rhubarb, and it was delicious. The filling wasn't sickening sweet like a normal pop tart, and it was spread between layers of what looked to be a modified puff pastry or phyllo dough. The top was drizzled with a fantastic thin frosting, and finished with sprinkles of pink sugar for a playful and crunchy touch.  5 stars for food!  Beer: Their beer selection on tap is magnificent. So many beers I know and love, and many that I had never tried/heard of before. I tried two new IPA's and they were both splendid. The pour was great both times - one in a pint and one in a tulip, the head was perfectly poured with just the right amount and appropriately sized bubbles. Their beer folks know their stuff. 5 stars for beer!  Atmosphere: I loved walking up and into ATAH. The slump block building reminds me of my childhood home, and their metal grate dividers outside are genius and rustic. The inside perfectly blends the beauty of the wood rafters and block walls with bright colors, natural wood chairs and tables, concrete bar top, and tile backsplash. And you can't miss the massive amount of windows to let in the sun and the gorgeous sunset views. It was a True pleasure to take part in the best time of Arizona summers at this amazing pub. Oh, and I love that they have three unisex bathrooms, it is a nice relief from the standard multiple stall setup that precludes you from privacy in your most private moments.  5 stars for atmosphere  So that's 5 stars all around, and I only expect it to get better with age. I'm going back tonight, and maybe tomorrow, and definitely Sunday. I'll be here a lot., you should definitely try it.

kE8Q9e_ZRfOvmLaMv_nMVg.text: Love the restaurant, beer and staff. You will normally find us Thursday evenings to enjoy a good brew.

nOf7W1oE87BP0m9BAoSLgA.text: This place has GIANT burgers.  Seriously, these are probably a health hazard.  It was SOOOOOO good, but I threw up afterwords.  I think it was because I ate way to much grease, so next time, I will definitely hold off on that.

yYDyJROy9_P2bjMPD-GNqA.text: This place is pretty cool, not sure about the food.  When we got there it was not even 6pm and our server told us they were out of Spud Tacos and he would let us know how long before they made more.  We got a flight of beers.  I only liked 2 of the six he selected.  I am not a beer drinker, I like them light and not too hoppy or lemony.  After about 20 minutes we saw another server and asked her to inquire how long before the Spud Tacos were available again.  She came back and said 45 minutes, wow.  How long does it take to cook sweet potatoes in their kitchen?  We were not going to wait for them and we were glad because I read the review on the New Times about an hour later and it was not glowing.  I think this place has potential.  It is a little bit too noisy, I think they should consider putting some noise absorbing tiles.

uZqvJ0V_uAgLs4SI2AGMaQ.text: Came in for lunch on Saturday and was quite surprised by the variety of beer.  Our waitress Betsy explained their system to us.  We ordered some unique beers that we had never had before and some super tasty food.  Service was very good and the vibe was cool.  We really enjoyed this place and will definitely be back the next time we are in town.

lXRO2VbKqlaFV7aFVALTLA.text: AWESOME! Food is great had a burger and flatbread, beer selection is great and the ambience is the best! My new favorite place! Next time I'll bring home a growler full of good brew! Everyone needs to go there!

A_FXf5JxhELn9ZuW-2cZ_Q.text: Great beer selection. We went for the Tuesday TV dinner. It was yummy, filing, and you can't beat the price!

l0qC5_i8qA_un4bc-A824g.text: If you love beer then come here.  Great craft tap selection, plus they include the serving glass type.  My favorite menu item, so far, are the SPAM Sliders.  SPAM you say, YES!  Give it a try, it is far different then what you may have been served as a kid.  We always stick with appetizers when coming here and have enjoyed the sausage platter, fries and gravy, and the wings.  I must admit that the only thing I have been WOW'd by were the sliders.  You definitely should give this place a shot and do yourself a favor by ordering a flight of beers to find that one you truly enjoy.

-MyoecnfrQNJ-ObHR_T_kg.text: I went back - this place consistently under scores.  No knowledge of beer from the waitstaff.  Takes 15 minutes to realize the beer you ordered is tapped out.  Busch League.  Patio still lacks lighting.  I won't be back sober.  Look:  Place is well done and I liked the clean look to the taps and backsplash.  Very loud, to the point where you're shouting to the person across the table.  Once the weather improves, opening the doors to the patio will help the noise.  Does this place have lights out on the patio or was it closed?  People want to sit outside at night if the weather is reasonable.  Beer:  Overpriced.  Local brews (4 Peaks and Lumberyard) were $6/pint while everything else was ~$7-9.  Yes, craft beer is more expensive but not everyone is willing to pay that much for a few beers.   Food:  Very tasty, diverse and I thought they could even increase prices.  The 810 was great.  Overall:  I've been looking forward to this place opening for a year now and was let down.  I'll go back in a few weeks, hopefully the bugs are worked out.  If they don't improve, I'll just buy a 6 pack of good beer for $10 and sit on my patio, which has lights.   Also, not sure if they have a happy hour but they need one.

geA0jTep5_D3XVdPl21hsg.text: I went there for the first time yesterday. I had the bison dog with fries. I thought the food was really good. The one downfall, I got the homemade ketchup with the fries, It was o.k. it tasted more like thick marinara sauce than ketchup.   The service was pretty good, and I was happy with the large selection of beers they had to try. Some of the descriptions could have been a little better on the board so you had a better idea of what you were getting.

jqAbMn6QRpGv0w_QcXLqZQ.text: I have been back to Angel's Trumpet quite a few times since my original visit and they continue to improve!! The waitstaff has been very helpful and friendly, and although they (understandly) can't speak with authority about all of their beers, they were always willing to get me one of the owners - who are beer gurus - to answer my questions.  I finally got to try a sour/wild beer on tap!!   The weather is so nice this time of year, and I love it when they have their big garage door open - which also helps the sound level quite a bit.   The homemade poptart is a fantastic, fluffly, baked puffed pastry with delicious filling and cream cheese frosting - think a gormet toaster strudle.  The ketchup is very interesting since it is made in-house and its nice to actually taste that tomato flavor.  I NEED to try their fluffernutter (peanut butter + marshmall fluff) next.

1W8ye_Mur4b2lWyO28F5MA.text: Great craft beer restaurant. They have a chalk board with hundreds of beers on tap. I usually get a flight and let the waiter pick for me. All of the staff seems very knowledgeable. Love the food too!

56wM7G_Wo9614rTUtwkHJA.text: One of my favorite places in Downtown Phoenix. They have such a unique variety food, and it all blends together extremely well. Expect a wait on the weekend, but for good reason. Worth trying!

O_PRrM6jTjiStrUcO4IhUw.text: This place is absolutely fantastic! They have a large selection of craft beer and it is constantly changing! My boyfriend and I went here on a Sunday afternoon and they have what is called Sunday fun day where certain beers are only $6 for a pitcher; what a deal! Their food is great as well! I had the grilled cheese and the honey drizzle on it was a stroke of genius! Give this place a check in next time you're in the are you will not be let down!

uS9WU0pzseMphzKcl6EEpQ.text: For a beer and burger place it doesn't get much better. Great draft beers, the Brewlee was on point and the house made ketchup was a nice bonus.

8ptGBVsjnmKYINnYdXeRIQ.text: I really enjoy this place. Great view of the city. Really enjoy the beer and food selection. My only complaint was that the last time they were there it just wasn't properly staffed. It was a beautiful day (and perhaps it's having lived in Chicago for 9 years and suffering through cold where when it got nice EVERYONE was outside), but if I had a restaurant I would assume everyone would be out and on my patio. The servers were working extremely hard, but there just weren't enough of them.

_nexLZ2LPHnfAgSRy-AzjQ.text: Totally different than I thought it was going to be- thought it would be a biker type/dive place.  Super cool- bright- good feel.  Had drinks and a vegetarian flatbread which was GREAT!  Will definitely be back!

nevAn89C3jhiFi24AzK7-w.text: Wish I could say something about the food or drinks, but the staff and manager were so incredibly rude to our large party that we left. We work in a large office nearby, and we routinely go out in large groups. Most places are very accommodating because they want the business- here, the manager acted like he was doing us a favor by allowing us in his restaurant. None of us will be back, and we're telling everyone in the office not to go here. Also, on a side note the bathrooms were disgusting.

NZTYPeVfoegMMb91AgQMZg.text: Great beer selection! Sure, the menu is "bar food", but give it a try - the burgers and the peanut butter flat bread dessert are delish! We've had issues with service but I enjoy the beer and atmosphere too much to care. :) Oh - and the outside area is dog friendly!

wGtWcBugITYB2iss8JGMSw.text: You can't go wrong by going to Angels Trumpet. The staff is knowledgeable friendly and is a great place to have a beer. Come on down I'll be sitting at the bar.

bp9Dk_NKJazDBa3WlNjOMg.text: I've been there on off nights and now on a Friday night.  I was optimistic about liking this place, but now I just don't want to go there.  It fails in every important regard except pretense. It tries to be semi-fancy with a Bauhaus style minimalist interior decor, carefully plated dainty portions, but the service is abysmal.  Tables are packed in as tight as they can be fit and it's very difficult to move between them. Friday, friends mostly got drinks from the bar and the whole evening, no one came by our table -- not even once.  Yet going to the bar is battle.  It's more like a college bar on game night.  I watched for 20 minutes as the bartenders huddled around the two restaurant computer terminals, waiting their turn and talking, running in and out, avoiding making eye contact with anyone, and occasionally turning around and randomly serving who happened to be right there.  By bad luck, I watched two sets of people surrounding the whole bar get served and didn't get served myself.  You could tell me to suck it up, but I know that in bars on corners, in sketchy music halls, dives, and nicer places, all over Phoenix, there are bartenders who know how to manage crowds with grace.  Good servers are hard to find, especially when you're apparently hiring based on looks.  They have a bunch of inexperienced kids.  While waiting at the bar for 20 minutes, I was asked approximately six times to move so that dirty dishes could be unloaded in front of me, or a server could squeeze by behind or in front of me, but at no point, despite me gesticulating and trying to make eye contact, was I offered a beer.  At no visit on any night has the wait staff been professional or competent.  I imagine ever trying to ask questions about what's on tap or what's coming in would be met with awkward confusion.  This is what I expect of  Mill Avenue on a Friday night. I love beer and I especially love good beer, and this establishment is on in a long string of places opening up across the valley that pretends to deal in that.  Another reviewer complained that they were confused by the beers and their hard to pronounce names, which is funny, because they've taken the step of numbering all of the taps and having people order by number.  The wait staff doesn't know the names of the beers or anything about them either.  And the beers are almost entirely non-extraordinary.  It's mostly stuff that you can get at Safeway in a bottle, year round, which admitted is better than some places with lots of taps where most of the taps are Coors, Bud, etc (that's the only star this place gets from me).  It's not that the beers are bad per se, but things like Oak Creek Brewing Company's Nutbrown and Four Peaks Brewing's Kiltlifter are $5 beers.  Those are also the sort of beer that's often on happy hour.  They're fine drinkin' beers, but charging $7 for them and being uppity about it only makes them seem better to people who have no idea what's going on.  This makes the facade of snottiness but actual ignorance, and the other reviewer's consternation, even more amusing.  A bar behind a Walmart attached to an ice hockey den in my neighborhood, the Icehouse Tavern, has better beers and a better selection, though in bottles.  The Icehouse Tavern also has chill, friendly service that's expertly executed.  Wound-be hipsters looking to enjoy a good beer and praise an interesting venue would do well to go there instead.  Boulders on Broadway in Tempe has better beers on tap and friendly, sane service, even when it's crazy.  Popago Brewing in Scottsdale has better beers on tap and knows theirs beers and though the service isn't fantastic, it's genuine and they know their stuff.  Taste of Tops in Tempe is five stars across the board -- beer, service, ambiance (okay, maybe only four on ambiance -- but still vastly better).  The Filmbar across the street from Angel's Trumpet has some good beers and ambiance and feels a lot less like a college bar where the inexperienced serve the inexperienced in droves.  The Roosevelt, not far away, though often packed, has great ambiance (it's an old brick house in a historic neighborhood), some good beers, though fewer taps, and significantly more accomplished servers. Places like Angels Trump House are able to pack a crowd, but that's it.  They do a disservice to good beer by pretentiously, rudely, and amateurishly serving mostly mediocre brews.  As an apparently independent outfit, I would expect better, not worse, than miserable, cynical attempts at beer snobbery for the sake of it, such as Yard House.  I fear that places like this will just keep awesome establishments that deal in craft beer from setting up in Phoenix.

w-wgM8LlzTwwEbB_MmiaWA.text: OMG - I hate writing this review for I've heard so much about this place!  We've been meaning to check out this place since it opened especially since the Roosevelt had closed.  We had family visiting over the long Columbus Day holiday and needed a night out with just the two of us especially since it was my birthday!  We even left Grandpa at home to try this place by ourselves!  When we arrived we walked into a "please seat yourself sign."  Hard to "seat yourself" when the place is packed.  We finally was offered a table at the back per a group who graciously gave up their table for friends who were a no show.  This was a table with a perfect window view of behind the scenes of the keg taps.  We waited about 12 minutes or so before a "waiter" felt bad for us to ask if we had ordered yet.  We asked for a drink menu only to be told we should have either looked at it on the way in or take a step outside to see it!  We told him what we wanted to drink and he said he would do the best to match our needs.  We get our drinks and the menu looked good and we figured out what we wanted to order but then another 15 minutes went by without any waiter attention and we decided to head off to another local place that we knew we would get better service.  We were forced to simply leave a $10 bill on the table for no one every came back to check on us and we promptly made our way to the door!!!!  I don't think we will be making our way back here anytime soon, we really should give this place a 1/2 star but we liked what they did with the place ;o).

9v3BZRZzeHzxJou2jC5A0Q.text: stopped in for dinner last night. It was our 2nd time there since they opened. We previously just had some pints on our first visit but was looking forward to checking out some food. We ordered some flatbread and a burger. The flatbread came to our table 30 minutes later and it was cold. Our server was busy with other tables around us and did not even ask us how the flatbread tasted. We waited another 15-20 minutes and the burger never arrived. The server never did come back to our table to check on us which was pretty weak.  The co-owner noticed our frustration and approached our table. I explained the situation and she was very cool and apologetic although was making excuses about the horrible service.  The server finally came back to our table after seeing the owner talking to us (weak)....anyway, I asked the owner to comp the flatbread and bring the check for the brews we ordered.  I understand they are trying to work out the kinks with the kitchen problems but the server really dropped the ball and did not apologize. I was quite surprised when the bill came back to the table and saw the beer was not comped by the owner (we had 2 pints and a sample tray)... Before the bill arrived I had specifically stated to the owner it was our 2nd visit and how we wanted to come back again. I told her I was impressed with the beer menu and thrilled they had Saison Dupont on tap that evening. Anyway, I paid the bill with a $0.00 tip and we left...worst dining experience I have ever encountered in my life. I am hopeful with time they will be running an efficient kitchen but our server was piss-poor and the fact we had to pay for the beer after the fiasco with the food was unacceptable.

5KVDQ1sLVGIbQ7iidJs52A.text: Where to begin....we finally made it to this joint on an event night for beer week. It was nice to see the place packed on a Thursday. The service was prompt and our waiter checked on us a lot even for as busy as it was. The food....wow! Talk about taking some run of the mill items and reinventing them in such a great way! We got a variety of items to try/share. Word to the wise:the portions are quite big. Not some tiny hipster plates that barely touch your appetite. The warm meat platter was amazing. A variety of sausages and sauces that were all spot on. A great way to start off with the amazing selection of pints. Our platter didn't come out right away as it got lost in the shuffle, but our waiter was more than apologetic so I can't really fault them on such a busy night. We also tried the Churchill grilled cheese with spam as an add-on. I can't wait to have this again! We used to have this in Minnesota a lot, but the high quality cheeses they use and bread really make this an amazing dish. My friend had the Nutter Fluffer with bacon add-on. Nutella, bananas, bacon, peanut butter, marshmallow cream. I'm probably missing a couple of items but man was this done right. Every bite was an adventure as each flavor came out. My wife got the mash tacos (I forget the exact name) mashed sweet potatoes, cheese, pesto in a fried shell. More of a quesadilla than taco but again....simply amazing. It's one of those menus you look at and think, "how would that go together?" Well it does. Can't wait to get back and try so e more items and beers.

JlAuZfQo9ApKd8Mw2xPr2Q.text: Some serious love went into this place and you can feel it.  Huge outdoor patio to swill some good brews (along with a nice, simple, sleek inside space).   Go...drink...be happy and support the local folks who played the part of Santa Claus and stuck this awesome gift under our collective Phx Xmas tree.  The evolution of downtown Phx continues.  BOOM.

7dA5X7ZTHIC4jmw7BpYL5g.text: traveling to a city, you never know what someone elses idea of "great local restaurant" is - this was "excellent" - I am not a beer expert, but everyone else in our party was.  They loved the broad selection of styles and brands to try.  The food was awesome - our party was divided - half got burgers, half got pizza and everyone loved their selection.  When we got there they said it would be 30 minute wait, but 5 minutes later we were seated outside, enjoying the balmy weather of Phoenix.  Enjoy the brews, enjoy the food!

ABJwEwce2Gpgs6hbDgNJUw.text: Really fun, cool environment with well educated staff who can be testy at times but are generally good natured and will spend the time if they have it. Coffee shop environment and a good place to hang with a couple friends.

xkvxGfcq8AF4c57ucBXF7Q.text: terrible first experience! Dirty kitchen crew outside smoking in an apron I could see the filth from where we parked a block away. No one greeted us while we wondered around trying to figure the place out, as several employees walked past us some even making eye contact. After figuring out it was seat yourself, again first time in, we waited for a very long time for service. Contemplated going elsewhere, decided to stay and then figured out what we were going to order for both appetizer and lunch and read most of the beers on the board...still no server! Decided to go to Pita Jungle for lunch where we had a great time, great food and above all great service!!

uL-M59lipSbfit_QHn_yEg.text: I would give it 1 star, but thought that was a bit harsh, and I wasn't there very long.  The whole set up made me very anxious.  The music is deafening and the acoustics and patrons talking make it a difficult place to relax.  They give you a piece of paper and a golf pencil and make you go stand in front of a board and choose your beer, many with which I was not familiar.  There were so many people jostling for position in front of this board and the one over the bar, that it was very off putting to me. There was no clipboard to place the piece of paper on so the golf pencil poked right through immediately.  I asked the waitress why they couldn't print up a menu of beers everyday so people don't have to stand around crowding some board.  She told me because they run out of some beers nightly.  I said back, then the waiters could just tell you what is 86'd as they run out..  They could kinda do like at sushi restaurants, where you check the item you want at your table.  Wanted to love this place, it was utter chaos in there and I couldn't have a conversation with anyone.  I don't think I'll be back.

UJBHUqoGtcFZWxkBFTKcQQ.text: I went to Angle's Trumpet (love the name) with the sweetheart. When entering we waited for the hostess to seat us I asked what's the deal with having to wait to be seated at an Ale House? We were told it was a restaurant but we could have a seat at the bar without waiting if we saw available seating. We were cool with that. We chose to sit at the small lounge area. It was cozy. There is an outside patio area. Love the 31 flavors of beer concept. We were told all the beers were micro brewed beers. Sweet! We were informed we could have a six beer sampler tray for $9.00 plus tax. I passed on that. Our server Brandi was very nice and informative. She recommended a Pale ale beer for me and a pumpkin cider beer for my sweets. I had a couple of beers, when I received the second beer I was informed the keg had ran out of beer leaving my glass three quarters of the way full. I was discounted two dollars for that beer because of this, that was nice. I thought the beers were a little warm. I like cold beer. I really liked this place and plan on returning soon.

r784iJqOiQ5Z0VfGh4hZlA.text: I like the concept, and I am excited to have a good local beer bar down the street.  The menu is awesome, and the service is friendly, but they need some help with organization.

zb7LAIcbKbhjiXPgWu2RBQ.text: It was good. The server was really nice, but nothing spectacular from other places we've seen.

13BrB5ujrmUwwJgkwEi1vw.text: This new restaurant is great for downtown! The service and food were exceptional. My husband loved the "flight". We'll be back for sure!

VKBCc3PHiTKMukMVUYahCQ.text: If I could give a negative star I would. I have been three times and all three times the service was horrible. Tonight we walked out after not being acknowledged for over 15 minutes. I wish I could say the bartenders were hustling but they were actually chatting amongst themselves instead of looking for eager patrons.  Makes me very sad considering all of the great beers they bring in.  I will not be going back.

6jm49GeziAF5lsGJRrYYaw.text: awesome parking for downtown location. Friendly workers and some strong beers. Good selection and they have a knack for good music.

ph7CD7AB-aRHYV9i41ykYA.text: The Cobra Bar & Angels Trumpet combo is hard to beat.  The Big Guppy fish tacos are the best fish tacos I've ever had.  Beer selection is endless.  The layout is nice, but can feel cluttered. Side dishes are a bit stingy too (I'm Korean, so I have higher expectations when it comes to side dishes).  The Big Guppy fish tacos are the best fish tacos I've ever had AND I'LL SAY IT AGAIN AND AGAIN.

OZlPKvkadQA62z7E3dk0iQ.text: PHOENIX, AZ: Came into town late and arrived just before the kitchen closed.  They were super gracious to whet my appetite with some of their best and well-reviewed fare.    The ambience is cool and very new American (high tables, wood tones, creative understated lighting, music is groovy and a little louder, very casual, a lot of beards eating here).  Tried two server recommendations: the pretzel and the fish tacos.  Pretzels (4.5 stars):  These were very good, among the best pretzels I've had.  The plating was done artistically, the pretzels were soft and spongy, and the dipping cheese and mustard were flavorful.    Guppy Fish Tacos: (5 stars) Outstanding!  Huge fish portions that were fresh and delicious, spicy aoli, excellent guacamole, wonderful salsa.  Every element was right on for these tacos and I enjoyed them tremendously.  The service, ambience and food were excellent on this visit, five stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Guppy Fish Tacos (5 stars): Catch these fish!  They taste like they look: hot n awesome!
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pretzels ($7.5/4.5 stars): Stack &#39;em high!  Nice pretzel presentation and they tasted great
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shot of the bar and dining area.  And my Mexican Coke. Nobody brews this American soft drink better than a Mexican!

y-D4w20muAUoe4v8X-gSzw.text: The only time I've been let down was when I stopped by for lunch during the week (they open at 3 M-Th).  I've had the burger with bacon and onion strings twice (can't remember the name), once with beef, and once with smoked, ground pork (smoked on the premises).  Delicious both times, but I'll stick with medium/medium rare beef for my burgers from now on.    The flat bread pizzas are pretty good, had the Alligator Pear pizza off of the "specials" menu.  The Avocado Salad was good too, and they smoke vegetables as well.  Who knew smoked beats could be so good?  The beer selection is constantly changing and has a couple of somethings for everyone.  Go and try something new to you.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gotta try the sampler!

hqhGCdg-y-OKAmWN-05Cjw.text: My dad picked this place cause of its variety of beers. I wasn't expecting much cause I'm not big on beer. I was pleasantly surprised... their food was delicious. My dad had the wings and I had their Farm Flatbread and homemade strawberry poptart for dessert and it was all scrumptious. Only down side is they have a small parking lot and I'm not familiar enough with the city to know any close parking lots. So worth trying to find a spot to check this place out though.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The homemade strawberry and cream poptart... otherwise known as a little piece of heaven. So devine I didn&#39;t even share.
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Farm Flatbread minus onions. So good.
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tasty wings

_QxDhQ7Nh0pMOPInmkedWA.text: idk i really use to like this place. that fun-guy pizza was one of my favorite meals. but the last couple of times when i have gone at night for just a beer or 3, i find myself stranded with no waiter for long stretches of time. additionally, the food just doesnt seem to have that snap, crackle, pop anymore. i have tried the chet burrito, the wings, and the brisket sandwich and they havent been as good as i remember. idk it saddens me. i havent written these guys off but i remember them being better than this

eEZ9kogiCCBaw3MLBps3jg.text: Finally!  I finally made it here.  Sheesh.  After a Yelp event over at FilmBar, a friend and I wanted to grab some food/drink.  I looked on my Monocole and realized that this place is directly across the street. Perfect. AND it was a Tuesday night which meant it was TV dinner night!  Thsi place is known for their grown up TV dinners on Tuesday.  I've been wanting to try this for 2 years now.  The 'fancied up" TV dinners are served on old school compartmentalized plates and feature gourmet renditions of old tv dinner foods.  It didn't disappoint.  My dinner cosisted of an open faced roast beef sandwich with cheese, horseradish and a ciabatta bun.  Delish!  The meat was perfectly tender.  It also included butternut squah, green been casserole, salad, and a cute cherry pie!  I loved it.    What really sold me is the beer offerings.  I'm a beer snob and this place doesn't disappoint.  It's not often I can find a beer I haven't had.  This place had some new options.    My friend opted for one of the pizzas and it was divine. Large enough to share, she clearly had leftovers.  The pizza has chicken, corn, cilantro and a bunch of other stuff I can't remember. But I'll be getting a pizza next.  We sat outside and my only complaint is the misters. I know it's hot and all, but those misters leave you soaking wet. It's like I"m back in the  South sitting outside or in the rain forest.  Holy smokes.

uS56j-fsQ4mT6rwYxaNRvA.text: It's a nice place, some of the wait staff had some strong body odor. The food was yummy and the beers were cold and tasty.

KCuvfTaFOCJTBplEz5fKlw.text: Great place! Beer selection, food and atmosphere inside and out was amazing. I wish I loved in Phoenix because I would go back weekly to try the different selections of beers.

Gfn7LhxQNmEjE1rz-5HQGg.text: Bomb a$$ wings, the "Mess" (gravy fries),.place is awesome! Right across from the Film Bar on 2nd St just south of Roosevelt. Dog Friendly! I've taken my Dog here a few times and sat on the Patio,..he LOVES it! Super bizee during 1st FRI. Great Beer,..friendly staff!!

fjuoGwFFl5KW2yoFGBgPTQ.text: Just moved to Phoenix from San Diego, CA which is known for its craft beer bars. This was a wonderful taste of home, lots of great rare beers on draft and cool ambience. Bar staff was very pleasant and knowledgeable as well.

HdweLxxLNUuZGTZOTiAzRw.text: The food here is amazing! Try the wings with the brown ale sauce and the outlaw (it's a southwestern burger) They make all the food themselves and it really shows. I found myself scarfing down their homemade catsup with particular vigor, and I'm not a catsup lover... Or even liker. Be sure to get the poptart for desert, it's always good. Of course I have to mention the 31 craft beers on tap and the trendy, hipster ambiance; but honestly I'd come here for any one of these awesome attributes... This place has it all! Want great service? Ask for Cindy. I've sat with her a few times and she always takes great care of me.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pop tart!
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Wings!

IMUbGIYq2g1Q39uB7x-DIw.text: Amazing!!!!  We first ordered "the mess" which is basically poutine and so delicious! They definitely do not skimp on the portion size. We could barely finish half of it, but so good  My husband ordered fish tacos as an entree which he loved and I ordered the Churchill with bacon and a side salad. Delicious! Our server was Jake (name on ticket at about 7:45-9pm on Friday 8/18). He was so friendly and attentive and I'd love to have him every time we come back, he made the first experience for us memorable. I LOVE friendly staff (I was a waitress for 5 years).  Food arrived very quickly and was just like we ordered. Very cool place that I felt was non- judgmental... Come as you are. Love this place! We will back soon

ZIF8RorqzrDKHhCHr91E8Q.text: What can I say great food and loads of choices for beer and wine.  The menu is somewhat limited but the quality is there.  Really like this place.

a9962ghxBggztJApobYm6A.text: I love this place!!    Excellent service from a busy, yet friendly waitress.  We ordered a sausage/onion pizza that was on special.  The mess, which is fries, gravy, and cheese curds.  Both of these where large portions, and yummy.  The best part however, was the homemade pop-tart...blueberry!  Not overly sweet, just perfect!   We didn't get any beer, as we were driving back home from Tucson.  The do have a large selection, and good variety for all tastes.    I can't wait to go back and spend an evening.

OnpfGjdGKsrO05xk4r8yKg.text: We arrived at 5:30 on a Friday and it was not as busy as expected, given that it is also March and the height of tourist season. The place did begin to fill up by the time we left an hour later. We have had beer here before, which was good, but we were sticking to food and no alcohol tonight. I could have used a good beer to wash away the taste of one of the most foul-tasting salads I have ever had. The avocado salad sounded promising and I had high hopes. Unfortunately, it had a taste that my partner described as "stale beer." Yup. That was it. Something obviously went terribly wrong with the dressing. I left most of my salad untouched but our waiter didn't ask if I liked it or not. Come to think of it, we hardly saw him. I contemplated other meals I could have had for the $11.50 this lettuce monstrosity cost me while my partner ate her wings. Nothing special, she said, but she did appreciate having three different dipping sauces. Coke comes in a can so there are no refills and the iced tea tasted like the dregs of instant. Overall, it was a waste of $30.

fFs2PKyuT6ArWd70NFTmzw.text: Love this place. Great selection of beers. Delicious appetizers. Good music , service and crowd. Reasonable prices. Went here for happy hour last week. Had sliders and some beers  which were YUMMY (and I'm not even a fan of sliders at all) Will be going back soon.

_1AMSsjspui-d-JGFxj5eA.text: Our date night... 1. Sausage platter w/ kangaroo as the wild game of the night....my 17 yr old son was upset when he found out we were eating kangaroo jack. I got over it, he was delicious.  2.  Six random beers to sample picked by our waitress. She did good. I recommend  Orange wheat and the rasberry one, forgot what it was called.  3. BBQ brisket grilled cheese & Outlaw burger with fries. I NEVER dip my fries in ketchup but I read they make their own. I finished mine, it was so good.   We were extremely happy with everything that we ordered. It was dark so my pics weren't the best. Gets a bit loud inside. Next time I am sitting outside, and getting a dessert. I must try a pop tart, and chicken plate, and pretzel, and tv dinner, and......   Just go!!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States

PmXGGZPkan8ct1sFqppHvQ.text: Really great Burgers and Flat Breads! Their beer selection is always changing and fun. Very casual and "hipster" environment. The staff is usually pretty friendly.  Parking is difficult.  If you are downtown and never been here, you definitely need to check it out!

cP8shNVdMGgQ69vpj-7Q7A.text: Well yes once again great food and of course great beer selection had the wings with the 3 dipping sauces... Sat at the bar the bar tender dude was a complete dud ..... Ya that's dud not dude 0 personality when I asked for a recommendation on a beer he muttered a few thoughts not that I could hear him or understand him  ........ Not a people person I guess...zzzzzz usually we've always had great fun service

1Z9mn6i5nZx30e8ecKAJMA.text: If I could give it 4.9 stars I would... the only gripe I have is the Beer Board... they need to rethink the way they display their beer selection or provide beer menus. I get that the beer menu changes constantly so even more of a reason to make the beer selections clear and easy to read.  Other than that it was a slam dunk, home run, and touch down! In the culinary sense of course. I regret not taking any pictures of our food or beer selections so I'll do my best to describe my experience.  My company was great, the food was inventive, fresh, exciting, and passionately prepared. I had the Fun-Guy flat bread pizza... very rich and fit for two. I chose this because of the mushrooms and goat cheese... it could have used a lot more Fun-Guys and some spice! My company had the fish tacos which I definitely will get the next time I go! Possibly on my top 5 list of fish tacos and I'm originally from California! And I'm Mexican! The fish was fried to perfect crispiness perfection, the cabbage was dressed right and had that little spice you need for a fish taco of this caliber, and the beans! OOOOOH THE BEANS! All I can say is BOOM! Not your typical mexican refried beans but something from another dimension... hats off to the bean chef!   As far as the beer goes... I always fall back on my frustration about beer... Too many beers, not enough brain cells... There was like 30+ different beers on the board so I decided to get a flight as did my company. We shared, we said YUMM, and we said YUCK... All depends on what you like... if you like a diverse selection of great beers you will Love this place!  The prices were VERY reasonable, the atmosphere was comfortably loud, the people pretty, and the music... I don't remember the music... maybe they didnt have any playing... if not they should have...

Gh5HBhMlD_wMdGCJ2Wjs7Q.text: Downtown Phoenix is by no means lacking great places to drink and/or eat. On any particular night you can leave your house walk into a few bars/restaurants and end up in some fabulous places.  One I frequent often is Angel's Trumpets Ale House.  I belly up to this bar for 2 reasons:  1). With 30 some beers on tap that rotate often, (most within the same night!)  I ALWAYS have options. I appreciate a beer adventure - trying as many as possible - so that I can broaden my beer drinking experience/knowledge.  I've found some great favorites here (ie Hopslam, Pranqster, omg GULP) It's like bringing all of the nation's best beer to one conference, located right here at Angel's Trumpets.  2). Space. There is lots of it. The spread is bright and open and with contemporary, upcycled decor - you really can't go wrong. Have a large group of people? No prob! Easy to accommodate. And with that patio in the back...give me a break! This massive patio (now with misters) is perfect for enjoying evenings under the Phoenix skyline.   But the Beer and Space can't sell this place alone. Angel's Trumpets is missing something -an energy, a feeling, an emotional attachment that is found so easily in other places like Lost Leaf, Crescent, or Brat Haus, Four Peaks and even Papago Brewery. Sometimes I feel like I'm eating in a big cafeteria hall (unless I'm on the patio) in which every conversation bounces off the walls and floors. There is never any music playing - which blows as I feel it should be a crucial part of any outing. After all, music, beer, art and food are such important aspects of the downtown culture. I'm still yearning for more - and I'm patiently waiting.

qvkcS7auPYFeq8I-yiHKSw.text: Killer beers and freaking fantastic food everything just rocked except it was very hot in the Resturant, I know it's Phoenix and its 104 outside but air conditioning is a good thing

gqg_DkKII0cfFA431QoHbQ.text: OMG. This place is a gem in the outskirts of downtown Phoenix.  The Avocado salad  with the homemade smoked turkey was outstanding.  The fries were fantastic and my family was fighting over them.  The big guppy was great and comes highly recommended. 810 was good and filling and the homemade ketchup had a special taste.  My sister thinks it has a hint of beer.  The service was very good. I would come again.

-t7i6X623hnFFUYsyr9WyA.text: We we're attending a Suns game and yelped a place to eat.  Family friendly, nice staff, well priced for the amount of food, and fun ambiance.  Good place to stop at before a game.

FlvYsFk1YJHAp10300UznA.text: Service is amazing here. Five star restaurant however their cider is hit or miss. Whenever I have called to request a certain type of cider, I get this response..."what cider are you having on tap?... It's whatever we want to make on that day." "Can you do cherry cider?" Well that's not what we want to make today." Bummer. Consistency is off on a lot of their taps. Don't expect to get the same alcoholic beverage choices next time you come.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The outlaw!

s6V6Lc7mRSyF1MEZ6l8cqg.text: We traveled from Prescott to the Phoenix airport and stopped in to have a bite before our flight. We ordered the avocado salad with smoked turkey, the cemita sandwich, the big guppy sandwich, along with interesting brews and draft wines. This was the best meal we had on our thanksgiving trip! Reasonable prices, knowledgeable staff, and the culinary highlight of our week. Good job!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Libations!
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Big Guppy fish tacos
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My honey with the cemita sandwich

cO4ve4Y9_ZIDKQWBrCpn8A.text: We stayed in a hotel near the convention center downtown and were very happy to come across Angels Trumpet.  The beer selection was epic and the salads were delicious.  The outside patio also provides great ambiance!

3qUhAZqWuXwJHvkIDFO_sw.text: While walking I had a thirst for a cold pint. Out of the corner I find this Alehouse opened, chill and relaxed atmosphere. So relaxed you grab your own menu and have a choice of community table, bar, outside seating, or perhaps a lil couch. Service was friendly, ordered local brew 8 Street pale ale and sweet potato taquitos with leafy pesto! Delicious. Highly recommend.

gAdUXkeWr44DZ2yShxBnAw.text: The food is just ok.  The beer was so fun to drink and the staff is really helpful in suggesting what to try.  Will come back here!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. TV Dinner!
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mess Fries!

Y0trATPTf4YZhMcgmug2jg.text: Come for the beer - keep coming back for the beer and the food!    Wide variety of craft beers, all on tap.  The menu is best described, I think, as 'Imaginative Bar Food'.  The Bison hot dog BLT on Flatbread is possibly the best sandwich idea it the world.  Friends had the Garden Pizza and raved about it.  The seasonal pop tart for dessert was extremely good too.  Reasonable priced with a great space indoors and out.  Dog friendly too!  Why 4-stars? 1. Service was spotty at times but I think it was just our server.  2. unless you are very knowledgeable about craft beers, do not expect a lot of help from the wait staff.  They have limited knowledge of all 31 varieties on hand.  So you could just guess and get something less than appealing to you.  3. This gives them room to grow!  It is my new favorite default downtown destination for lunch or dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Night view from back patio, looking downtown.
Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beer menu 11/4/2012

_JSqh9wPQuQ7dQbV-VmWsA.text: So far, so good... Friendly staff, clean... Beer for days... Pretzel (rolls) are tasty!! Custom beer flight.... Can't wait to come back and drink my way through the rotating board. Unassuming from the outside but the funs through the door... Get on in here!

photos.caption: Photo of Angels Trumpet Ale House - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beer flight and pretzels

eN-MNVafcXgImGvUesFiEg.text: Perfect place to go if you are downtown for an event or any reason.  Not only do they have a great selection of BEER, the menu is fantastic.  There were too many choices to narrow down my meal.  Kudos to Ashley for great service and meal advice.

lgW0_EOItKngPzBe8bQhHA.text: Angel's website is terrible which initially scared me away from dining here. I'm glad I took the risk and went in anyway! Great selection of beers- chalkboard has title, place where it's brewed, type of beer and type of glass listed all for patrons to read. Menu is great too- my table shared "the mess" which is their version of poutine and it was delicious. I will definitely be back!

C-zLN470hrJ2SbPOJ8nrtA.text: Great food, service & atmosphere! I brought my in laws & out of town guests tonight, we all had a wonderful time! Good variety of beer, outdoor seating while we waited for a table was perfect, very comfortable. The service was excellent; knowledgable, accommodating & friendly staff! The food.... Wow.. Worth writing a review about! as a group we chose everything from the hot wings to sausage plate for apps. Main course: grilled cheese, burrito, pizza, fish tacos & cheeseburger! All items were rated A+ by my family! I felt like a hero bringing them here! This is not your average bar food, the flavors, seasoning & creativity in each meal were great! My personal fav: Churchill grilled cheese w/ bacon jam. Yum.  Highly recommended for any gathering! :) we will be back!

x5n2DaAueifAjYpsSDe_kg.text: Oh man they have an AMAZING selection of STRONG beers!  As a craft beer nerd from San Diego, the CAPITAL of craft beer south of Portland, I was impressed.  And their pork burger with fried egg was AMAZING!  I am glad i found this spot before leaving AZ.  If you like craft beer and fatty foods to go with it, this is the place.  If you like budlight and carrots....for the love of God, change your lifestyle. The 6 drink sampler is perfect for a taste, but i really wanted to try more, since their beer is of a great variety (not just a bunch of IPAs and Wheats and Belgians, but they seriously ran the gamut) .  Will return if I make my way back to Phoenix!

oaHo8KKX1Su_tsminZba4Q.text: I need to point out how accommodating the staff was . . .  I visited ATAH after the Strong Beer Festival; as you might imagine the place was a mad-house.  That's an understatement.  In fact, the line to the restroom was almost out the door.  Anyway, we were put on a wait for seating.  After about an hour we were notified that a table was ready.  It was the worst table in the place - the one RIGHT next to the line of people waiting to use the restroom.  My comment to them was a bit gruff - "hell no, I'm not sitting where I get to stare at drunk people's asses while I eat" (my apologies to the staff).  They didn't blink an eye or even once get a snotty tone.  They were very professional.  They put us back in the list and we were seated at a better table as one came available.  Once seated we were treated to fabulous service and amazing food.  I'm going back for sure.  Again, ATAH Staff - my apologies for being a difficult patron.  You handled it very well!

3WR9sV5wLXWhaDt-wREaMA.text: Went here while visiting friends who suggested coming here. We had a party of 5 and arrived on a Saturday around 6pm. There was a wait, but it was not too long, probably 15-20 minutes. We sat outside after a table was ready.  I decided to go with the beer sampler special, which is any 6 beers on tap, I think it was around $11. I tried a range of different beers, from an IPA to a brown ale to a saison. I really liked the selection -- it was hard for me to decide because there were so many delicious-sounding beers to choose from! I would order 4/6 of them again, and the other 2 were just not my taste. For dinner, I ordered a pulled pork sandwich with avocado (I forget the name of it). Fries came on the side. The bread and overall taste of the sandwich was good, but unfortunately the pork was dry. My boyfriend had brisket in his sandwich, and he said his meat was also dry. At one point a piece of pork fell out of the sandwich, and I thought I was picking up a fry, but it was actually a long strand of dry meat! The fries were very good though - perfectly crispy. Our service was great...our server checked up on us the perfect amount and was quick bringing everything out.  I also really liked the vibe here. There were all kinds of people dining the night we went. Older people, young people with beautiful tattoos, a group of people wearing onesies and halloween costumes, couples, singles, etc. It was a great night for people-watching. The place was pretty packed but I never felt like it was too loud.   I would definitely come here again, and either order a different sandwich, or hope the dry meat was a fluke. I loved the vibe and the beer selection. Overall, a great place in Phoenix!

EvDDUtByneUNliipCuKb0g.text: Flat bread and poutine (the mess) were delish. Super busy on a Friday night. Our server was great, will have to come back and try a flight.

zXNQkyU7OEi6T3H-FZOkRA.text: 25+ beers on tap and none are uber mainstream!  I love discovering hidden gems in the central/downtown area and this is my latest discovery.  My mates have been raving about this place and I finally found time to grab a brew with them.  The decor is your typical modern/hipster with a twist of vintage thrown in.  The bartender that night was a lovely young lady who I recognized from Roosevelt Bar (which is now closed).  She was very knowledgeable and gave me wonderful recommendations based off of what I normally drink.    In short, this is a great place to grab a brew and reconnect with mates you haven't had time to see.  I will be here again very soon.
